text: The book of the generation of Jesus Christ , the son of David , the son of Abraham .
text2: Eta so si ramome te zhangliolpe e vitsa le Jesus Kristoski , avilo katar o David kai avilo katar o Abraham .

text: Abraham begat Isaac ; and Isaac begat Jacob ; and Jacob begat Judas and his brethren ;
text2: O Abraham sas o dat le Isaakosko ; O Isaak sas o dat le Jakovosko ; o Jakov sas o dat le Judasko ai leske phralengo ;

text: And Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar ; and Phares begat Esrom ; and Esrom begat Aram ;
text2: O Judah sas o dat le Pharesko ai le Zarahosko ( lenge dei sas e Thamar ) ; O Phares sas o dat le Esromosko ; O Esrom sas o dat le Aramosko ;

text: And Aram begat Aminadab ; and Aminadab begat Naasson ; and Naasson begat Salmon ;
text2: O Aram sas o dat le Aminadabosko ; O Amindab sas o dat le Naassonosko ; O Naasson sas o dat le Salmonosko ;

text: And Salmon begat Booz of Rachab ; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth ; and Obed begat Jesse ;
text2: O Salmon sas o dat le Boazosko ( E Rachab sas leski dei ) ; O Boaz sas o dat le Obedosko ( Ruth sas leski dei ) ; o Obed sas o dat le Jessesko ;

text: And Jesse begat David the king ; and David the king begat Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias ;
text2: O Jesse sas o dat le Davidosko , o amperato ;

text: And Solomon begat Roboam ; and Roboam begat Abia ; and Abia begat Asa ;
text2: O David sas o dat le Solomonosko ( leski dei sas e rhomni le Uriaseski ) ; O Solomon sas o dat le Roboamosko ; O Roboam sas o dat le Abiahosko ; O Abia sas o dat le Asahosko ;

text: And Asa begat Josaphat ; and Josaphat begat Joram ; and Joram begat Ozias ;
text2: O Asa sas o dat le Josaphatosko ; O Josphat sas o dat le Joramosko ; o Joram sas o dat le Oziasosko ;

text: And Ozias begat Joatham ; and Joatham begat Achaz ; and Achaz begat Ezekias ;
text2: O Ozias sas o dat le Joathamosko ; O Joatham sas o dat le Achazosko ; O Achaz sas o dat le Ezekiasko ;

text: And Ezekias begat Manasses ; and Manasses begat Amon ; and Amon begat Josias ;
text2: O Ezekias sas o dat le Manassesko ; O Manasses sas o dat le Amonosko ; O Amon sas o dat le Josiasko ;

text: And Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren , about the time they were carried away to Babylon :
text2: O Josias sas o dat le Jechoniasko ai leske phralengo , pe vriama kai ningerde la narodos Israel ande Babylon .

text: And after they were brought to Babylon , Jechonias begat Salathiel ; and Salathiel begat Zorobabel ;
text2: Kana sas ande Babylon , O Jechonias sas o dat le Salathielosko ; O Salathiel sas o dat le Zorobabelosko ;

text: And Zorobabel begat Abiud ; and Abiud begat Eliakim ; and Eliakim begat Azor ;
text2: O Zorobabel sas o dat le Abuidosko ; O Abiud sas o dat le Eliakimosko ; O Eliamkim sas o dat le Azorosko ;

text: And Azor begat Sadoc ; and Sadoc begat Achim ; and Achim begat Eliud ;
text2: O Azor sas o dat le Zadocobosko ; O Zadoc sas o dat le Achimosko ; O Achim sas o dat le Eliudosko ;

text: And Eliud begat Eleazar ; and Eleazar begat Matthan ; and Matthan begat Jacob ;
text2: O Eliud sas o dat le Eleazarosko ; o Eleazar sas o dat le Matthanosko ; O Matthan sas o dat le Jacobosko ;

text: And Jacob begat Joseph the husband of Mary , of whom was born Jesus , who is called Christ .
text2: O Jacob sas o dat le Josephosko , o rhom la mariako , kastar arakhadilo biandilo o Jesus , kai akharen ' Kristo ' .

text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations ; and from David until the carrying away into Babylon are fourteen generations ; and from the carrying away into Babylon unto Christ are fourteen generations .
text2: Sa le vitsi de katar o Abraham zhi ka o David sas desh u shtar , de katar o David zhi ka e vriama kai sas ningerde ande Babylon sas desh u shtar vitsi , ai kotsar desh u shtar zhi kai arakhadilo o Kristo .

text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise : When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph , before they came together , she was found with child of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Eta sar arakhadilo o Jesus Kristo . E Maria leski dei sas tomnime ka Josef , numa mai anglal sar te traiin andek than , ashili phari katar e putiera le Swuntone Duxoski .

text: Then Joseph her husband , being a just man , and not willing to make her a publick example , was minded to put her away privily .
text2: O Josef lako rhom sas chacho manush , ai chi manglias te kerel lake lazhav ; manglia te mekel la chordanes .

text: But while he thought on these things , behold , the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream , saying , Joseph , thou son of David , fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife : for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Sar gindilaspe pa kodia , iek angelo le Devlesko avisailo leste ando suno , ai phendia leske , ' Josef , shav le Davidosko , Na dara te le la Maria sar chiri rhomni . Ke katar o Swunto Duxo ashili phari .

text: And she shall bring forth a son , and thou shalt call his name JESUS : for he shall save his people from their sins .
text2: Arakhadiola lake Shav , ai desa les o anav Jesus , ke wo si kai skepila peska manushen katar lenge bezexa . '

text: Now all this was done , that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet , saying ,
text2: Sa kodia kerdilia te pherdiol so phendiasas o Del katar o profeto .

text: Behold , a virgin shall be with child , and shall bring forth a son , and they shall call his name Emmanuel , which being interpreted is , God with us .
text2: ' E shei e bari ashela phari ai arakhadilia lake iek Shav , ai akharena lesko anav Emmanuel , ' ( Kodia si ' O Del amensa ' ) .

text: Then Joseph being raised from sleep did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him , and took unto him his wife :
text2: Kana o Josef wushtilo andai lindri , kerdias so phendias lesko o angelo le Devlesko , ai lias la Maria rhomni .

text: And knew her not till she had brought forth her firstborn son : and he called his name JESUS .
text2: Numa chi traiisarde andek than zhi kai chi arakhadilo o Shav , ai dia les o anav Jesus .

text: Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea in the days of Herod the king , behold , there came wise men from the east to Jerusalem ,
text2: O Jesus arakhadilo ando Bethlehem ande Judea . Pe kodia vriama o Herod sas o amperato .

text: Saying , Where is he that is born King of the Jews ? for we have seen his star in the east , and are come to worship him .
text2: Antunchi le manush kai jinenas le chererhaia avile anda Easto , ai aresle ande Jerusalem . Ai phushle , " Kai kodo kai arakhadilo o Amperato le Zhidovongo ? Ame dikhliam leski cherarhai ando Easto , ai aviliam te preznais ai te luvudis les . "

text: When Herod the king had heard these things , he was troubled , and all Jerusalem with him .
text2: Kana o amperato Herod ashundya pa kadia , darailo zurales , ai chi le manush kai sas ando Jerusalem lesa .

text: And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together , he demanded of them where Christ should be born .
text2: Chidia andek than sa le bare rasha , ai le manush kai ramon o zakono , ai phushlia le , " Kai trobulas te arakhadilo o Kristo ? " Won phende leske ,

text: And they said unto him , In Bethlehem of Judaea : for thus it is written by the prophet ,
text2: " Ando Bethlehem ande Judea . Ke kadia si so ramosardia o profeto ,

text: And thou Bethlehem , in the land of Juda , art not the least among the princes of Juda : for out of thee shall come a Governor , that shall rule my people Israel .
text2: Ai tu Bethlehem , phuv anda Judea , chi san e mai tsigni andal gazdi andai Judea ; ke tutar avela iek gazda kai avela o pastuxo murho narodoske Israel . ' "

text: Then Herod , when he had privily called the wise men , inquired of them diligently what time the star appeared .
text2: Porme o Herod chordanes akhardia le manushen kai jinenas le chererhaia , ai phushlia lendar e vorta vriama kai sikadili e chererhai .

text: And he sent them to Bethlehem , and said , Go and search diligently for the young child ; and when ye have found him , bring me word again , that I may come and worship him also .
text2: Wo tradia len ande Bethlehem ai phendia lenge , " Zhan ai roden mishto la glata ; ai kana arakhena les , phenena i mange , te zhav vi me te preznaiv ai te luvudiv les . "

text: When they had heard the king , they departed ; and , lo , the star , which they saw in the east , went before them , till it came and stood over where the young child was .
text2: Kana ashunde ka o amperato , geletar . Ai e chererhai kai dikhlesas ando Easto , zhalas anglal lende , zhi pon aresle po than kai sas e glata .

text: When they saw the star , they rejoiced with exceeding great joy .
text2: Kana dikhle e chererhai , raduisaile zurales .

text: And when they were come into the house , they saw the young child with Mary his mother , and fell down , and worshipped him : and when they had opened their treasures , they presented unto him gifts ; gold , and frankincense , and myrrh .
text2: Kana aresle ando kher , dikhle la glata peska dasa e Maria . Thode pe ande changende ai preznaisarde ai luvudisarde les , porme phuterde penge gone , ai dine les podarki : sumnakai , frankincense ai mirrh .

text: And being warned of God in a dream that they should not return to Herod , they departed into their own country another way .
text2: O Del phendia lenge ando suno te na zhan palpale ka Herod ; anda kodia gele pa kaver drom te zhan palpale ande pengo them .

text: And when they were departed , behold , the angel of the Lord appeareth to Joseph in a dream , saying , Arise , and take the young child and his mother , and flee into Egypt , and be thou there until I bring thee word : for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him .
text2: Kana geletar le manush kai jinenas le chererhaia , iek angelo le Devlesko avisailo ka Josef ando suno , ai phendia leske , " Wushti opre , le la glata ai leska da , ai zhatar ande Egypt , besh kotse zhi kai phenava tuke te aves palpale , ke o Herod si te rodel la glata te mudarel les . "

text: When he arose , he took the young child and his mother by night , and departed into Egypt :
text2: O Josef wushtilo , lia la glata ai leska da , ai geletar e riate ande Egypt .

text: And was there until the death of Herod : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet , saying , Out of Egypt have I called my son .
text2: Beshle kotse zhi kai mulo o Herod . Te kerdiol so phendiasas o Del katar o profeto . " Akhardem murhe Shaves avri andai Egypt . "

text: Then Herod , when he saw that he was mocked of the wise men , was exceeding wroth , and sent forth , and slew all the children that were in Bethlehem , and in all the coasts thereof , from two years old and under , according to the time which he had diligently inquired of the wise men .
text2: Kana o Herod haliardia ke le manush kai jinenas le chererhaia athade les , xolialo zurales . Ai tradia te mudaren sa le shavorhen kai sas ando Bethlehem ai vi avrial kai sas dui bershenge ai mai terne , pala e vriama kai sichilosas katar le manush kai jinen le chrerhaia .

text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet , saying ,
text2: Antunchi pherdilo so phendiasas o profeto Jeremiah .

text: In Rama was there a voice heard , lamentation , and weeping , and great mourning , Rachel weeping for her children , and would not be comforted , because they are not .
text2: " Iek glaso ashundilo ande Rama , roimos ai huhuimos . E Rachel rovelas peske shaven ; ai chi manglias te pochin la , ke lake glate na mas .

text: But when Herod was dead , behold , an angel of the Lord appeareth in a dream to Joseph in Egypt ,
text2: Kana o Herod mulo , ek angelo le Devlesko avisailo ando suno ka Josef ande Egypt ,

text: Saying , Arise , and take the young child and his mother , and go into the land of Israel : for they are dead which sought the young child ' s life .
text2: ai phendia leske , " Wushti opre , le la glata ai leska da , ai zha palpale ande Israel , ke kodola kai rodenas te mudaren la glata mule . "

text: And he arose , and took the young child and his mother , and came into the land of Israel .
text2: O Josef wushtilo , lia la glata ai leska da ai gele ande Israel .

text: But when he heard that Archelaus did reign in Judaea in the room of his father Herod , he was afraid to go thither : notwithstanding , being warned of God in a dream , he turned aside into the parts of Galilee :
text2: Numa kana ashundias ke o Archelaus ashilo amperato ande Juda ando than pesko dadesko o Herod , darailo te zhal kotse . Ai ke phendosas leske ando suno katar o Del gelo ande Galilee ;

text: And he came and dwelt in a city called Nazareth : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophets , He shall be called a Nazarene .
text2: Gelo te beshel ando foro Nazareth , te pherdiol so sas phendo katar le profeturia , , ke si te akharen les Nazarene .

text: In those days came John the Baptist , preaching in the wilderness of Judaea ,
text2: Ande kodia vriama o Iovano o baptisto dias duma ande pusta ande Judea .

text: And saying , Repent ye : for the kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: Ai phenelas , " Kein tume anda tumare bezexa ke e amperetsia le Devleski avel . "

text: For this is he that was spoken of by the prophet Esaias , saying , The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: O profeto Esaia phenelas pa Iovano , kana phendia , " Ek glaso kai del mui ande pusta . Keren drom le Devleske , keren leske vorta drom ! "

text: And the same John had his raiment of camel ' s hair , and a leathern girdle about his loins ; and his meat was locusts and wild honey .
text2: Le tsalia le Iovanoske sas kerde andal bal la gemulake ai phiravelas prastia morchaki ; lesko xabe sas grimptsuria ai divlo avjin .

text: Then went out to him Jerusalem , and all Judaea , and all the region round about Jordan ,
text2: O narodo avelas leste anda Jerusalem , anda sa e Judea ai anda sa o Jordan .

text: And were baptized of him in Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: Phende peske bezexale , ai o Iovano o baptisto bolelas le ando pai kai bushol Jordan .

text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees come to his baptism , he said unto them , O generation of vipers , who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
text2: Kana o Iovano dikhlia ke but Farizeanuria ai Saduseanuria avile leste te bolenpe , phendia lenge , " Tume vitsa sapeski , kon phendias tumenge ke sai skepin katar e xoli le Devleski kai si te avel ?

text: Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance :
text2: Keren so sikavel ke chaches amboldian tume katar tumare bezexa te avel fruta tumendar . Ai na gindin ke vorta san kana phenen tumenge , ' ' Abraham si amaro dat ' ' ke me phenav tumenge ke o Del sai kerel anda kadala bax shave le Abrahamoske .

text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees : therefore every tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: " O tover ka le vuni la krengake ; ke che godi krenga chi dela lashi fruta avela shindi , ai shudini ande iag .

text: I indeed baptize you with water unto repentance : but he that cometh after me is mightier than I , whose shoes I am not worthy to bear : he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost , and with fire :
text2: Me bolav tumen ando pai te sikadiol ke keisailian ai amboldian tume katar tumare bezexa , numa avel iek pala mande , kai si mai baro mandar ; me chi mov dosta te inkerav leske papucha . Wo bolela tume ando Swunto Duxo ai iagasa .

text: Whose fan is in his hand , and he will throughly purge his floor , and gather his wheat into the garner ; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire .
text2: Si les so trobul ai gata lo te xulavel o jiv , o jiv thola ande pesko bano ai le suluma phabarela ande iag kai shoxar chi merela . "

text: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee to Jordan unto John , to be baptized of him .
text2: Antunchi o Jesus avilo anda Galilee ka pai o Jordan te belel les o Iovano .

text: But John forbad him , saying , I have need to be baptized of thee , and comest thou to me ?
text2: O Iovano aterdiolas les ai phendia , " Me trobul te avav boldo tutar . Ai tu aves mande te bolav me tut ! "

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Suffer it to be so now : for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness . Then he suffered him .
text2: O Jesus phendias leske , " Mek te kerdiol kadia , ke trobul te keras so godi si vorta angla Del . " Antunchi o Iovano boldia les .

text: And Jesus , when he was baptized , went up straightway out of the water : and , lo , the heavens were opened unto him , and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove , and lighting upon him :
text2: Kana o Jesus boldilo , avilo opre anda pai . Ai strazo phuterdilo o cheri angla leste ai dikhlia o Duxo le Devlesko sar ek gulumbo xulelas ai avilo pe leste .

text: And lo a voice from heaven , saying , This is my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: Ai ek glaso avilo anda rhaio , ai phendia , " kado si murho Shav kai si mange de sa drago , kasa sim de sa raduime . "

text: Then was Jesus led up of the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted of the devil .
text2: Antunchi o Jesus angerdosas katar o Swunto Duxo ande pusta te avel zumado katar o beng .

text: And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights , he was afterward an hungred .
text2: O Jesus zhunilas ai kana chi xalias shtarvardesh dies ai shtarvardesh racha , bokhailo .

text: And when the tempter came to him , he said , If thou be the Son of God , command that these stones be made bread .
text2: O beng avilo ai phendias leske , " Te san O Shav le Devleske , phen te kerdiol anda kadala bax manrho . "

text: But he answered and said , It is written , Man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God .
text2: Numa o Jesus phendia , " Ramome ke o manush chi traiila ferdi katar o manrho , numa katar swako vorba kai avel anda mui le Devlesko . "

text: Then the devil taketh him up into the holy city , and setteth him on a pinnacle of the temple ,
text2: Porme o beng ingerdia les ando Swunto foro , ai thodia les ta opre pe tamplo .

text: And saith unto him , If thou be the Son of God , cast thyself down : for it is written , He shall give his angels charge concerning thee : and in their hands they shall bear thee up , lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone .
text2: Ai phenel leske , " Te san O Shav le Devlesko , shude tu tele , ke ramome ' O Del phenela peske angelonge te len tut pel vas , kaste te na dukhaves chi cho punrho pek bax . ' "

text: Jesus said unto him , It is written again , Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God .
text2: O Jesus phenel leske , ' Ai vi ramome , te na zumaves che Devles . '

text: Again , the devil taketh him up into an exceeding high mountain , and sheweth him all the kingdoms of the world , and the glory of them ;
text2: Antunchi o beng ingerdia les pe ek bari plai , ai sikadia leske sa le thema la lumiake , ai lengo barimos .

text: And saith unto him , All these things will I give thee , if thou wilt fall down and worship me .
text2: Ai phendia leske , " Dava tu sa kadala te thosa tu ande changende te preznais ai te luvudis man . "

text: Then saith Jesus unto him , Get thee hence , Satan : for it is written , Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God , and him only shalt thou serve .
text2: Antunchi o Jesus phendias leske , " Zhatar Satano ke si ramome , Preznaisar ai luvudisar ferdi che Devles ai servisar ferdi les ! "

text: Then the devil leaveth him , and , behold , angels came and ministered unto him .
text2: Antunchi o beng meklia les , ai le angeluria avile ka Jesus ai zhutisarde les .

text: Now when Jesus had heard that John was cast into prison , he departed into Galilee ;
text2: Kana o Jesus ashundia ke o Iovano sas thodino ande temnitsa , gelo palpale ande Galilee .

text: And leaving Nazareth , he came and dwelt in Capernaum , which is upon the sea coast , in the borders of Zabulon and Nephthalim :
text2: Gelotar andai Nazareth , avilo ai beshlo ande Capernaum , foro kai si pasha e maria karing o Zabulon ai Nephthalim .

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying ,
text2: Te pherdiol so o profet o Isaiah phendias ,

text: The land of Zabulon , and the land of Nephthalim , by the way of the sea , beyond Jordan , Galilee of the Gentiles ;
text2: " O them Zabulon , ai o them Nephtalim , karing e maria , inchal o Jordan , e Galilee kai beshen le manush kai Nai Zhiduvuria !

text: The people which sat in darkness saw great light ; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up .
text2: O narodo kai traiinas ando tuniariko dikhle ek bari vediara . Kodola kai traiinas ande vushalin la martiaki , avili vediara pe lende . "

text: From that time Jesus began to preach , and to say , Repent : for the kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: De kotar o Jesus dias duma te phenel , ambolden tume katar tumare bezexa ke e amperetsia le rhaioski pashol ! "

text: And Jesus , walking by the sea of Galilee , saw two brethren , Simon called Peter , and Andrew his brother , casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: Sar phirelas o Jesus pasha maria Galilee , dikhlia do phralen , O Simon ( akharenas les Petri ) ai lesko phral , o Andres , shudenas sita ande maria ke won sas masharia .

text: And he saith unto them , Follow me , and I will make you fishers of men .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Aven mansa , ai kerava anda tumende masharia kai astaren manushen " .

text: And they straightway left their nets , and followed him .
text2: Strazo mekle penge siti , ai linepe pala leste .

text: And going on from thence , he saw other two brethren , James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , in a ship with Zebedee their father , mending their nets ; and he called them .
text2: Gelo mai angle ai mai dikhlia do phralen , O James ai O Iovano , le shave le Zebedeske ando chuno sas peske dadesa , lasharenas penge siti kana o Jesus akhardia le .

text: And they immediately left the ship and their father , and followed him .
text2: Ai strazo mekle o chuno ai peske dades , ai linepe pala leste .

text: And Jesus went about all Galilee , teaching in their synagogues , and preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people .
text2: O Jesus gelo ande sa e Galilee , ai sicharelas ande lenge synagoguria , motholas e lashi viasta pa e amperetsia le rhaioski , ai sastiarelas le manushen anda sa lengo naswalimos ai nasulimos .

text: And his fame went throughout all Syria : and they brought unto him all sick people that were taken with divers diseases and torments , and those which were possessed with devils , and those which were lunatick , and those that had the palsy ; and he healed them .
text2: Leski viasta geli pe sa e Syria ; anda kodia andine leste sa kodolen kai sas le but fialuria naswalimos ai but fialuria dukha , kodola kai sas beng ande lende , kodolen kai zalin ai peren , ai le bangen , ai wo sastisardia le .

text: And there followed him great multitudes of people from Galilee , and from Decapolis , and from Jerusalem , and from Judaea , and from beyond Jordan .
text2: Bare naroduria andai Galilee , andai Decapolis , andai Jerusalem , andai Judea , ai inchal o Jordan lenaspe pala leste .

text: And seeing the multitudes , he went up into a mountain : and when he was set , his disciples came unto him :
text2: O Jesus dikhlia le narodos , gelo opre pe plai , ai beshlo tele , leske disipluria avile leste ,

text: And he opened his mouth , and taught them , saying ,
text2: Dias duma ai sichardias le ,

text: Blessed are the poor in spirit : for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: " Raduime kodola kai zhanen ke nai barvale ando duxo ai ke trobul le o Del ; lenge si e amperetsia le rhaioski !

text: Blessed are they that mourn : for they shall be comforted .
text2: Raduime kodola ka zhanen nekazo ke won avena pechime !

text: Blessed are the meek : for they shall inherit the earth .
text2: Raduime kodola kai si domolo andral ; ke lenge si te avel e phuv !

text: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness : for they shall be filled .
text2: Raduime kodola kai si bokhale ai trushale te aven vorta ai te keren so si vorta ; ke won avena pherde .

text: Blessed are the merciful : for they shall obtain mercy .
text2: Raduime kodola kai si le mila ; ke won avena dine mila !

text: Blessed are the pure in heart : for they shall see God .
text2: Raduime kodola kai si chisto ando ilo ; ke won si te dikhen le Devles !

text: Blessed are the peacemakers : for they shall be called the children of God .
text2: Raduime le pacharia kai pechina avren ; won avena akharde le shave le Devleske !

text: Blessed are they which are persecuted for righteousness ' sake : for theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Raduime kodola kai si chinuime ke keren so si vorta ; e amperetsia le rhaioski si lenge .

text: Blessed are ye , when men shall revile you , and persecute you , and shall say all manner of evil against you falsely , for my sake .
text2: Raduime san kana manush stramina tut , ai chinuin tut , ai xoxaven swako fielo nasulimos pa tute , ke san murho .

text: Rejoice , and be exceeding glad : for great is your reward in heaven : for so persecuted they the prophets which were before you .
text2: Raduisavo ai av veselo , ke bari pochin azhukerel tut ando rhaio , ke sakadia chinuisarde le profeton kai sas mai anglal tutar .

text: Ye are the salt of the earth : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be salted ? it is thenceforth good for nothing , but to be cast out , and to be trodden under foot of men .
text2: " Tume san o lon pe kadia phuv . Numa o lon te xasarela pesko skuso sar kerena anda leste pale londo ? Chi mai avela kanchesko , ferdi te avel shudino avri , te phiren le manush opral .

text: Ye are the light of the world . A city that is set on an hill cannot be hid .
text2: Tume san e vediara la lumiake . Iek foro pe plai nashti te avel garado .

text: Neither do men light a candle , and put it under a bushel , but on a candlestick ; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house .
text2: Khonik chi del iag iek lampo , ai te garavel les telai skafidi , numa thol les opral pe skafidi te del vediara savorhen kai si ando kher .

text: Let your light so shine before men , that they may see your good works , and glorify your Father which is in heaven .
text2: Kadia trobul tumari vediara te strefial anglal manush , kashte te dikhen o mishtimos kai keren , ai te luvudin tumare Dades kai si ando rhaio .

text: Think not that I am come to destroy the law , or the prophets : I am not come to destroy , but to fulfil .
text2: " Na gindin ke avilem te parhuvav o zakono vai o sicharimos le profetongo . Chi avilem te rimov le , numa avilem te pherav le .

text: For verily I say unto you , Till heaven and earth pass , one jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law , till all be fulfilled .
text2: Phenav tumenge o chachimos , zhi kai godi avela o rhaio ai e phuv , chi iek vorba chi e mai tsinorhi ram , chi xasavola anda o zakono zhi kai chi avela sa kerdo .

text: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least commandments , and shall teach men so , he shall be called the least in the kingdom of heaven : but whosoever shall do and teach them , the same shall be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Savo godi chi kerela vorta iek andal mai tsinorhi andal zakonuria , ai sicharela avren te keren sa kadia , avela o mai tsinorho ande amperetsia le rhaioski ; numa kodo kai kerela vorta o zakono ai sicharela avren te keren vorta o zakono , avela baro ande amperetsia le rhaioski .

text: For I say unto you , That except your righteousness shall exceed the righteousness of the scribes and Pharisees , ye shall in no case enter into the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Phenav tumenge , te na avena mai vorta sar le Farizeanuria ai le Gramnoturia , chi zhana ande amperetsia le rhaioski .

text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time , Thou shalt not kill ; and whosoever shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment :
text2: " Tume ashundian ke sas phendo tumare phurenge , ' Te na mudares ; savo godi mudarela avela anglai kris . '

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment : and whosoever shall say to his brother , Raca , shall be in danger of the council : but whosoever shall say , Thou fool , shall be in danger of hell fire .
text2: Numa me phenav tumenge ; savo godi xoliavola pe pesko phral bi goresko si te avel anglai kris , ai kodo kai phenela peske phraleske ' Raca ! ' nai kanchesko si te avel anglai kris ; kodo kai ankerela peske phrales ' prosto ' trobul te arakhelpe ke sai zhal ande iag le iagoski .

text: Therefore if thou bring thy gift to the altar , and there rememberest that thy brother hath ought against thee ;
text2: Kana anesa ka Del chi podarka ai kotse te desa tu goji ke che phrales si vari so pe tute .

text: Leave there thy gift before the altar , and go thy way ; first be reconciled to thy brother , and then come and offer thy gift .
text2: Mek chi podarka anglal altari , ai zha lashardiol che phrales mai anglal , antunchi haidi ai de chi podarka .

text: Agree with thine adversary quickly , whiles thou art in the way with him ; lest at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge , and the judge deliver thee to the officer , and thou be cast into prison .
text2: Pochisavo sigo kodolesa kai angerel tut pe kris , zhi kai san lesa po drom , te na angerel tut angla e kris , ai e kris te del tut ka baro te thol tu ande temnitsa .

text: Verily I say unto thee , Thou shalt by no means come out thence , till thou hast paid the uttermost farthing .
text2: Phenav tuke o chachimos , chi anklesa kotsar zhi kai chi pochinesa swako pena . "

text: Ye have heard that it was said by them of old time , Thou shalt not commit adultery :
text2: " Ashundian ke sas phendo ' Na kurvisavo . ' Numa me phenav tumenge : swako manush kai dikhel pe zhuvliate chorhe gindosa vuzhe kerdia lasa kurvimos ande pesko ilo .

text: And if thy right eye offend thee , pluck it out , and cast it from thee : for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish , and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell .
text2: Te si chi iakh e chachi kai kerel tu te peres ando bezex , ankalav la , ai shudela tutar ; ke mai mishto tuke te xasaresa iek kotor anda cho stato , ai te zhas ando rhaio sar te avel sa cho stato shudino ando iado .

text: And if thy right hand offend thee , cut if off , and cast it from thee : for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members should perish , and not that thy whole body should be cast into hell .
text2: Te si cho vas o chacho ke kerel tu te peres ando bezex , shin les ai shude les tutar ; ke mai mishto te xasares iek kotor anda cho stato sar te zhal sa cho stato ando iado . "

text: It hath been said , Whosoever shall put away his wife , let him give her a writing of divorcement :
text2: " Sas phendo , ' Kudo kai dela drom peska rhomnia , trobul te del la lil ke mekel la . '

text: But I say unto you , That whosoever shall put away his wife , saving for the cause of fornication , causeth her to commit adultery : and whosoever shall marry her that is divorced committeth adultery .
text2: Numa me phenav tumenge , kon godi mekela peska rhomnia , ai te na avela ke kurvisaile , wo kerel la te kerel bezex te mai meritila ; ai kudo kai ansurilape zhuviliasa kai aver meklias vi wo kerel bezex . "

text: Again , ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time , Thou shalt not forswear thyself , but shalt perform unto the Lord thine oaths :
text2: " Ai vi mai ashundian ke sas phendo le phurenge , ' Te na phages chi solax , numa ker so shinadian angla Del ande chi solax . '

text: But I say unto you , Swear not at all ; neither by heaven ; for it is God ' s throne :
text2: Numa me phenav tumenge : te na solaxan vov si , chi po rhaio , ke kotse si o skamin le Devlesko ;

text: Nor by the earth ; for it is his footstool : neither by Jerusalem ; for it is the city of the great King .
text2: ai chi pe phuv , ke kotse si kai thol peske punrhe ; chi pe Jerusalem , ke kodo si o foro le bare amperatosko .

text: Neither shalt thou swear by thy head , because thou canst not make one hair white or black .
text2: Na solaxa chi pe cho shero , ke nashti keres iek bal parno vai kalo .

text: But let your communication be , Yea , yea ; Nay , nay : for whatsoever is more than these cometh of evil .
text2: Te avela chi vorba si ferdi phen ' Si ' , ai te avela nai ferdi phen ' Nai ' , te phenesa mai but kodo avel katar o nasul iek . "

text: Ye have heard that it hath been said , An eye for an eye , and a tooth for a tooth :
text2: " Tume ashundian ke sas phendo , ' Iakh anda iakhate , ai dand anda dandeste . '

text: But I say unto you , That ye resist not evil : but whosoever shall smite thee on thy right cheek , turn to him the other also .
text2: Numa me phenav tuke : te na potreis numa rhevdisar kodoleske kai kerel tuke nasul . Te dela tut palma pa e chachi rig le moski , ambolde chi e kolaver .

text: And if any man will sue thee at the law , and take away thy coat , let him have thy cloke also .
text2: Te mangela vari kon te del tut pe kris , te lel cho gat , de les vi chi raxami .

text: And whosoever shall compel thee to go a mile , go with him twain .
text2: Te kerela tut vari kon pe zor te zhas iek kilimetro , zha lesa dui .

text: Give to him that asketh thee , and from him that would borrow of thee turn not thou away .
text2: De ka kodo kai mangel tutar ; ai na zhatar katar kodo kai mangel vunzhele tutar . "

text: Ye have heard that it hath been said , Thou shalt love thy neighbour , and hate thine enemy .
text2: " Tume ashundian ke sas phendo , ' Ke trobul te avel tuke drago cho vortako , ai te vurhitsis che duzhmanon . '

text: But I say unto you , Love your enemies , bless them that curse you , do good to them that hate you , and pray for them which despitefully use you , and persecute you ;
text2: Numa me phenav tumenge : te avel tumenge drago tumare duzhmaia , rhugin kodolenge kai den tumen armaia , keren mishtimos kodolenge kai san lenge vurhito , ai rhugin kodolenge kai keren tumenge nasul , ai chinuin tume .

text: That ye may be the children of your Father which is in heaven : for he maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good , and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust .
text2: Kashte te aven shave tumare Dadeske kai si ando rhaio . Ke wo kerel te wushtel o kham vi pel nasul ai vi pel lashe , kerel te del breshind pe kodola kai si vorta ai vi pe kodola kai nai vorta .

text: For if ye love them which love you , what reward have ye ? do not even the publicans the same ?
text2: Ke te avela tumenge drago ferdi kodola kai san lenge drago , che mishtimos si tume chi keren sa kadia ? Le manush kai chiden e taksa .

text: And if ye salute your brethren only , what do ye more than others ? do not even the publicans so ?
text2: Ai te dena dies lasho ferdi tumare phralen , so keren mai but kavrendar , chi keren vi le manush kai chiden e taksa sa kadia .

text: Be ye therefore perfect , even as your Father which is in heaven is perfect .
text2: Anda kodia tu av bi doshako sar cho Dat , ando rhaio si bi doshako . "

text: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men , to be seen of them : otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven .
text2: " Arakhen tume te na keren tumaro mishtimos anglal manush kaste te thon sama pe tumende . Ke te kerena anda kadia chi lena o mishtimos katar tumaro Dat kai si ando rhaio .

text: Therefore when thou doest thine alms , do not sound a trumpet before thee , as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets , that they may have glory of men . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: Kana des love kal chorhe , na bashav andai tuturazia ande le synagoguria ai pel droma sar keren le manush kai ankerdion so nai . Kadia keren kashte te luvudin le le manush . Me phenav tumenge o chachimos ! Vuzhe line pengo mishtimos .

text: But when thou doest alms , let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth :
text2: Numa tu kana des love kal chorhe , na mek te zhanel cho stingo vas , so cho chacho vas kerel . Kashte so dian te avel garado : ai cho Dat kai dikhel so keres garades , dela tut mishtimos . "

text: And when thou prayest , thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are : for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets , that they may be seen of men . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: " Kana rhugin tume , na aven sar kodola manush kai ankerdion so nai ke lengedrago te rhuginpe ande punrhende andel synagoguuria , ai andel koltsuria le dromenge , kashte te dikhen le le manush . Me phenav tumenge chachimasa ! Vuzhe line pengo mishtimos .

text: But thou , when thou prayest , enter into thy closet , and when thou hast shut thy door , pray to thy Father which is in secret ; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly .
text2: Numa tu , kana rhugis tu , zha ande chi soba , phandav o wudar , ai rhugisavo ka cho Dat kai si ando than kai chi dikhel les khonik . Ai cho Dat kai dikhel so keres kana san korkorho , dela tut so manges .

text: But when ye pray , use not vain repetitions , as the heathen do : for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking .
text2: Kana rhugin tume na bulguiin intaino ai butivar , sar keren le manush kai chi zhanen le Devles ; Won gindin ke te rhuginape butivar iek fielo , keren te ashunel le o Del .

text: Be not ye therefore like unto them : for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of , before ye ask him .
text2: Na keren sar lende ; ke tumaro Dat kai si ando rhaio zhanel so trobul tumen mai anglal sar te mangen lestar . "

text: After this manner therefore pray ye : Our Father which art in heaven , Hallowed be thy name .
text2: " Anda kodia rhugin tume kadia , ' Amaro Dat kai san ando rhaio , te avel cho anav ankerdo swunto .

text: Thy kingdom come . Thy will be done in earth , as it is in heaven .
text2: Chi amperetsia te avel . Chi voia te kerdiol pe phuv sar ando rhaio .

text: Give us this day our daily bread .
text2: De amen adies amaro manrho sar swako dies .

text: And forgive us our debts , as we forgive our debtors .
text2: Iertisar amare bezexa , sar vi ame iertis kodolen kai keren bezexa karing amende .

text: And lead us not into temptation , but deliver us from evil : For thine is the kingdom , and the power , and the glory , for ever . Amen .
text2: Na mek ame te zhas ando zumaimos , numa skepisar ame katar o nasul iek . Ke tute si e amperetsia , e putiera , ai o barimos zhi pon godi . ' ' Amen '

text: For if ye forgive men their trespasses , your heavenly Father will also forgive you :
text2: " Te iertina le manushenge dosha , vi tumaro Dat kai si ando rhaio iertila tumen :

text: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses , neither will your Father forgive your trespasses .
text2: Numa te na iertina le manushenge dosha , chi tumaro Dat chi iertil tumare dosha . "

text: Moreover when ye fast , be not , as the hypocrites , of a sad countenance : for they disfigure their faces , that they may appear unto men to fast . Verily I say unto you , They have their reward .
text2: " Kana zhonin , na triston sar kodola manush kai ankerdion so nai , kai keren te sikadiol pe lenge muia te haliaren le manush ke won zhonin . Me phenav tumenge chachimasa , vuzhe line pengo mishtimos .

text: But thou , when thou fastest , anoint thine head , and wash thy face ;
text2: Numa kana zhonisa , xalav cho mui , ai hulav che bal ,

text: That thou appear not unto men to fast , but unto thy Father which is in secret : and thy Father , which seeth in secret , shall reward thee openly .
text2: Kashte te na sikadiol le manushenge ke zhonis , ferdi che Dadeske kai si ando than kai chi dichol ai cho Dat kai dikhel so keres , dela tu mishtimos . "

text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth , where moth and rust doth corrupt , and where thieves break through and steal :
text2: Na chiden tumenge barvalimos pe phuv , kai moio ai rhuzhina sai rimon , ai kai le chor sai den andre ai choren .

text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt , and where thieves do not break through nor steal :
text2: Numa chiden tumenge barvalimos ando rhaio , kai o moio ai e rhuzhina nashti rimon , ai chor nashti den andre te choren .

text: For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
text2: Ke kai si cho barvalimos , kotse si te avel cho ilo .

text: The light of the body is the eye : if therefore thine eye be single , thy whole body shall be full of light .
text2: O lampo le statosko si e iakh . Te si che iakha bi doshako , sa cho stato si te avel pherdo vediara .

text: But if thine eye be evil , thy whole body shall be full of darkness . If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness , how great is that darkness !
text2: Numa te avena nasul che iakha , sa cho stato avela pherdo tuniariko . Antunchi te si e vediara ande tute tuniariko , sode de baro tuniariko !

text: No man can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: Khonik nashti podail duie gazden , ke vurhitsila iekes ai avela leske drago o kaver ; vai inkerela chachimasa iekesa ai avela leske sar khanchi o kolaver . Nashti podais andek than le Devles ai o mammon ( Barvalimos ) .

text: Therefore I say unto you , Take no thought for your life , what ye shall eat , or what ye shall drink ; nor yet for your body , what ye shall put on . Is not the life more than meat , and the body than raiment ?
text2: " Eta sostar phenav tumenge : Na daran anda tumaro traio , ai phenen ' So xasa , so piiasa , sar kerasa te huriarvas amaro stato ? ' Pate o traio nai mai baro sar o xabe ? Ai o stato nai mai baro sar le tsalia ?

text: Behold the fowls of the air : for they sow not , neither do they reap , nor gather into barns ; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them . Are ye not much better than they ?
text2: Dikhen pel chiriklia kai hurian ando cheri : chi shuden sumuntsi , chi chiden , ai chi garaven xabe andel banuria : numa tumaro Dat kai si ando rhaio pravarel le ! Chi mon tume mai but sar le chiriklia ? "

text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature ?
text2: Savo anda tumende te nekezhila sai lunzharela pesko traio xantsi ? "

text: And why take ye thought for raiment ? Consider the lilies of the field , how they grow ; they toil not , neither do they spin :
text2: Ai sostar nekezhin andal tsalia ? Dikhen sar barion le luluja pel kimpuria ; chi keren buchi , ai chi keren peske tsalia .

text: And yet I say unto you , That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these .
text2: Numa phenav tumenge , chi o Solomon , ande sa pesko barvalimos nas kadia shukar huriardo sar iek luluji .

text: Wherefore , if God so clothe the grass of the field , which to day is , and to morrow is cast into the oven , shall he not much more clothe you , O ye of little faith ?
text2: Te huriarvela O Del kadia e char kai si pel kimpuria adies , ai kai terhara avela shudini ande iag . Sode mai but huriarvela tumen , manush kai si tume xantsi pachamos ?

text: Therefore take no thought , saying , What shall we eat ? or , What shall we drink ? or , Wherewithal shall we be clothed ?
text2: Na daran tume ; ai phenen , ' So xasa ? So piiasa ? Ai sar huriaravas ame ? '

text: ( For after all these things do the Gentiles seek : ) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things .
text2: Ke kodia roden le manush kai chi zhanen le Devles , numa tumaro Dat kai si ando rhaio , zhanel ke trobul tumen sa kadala dieli .

text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God , and his righteousness ; and all these things shall be added unto you .
text2: Rode mai anglal e amperetsia le Devleski , ai so si vorta angla Del ; ai O Del , dela tume sa kodola dieli opral .

text: Take therefore no thought for the morrow : for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself . Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof .
text2: Anda kodia na nekezhin anda terhara , ke terhara lela sama pestar , ke ande swako dies si dosta nekezo . "

text: Judge not , that ye be not judged .
text2: " Na shin kris , te na avel kris shinde pe tute .

text: For with what judgment ye judge , ye shall be judged : and with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you again .
text2: Ke sar shinesa kris pe kavreste kadia avela kris shindi pe tute , e musura kai musurisa kolavres kodolasa avesa tu musurime .

text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye , but considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye ?
text2: Sostar dikhes e tsipiliga ande iakh chi phraleski , ai chi dikhes o stilpo kai si ande chiri iakh .

text: Or how wilt thou say to thy brother , Let me pull out the mote out of thine eye ; and , behold , a beam is in thine own eye ?
text2: Sar sai phenes che phraleske , Mek ma te lav e tsipliga anda chiri iakh , ' kana tut si stilpo ande chiri iakh ?

text: Thou hypocrite , first cast out the beam out of thine own eye ; and then shalt thou see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother ' s eye .
text2: Tu manush kai ankerdios so chi san ! Ankalav mai anglal o stilpo anda chiri iakh , ai porme dikhesa dosta de mishto te ankalaves e tsipliga kai si ande iakh che phraleske .

text: Give not that which is holy unto the dogs , neither cast ye your pearls before swine , lest they trample them under their feet , and turn again and rend you .
text2: " Na den so si swunto kal zhukel , ai shuden tumare perli anglal bale , ke kham te vulin le telal punrhe , ai amboldenpe pe tumende te xan tume .

text: Ask , and it shall be given you ; seek , and ye shall find ; knock , and it shall be opened unto you :
text2: " Mangen , ai avela tume dino ; roden , ai arakhena ; maren , ai avela tumenge phuterdo .

text: For every one that asketh receiveth ; and he that seeketh findeth ; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened .
text2: Ke kon godi mangela avela les , kodo kai rodel arakhela , ai kodoleske kai marel avela phuterdo .

text: Or what man is there of you , whom if his son ask bread , will he give him a stone ?
text2: Savo anda tumende del bax peske shaves te mangela lestar manrho ?

text: Or if he ask a fish , will he give him a serpent ?
text2: Vai te del les sap , te mangela lestar masho ?

text: If ye then , being evil , know how to give good gifts unto your children , how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him ?
text2: Tume kai san nasul , zhanen sar te den mishtimos tumare glaten . Sode mai but tumaro Dat kai si ando rhaio dela mishtimos kodolen kai mangen lestar ? "

text: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you , do ye even so to them : for this is the law and the prophets .
text2: " Ande sako fielo keren kolavrenge so tume mangen le kolaver te keren tumenge ; ke kodia si o zakono ai o sicharimos le profetonge .

text: Enter ye in at the strait gate : for wide is the gate , and broad is the way , that leadeth to destruction , and many there be which go in thereat :
text2: " Zhan andre pa e tang vurota ; ke bufli e vurota , ai vushoro o drom kai ingerel ando iado , ai but si kai len kodo drom .

text: Because strait is the gate , and narrow is the way , which leadeth unto life , and few there be that find it .
text2: Ke e vurota tang ai o drom tang kai ingerel ka traio , ai xantsi si kai arakhen les . "

text: Beware of false prophets , which come to you in sheep ' s clothing , but inwardly they are ravening wolves .
text2: " Arakhen tume katar le profeturia kai nai chache , kai aven tumende andel bakrenge tsalia , numa andral won si divli ruv .

text: Ye shall know them by their fruits . Do men gather grapes of thorns , or figs of thistles ?
text2: Tume prinzharen le katar lenge fruta . Sai chidelpe struguro pai krenga kanrhenge , vai figi pai tsignida ?

text: Even so every good tree bringeth forth good fruit ; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit .
text2: Swako lashi pruing del lashi fruta , numa e chori pruing del chorhi fruta .

text: A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit , neither can a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit .
text2: Ek lashi pruing nashti del chorhi fruta , ai chorhi pruing nashti del lashi fruta .

text: Every tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: Savi godi pruing kai chi del lashi fruta avela shindi ai shudini ande iag .

text: Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them .
text2: Kadia tume prinzharena len kai nai chache katar lenge fruta . "

text: Not every one that saith unto me , Lord , Lord , shall enter into the kingdom of heaven ; but he that doeth the will of my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Na swako kai phenena mange ' Devla , Devla ' avena ande amperetsia le rhaioski , numa kodola kai kerena e voia murhi Dadeski kai si ando rhaio .

text: Many will say to me in that day , Lord , Lord , have we not prophesied in thy name ? and in thy name have cast out devils ? and in thy name done many wonderful works ?
text2: But ande kodo dies phenena mange , ' Devla , Devla ! Chi diam profesi ande chiro anav ? Chi gonisardiam le bengen ande chiro anav ? Ai kerdiam but mirakluria ande chiro anav ?

text: And then will I profess unto them , I never knew you : depart from me , ye that work iniquity .
text2: Antunchi phenava lenge , ' Shoxar , Chi zhanglem tume . Zhantar mandar , tume kai keren nasulimos ! ' "

text: Therefore whosoever heareth these sayings of mine , and doeth them , I will liken him unto a wise man , which built his house upon a rock :
text2: " Anda kodia kon godi ashunela kadala vorbi kai phenav , ai kerela le , avela sar ek manush gojaver kai vazdias pesko kher pek stana baxreski .

text: And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house ; and it fell not : for it was founded upon a rock .
text2: O breshind dias , le bare paia avile , e barval phurdias zurales pe kodo kher . Numa chi pelo , ke vazdino sas pe stana le baxreski .

text: And every one that heareth these sayings of mine , and doeth them not , shall be likened unto a foolish man , which built his house upon the sand :
text2: Numa kon godi kai ashunela le vorbi kai phenav , ai chi kerela le , avela sar ek manush prosto kai vazdias pesko kher pe chishai .

text: And the rain descended , and the floods came , and the winds blew , and beat upon that house ; and it fell : and great was the fall of it .
text2: O breshind dias , o pai o baro avilo , e barval phurdia pe kodo kher . Ai pelo zurales ! "

text: And it came to pass , when Jesus had ended these sayings , the people were astonished at his doctrine :
text2: Kana O Jesus getosardias so phenelas chudisailo o narodo katar lesko sicharimos .

text: For he taught them as one having authority , and not as the scribes .
text2: Ke wo sicharelas sar iek manush kai sas les putiera , ai na sar lenge manush kai sicharenas o zakono le Gramnturia .

text: When he was come down from the mountain , great multitudes followed him .
text2: Kana O Jesus avilo tele pai plaiing , but narodo lias pe pala leste .

text: And , behold , there came a leper and worshipped him , saying , Lord , if thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Ai antunchi avilo ek naswalo kai sas les leprosi , thodiape ande changende angla leste ai phendia leske , " Gazda , tu te mangesa sai vuzhares ma . "

text: And Jesus put forth his hand , and touched him , saying , I will ; be thou clean . And immediately his leprosy was cleansed .
text2: O Jesus anzardias o vas , thodia o vas pe leste , ai phendia , " Mangav , av vuzho ! " Ai strazo vuzhilo andai leprosi .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , See thou tell no man ; but go thy way , shew thyself to the priest , and offer the gift that Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: Porme O Jesus phendia leske , " Arakh tu ! Te na phenes kanikaske , numa zha sikadio kal rasha ; ai de e podarka kai phendia o Moses te den , kashte te zhanen . "

text: And when Jesus was entered into Capernaum , there came unto him a centurion , beseeching him ,
text2: Sar avilo O Jesus ando Capernaum , ek kapitano andal Romanuria avilo leste ai manglia lesko zhutimos : ai phendia , " Gazda , murho sluga pashliol khere , bandilo ai chinuil zurales .

text: And Jesus saith unto him , I will come and heal him .
text2: O Jesus phendia leske , " Avav te sastiarav les . "

text: The centurion answered and said , Lord , I am not worthy that thou shouldest come under my roof : but speak the word only , and my servant shall be healed .
text2: Numa o kapitano phendias leske , " Gazda , chi sim dosta de lasho te aves ande murho kher . Numa phen e vorba , ai murho sluga avela sasto .

text: For I am a man under authority , having soldiers under me : and I say to this man , Go , and he goeth ; and to another , Come , and he cometh ; and to my servant , Do this , and he doeth it .
text2: Ke vi me si aver bare pe mande , ai telal murho vas si ketani . Phenav iekeske ' Zha ! ai zhal ; phenav avreske ' Aidi ! ' ai avel ; ai phenav murha slugake , ' Ker kacha ! ' ai kerel . "

text: When Jesus heard it , he marvelled , and said to them that followed , Verily I say unto you , I have not found so great faith , no , not in Israel .
text2: Kana O Jesus ashundia , chudisailo , ai phendia kodolenge kai lenaspe pala leste . " O chachimos phenav tumenge , chi arakhlem kanikaste ande Israel kasavo pachamos .

text: And I say unto you , That many shall come from the east and west , and shall sit down with Abraham , and Isaac , and Jacob , in the kingdom of heaven .
text2: Phenav tumenge , ke but avena anda Easto ai anda Westo , ai beshena kai skafidi le Abrahamoski , le Isakoski ai le Jakovoski ande amperetsia le rhaioski .

text: But the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer darkness : there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth .
text2: Numa le shave la amperetsiake avena shudine avri ando tuniariko , kotse kai roven ai kai chiden dandendar .

text: And Jesus said unto the centurion , Go thy way ; and as thou hast believed , so be it done unto thee . And his servant was healed in the selfsame hour .
text2: Porme O Jesus phendia le kapitanoske , " Zha , ke kerdiol tuke sar pachaian . " Ai kodo chaso o sluga sastilo .

text: And when Jesus was come into Peter ' s house , he saw his wife ' s mother laid , and sick of a fever .
text2: Kana O Jesus gelo ka Petri ando kher , dikhlia leska sakra pashliolas , ke phabolas .

text: And he touched her hand , and the fever left her : and she arose , and ministered unto them .
text2: Azbadia lako vas , ai o zharo meklia la ; wushtili ai podaisardia les .

text: When the even was come , they brought unto him many that were possessed with devils : and he cast out the spirits with his word , and healed all that were sick :
text2: Kana peli e riat , andine ka Jesus buten kai sas beng ande lende . Wo gonisardia anda lende duxuria la vorbasa , ai sastiardia sa le naswalen .

text: That it might be fulfilled which was spoken by Esaias the prophet , saying , Himself took our infirmities , and bare our sicknesses .
text2: Kashte te pherdiol so sas phendo katar o profeto , o Esaia , " Wo lia amare nasulimata , ai lias pe peste amare naswalimata . "

text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes about him , he gave commandment to depart unto the other side .
text2: Kana O Jesus dikhlia le narodos pe swako rig pestar , phendia te nakhen inchal pe kolaver rig le paieske .

text: And a certain scribe came , and said unto him , Master , I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest .
text2: Iek Gramnoto avilo leste , ai phendia leske , " Gazda , zhav pala tute kai godi zhasa . "

text: And Jesus saith unto him , The foxes have holes , and the birds of the air have nests ; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his head .
text2: O Jesus phendia leske , " Le foxes ( miazol le ruv ) si le gropi , ai le chiriklia si le kuiburia , numa O Shav le Manushesko nai les than te thol pesko shero . "

text: And another of his disciples said unto him , Lord , suffer me first to go and bury my father .
text2: Aver iek anda leske disipluria phendia leske , " Gazda , mek zhav mai anglal te gropov murhe dades . "

text: But Jesus said unto him , Follow me ; and let the dead bury their dead .
text2: O Jesus phendia leske , " Av tu pala mande , ai mek le mulen , te gropon penge mulen . "

text: And when he was entered into a ship , his disciples followed him .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus anklisto ando chuno , ai leske disipluria lesa .

text: And , behold , there arose a great tempest in the sea , insomuch that the ship was covered with the waves : but he was asleep .
text2: Bari barval avili pe maria , ta le talazuria vusharavenas o chuno . Numa O Jesus sovelas .

text: And his disciples came to him , and awoke him , saying , Lord , save us : we perish .
text2: Leske disipluria gele leste , wushtiade les ai phende leske , " Gazda , skepisar amen , ke xaiimaske sam ! "

text: And he saith unto them , Why are ye fearful , O ye of little faith ? Then he arose , and rebuked the winds and the sea ; and there was a great calm .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Che xantsi pachamos si tume ! Sostar daran kadia zurales ? " Wushtilo ai dia mui pe barval ai pe maria , ai kerdili bari hodina .

text: But the men marvelled , saying , What manner of man is this , that even the winds and the sea obey him !
text2: Savorhe chudisaile ai phende , " Che fielo manush kado , vi e barval ai e maria pachan lesko mui !

text: And when he was come to the other side into the country of the Gergesenes , there met him two possessed with devils , coming out of the tombs , exceeding fierce , so that no man might pass by that way .
text2: Kana O Jesus areslo pe kaver rig le paieske ando them kai bushol Gadarenes , dui manush kai sas but beng ande lende ankliste avri andal kaplitsi , ai avile karing leste . Kodola manush sas kadia de nasul te khonik nashti nakhenas pa kodo drom .

text: And , behold , they cried out , saying , What have we to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of God ? art thou come hither to torment us before the time ?
text2: Denas mui , " So manges amendar , Jesus , Shav le Devlesko ? So avilian katse te chinuis ame mai anglal sar e vriama ? "

text: And there was a good way off from them an herd of many swine feeding .
text2: Nas dur lendar but bale kai xanas .

text: So the devils besought him , saying , If thou cast us out , suffer us to go away into the herd of swine .
text2: Le beng rhugisaile ka Jesus , phende , " Te gonisa ame avri , trade ame andel bale .

text: And he said unto them , Go . And when they were come out , they went into the herd of swine : and , behold , the whole herd of swine ran violently down a steep place into the sea , and perished in the waters .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , ' Zhan ' . Ankliste avri ai gele andel bale . Ai sa le bale shudepe pai xar ande maria ai tasule ando pai .

text: And they that kept them fled , and went their ways into the city , and told every thing , and what was befallen to the possessed of the devils .
text2: Le manush kai lenas sama katar le bale nashle , gele ando foro , ai phende sa so kerdilia le bengailensa .

text: And , behold , the whole city came out to meet Jesus : and when they saw him , they besought him that he would depart out of their coasts .
text2: Antunchi sa o narodo anda foro avile ka Jesus ; kana dikhle les , rhugisaile leste te zhaltar anda lengo them .

text: And he entered into a ship , and passed over , and came into his own city .
text2: O Jesus anklisto ando chuno , nakhlo inchal e maria , ai gelo ande pesko foro .

text: And , behold , they brought to him a man sick of the palsy , lying on a bed : and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy ; Son , be of good cheer ; thy sins be forgiven thee .
text2: Andine leste ieke manushes kai sas bango , pashliolas po than . O Jesus dikhlia lengo pachamos , ai phendias le bangeske , " Raduisavo , murho shav ! Che bezexa iertime le . "

text: And , behold , certain of the scribes said within themselves , This man blasphemeth .
text2: Antunchi le Gramnoturia phenenas peske , " Sar sai kado manush tromal te lel o than le Devlesko , ke ferdi O Del sai iertil le bezexa ! "

text: And Jesus knowing their thoughts said , Wherefore think ye evil in your hearts ?
text2: O Jesus zhanglia lenge ginduria ai phendia , " Sostar si tume kasave chorhe ginduria ande tumaro ilo ?

text: For whether is easier , to say , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Arise , and walk ?
text2: So si mai vushoro te phenes , ' Che bezexa iertime , ' vai ' Wushti opre ai phir ? "

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , ( then saith he to the sick of the palsy , ) Arise , take up thy bed , and go unto thine house .
text2: Numa te zhanen ke ka O Shav le Manushesko si e putiera pe phuv te iertil le bezexa . " Antunchi phendia le bangeske , ' Wushti , le cho than , ai zha khere ! '

text: And he arose , and departed to his house .
text2: O manush wushtilo ai gelotar khere .

text: But when the multitudes saw it , they marvelled , and glorified God , which had given such power unto men .
text2: Kana o narodo dikhlia kodia , daraile , chudisaile , ai luvudinas le Devles kai dias kasavi putiera ka o manush .

text: And as Jesus passed forth from thence , he saw a man , named Matthew , sitting at the receipt of custom : and he saith unto him , Follow me . And he arose , and followed him .
text2: O Jesus gelotar kotsar , ai dikhlia ieke manushes kai busholas Mate , beshelas tele kai skafidi kai pochinenas e taksa le themeske . Ai phendia leske , " Av pala mande . " Wo wushtilo ai liape pala leste .

text: And it came to pass , as Jesus sat at meat in the house , behold , many publicans and sinners came and sat down with him and his disciples .
text2: Kana O Jesus xalas ande lesko kher , but manush kai chiden e taksa , ai le bezexale avile te beshen kai skafidi lesa ai leske disiplonsa .

text: And when the Pharisees saw it , they said unto his disciples , Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Le Farizeanuria dikhle kodia ai phushle leske disiplon , " Sostar tumaro gazda xal le manushensa kai chiden e taksa ai kodolensa kai si bezexale ? "

text: But when Jesus heard that , he said unto them , They that be whole need not a physician , but they that are sick .
text2: O Jesus ashundia ai phendia lenge , " Le manush kai si saste chi trobul le dokxtoro , le naswalen trobul .

text: But go ye and learn what that meaneth , I will have mercy , and not sacrifice : for I am not come to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Zhan ai sichon te haliaren , me mangav mila te den iekavres , ai na sakrifis , ke chi avilem te akharav kodolen kai gindinpe vorta angla Del , numa le bezexalen . "

text: Then came to him the disciples of John , saying , Why do we and the Pharisees fast oft , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: Le disipluria le Iovanoske o baptisto avile ka Jesus , ai phushle lestar , " Sostar ame ai le Farizeanuria zhonis butivar , numa chire disipluria chi zhonin ? "

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber mourn , as long as the bridegroom is with them ? but the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken from them , and then shall they fast .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Sar sai zhelin le manush kai si akharde ka abiav , kana o manush kai ansurilpe lensa le ? Numa avela e vriama kai o manush kai ansurilpe avela lino lendar , antunchi zhonina .

text: No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment , for that which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment , and the rent is made worse .
text2: Khonik chi thol nevo kotor poxtan te lasharel phurane tsalia , ke o nevo kotor tsigniol , ai kerdiolpe mai nasul o shinimos .

text: Neither do men put new wine into old bottles : else the bottles break , and the wine runneth out , and the bottles perish : but they put new wine into new bottles , and both are preserved .
text2: Le manush chi thon nevi mol andel phurane morchia moliake , ke le morchia pharhadion , ai e mol shordiol , ai le morchia rimonpe . Numa thon e nevi mol andel morchia , kadia chi e mol ai chi le morchia chi rimonpe . "

text: While he spake these things unto them , behold , there came a certain ruler , and worshipped him , saying , My daughter is even now dead : but come and lay thy hand upon her , and she shall live .
text2: Sar O Jesus phenelas lenge kadala vorbi , iek baro andai synagogue avilo ai thodiape ande changende angla leste , ai phendias , " Numa so muli murhi shei ; haidi tho cho vas pe late , ai woi traiila . "

text: And Jesus arose , and followed him , and so did his disciples .
text2: O Jesus wushtilo , ai gelo pala leste , peske disiplonsa .

text: And , behold , a woman , which was diseased with an issue of blood twelve years , came behind him , and touched the hem of his garment :
text2: Antunchi , iek naswali zhuvli , kai xasarelas rat de desh u dui bersh , avili palal pala leste , ai azbadia e tivala leska raxamaki .

text: For she said within herself , If I may but touch his garment , I shall be whole .
text2: Woi phenelas peske , " Numa te sai azbava leske tsalia , avava sasti . "

text: But Jesus turned him about , and when he saw her , he said , Daughter , be of good comfort ; thy faith hath made thee whole . And the woman was made whole from that hour .
text2: O Jesus amboldiape , dikhlia la , ai phendia , " Raduisavo murhi shei ! Ke cho pachamos sastiardia tu . " Ai ande kodo chaso sastili .

text: And when Jesus came into the ruler ' s house , and saw the minstrels and the people making a noise ,
text2: Kana O Jesus areslo ka kher le baresko andai synagogue . Dikhlia le musikanton , ai baro narodo buntuime , but mui kerenas .

text: He said unto them , Give place : for the maid is not dead , but sleepeth . And they laughed him to scorn .
text2: Wo phendias lenge , " Zhantar ke e sheiorhi nai muli , numa sovel ! " Won asaie lestar .

text: But when the people were put forth , he went in , and took her by the hand , and the maid arose .
text2: Kana gonisardia le narodos , gelo ando kher , lia la vastestar , ai e shovorhi wushtili .

text: And the fame hereof went abroad into all that land .
text2: Kodia viasta geli ande sa kodo them .

text: And when Jesus departed thence , two blind men followed him , crying , and saying , Thou Son of David , have mercy on us .
text2: Sar zhalastar O Jesus , dui korhe linepe palal leste ai tsipinas , " Al tuke mila anda amende , Shav le Davidosko . "

text: And when he was come into the house , the blind men came to him : and Jesus saith unto them , Believe ye that I am able to do this ? They said unto him , Yea , Lord .
text2: Kana O Jesus areslo ando kher , le korhe avile leste , O Jesus phushlia le , " Pachan tume ke sai kerav kodia ? " " Sai , Gazda , " Won phende leske .

text: Then touched he their eyes , saying , According to your faith be it unto you .
text2: Antunchi azbadia lenge iakha ai phendia , " Te kerdiol tumenge , so pachaian ! "

text: And their eyes were opened ; and Jesus straitly charged them , saying , See that no man know it .
text2: Ai lenge iakha phuterdile . O Jesus phendia lenge , " Len tume sama , te na zhanel khonik ! "

text: But they , when they were departed , spread abroad his fame in all that country .
text2: Numa kana geletar , phende e viasta pe leste pe sa kodo them .

text: As they went out , behold , they brought to him a dumb man possessed with a devil .
text2: Kana won zhanastar , andine leste ieke manushes kai nashti delas duma ke sas beng ande leste .

text: And when the devil was cast out , the dumb spake : and the multitudes marvelled , saying , It was never so seen in Israel .
text2: Kana o beng gonime anda leste , o muto dia duma . Sa o narodo chudisaile , ai phenenas , ' Shoxar chi dikhliam kadia ande Israel ! "

text: But the Pharisees said , He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils .
text2: Numa le Farizeanuria phenenas , " O baro le bengengo del les e putiera te gonil le bengen . "

text: And Jesus went about all the cities and villages , teaching in their synagogues , and preaching the gospel of the kingdom , and healing every sickness and every disease among the people .
text2: O Jesus gelo anda sa le foruria ai anda sa le gava , ai sicharelas ande lenge synagoguria , delas duma e lashi viasta pa e amperetsia , ai sastiarelas sa le naswalimata ai sa o nasulipe .

text: But when he saw the multitudes , he was moved with compassion on them , because they fainted , and were scattered abroad , as sheep having no shepherd .
text2: Kana wo dikhlia o narodo bari mila lia les anda lende , ke chinuinas nekezhime sas , ai nashti zhutinaspe , sar bakriorhe kai nai le pastuxo .

text: Then saith he unto his disciples , The harvest truly is plenteous , but the labourers are few ;
text2: Antunchi phendias peske disiplonge , " But jiv si te chidelpe , numa xantsi bucharia si .

text: Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest , that he will send forth labourers into his harvest .
text2: Rhugin tume ka o gazda le chidimasko te tradel bucharia ande pesko chidimos .

text: And when he had called unto him his twelve disciples , he gave them power against unclean spirits , to cast them out , and to heal all manner of sickness and all manner of disease .
text2: O Jesus akhardia peste , peske desh u do disiplon , ai dia le putiera pe le bi vuzhe duxuria , kaste te sai gonin le avri , ai te sastiaren sa le naswalimata ai sa o nasulipe .

text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these ; The first , Simon , who is called Peter , and Andrew his brother ; James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother ;
text2: Eta le anava le desh u do apostlonge : pervo O Simon ( akhardo sas Petri ) ai lesko phral o Andre ; o James ai lesko phral o Iovano , shave le Zebedoske ;

text: Philip , and Bartholomew ; Thomas , and Matthew the publican ; James the son of Alphaeus , and Lebbaeus , whose surname was Thaddaeus ;
text2: o Philip ai o Bartholomew ; o Thomas ai o Mate kai chidelas e taksa ; o James o shav le Alphaeusosko , ai o Lebbaeus ( akhardo sas Thaddaeus ) :

text: Simon the Canaanite , and Judas Iscariot , who also betrayed him .
text2: O Simon o Canaanite , ai o Judas Iscariot , kai dia le Kristos andel vas leske duzhmanonge .

text: These twelve Jesus sent forth , and commanded them , saying , Go not into the way of the Gentiles , and into any city of the Samaritans enter ye not :
text2: Kadala desh u dui Wo tradias angle ai phendias lenge : " Na zhan mashkar le Nai Zhiduvuria , ai na zhan andel foruria kai si le Samaritanuria .

text: But go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
text2: Zhan , mai bini ka le xasarde bakriorhe , o narodo Israel .

text: And as ye go , preach , saying , The kingdom of heaven is at hand .
text2: Sar zhan , den duma pa Del ai phenen , ' E amperetsia le rhaioski pashili ! '

text: Heal the sick , cleanse the lepers , raise the dead , cast out devils : freely ye have received , freely give .
text2: Sastiaren le naswalen , zhuvindin le mulen , vuzharen le lepra , gonin avri le bengen . Tume lian ivia , ivia den .

text: Provide neither gold , nor silver , nor brass in your purses ,
text2: Na len tumensa sumnakai , vai rup , chi xarkune ande tumare chisa ;

text: Nor scrip for your journey , neither two coats , neither shoes , nor yet staves : for the workman is worthy of his meat .
text2: Na len chisi dromeske , vai dui gada , vai papucha , vai rovli , ke o manush kai kerel buchi mol te den les leske pochin .

text: And into whatsoever city or town ye shall enter , inquire who in it is worthy ; and there abide till ye go thence .
text2: Ande fersavo foro vai gav kai arasena , phushen kon si lasho manush , ai beshen ka leske kher zhi kai tume zhanatar kotsar .

text: And when ye come into an house , salute it .
text2: Kana zhana ando kher phenen , " E pacha te avel tumensa . "

text: And if the house be worthy , let your peace come upon it : but if it be not worthy , let your peace return to you .
text2: Kodola manush te primin tumen sar trobul , tumare pacha te avel pe lende , numa te na primin tumen sar trobul te amboldel tumare pacha palpale .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear your words , when ye depart out of that house or city , shake off the dust of your feet .
text2: Te na primina tumen sar trobul vai te na ashunena tumende , kana zhantar anda kodo kher vai foro , chinon e pulburia pa tumare punrhe .

text: Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Phenav tumenge o chachimos , mai vushoro avela le narodoske anda Sodom ai andai Gomorrah po dies la krisako , de sar kodole foroske !

text: Behold , I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves : be ye therefore wise as serpents , and harmless as doves .
text2: Dikhen ! Me tradav tume sar bakriorhe mashkar le ruv . Aven gojaver ai arakhen tume sar le sap , ai aven domolo sar le gulumburia .

text: But beware of men : for they will deliver you up to the councils , and they will scourge you in their synagogues ;
text2: Arakhen tume katar le manush , ke angerena tumen pe kris , ai marena tumen bichonsa ande penge synagoguria .

text: And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake , for a testimony against them and the Gentiles .
text2: Angerena tume angla le bare le foroske ai anglal amperatsi mange , te aven marturo angla lende ai sa le Nai Zhiduvuria .

text: But when they deliver you up , take no thought how or what ye shall speak : for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak .
text2: Numa kana lena tumen , na xal tume briga sar phenena vai so phenena , ke avela tume dino ando kodo chaso , so trobula te mothon .

text: For it is not ye that speak , but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you .
text2: Ke chi dena tume duma , numa O Swunto Duxo tumare Dadesko dela duma tumendar .

text: And the brother shall deliver up the brother to death , and the father the child : and the children shall rise up against their parents , and cause them to be put to death .
text2: O phral purhila peske phrales te mudaren les , ai o dat purhila peska glata ; le glate xoliavona pe pengo dat , ai pengi dei ai kerena te mudaren le .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake : but he that endureth to the end shall be saved .
text2: Sa le manush vurhitsina tumen pala mande . Numa kodo kai rhevdila ai inkerela zhando gor , avela skepime .

text: But when they persecute you in this city , flee ye into another : for verily I say unto you , Ye shall not have gone over the cities of Israel , till the Son of man be come .
text2: Kana chinuina tumen andek foro , zhan ande aver . Phenav tumenge o chachimos , chi aresena te zhan ande sa le foruria ande Israel , mai anglal sar O Shav le Manushesko te avel .

text: The disciple is not above his master , nor the servant above his lord .
text2: Chi iek kai sichol nai mai baro sar kodo kai sicharel les , ai chi iek sluga nai mai bari sar pesko gazda .

text: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master , and the servant as his lord . If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub , how much more shall they call them of his household ?
text2: Dosta kodoleske kai sichol te kerdiol sar kodo kai sicharel les , ai e sluga te kerdiol sar pesko gazda . Ai won te akharena le gazdas le kheresko , Beelzebub , sode mai but akharena le manushen kai beshen ande lesko kher !

text: Fear them not therefore : for there is nothing covered , that shall not be revealed ; and hid , that shall not be known .
text2: Anda kodia na daran lendar . Ke nai khanchi wusharado kai chi avela sikado ; ai nai khanchi garado kai chi avela zhanglo .

text: What I tell you in darkness , that speak ye in light : and what ye hear in the ear , that preach ye upon the housetops .
text2: So phenava tuke ando tuniariko tu phen adiese ; ai so ashunes phendo tuke ando khan , phen pal khera opral .

text: And fear not them which kill the body , but are not able to kill the soul : but rather fear him which is able to destroy both soul and body in hell .
text2: Na daran katar kodola kai sai mudaren o stato numa nashti mudaren o duxo ; mai bini daran katar O Del , kai sai mudarel o duxo ai o stato ando iado .

text: Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing ? and one of them shall not fall on the ground without your Father .
text2: Nai bichinde dui chiriklia pe iek pena ; numa chi iek anda lende chi perel pe phuv bi te zhanel cho Dat .

text: But the very hairs of your head are all numbered .
text2: Ai vi le bal ande tumaro shero sa jindo le .

text: Fear ye not therefore , ye are of more value than many sparrows .
text2: Anda kodia na dara , ke tu mos mai but sar but chiriklia ! "

text: Whosoever therefore shall confess me before men , him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Kon godi mothola ke si murho anglal manush , i me phenava ke si murho angla murho Dat kai si ando rhaio .

text: But whosoever shall deny me before men , him will I also deny before my Father which is in heaven .
text2: Numa kon godi mothola ke nai murho anglal manush , vi me mothava ke nai murho angla murho Dat kai si ando rhaio .

text: Think not that I am come to send peace on earth : I came not to send peace , but a sword .
text2: Na gindin ke avilem te anav pacha pe phuv , chi avilem te anav pacha , numa e sabia .

text: For I am come to set a man at variance against his father , and the daughter against her mother , and the daughter in law against her mother in law .
text2: Ke avilem te hulavav le shaves katar o dat , la sha katar e dei , ai e bori katar e sakra ;

text: And a man ' s foes shall be they of his own household .
text2: Le manusheske duzhmaia avena kodola kai si ande lesko kher .

text: He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthy of me : and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me .
text2: Kon godi si leske mai drago lesko dat vai leski dei mai but sar me chi mol dosta te avel pala mande ; kon godi si leske mai drago lesko shav vai leski shei mai but sar me chi mol dosta te avel pala mande .

text: And he that taketh not his cross , and followeth after me , is not worthy of me .
text2: Kodo kai chi lel pesko trushul ai te lelpe pala mande , chi mol dosta te achel pala mande .

text: He that findeth his life shall lose it : and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it .
text2: Kodo kai arakhela pesko traio xasarela les ; numa kodo kai xasarela pesko traio pala mande arakhela les .

text: He that receiveth you receiveth me , and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me .
text2: O manush kai primil tumen primil man ; ai o manush kai primil man primil kodoles kai tradia man .

text: He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall receive a prophet ' s reward ; and he that receiveth a righteous man in the name of a righteous man shall receive a righteous man ' s reward .
