text2: Len sama ai rhugin tume , te na peren ando zumaimos : o duxo mangel , numa o stato kovlo . "

text: He went away again the second time , and prayed , saying , O my Father , if this cup may not pass away from me , except I drink it , thy will be done .
text2: Gelotar e duito data , ai rhugisailo , " Murho Dat te nashti nakhela kadia kuchi mandar , zhi pon chi piiava andai kuchi , chiri voia te avel kerdi . "

text: And he came and found them asleep again : for their eyes were heavy .
text2: Kana avilo palpale mai iek data arakhlias le ke soven ke nashti ankerenas peske iakha phuterde .

text: And he left them , and went away again , and prayed the third time , saying the same words .
text2: Mai iek data meklias le , gelotar ai rhugisailo pe trito data , ai phendias sa kodola vorbi .

text: Then cometh he to his disciples , and saith unto them , Sleep on now , and take your rest : behold , the hour is at hand , and the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners .
text2: Antunchi avilo kal disipluria , ai phendias lenge , " Vi akana soven , ai hodinin . Dikhen , o chaso avilo te avel dino O Shav le Manushesko , ando vas bezexale manushengo .

text: Rise , let us be going : behold , he is at hand that doth betray me .
text2: Wushten , aventar , Dikhen , avel kodo kai dias ma ando vas . "

text: And while he yet spake , lo , Judas , one of the twelve , came , and with him a great multitude with swords and staves , from the chief priests and elders of the people .
text2: Sar O Jesus delas duma o Judas , iek andal desh u dui avilo , lesa avilo baro narodo sabiensa ai kashtensa , tradine sas katar le bare rasha , ai katar le phure kai poronchinas .

text: Now he that betrayed him gave them a sign , saying , Whomsoever I shall kiss , that same is he : hold him fast .
text2: Kodo kai dias les ando vas dias len ek semno , phendias , " Kodoles kai chumidava , si o manush , len les . "

text: And forthwith he came to Jesus , and said , Hail , master ; and kissed him .
text2: Andak data gelo ka O Jesus , phendias leske , " Sar san gazda ? " ai chumidias les .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Friend , wherefore art thou come ? Then came they , and laid hands on Jesus , and took him .
text2: O Jesus phendias leske , " Vortakona , ker so avilian te keres . " Antunchi avile le manush angle , thode o vas po Jesus ai phangle les .

text: And , behold , one of them which were with Jesus stretched out his hand , and drew his sword , and struck a servant of the high priest ' s , and smote off his ear .
text2: Iek anda kodola kai sas le Kristosa , anzilo ai lias peski sabia , ai shindias tele o khan kodolesko kai sas sluga ka rashai o baro .

text: Then said Jesus unto him , Put up again thy sword into his place : for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus phendias leske , " Tho chi sabia palpale : ke kon godi lel e sabia xaiil katar e sabia .

text: Thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my Father , and he shall presently give me more than twelve legions of angels ?
text2: Dar gindis ke nashti dav mui pe murho Dat , ai andek data tradel mange mai but sar eftavardesh mi angeluria ? "

text: But how then shall the scriptures be fulfilled , that thus it must be ?
text2: Numa sar antunchi te pherdiol o ramomos kai mothol ke musai te kerdiolpe , so akana kerdiol .

text: In that same hour said Jesus to the multitudes , Are ye come out as against a thief with swords and staves for to take me ? I sat daily with you teaching in the temple , and ye laid no hold on me .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus phendias le narodoske , " Dar chor sim te avilian pala mande sabiensa ai kashtensa te astaren ma ? Dies pala dieseste beshlem ande tamplo te sicharav , ai chi thodian o vas pe mande . "

text: But all this was done , that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled . Then all the disciples forsook him , and fled .
text2: Numa sa kado kerdilo , kashte o ramomos le profetongo te pherdiol . " Antunchi sa le disipluria mekle les , ai rhispisaile .

text: And they that had laid hold on Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest , where the scribes and the elders were assembled .
text2: Antunchi kodola kai line le Kristos ningerde les ka rashai o baro , ka Caiaphas , ka lesko kher , kotse le Gramnoturia ai le phure kai poronchinas chidinisaile .

text: But Peter followed him afar off unto the high priest ' s palace , and went in , and sat with the servants , to see the end .
text2: O Petri liape pala leste de dural zhi ka e bar le bare rashaske , gelo andre , beshlo tele le slugensa , te dikhel so kerdiol .

text: Now the chief priests , and elders , and all the council , sought false witness against Jesus , to put him to death ;
text2: Le rasha le bare , ai sa e Sanhedren kodola kai shinenas le krisa , rodenas te thon beda xoxamni po Jesus , te shinen kris pe leste , te mudaren les .

text: But found none : yea , though many false witnesses came , yet found they none . At the last came two false witnesses ,
text2: Numa chi arakhle , makar ke but avile angle te xoxaven pa leste . De anda gor avile dui ai phende .

text: And said , This fellow said , I am able to destroy the temple of God , and to build it in three days .
text2: Kado manush phendias , " Man si e putiera te xaiiv e tampla le Devleski , ai ande trin dies te vazdav kodia tampla . "

text: And the high priest arose , and said unto him , Answerest thou nothing ? what is it which these witness against thee ?
text2: Antunchi o rashai o baro wushtilo opre , ai phendias leske , " Nai tu so te phenes pa kodia ? So phenen kadala manush pa tute ? "

text: But Jesus held his peace . And the high priest answered and said unto him , I adjure thee by the living God , that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ , the Son of God .
text2: Numa O Jesus chi phendias khanch . O rashai o baro phendias leske , " Thav tut pe solax angla O Del o zhuvindo te phenes amenge dar san tu O Kristo , O Shav le Devlesko . "

text: Jesus saith unto him , Thou hast said : nevertheless I say unto you , Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of power , and coming in the clouds of heaven .
text2: O Jesus phendias leske , " Tu phendian chire vorbensa , ai mai but me phenav tuke , ke mai angle si te dikhen O Shav le Manushesko ka o vas o chacho putierako ai sar avel pel nuveria le rhaioski . "

text: Then the high priest rent his clothes , saying , He hath spoken blasphemy ; what further need have we of witnesses ? behold , now ye have heard his blasphemy .
text2: Antunchi o rashai o baro shindias peske tsalia , ai dias mui , " Wo dias duma xoxaimos karing O Del , xoxavel pa Del ( Blasfime ! ) So mai trobul ame marturia ? Vi tume ashundian o blasfime .

text: What think ye ? They answered and said , He is guilty of death .
text2: So haliaren tume ? " " Trobul mudardo , " won phende .

text: Then did they spit in his face , and buffeted him ; and others smote him with the palms of their hands ,
text2: Antunchi chungarde les ando mui , dine les dab dukhumensa . Aver marde les palmi ,

text: Saying , Prophesy unto us , thou Christ , Who is he that smote thee ?
text2: ai phende , " Kristo , de ame profesi , kon dias tu dab ! "

text: Now Peter sat without in the palace : and a damsel came unto him , saying , Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee .
text2: O Petri beshelas avri ande bar ; iek zhuvli sluga avili , ai phendias , " Vi tu sanas lesa O Jesus andai Galilee . "

text: But he denied before them all , saying , I know not what thou sayest .
text2: Wo phendias , " Nai chaches " angla savorhende , " Chi zhanav pa soste des duma . "

text: And when he was gone out into the porch , another maid saw him , and said unto them that were there , This fellow was also with Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: Antunchi gelo karing e wurota , kotse kaver zhuvli dikhlias les , ai phendias kodolenge kai sas kotse , vi wo sas kodolesa O Jesus andai Nazareth . "

text: And again he denied with an oath , I do not know the man .
text2: Mai iek data phendias , " Nai chaches , " ai solaxadias , " Me chi zhanav les . "

text: And after a while came unto him they that stood by , and said to Peter , Surely thou also art one of them ; for thy speech bewrayeth thee .
text2: Hantsi vriama pala kodia kodola kai sas kote avile ka Petri , ai phende , " Chaches vi tu san iek anda lende , ke cho divano purhil tut . "

text: Then began he to curse and to swear , saying , I know not the man . And immediately the cock crew .
text2: Antunchi o Petri dias pe armaia ai solaxadias lenge , " Me chi zhanav kadale manushes , " ai strazo o kurkorsho bashlo .

text: And Peter remembered the word of Jesus , which said unto him , Before the cock crow , thou shalt deny me thrice . And he went out , and wept bitterly .
text2: Antunchi o Petri diape goji ka le vorbi , kai O Jesus phendiasas leske , " Mai anglal sar te bashel o kurkorsho , tu trivar phenesa , ke chi zhanes ma . " Anklisto avri , ai ruia zurales .

text: When the morning was come , all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death :
text2: Kana phuterdilo o dies sa le rasha ai le phure kai poronchinas avile andek than , ai dinepe duma pa O Jesus ai ashshile te mudaren les .

text: And when they had bound him , they led him away , and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor .
text2: Phangle les , ai ningerde les ka Pilate o guvernori .

text: Then Judas , which had betrayed him , when he saw that he was condemned , repented himself , and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders ,
text2: Kana O Judas kodo kai dias les ando vas , dikhlias ke shinde leske kris te mudaren les , keisailo , ai ningerdias palpale le trenda kotora rup kal rasha ai kal phure kai poronchinas .

text: Saying , I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood . And they said , What is that to us ? see thou to that .
text2: Ai phendias , " Bezex kerdem ke dem ando vas chache manushes , phende leske , " So si amenge kodia , chiri diela si . "

text: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple , and departed , and went and hanged himself .
text2: O Judas shudias le rupune love ande tamplo , ai gelo ai mudardilo .

text: And the chief priests took the silver pieces , and said , It is not lawful for to put them into the treasury , because it is the price of blood .
text2: Le bare rasha vazde sa le love , ai phende , " Nai mishto te thas kadala love andel love la tamplaki , ke kadala si ratvale love . "

text: And they took counsel , and bought with them the potter ' s field , to bury strangers in .
text2: Dinepe duma ai ashshile te chinen le lovensa ek kimpo kai busholas " Potter ' s field " o than kai bichinel le phiria chikake , te gropon streinon .

text: Wherefore that field was called , The field of blood , unto this day .
text2: Anda kodia phenen leske , " O kimpo le ratesko , zhi adies . "

text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremy the prophet , saying , And they took the thirty pieces of silver , the price of him that was valued , whom they of the children of Israel did value ;
text2: Antunchi so sas phendo katar o profeto Jeremiah pherdilo , " Line le trenda kotora rup , sode wo moldias uni Zhidovonge .

text: And gave them for the potter ' s field , as the Lord appointed me .
text2: Ai dine le te chinen o kimpo " Potter ' s field " . Sar O Del phendias mange . "

text: And Jesus stood before the governor : and the governor asked him , saying , Art thou the King of the Jews ? And Jesus said unto him , Thou sayest .
text2: O Jesus sas angla guvernori Pilate : ai o guvernori Pilate phushlias les , " Tu san o amperato le Zhidovongo ? " " Sar tu phendian , " O Jesus phendias leske .

text: And when he was accused of the chief priests and elders , he answered nothing .
text2: Kana phende ke doshalo lo le rasha le bare ai le phure kai poronchinas , wo chi phendias khanchi .

text: Then said Pilate unto him , Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee ?
text2: Antunchi o Pilate phendias leske , " Chi ashunes sa le dosha kai mothon pe tute ? "

text: And he answered him to never a word ; insomuch that the governor marvelled greatly .
text2: Numa O Jesus chi phendias khanchi ka chi iek andal dosha kai thode pe leste , anda kodia o guvernori Pilate chudisailo .

text: Now at that feast the governor was wont to release unto the people a prisoner , whom they would .
text2: Sas ek zakono ka guvernori Pilate po dies o baro le Zhidivongo te mekel avri iekes ande temnitsa savo godi o narodo halola .

text: And they had then a notable prisoner , called Barabbas .
text2: Sas phandado antunchi iek kai zhangloliaspe ke de sa nasul lo , lesko anav sas Barabbas .

text: Therefore when they were gathered together , Pilate said unto them , Whom will ye that I release unto you ? Barabbas , or Jesus which is called Christ ?
text2: Kana sas chidine , o Pilate phendias lenge , " Saves mangen te mekav tumenge ? O Barabbas vai O Jesus kai mothon leske Kristo ? "

text: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him .
text2: Ke wo zhanglias sostar dine les ando vas , ke le rashan sas inetsia pe leste .

text: When he was set down on the judgment seat , his wife sent unto him , saying , Have thou nothing to do with that just man : for I have suffered many things this day in a dream because of him .
text2: Kana beshlias po skamin te kerel e kris , leski rhomni tradias te mothon leske , " Na hamisavo ka kado chacho manush , ke adies chinuisardem but pala o suno kai dikhlem pa leste . "

text: But the chief priests and elders persuaded the multitude that they should ask Barabbas , and destroy Jesus .
text2: Le rasha le bare ai le phure kai poronchinas thode le narodos te mangen te mekel kodoles kai bushol Barabbas , ai te mudarel kodoles kai bushol Jesus .

text: The governor answered and said unto them , Whether of the twain will ye that I release unto you ? They said , Barabbas .
text2: O Pilate magdata phendias lenge , " Savo andal dui mangen te mekav tumenge ? " Won phende , " Barabbas "

text: Pilate saith unto them , What shall I do then with Jesus which is called Christ ? They all say unto him , Let him be crucified .
text2: O Pilate phendias lenge , " So te kerav kadalesa O Jesus kai mothon leske Kristo ? " Savorhe phende , " Tho les po trushul . "

text: And the governor said , Why , what evil hath he done ? But they cried out the more , saying , Let him be crucified .
text2: O Pilate phendias , " Sostar , che nasulimos kerdias ? " Numa won mai zurales dine mui , " Tho les po trushul . "

text: When Pilate saw that he could prevail nothing , but that rather a tumult was made , he took water , and washed his hands before the multitude , saying , I am innocent of the blood of this just person : see ye to it .
text2: Kana o Pilate dikhlias ke nashti kerel khanchi , ke buntuilaspe o narodo , lias pai , ai xaladias peske vas angla narodo , ai phendias , " Me chi sim doshalo anda rat kadale chache manushesko , akana zhi tumende si . "

text: Then answered all the people , and said , His blood be on us , and on our children .
text2: Sa le manush phende , " Lesko rat te avel pe amende ai pe amare glate . "

text: Then released he Barabbas unto them : and when he had scourged Jesus , he delivered him to be crucified .
text2: Antunchi meklias lenge o Barabbas , marde le Jesusos bichosa , ai dias les te thon les po trushul .

text: Then the soldiers of the governor took Jesus into the common hall , and gathered unto him the whole band of soldiers .
text2: Antunchi le ketani le Pilatoske line le Jesusos ningerde les ando kher le ketanengo , ai chidinisaile kruglom lestar ek antrego kompania ketani .

text: And they stripped him , and put on him a scarlet robe .
text2: Line leske tsalia pe leste , ai thode pe leste ek loli raxami .

text: And when they had platted a crown of thorns , they put it upon his head , and a reed in his right hand : and they bowed the knee before him , and mocked him , saying , Hail , King of the Jews !
text2: Kerde korona andal lunzhe kanrhe , ai thode la po lesko shero , ai thode rhai ande lesko vas o chacho , dine changa angla leste , te maren mui lestar , ai phenenas , " Lungo traio ka o amperato le Zhidovongo ! "

text: And they spit upon him , and took the reed , and smote him on the head .
text2: Chungarde pe leste , line e rhai ai marde les pa shero lasa .

text: And after that they had mocked him , they took the robe off from him , and put his own raiment on him , and led him away to crucify him .
text2: Kana getosarde te maren mui lestar , line pa leste e raxami , dine leske tsalia pe leste , ai ningerde les te thon les po trushul .

text: And as they came out , they found a man of Cyrene , Simon by name : him they compelled to bear his cross .
text2: Po drom kai zhanas , arakhle ieke manush anda Cyrene , kai busholas Simon : ai thode les te ningerel o trushul .

text: And when they were come unto a place called Golgotha , that is to say , a place of a skull ,
text2: Aresle ka kodo than kai bushol Golgatha , o than kai miazol " Kokalo sheresko " .

text: They gave him vinegar to drink mingled with gall : and when he had tasted thereof , he would not drink .
text2: Dine les lolo shut hamime drabensa te pel , kana zumadias , ai haliardias so si , chi pelias .

text: And they crucified him , and parted his garments , casting lots : that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the prophet , They parted my garments among them , and upon my vesture did they cast lots .
text2: Thode les po trushul , ai hulade leske tsalia pe save godi nirisardias les : te kerdiol so o profeto phendiasas , " Hulade murhe tsalia mashkar pende , ai thodepe te dikhen kon niril murhe raxami . "

text: And sitting down they watched him there ;
text2: Pala kodia beshle kote ai dikhenas pe leste .

text: And set up over his head his accusation written , THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS .
text2: Opral pa lesko shero amblade ek ramomos kai phenelas che dosh ankerde pe leste " KADO SI O JESUS AMPERATO LE ZHIDOVONGO . "

text: Then were there two thieves crucified with him , one on the right hand , and another on the left .
text2: Lesa ek data dui chor sas thodine po trushul , iek ka lesko chacho vas , ai iek ka lesko stingo .

text: And they that passed by reviled him , wagging their heads ,
text2: Zhene kai nakhenas kotsar , kerenas anda shero ai mishkirinas les .

text: And saying , Thou that destroyest the temple , and buildest it in three days , save thyself . If thou be the Son of God , come down from the cross .
text2: Ai phenenas , " Tu kai sas te xaiis e tampla , ai ande trin dies te vazdes kodia tampla , skepisar tut te san tu O Shav le Devlesko , aidi tele pa trushul . "

text: Likewise also the chief priests mocking him , with the scribes and elders , said ,
text2: Sakadia le rasha le bare , le phure kai poronchinas , ai kodola kai sikavenas le zakonuria marde mui lestar .

text: He saved others ; himself he cannot save . If he be the King of Israel , let him now come down from the cross , and we will believe him .
text2: Phenenas , " Skepisardias kavren , numa nashti skepil pes . Wo si O Amperato le themesko Israel , mek avel tele pa trushul , ai pachasa ame ande leste .

text: He trusted in God ; let him deliver him now , if he will have him : for he said , I am the Son of God .
text2: Wo pachalpe ando Del ai jinel pe leste , phendia ke O Shav le Devlesko lo , aven dikhas te mangela O Del te skepil les akana .

text: The thieves also , which were crucified with him , cast the same in his teeth .
text2: Vi le chor kai sas thodine po trushul lesa , marde lestar mui sakadia .

text: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land unto the ninth hour .
text2: Kal desh u dui po mashkar le diesesko tuniariko avilo pe lumia pe kai trin chasuria .

text: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice , saying , Eli , Eli , lama sabachthani ? that is to say , My God , my God , why hast thou forsaken me ?
text2: Karing le trin chasuria O Jesus dias mui andek baro glaso , " Eli , Eli , lama sabachthani ? " Kodia si " Murho Del , Murho Del , Sostar meklian ma ? "

text: Some of them that stood there , when they heard that , said , This man calleth for Elias .
text2: Uni anda kodola kai sas kote ashunde les , ai phende , " Po Elijah del mui . "

text: And straightway one of them ran , and took a spunge , and filled it with vinegar , and put it on a reed , and gave him to drink .
text2: Strazo iek anda lende grebisailo , lias ek kotor , thodias les ando lolo shut , thodias po khash ai zumadias te del ka Jesus te pel .

text: The rest said , Let be , let us see whether Elias will come to save him .
text2: Numa le kaver phende , " Mek les aven dikhas te avela o Elijah te skepil les . "

text: Jesus , when he had cried again with a loud voice , yielded up the ghost .
text2: Magdata O Jesus dias mui ando baro glaso , antunchi dias pesko duxo opre , ai mulo .

text: And , behold , the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom ; and the earth did quake , and the rocks rent ;
text2: Strazo o poxtan ande tamplo shindilo ande donde de opral zhi tele ; e phuv izdraias . Le bax pharhale .

text: And the graves were opened ; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose ,
text2: Le greposhevuria phuterdile , but anda le Devleske manush kai mule sas , sas vazdine ka traio .

text: And came out of the graves after his resurrection , and went into the holy city , and appeared unto many .
text2: Avile avri andal greposhevuria . Kana O Jesus wushtilo , won gele ando swunto foro , kote but zhene dikhle le .

text: Now when the centurion , and they that were with him , watching Jesus , saw the earthquake , and those things that were done , they feared greatly , saying , Truly this was the Son of God .
text2: O fitsiri ai le ketani kai sas lesa dikhenas po Jesus , dikhle sar izdraias e phuv , ai so godi kerdiliape , daraile zurales , ai phende , " Chaches kado sas O Shav le Devlesko . "

text: And many women were there beholding afar off , which followed Jesus from Galilee , ministering unto him :
text2: But zhuvlia avile pala Jesus andai Galilee te len sama lestar ai dikhenas de dural .

text: Among which was Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James and Joses , and the mother of Zebedee ' s children .
text2: Mashkar lende e Maria Magdalena , ai e Maria e dei le Iakovoski ai le Josefoski , ai e dei le shave le Zebedoske .

text: When the even was come , there came a rich man of Arimathaea , named Joseph , who also himself was Jesus ' disciple :
text2: Kana peli e riat , avilo iek manush barvalo andai Arimathaea , lesko anav sas Josef , wo sas iek anda kodola kai pachanaspe ando Jesus .

text: He went to Pilate , and begged the body of Jesus . Then Pilate commanded the body to be delivered .
text2: Gelo ke o Pilate , ai manglias le Jesusosko stato . O Pilate dias ordina te den les leste .

text: And when Joseph had taken the body , he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth ,
text2: Kana o Joseph lias o stato , vuluisardias les andek vuzho poxtan .

text: And laid it in his own new tomb , which he had hewn out in the rock : and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre , and departed .
text2: Ai thodias les ande pesko nevo greposhevo kai sas shindo ando bax , ai spidias ek baro bax angla greposhevo , ai gelotar ,

text: And there was Mary Magdalene , and the other Mary , sitting over against the sepulchre .
text2: E Maria Magdalena ai e kaver Maria beshenas angla greposhevo .

text: Now the next day , that followed the day of the preparation , the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate ,
text2: Pe terharin , kana getolaspe , o pervo anda le diesa le bare le Zhidovongo , le rasha le bare ai le Farizeanuria gele ka Pilate .

text: Saying , Sir , we remember that that deceiver said , while he was yet alive , After three days I will rise again .
text2: Ai phende leske , " Raia , diam ame goji ke kodo xoxamno mai anglal sar te merel phendias , " Po trito dies si te zhuvindiv . "

text: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day , lest his disciples come by night , and steal him away , and say unto the people , He is risen from the dead : so the last error shall be worse than the first .
text2: Anda kodia de ordina te phandachen o greposhevo mishto , zhi po trito dies , ke kam zhan leske disipluria te choren lesko stato , ai mothon le manushenge , ke wushtilo andai martia : Kodo xoxaimos si te avel mai nasul sar o pervo . "

text: Pilate said unto them , Ye have a watch : go your way , make it as sure as ye can .
text2: O Pilate phendias lenge , " Si tume zhene , zhan , keren so zhanen . "

text: So they went , and made the sepulchre sure , sealing the stone , and setting a watch .
text2: Geletar , ai phandade o greposhevo zurales , ai thode vari so po bax te haliardiolpe te phutrena les , ai mekle zhene te len sama .

text: In the end of the sabbath , as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week , came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre .
text2: Pala Sabat kana phuterdilo o dies . O pervo dies le kurkosko , e Maria Magdalena ai e kaver Maria gele te dikhen ka greposhevo .

text: And , behold , there was a great earthquake : for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven , and came and rolled back the stone from the door , and sat upon it .
text2: Kote izdraias e phuv zurales , ke ek angelo le Devlesko avilo tele anda rhaio , ai spidias palpale o bax , ai beshlo pe leste .

text: His countenance was like lightning , and his raiment white as snow :
text2: Strefialas sar o rhunjito , ai leske tsalia sas parne sar o iiv .

text: And for fear of him the keepers did shake , and became as dead men .
text2: Le zhene kai meklesas te len sama , daraile kadia de zurales ta izdranas ai kerdile sar mule manush .

text: And the angel answered and said unto the women , Fear not ye : for I know that ye seek Jesus , which was crucified .
text2: O angelo phendias le zhuvliange , " Na daran , zhanav ke roden te dikhen le Jesusos kai mulo po trushul .

text: He is not here : for he is risen , as he said . Come , see the place where the Lord lay .
text2: Nai katse , wushtilo , sar kai phendias , Aven ai dikhen o than kai sas .

text: And go quickly , and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead ; and , behold , he goeth before you into Galilee ; there shall ye see him : lo , I have told you .
text2: Zhan sigo ai phenen leske disiplonge , ke wo wushtilo andai martia , ai zhal mai anglal tumendar ande Galilee , kote si te dikhen les , na bustren so phendem tumenge .

text: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy ; and did run to bring his disciples word .
text2: Grebisaile te zhantar katar o greposhevo ande dar numa vi veselo sas , nashle te phenen leske disiplonge .

text: And as they went to tell his disciples , behold , Jesus met them , saying , All hail . And they came and held him by the feet , and worshipped him .
text2: O Jesus avilo ande lengo drom , dias le dies lasho . Avile leste , ai dine changa angla leste , thode le vas pe lesko punrhe , luvudinas les ai preznainas les .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Be not afraid : go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee , and there shall they see me .
text2: O Jesus antunchi phendias lenge , " Na daran , zhan ai phenen murhe phralenge te zhan ande Galilee , kote si te dikhen ma . "

text: Now when they were going , behold , some of the watch came into the city , and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done .
text2: Zhi pon le zhuvlia sas po drom . Uni andal ketani kai lenas sama ka greposhevo gele palpale ando foro , ai phende le bare rashange so godi kerdiliape .

text: And when they were assembled with the elders , and had taken counsel , they gave large money unto the soldiers ,
text2: Le rasha le bare avile andek than le phurensa kai poronchin ai dinepe duma so te keren . Dine but love kal ketani .

text: Saying , Say ye , His disciples came by night , and stole him away while we slept .
text2: Ai phende lenge , " Mothon ke leske disipluria , " Avile ande riat , ai chorde lesko stato zhi pon tume sovenas . "

text: And if this come to the governor ' s ears , we will persuade him , and secure you .
text2: Te aresela kado divano ka o guvernori Pilate , pachas les ame ai mekas te avel beda pe tumende . "

text: So they took the money , and did as they were taught : and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day .
text2: Le ketani line le love , ai kerde so phende lenge , kado divano phendo mashkar le Zhiduvuria zhi adies .

text: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee , into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them .
text2: Le desh u dui disipluria gele ande Galilee pe plai kai O Jesus tradias le .

text: And when they saw him , they worshipped him : but some doubted .
text2: Kana dikhle les , luvudisarde ai preznaisarde les . numa uni chi pachanas .

text: And Jesus came and spake unto them , saying , All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth .
text2: O Jesus avilo pasha lende ai phendias lenge , " Sa e putiera ando rhaio ai pe phuv si dini mande .

text: Go ye therefore , and teach all nations , baptizing them in the name of the Father , and of the Son , and of the Holy Ghost :
text2: Anda kodia , zhan ai keren disipluria anda sa le thema , bolen le ando anav le Dadesko , le Shavesko , ai le Swuntone Duxosko .

text: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you : and , lo , I am with you alway , even unto the end of the world . Amen .
text2: Sikaven le te keren so godi phendem tumenge , ai na bustren ke tumensa sim , zhi ando gor la lumiako . "

text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ , the Son of God ;
text2: E lashi viasta le Jesus Kristoski , O Shav le Devlesko .

text: As it is written in the prophets , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Ande klishka le profetoski sar ramosardia o Isaiah , O Del phenelas pa Iovano . Ashun ! Tradava murho sluga mai anglal tutar te lasharel o drom tumenge .

text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Ek glaso kai del mui ande pusta , " Lashar o drom le Devlesko ; keren leske vorta drom ! "

text: John did baptize in the wilderness , and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins .
text2: O Iovano o baptisto avilo ande pusta bolelas le manushen ai dia duma pa Del . Phenelas , " Kein tume anda tumare bezexa ai aven bolde .

text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea , and they of Jerusalem , and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: O Narodo avelas leste anda sa e Judea ai anda Jerusalem . Phende peske bezexale , ai o Iovano bolelas len ando pai Jordan .

text: And John was clothed with camel ' s hair , and with a girdle of a skin about his loins ; and he did eat locusts and wild honey ;
text2: Le tsalia le Iovanoske sas kerde andal bal la gemulake , ai phiravelas prastia morchaki kruglom peske mashkar , xalas sarancha / grimptsuria ai avjin sirbatiko / divlo avjin .

text: And preached , saying , There cometh one mightier than I after me , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose .
text2: Wo dia duma pa Del , phenelas , " Kodo kai avela pala mande si mai baro mandar ; chi sim dosta lasho te banjuav ai phutrav leske doria .

text: I indeed have baptized you with water : but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Me bolav tume le paiesa , numa wo bolel tume le Swuntone Duxosa . "

text: And it came to pass in those days , that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee , and was baptized of John in Jordan .
text2: Ande kodia vriama , O Jesus avilo andai foro Nazareth , kai si ando them Galilee , ai o Iovano boldia les ando pai Jordan .

text: And straightway coming up out of the water , he saw the heavens opened , and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him :
text2: Kana O Jesus anklisto anda pai , strazo o cheri phuterdilo angla leste , ai O Duxo le Devlesko sar ek gulumbo xulelas ai avilo pe leste .

text: And there came a voice from heaven , saying , Thou art my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: Ai ek glaso anda rhaio phendia , " Tu san murho Shav kai si de sa mange drago . Kasa sim de sa raduime . "

text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness .
text2: Ai strazo O Jesus angerdosas katar O Swunto Duxo ande pusta .

text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days , tempted of Satan ; and was with the wild beasts ; and the angels ministered unto him .
text2: Ai sas kotse ande pusta shtarvardesh dies te avel zumado katar o beng . Ai sas kotse le chore zheganiasa , numa le angeluria le sama lestar .

text: Now after that John was put in prison , Jesus came into Galilee , preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God ,
text2: Pala kodia o Iovano sas thodino ande temnitsa , O Jesus avilo ande Galilee . Wo del duma e lashi viasta le Devleski katar O Del .

text: And saying , The time is fulfilled , and the kingdom of God is at hand : repent ye , and believe the gospel .
text2: Ai wo phenel , " E vriama te pherdiol , ai e amperetsia le rhaioski pashol : kein tume anda tumare bezexa ai pachan e lashi viasta . "

text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee , he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: Sar phirelas O Jesus pasha maria Galilee , dikhlia o Simon ai lesko phral , o Andre shudenas sita ande maria ke won sas masharia .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Come ye after me , and I will make you to become fishers of men .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Aven mansa ai kerava anda tumende masharia kai astaren manushen . "

text: And straightway they forsook their nets , and followed him .
text2: Strazo mekle penge siti ai linepe pala lesta .

text: And when he had gone a little further thence , he saw James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , who also were in the ship mending their nets .
text2: O Jesus gelo mai angle ai dikhlia o Iakov ai o Iovano , le shave le Zebedeske . Won sas ando ek chuno lasharenas penge siti .

text: And straightway he called them : and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants , and went after him .
text2: Ai strazo O Jesus akhardia le ; ai mekle peske dades , o Zebede ando chuno le slugensa kai kerenas buchi lenge , ai linepe pala Jesus .

text: And they went into Capernaum ; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue , and taught .
text2: Gele ando foro Caperaum . Ai strazo po dies Savatosko O Jesus gelo ande synagogue te sicharel le manushen .

text: And they were astonished at his doctrine : for he taught them as one that had authority , and not as the scribes .
text2: Kodo narodo chudimesas sar sicharelas o zakono , ke O Jesus sicharelas le putierasa , nas sar le Gramnoturia .

text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit ; and he cried out ,
text2: Ande synagogue sas iek manush kai sas ande leste o bi vuzho ; ai tsipisardia zurales .

text: Saying , Let us alone ; what have we to do with thee , thou Jesus of Nazareth ? art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art , the Holy One of God .
text2: " So manges amendar , O Jesus andai Nazareth ? Avilian te mudares ame ? Zhanav kon san . Tu san O Swunto Shav le Devlesko ! "

text: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and come out of him .
text2: O Jesus dia les trad , ai phendia leske , " Chi mai des duma ai ankles avri anda leste ! "

text: And when the unclean spirit had torn him , and cried with a loud voice , he came out of him .
text2: O bi vuzho peradia kodole manushes pe phuv , tsipisardia zurales , ai anklisto avri anda leste .

text: And they were all amazed , insomuch that they questioned among themselves , saying , What thing is this ? what new doctrine is this ? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits , and they do obey him .
text2: Savorhe chudisaile ai phushenas iek kavreske , " So kerdilia ? Si nevo sicharimos ? Kado manush del duma le putierasa ai zorasa ka le bengen ai anklen avri . "

text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee .
text2: Ai strazo katar godi o narodo delas duma po Jesus ande sa o them Galilee .

text: And forthwith , when they were come out of the synagogue , they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew , with James and John .
text2: Won geletar andai synagogue and strazo avile ando kher le Simonosko ai Andresko , o Iakov ai o Iovano gele lensa .

text: But Simon ' s wife ' s mother lay sick of a fever , and anon they tell him of her .
text2: E sakra le Petreski , sas ando than ke phabolas , ai strazo won phende leske pa late .

text: And he came and took her by the hand , and lifted her up ; and immediately the fever left her , and she ministered unto them .
text2: Wo avilo late , lia lako vas ai vazdia la . Ai strazo o zharo mekia la , wushtili ai podaisardia les ,

text: And at even , when the sun did set , they brought unto him all that were diseased , and them that were possessed with devils .
text2: Akana peli e riat , andine ka Jesus sa le manush kai sas naswale , ai kodolen kai sas beng ande lende .

text: And all the city was gathered together at the door .
text2: Sa le manush ande foro chidinesas angla o kher .

text: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases , and cast out many devils ; and suffered not the devils to speak , because they knew him .
text2: O Jesus sastiardia but naswalen kai sas le but fialuria naswalimata , ai gonisardia le bengen ; ai chi meklia le beng te mothon , ke won zhanenas les .

text: And in the morning , rising up a great while before day , he went out , and departed into a solitary place , and there prayed .
text2: Kana phuterdilo o dies O Jesus wushtilo , ai gelotar vari kai te avel korkorho , ai kotse rhugisailo .

text: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him .
text2: O Simon ai won kai sas lesa gele te roden les ;

text: And when they had found him , they said unto him , All men seek for thee .
text2: Kana arakhle les , phende leske , " Savorhen roden tu . "

text: And he said unto them , Let us go into the next towns , that I may preach there also : for therefore came I forth .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Aventar , trobul te zhas ande aver gava kai si pashe te sicharav E Vorba le Devleski , ke sostar avilem . "

text: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee , and cast out devils .
text2: Ai wo dia duma pa Del ande synagoguria ande sa Galilee , ai gonisardia le bengen .

text: And there came a leper to him , beseeching him , and kneeling down to him , and saying unto him , If thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Iek lepra avilo ka Jesus , thodiape ande changende angla leste , ai phendia leske , " Tu te mangesa , sai vuzhares ma . "

text: And Jesus , moved with compassion , put forth his hand , and touched him , and saith unto him , I will ; be thou clean .
text2: Ai O Jesus sas leske mila leste , lunzhardia o vas , azbadia les , ai phendia leske , " Mangav , av vuzho ! "

text: And as soon as he had spoken , immediately the leprosy departed from him , and he was cleansed .
text2: Strazo wuzhilo andai leprosi , sasto sas .

text: And he straitly charged him , and forthwith sent him away ;
text2: Ai strazo O Jesus dia les trad te zhaltar , phenelas ,

text: And saith unto him , See thou say nothing to any man : but go thy way , shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: " Arakh tu , te na phenes kanikaske , numa zha sikadiol kal baro rasha , porme de e podarka kai phendia o Moses te den , kashte te zhanen . "

text: But he went out , and began to publish it much , and to blaze abroad the matter , insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city , but was without in desert places : and they came to him from every quarter .
text2: Numa kado manush gelo ai dia duma pa so kerdia O Jesus , ai phendia e lashi viasta kai godi zhalas . Pala kodia O Jesus nashti zhal ando foro angla le manushen , numa sas ande pusta , ai le manush avile leste katar swako rig .

text: And again he entered into Capernaum , after some days ; and it was noised that he was in the house .
text2: O Jesus pale gelo ando Capernau , ai ashunenas e viasta ke wo sas ando kher .

text: And straightway many were gathered together , insomuch that there was no room to receive them , no , not so much as about the door : and he preached the word unto them .
text2: Ai strazo but manush chudinisaile andek than ando kher , ma nas than andre te beshen , ai vi avrial angla o wudar nas than . O Jesus sicharelas le E Vorba le Devleski .

text: And they come unto him , bringing one sick of the palsy , which was borne of four .
text2: Shtar manush avile leste , ai andine leste ieke manushes kai sas bango , pashliolas po than .

text: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press , they uncovered the roof where he was : and when they had broken it up , they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay .
text2: Numa chi zhanenas kai te zhan ando kher ke but narodo sas , ankliste po chardako , ai kerde ek gropa , ai vuliarde les le thanasa mashkar O narodo ai angla Jesus .

text: When Jesus saw their faith , he said unto the sick of the palsy , Son , thy sins be forgiven thee .
text2: Kana O Jesus dikhlia lengo pachamos , phendias le bangeske , " Shav che bezexa iertime le . "

text: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there , and reasoning in their hearts ,
text2: Numa sas uni Gramnoturia beshenas tele kotse , ai phenenas peske ,

text: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies ? who can forgive sins but God only ?
text2: " Sar sai kado manush tromal te lel o than le Devlesko ? Ke ferdi O Del sai iertil le bezexa ? "

text: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves , he said unto them , Why reason ye these things in your hearts ?
text2: Ai strazo O Jesus zhanglia lenge ginduria , ai phendia lenge , " Sostar si tume kasave chorhe ginduria ande tumaro ilo ?

text: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Arise , and take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: So si mai vushoro te phenes ka le banges , " Che bezexa iertime vai wushti opre ai phir ? "

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , ( he saith to the sick of the palsy , )
text2: Numa te zhanen ke ka O Shav le Manushesko si e putiera te iertil le bezexa . " Ai phedia le bangeske ,

text: I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy bed , and go thy way into thine house .
text2: Phenav tuke , " Wushti , le cho than ai zha khere ! "

text: And immediately he arose , took up the bed , and went forth before them all ; insomuch that they were all amazed , and glorified God , saying , We never saw it on this fashion .
text2: Ai strazo wushtilo , gelotar angla lende , sa narodo chudisailo , ai luvudinas le Devles , phenen , " Shoxar chi dikhlian ek diela sar dikhliam adies . "

text: And he went forth again by the sea side ; and all the multitude resorted unto him , and he taught them .
text2: Pala kodia O Jesus gelo palpale kai maria Galilee ; ai sa narodo avelas leste , ai wo sichardia le .

text: And as he passed by , he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom , and said unto him , Follow me . And he arose and followed him .
text2: Sar phiravelaspe , dikhlia o Levi , o shav le Alphaeusosko beshelas tele kai skafidi kai pochinenas e taksa le themeske , ai phendia leske , " Av pala mande . " O Levi wushtilo ai liape pala leste .

text: And it came to pass , that , as Jesus sat at meat in his house , many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples : for there were many , and they followed him .
text2: Kana O Jesus xalas ando lesko kher , but manush kai chiden e taksa , ai le bezexale avile te beshen kai skafidi lesa ai leske disipluria .

text: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners , they said unto his disciples , How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners ?
text2: - Ai kana le Gramnoturia ai le Farizeanuria dikhle ke Jesus xalas le manushensa kai chiden e taksa ai kodolen kai si bezexale ; phushle leske disipluria , " Sostar tumaro gazda xal le manushensa kai chiden e taksa ai kodolensa kai si bezerxale ? "

text: When Jesus heard it , he saith unto them , They that are whole have no need of the physician , but they that are sick : I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: O Jesus ashundia le ai phendia lenge , " Le manush kai si saste chi trobul le dokxtoro , le naswalen trobul . Chi avilem te akharav kodolen kai gindinpe vorta angla Del , numa le bezexalen . "

text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast : and they come and say unto him , Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: Le disipluria le Iovanoske ai le Farizeanuria zholinas , ai aven ka Jesus ai phushen lestar , " Sostar , le disipluria le Iovanoske ai le Farizeanuria zholin butivar , ai che disipluria chi zholin ? "

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ? as long as they have the bridegroom with them , they cannot fast .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Sar sai zholin le manush kai si akharde ka abiav , kana o manush kai ansurilpe lensalo ?

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: Numa avela e vriama kai o manush kai ansurilpe avela lino lendar , antunchi zholina . "

text: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment : else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old , and the rent is made worse .
text2: " Khonik chi suvel nevo kotor poxtan te lasharel phurane tsalia , ke o nevo kotor tsigniol , ai kerdiol mai nasul o shinimos .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles : else the new wine doth burst the bottles , and the wine is spilled , and the bottles will be marred : but new wine must be put into new bottles .
text2: Le manush chi thon nevi mol andel phurane morchia moliake , ke le morchia pharhadion , ai e mol shordiol , ai le morchia rimonpe . Numa thon e nevi mol andel neve morchia .

text: And it came to pass , that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day ; and his disciples began , as they went , to pluck the ears of corn .
text2: Ande kodia vriama O Jesus nakhlia pe ek niva kai bariolas jiv po Sabat . Ai leske disipluria line anda jiv .

text: And the Pharisees said unto him , Behold , why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful ?
text2: Ai le Farizeanuria phende leske , " Eta , Sostar che disipluria keren so nai slobodo te keren po Sabat ? "

text: And he said unto them , Have ye never read what David did , when he had need , and was an hungred , he , and they that were with him ?
text2: Wo phendia lenge , " Chi jindian so kerdia o David kana bokhailo , wo ai le manush kai sas lesa ?

text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest , and did eat the shewbread , which is not lawful to eat but for the priests , and gave also to them which were with him ?
text2: Sar gelo ando kher le Devlesko kana o Abiathar sas o baro rasha , ai xalias andal halome manrhe kai nas leske slobodo te xal , vai kodolenge kai sas lesa , numa le rashange .

text: And he said unto them , The sabbath was made for man , and not man for the sabbath :
text2: Wo phendia lenge , " O Sabat kerdilo le manushenge ; ai nai manush le Sabatoske .

text: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Ke O Shav le Manushesko si o gazda le Sabatosko . "

text: And he entered again into the synagogue ; and there was a man there which had a withered hand .
text2: O Jesus gelo palpale ande synagogue , ai kotse sas iek manush kai sas les vas bango .

text: And they watched him , whether he would heal him on the sabbath day ; that they might accuse him .
text2: Won lenas sama po Jesus , te sastiarela vari kas savatone ; kashte te dosharen les .

text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand , Stand forth .
text2: O Jesus phendia le manushesko kai sas les vas bango , " Wushti opre . "

text: And he saith unto them , Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days , or to do evil ? to save life , or to kill ? But they held their peace .
text2: Ai phushlia lenge , " Slobodo po Sabat te kerelpe mishtimos vai te kerelpe nasulimos ? Te skepisar le manushes vai te mudar le manushes ? Numa chi phende khanch .

text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger , being grieved for the hardness of their hearts , he saith unto the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it out : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: O Jesus xolailo sas kana dikhlia pe lende , nekezhilas ke nas le mila le manushenge , numa mila sas les pe lende . Phende le manusheske , " Lunzhar cho vas . " Wo lunzhardia pesko vas ai sasto sas sar o kolaver .

text: And the Pharisees went forth , and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: Le Farizeanuria geletar , ai strazo dinepe duma le slugensa le amperatosko o Herod , sar te mudaren les .

text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea : and a great multitude from Galilee followed him , and from Judaea ,
text2: O Jesus gelo kai maria leske disiplonsa , ai but narodo lenaspe pala leste andai Galilee , ai andai Judea ,

text: And from Jerusalem , and from Idumaea , and from beyond Jordan ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
text2: ai andai Jerusalem , ai andai Idumea , ai inchal o Jordan , ai andai le foruria Tire ai Sidon .

text: And he spake to his disciples , that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude , lest they should throng him .
text2: Kana o narodo ashunde so kerdiasas , avile leste . Ai wo phendia leske disipluria kai mangel ek chuno te azhukerel les te trobul les , ke o baro narodo pashon pasha leste katar swako rig .

text: For he had healed many ; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him , as many as had plagues .
text2: Ke sastiardia but manushen , ai sa le naswale avenas leste te azban les .

text: And unclean spirits , when they saw him , fell down before him , and cried , saying , Thou art the Son of God .
text2: Kana le bi vuzhe dikhle les , pele tele angla leste , ai tsipisarde , phenen , " Tu san O Shav le Devlesko ! "

text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known .
text2: Ai strazo O Jesus dia le trad te na phenen kon sas wo .

text: And he goeth up into a mountain , and calleth unto him whom he would : and they came unto him .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus gelo po plai ai akhardia peste le manushen kai manglia . Won avile leste .

text: And he ordained twelve , that they should be with him , and that he might send them forth to preach ,
text2: Wo alosardia desh u dui , kai akhardia Apostles te beshen lesa , ai tradela le te den duma pa Del .

text: And to have power to heal sicknesses , and to cast out devils :
text2: Ai dia le e putiera te sastiaren le naswalimata , ai te gonin le bengen :

text: And Simon he surnamed Peter ;
text2: Ai o Simon wo akhardo Petri .

text: And James the son of Zebedee , and John the brother of James ; and he surnamed them Boanerges , which is , The sons of thunder :
text2: Ai o Iakov o shav le Zebedesko ai lesko phral o Iovano , wo akhardo le Boanerges kai si " Le shave rhunjitosko . "

text: And Andrew , and Philip , and Bartholomew , and Matthew , and Thomas , and James the son of Alphaeus , and Thaddaeus , and Simon the Canaanite ,
text2: Ai Andre , ai Philip , ai Bartholmew , ai Mate , ai Thomas , ai Iakov o shav le Alphaeusosko , ai Thaddaeus , ai o Simon o Canaanite ,

text: And Judas Iscariot , which also betrayed him : and they went into an house .
text2: ai o Judas Iscariot , kai purhisardia les , ai gele ando kher .

text: And the multitude cometh together again , so that they could not so much as eat bread .
text2: Kana O Jesus avilo ando kher , but narodo chidinisaile andek than angla leste , ai nas le vriama te xan .

text: And when his friends heard of it , they went out to lay hold on him : for they said , He is beside himself .
text2: Kana leski familia ashundia kodia , roden te astaren les ke le manush phenenas , " Xasardo leski goji ! "

text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said , He hath Beelzebub , and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils .
text2: Ai le Gramnoturia avile andai Jerusalem phenenas , " Si les Beelzebub ande leste ! Ai gonil le bengen ke o baro le bengengo , o Beelzebub del les e putiera . "

text: And he called them unto him , and said unto them in parables , How can Satan cast out Satan ?
text2: Ai O Jesus akhardia le manushen leste , ai phendia lenge paramichi , " Sar sai o beng gonil le bengen ?

text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself , that kingdom cannot stand .
text2: Ek amperetsia kai si xuladi pe peste si te xaiil , chi ashela .

text: And if a house be divided against itself , that house cannot stand .
text2: Ek familia kai si xulade pe peste si te xaiil , chi ashela .

text: And if Satan rise up against himself , and be divided , he cannot stand , but hath an end .
text2: Teala o beng gonil le bengen , won si xulade pe peste . Sar rhivdila ai ashela leske amperetsia ?

text: No man can enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he will first bind the strong man ; and then he will spoil his house .
text2: Vai sar sai del vari kon ando kher zurale manushesko , ai te lel so si lesko , bi te phandel le zurale manush , ai antunchi te lel so si lesko "

text: Verily I say unto you , All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men , and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme :
text2: Chachimasa phenav tumenge , " Sa le bezexa ai kai den duma nasul le manush sai iertilpe .

text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness , but is in danger of eternal damnation :
text2: Numa kon del duma nasul po Swunto Duxo , shoxar chi avela iertime . Chi ande kadia lumia vai e lumia kai si te avel . "

text: Because they said , He hath an unclean spirit .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge kadala vorbi ke uni phenenas , " Si les iek beng ande leste . "

text: There came then his brethren and his mother , and , standing without , sent unto him , calling him .
text2: Antunchi leski dei ai leske phral avile , beshenas avri , ai mangenas te den duma lesa .

text: And the multitude sat about him , and they said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee .
text2: But narodo beshenas tele pasha Jesus , ai phenen leske , " Dikh , chi dei ai che phral avri , ai mangen te dikhen tu . "

text: And he answered them , saying , Who is my mother , or my brethren ?
text2: Wo dia lenge atweto , phenel , " Kon si murhi dei , vai murhe phral ? "

text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: Ai wo dikhlia pe lende kai beshenas tele pasha leste ai phendia , " Eta , Murhi dei ai murhe phral ! "

text: For whosoever shall do the will of God , the same is my brother , and my sister , and mother .
text2: Ke kon godi kerel e voia murho Dadeski kai si ando rhaio , si murho phral , murhi phei , ai murhi dei . "

text: And he began again to teach by the sea side : and there was gathered unto him a great multitude , so that he entered into a ship , and sat in the sea ; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land .
text2: Pale O Jesus gelo kai maria Galilee ai sicharelas . Kadia de but narodo chidinisailo kruglom lestar ta anklisto ando chuno ai beshlo tele , o chuno sas po pai , ai o narodo beshelas po berego .

text: And he taught them many things by parables , and said unto them in his doctrine ,
text2: Ai sicharelas lenge paramichi pa but dieli , ai phendias lenge ande leske sicharimos ,

text: Hearken ; Behold , there went out a sower to sow :
text2: " Ashun ! Eta , iek manush gelo te shudel sumuntsi pe phuv .

text: And it came to pass , as he sowed , some fell by the way side , and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up .
text2: Ai sar shudelas le sumuntsi pe phuv , uni pele pasha drom , ai le chiriklia avile ai xale le .

text: And some fell on stony ground , where it had not much earth ; and immediately it sprang up , because it had no depth of earth :
text2: Uni pele po than kai sas bax , kai nas but phuv . Le sumuntsi barile sigo ke nas but phuv .

text: But when the sun was up , it was scorched ; and because it had no root , it withered away .
text2: Kana anklisto o kham , phabardia le , ke nas vuni , shuchile .

text: And some fell among thorns , and the thorns grew up , and choked it , and it yielded no fruit .
text2: Ai uni pele mashkar le kanrhe , kodola kanrhe barile ai tasade le , ai chi dine fruiti .

text: And other fell on good ground , and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased ; and brought forth , some thirty , and some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Numa aver pele pe lashi phuv , ai dine fruti , uni dine trenda , aver shovardesh ai aver iek shel .

text: And he said unto them , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Ai wo phendia lenge , " Kudo kai si les khan te ashunel , mek te ashunel ! "

text: And when he was alone , they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable .
text2: Kana O Jesus sas korkorho , uni manush kai ashunde les ai le desh u dui disipluria avile leste ai phushle les pa paramichi .

text: And he said unto them , Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God : but unto them that are without , all these things are done in parables :
text2: Wo phendia lenge , " Ke tumenge sas shinado te zhanen so si garado pa e amperetsia le Devleski , numa lenge nas dino , le kolavrenge si phendo kadia buchi ande paramichi .

text: That seeing they may see , and not perceive ; and hearing they may hear , and not understand ; lest at any time they should be converted , and their sins should be forgiven them .
text2: Dikhen , numa chi dichol lenge : ai ashunen , numa chi haliaren ; te haliaren , amboldenpe karing mande , ai lenge bezexa aven iertime . "

text: And he said unto them , Know ye not this parable ? and how then will ye know all parables ?
text2: O Jesus phushlia lenge , " Chi haliaren kadia paramichi ? Sar sai haliaren le kaver paramichi kai phenav tumenge ?

text: The sower soweth the word .
text2: O manush kai shudel e sumuntsa si E Vorba le Devleski .

text: And these are they by the way side , where the word is sown ; but when they have heard , Satan cometh immediately , and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts .
text2: Kodola kai si pasha drom , si kodola kai ashunen E Vorba le Devkeski ; kana ashunen la , strazo avela o beng ai ankalavel so sas thodino ando ilo le manushesko .

text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground ; who , when they have heard the word , immediately receive it with gladness ;
text2: E sumuntsa kai sas shudine pe phuv kai sas bax , si sar le manush kai ashunen E Vorba , ai andak data lel E Vorba ai veselimelo .

text: And have no root in themselves , and so endure but for a time : afterward , when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word ' s sake , immediately they are offended .
text2: Numa chi gelo divano dur ande lengo ilo ai nas te ankerdiol , rhivdil xantsi vriama , ke kana avel zumaimos pe lende , vai dosharen le manush , vai maren mui lestar ke ashundias E Vorba ai pachaias , antunchi lenge dragostia xantsol duriol ai mekelpe .

text: And these are they which are sown among thorns ; such as hear the word ,
text2: E sumuntsa kai sas shudini mashkar le kanrhe si sar le manush kai ashunde E Vorba le Devleski .

text: And the cares of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , and the lusts of other things entering in , choke the word , and it becometh unfruitful .
text2: Numa ande lengo ilo si le ginduria , o pharipe , o nekazo le traiosko ande kadia lumia , ai o dziliarimos barvalimasko , kadala tasaven E Vorba le Devleski , ai nashti del fruta .

text: And these are they which are sown on good ground ; such as hear the word , and receive it , and bring forth fruit , some thirtyfold , some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: E sumuntsa kai sas shudini pe lashi phuv si sar le manush kai ashunen E Vorba le Devleski ai haliaren la , ai anen fruta ande lende ai kotsar avel mai but katar uni iek shel , katar uni shovardesh , ai katar uni trenda . "

text: And he said unto them , Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel , or under a bed ? and not to be set on a candlestick ?
text2: Wo phendia lenge , " Khonik chi del iag iek memeli ai garavel les telai vadra vai telai pato ? Numa thol les pe skafidi te del vediara savorhen kai si ando kher .

text: For there is nothing hid , which shall not be manifested ; neither was any thing kept secret , but that it should come abroad .
text2: Ke nai khanchi garado , kai trobul e avel sikado ; khanchi garado , kai trobul te zhanen ai te dikhen savorhe . Ashun mishto , te si tume khan te ashunen ! "

text: And he said unto them , Take heed what ye hear : with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you : and unto you that hear shall more be given .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Len sama so ashunen . Ke so keren le kolavrenge , O Del kerela tumenge , ai vi mai but .

text: For he that hath , to him shall be given : and he that hath not , from him shall be taken even that which he hath .
text2: Ke kodoles kai si les , avela dino ; numa kodoles kai nai les , avela lino lestar . "

text: And he said , So is the kingdom of God , as if a man should cast seed into the ground ;
text2: Wo phendia , " E amperetsia le Devleski , si sar iek manush kai shudel sumuntsa pe phuv ;

text: And should sleep , and rise night and day , and the seed should spring and grow up , he knoweth not how .
text2: Sovel swako riat ai wushti swako diminiatsi . E sumuntsa bariol , numa chi zhanel sar .

text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself ; first the blade , then the ear , after that the full corn in the ear .
text2: E phuv del fruta anda peste , mai anglal avel e patri , porme o jiv , ai gata ande korzha .

text: But when the fruit is brought forth , immediately he putteth in the sickle , because the harvest is come .
text2: Kana gata e fruta , shinel la , ke o chidimos avilo . "

text: And he said , Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God ? or with what comparison shall we compare it ?
text2: O Jesus phendia , " Pe soste miazol e amperetsia le Devleski ? Vai savi paramichi sai phenav tumenge te haliaren mishto ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when it is sown in the earth , is less than all the seeds that be in the earth :
text2: Si sar ek sumuntsa garchitsaki , kai sas shudini pe phuv .

text: But when it is sown , it groweth up , and becometh greater than all herbs , and shooteth out great branches ; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it .
text2: Makar ke si e mai tsinorhi andal sumuntsi : Kana bariol si mai bari andal patria , ai kerdiol krenga ; ta le chiriklia anda cheri aven te beshen ande krenga . "

text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them , as they were able to hear it .
text2: O Jesus sicharelas le manushen E Vorba le Devleski le paramichensa ; wo sichardia le xantsi po xantsi sar dashtisarde te haliaren .

text: But without a parable spake he not unto them : and when they were alone , he expounded all things to his disciples .
text2: Numa bi le paramichensa cii dia duma lenge : ai kana korkorho sas leske slugensa , wo sichardia le so znachil sa le paramichi .

text: And the same day , when the even was come , he saith unto them , Let us pass over unto the other side .
text2: Ai wo saikfielo dies , kana e riat avili , phendia lenge , " Aven pe kaver rig le paieske . "

text: And when they had sent away the multitude , they took him even as he was in the ship . And there were also with him other little ships .
text2: Ai kana mekle o narodo ; le disipluria ankliste ando chuno kai sas O Jesus , ai ingerde les lensa . Ai sas aver chunuria .

text: And there arose a great storm of wind , and the waves beat into the ship , so that it was now full .
text2: Bari barval avili pe maria , ta le talazuria vusharavenas o chuno , ai pherdiolas o chuno le paiesa .

text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship , asleep on a pillow : and they awake him , and say unto him , Master , carest thou not that we perish ?
text2: O Jesus sas palal ando chuno sovelas pe sheran . Wushtiarde les , ai phende leske , " Gazda , nai khanchi tuke ke xaiisavas ? "

text: And he arose , and rebuked the wind , and said unto the sea , Peace , be still . And the wind ceased , and there was a great calm .
text2: O Jesus wushtilo ai dia mui pe barval , tsipisardia pe maria " Ash ! Besh trankilo ! " ai e barval kerdili bari hodina , ai o pai chi mai buntuilpe .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye so fearful ? how is it that ye have no faith ?
text2: Wo phendia lenge , " Sostar daran kadia zurales ? Sarta nai tume khanchi pachamos ? "

text: And they feared exceedingly , and said one to another , What manner of man is this , that even the wind and the sea obey him ?
text2: Daraile , ai phenen iek kavreske , " Che fielo manush kado , vi e barval ai e maria pachan lesko mui ! "

text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea , into the country of the Gadarenes .
text2: Ai aresle pe kaver rig le paieske , ando them kai bushol Gadarenes .

text: And when he was come out of the ship , immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit ,
text2: Ai kana anklisto avri anda chuno , strazo ek manush anklisto avri andal kaplitsi kai sas les ek bi vuzho ande leste .

text: Who had his dwelling among the tombs ; and no man could bind him , no , not with chains :
text2: Kado manush beshelas andel kaplitsi ; ai khonik nashti phandel les le lansuriansa .

text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains , and the chains had been plucked asunder by him , and the fetters broken in pieces : neither could any man tame him .
text2: Ke butivar le manush phandesas les lantsonsa ai sastrensa pel punrhe , numa wo pharhadia le lantsuria ai le sastri kai sas pel punrhe ai vas . Khonik nashtil te aterdiol les ke sas les pra but zor .

text: And always , night and day , he was in the mountains , and in the tombs , crying , and cutting himself with stones .
text2: Swako riat ai swako dies phirelas andel kaplitsi ai po plaia , tsipilas , ai shinelaspe le baxensa .

text: But when he saw Jesus afar off , he ran and worshipped him ,
text2: Kana o manush kai sas les ek bi vuzho ande leste dikhlian O Jesus dur lestar , nashlia ai dia le changa angle leste .

text: And cried with a loud voice , and said , What have I to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of the most high God ? I adjure thee by God , that thou torment me not .
text2: Ai tsipisardia zurales , ai phendias , " So manges mandar , Jesus , tu , Shav le Devlesko ? Phushav tut ando anav le Devlesko , na chinuisar ma . "

text: For he said unto him , Come out of the man , thou unclean spirit .
text2: Ke O Jesus phenelas leske , " Tu , bi vuzho , ankles avri anda leste . "

text: And he asked him , What is thy name ? And he answered , saying , My name is Legion : for we are many .
text2: O Jesus phushlia le bi vuzhesko , " Sar bushos ? " Wo dia atweto , phenel , " Le Legion , ke but sam . "

text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country .
text2: Ai wo rhugilaspe ka Jesus te na tradel le bi vuzhe avri anda them .

text: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding .
text2: Nas dur but bale kai xanas .

text: And all the devils besought him , saying , Send us into the swine , that we may enter into them .
text2: Le beng rhugisaile ka Jesus , " Te gonisa ame avri trade ame andel bale . "

text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave . And the unclean spirits went out , and entered into the swine : and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea , ( they were about two thousand ; ) and were choked in the sea .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge te zhan andel bale , ai le bi vuzhe ankliste avri ai gele andel bale . Ai sa le bale shudepe pai xar ande maria , ai tasule ando pai . Sas pashte dui mi bale .

text: And they that fed the swine fled , and told it in the city , and in the country . And they went out to see what it was that was done .
text2: Le manush kai lenas sama katar le bale sigo gele ando foro ai avrial le gave , ai phende so kerdilia . Ai sa le manush avile te dikhen so kerdilia .

text: And they come to Jesus , and see him that was possessed with the devil , and had the legion , sitting , and clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: Avile ka Jesus ai dikhle o manush kai sas les but beng ande leste , ai beshelas tele , ai vuriardo , ai leske goji vorta ; ai daraile .

text: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil , and also concerning the swine .
text2: Kudola kai dikhle les , phende le manush so kerdilia pa o manush kai sas le beng ande leste , ai vi pa le bale .

text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts .
text2: Ai phushle les te zhaltar anda lengo them .

text: And when he was come into the ship , he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him .
text2: Ai kana O Jesus anklisto ando chuno , o manush kai sas les le beng ande leste manglia te zhal lesa .

text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not , but saith unto him , Go home to thy friends , and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee , and hath had compassion on thee .
text2: Numa O Jesus chi meklia les te zhal , ai phendia leske , " Zha khere ai phenes lenge so godi kerdia tuke O Del , ai sar sas les mila pe tute . "

text: And he departed , and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him : and all men did marvel .
text2: Kodo manush gelotar ai phendia sa le manush ande Decapolis so godi kerdia leske O Jesus ; ai sa le manush chudisaile .

text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side , much people gathered unto him : and he was nigh unto the sea .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus gelo palpale inchal e maria ando chuno , ai but narodo chidinisaile angla leste : ai wo sas po berego .

text: And , behold , there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue , Jairus by name ; and when he saw him , he fell at his feet ,
text2: Ai , eta , iek baro andai synagogue avilo kai busholas Jairus , ai kana dikhlia O Jesus , shudiape kal punrhe ,

text: And besought him greatly , saying , My little daughter lieth at the point of death : I pray thee , come and lay thy hands on her , that she may be healed ; and she shall live .
text2: ai dia duma zurales leske , phenel , " Murhi shei merel akana ; aidi ai tho cho vas pe late , te avela sasti ai woi traiila .

text: And Jesus went with him ; and much people followed him , and thronged him .
text2: O Jesus gelo lesa ; ai but manush lenaspe pala leste , ai pashonas pasha leste katar swako rig .

text: And a certain woman , which had an issue of blood twelve years ,
text2: Sas ek zhuvli kai xasarelas pesko rat de desh u dui bersh ,

text: And had suffered many things of many physicians , and had spent all that she had , and was nothing bettered , but rather grew worse ,
text2: ai chinuisardia but . Geli ka but dokxturia , xaliasas sa peske love , numa chi iek chi sastiardia la , ai mai nasul sas .

text: When she had heard of Jesus , came in the press behind , and touched his garment .
text2: Kana ashundia pa Jesus , avili palal pala Jesus ai azbadia e tivala leske raxamaki .

text: For she said , If I may touch but his clothes , I shall be whole .
text2: Ke phendiape , " Te sai azbava leske tsalia avava sasti . "

text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up ; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague .
text2: Ai strazo o rat kai xasarelas aterdilo ; ai woi zhanglia ke sastilisas katar o naswalimos .

text: And Jesus , immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him , turned him about in the press , and said , Who touched my clothes ?
text2: Ai O Jesus , strazo zhanelaspe kai putiera ankliste avri anda leste , amboldiape ai phendia ka le manush , " Kon azbadia murhe tsalia ? "

text: And his disciples said unto him , Thou seest the multitude thronging thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: Leske disipluria phende leske , " Tu dikhes but narodo pashon pasha tute katar swako rig , ai tu mothos , " Kon azbadia ma ? "

text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing .
text2: O Jesus amboldiape ai dikhlia pe late kai azbadia leske tsalia .

text: But the woman fearing and trembling , knowing what was done in her , came and fell down before him , and told him all the truth .
text2: Numa e zhuvli daralas ai izdralas , zhanelas so kerdia O Jesus lake , avili ai dia le changa angla leste , ai phendia leske sa o chachimos .

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace , and be whole of thy plague .
text2: Ai phendia lake , " Murhi shei , cho pachamos sastiardia tu ; zha pachasa , sasti san katar cho naswalimos . "

text: While he yet spake , there came from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house certain which said , Thy daughter is dead : why troublest thou the Master any further ?
text2: Sar delas duma inker , avile manush katar o kher le baresko andai synagogue ai phende , " Chi sheiorhi muli . Sostar mai dziliares o gazda ? "

text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken , he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue , Be not afraid , only believe .
text2: Kana O Jesus ashundia kadala vorbi , phendia le baresko andai synagogue , " Na dara , ferdi pacha tu . "

text: And he suffered no man to follow him , save Peter , and James , and John the brother of James .
text2: Ai O Jesus chi meklia khonik te zhal lesa , ferdi o Petri , ai Iakov , ai Iovano o phral le Iakovosko .

text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue , and seeth the tumult , and them that wept and wailed greatly .
text2: Aresle ka kher le baresko andai synagogue , ai O Jesus dikhlia baro narodo buntuime , but mui kerenas , ai rovenas . Wo gelo andre ai phushlia le ,

text: And when he was come in , he saith unto them , Why make ye this ado , and weep ? the damsel is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: " Sostar keren kadia , ai roven ? E sheiorhi nai muli , numa sovel ! "

text: And they laughed him to scorn . But when he had put them all out , he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel , and them that were with him , and entereth in where the damsel was lying .
text2: Won asaie lestar , kana gonisardia le narodos , wo angerdia o dat ai e dei la sheiake , ai won kai sas lesa , ai gele ande soba kai pashliolas .

text: And he took the damsel by the hand , and said unto her , Talitha cumi ; which is , being interpreted , Damsel , I say unto thee , arise .
text2: Ai lia la vastestar , ai phendia lake , " Talitha cumi " kai si " Sheiorhio , phenav tuke , Wushti opre . "

text: And straightway the damsel arose , and walked ; for she was of the age of twelve years . And they were astonished with a great astonishment .
text2: Ai strazo e sheiorhi wushtili , ai phiradia . Desh u dui bershengi sas . Ai chudisaile but !

text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it ; and commanded that something should be given her to eat .
text2: Wo dias le trad te na mothon kanikaske ; ai phendia lenge , " De la vari so te xal . "

text: And he went out from thence , and came into his own country ; and his disciples follow him .
text2: O Jesus gelotar kotsar , ai areslo ando foro kai barilo ; ai leske disipluria linepe pala leste .

text: And when the sabbath day was come , he began to teach in the synagogue : and many hearing him were astonished , saying , From whence hath this man these things ? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him , that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands ?
text2: Ai po dies Savato , sicharelas le narodos ande lengi synagogue , chudisaile , ai phenenas , " Katar lias kado manush kasavo haliarimos ai putiera te kerel mirakluria ?

text: Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mary , the brother of James , and Joses , and of Juda , and Simon ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were offended at him .
text2: Nai kado o stoliari , o shav le Mariako , o phral le Iakovosko , ai le Josesosko , ai le Judasosko , ai o Simonosko ? Ai leske pheia nai sa mashkar amende ? Xoliale pe leste .

text: But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , but in his own country , and among his own kin , and in his own house .
text2: Numa O Jesus phendia lenge , " Ferdi ande lesko foro ai ande lesko kher chi preznain le profeturia . "

text: And he could there do no mighty work , save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk , and healed them .
text2: O Jesus chi kerdia but mirakluria kotse , numa thodia leske vas pe xantsi manush kai sas naswale , ai sastiardia len .

text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief . And he went round about the villages , teaching .
text2: Ai chudisailo ke nai lenge pachamos . Antunchi gelo kal gava kotse , sicharel le manushen .

text: And he called unto him the twelve , and began to send them forth by two and two ; and gave them power over unclean spirits ;
text2: O Jesus akhardia peste , peske desh u do disipluria , ai tradia le dui po dui ; ai dia le e putiera pe le bi vuzhe duxuria ;

text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey , save a staff only ; no scrip , no bread , no money in their purse :
text2: Ai phendia lenge , " Na len khanchi tumensa po drom kai zhan , ferdi iek rovli ; na len gono , vai manrho , vai love ande tumare posucha ;

text: But be shod with sandals ; and not put on two coats .
text2: Thos pe tute le papucha ; numa chi thos pe tute dui gada .

text: And he said unto them , In what place soever ye enter into an house , there abide till ye depart from that place .
text2: Ai phendia lenge , ande fersavo kher kai aresena , beshen ka lesko kher zhi kai tume zhanatar kotsar .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear you , when ye depart thence , shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them . Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Kodola manush te na primina tume vai te na ashunena tumende , kana zhantar anda kodo kher vai foro , chinon e pulberia pa tumare punrhe . Phenav tumenge , mai vushoro le narodoske anda Sodom ai Gomorrah po dies la krisako , ke sar kodole foroske !

text: And they went out , and preached that men should repent .
text2: Ai geletar , denas duma pa Del , phenenas , " Trobul te keiin tume anda tumare bezexa ! "

text: And they cast out many devils , and anointed with oil many that were sick , and healed them .
text2: Ai gonisarde but beng , ai thodia vuloi pe but naswalen , ai sastiarde le .
