text: And king Herod heard of him ; ( for his name was spread abroad : ) and he said , That John the Baptist was risen from the dead , and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: Ai o amperato o Herod ashundias e viasta pa Jesus . Le manush phenenas , " Kado si o Iovano o baptisto , zhuvindisailo pai martia . Anda kodia si les e putiera te kerel mirakluria . "

text: Others said , That it is Elias . And others said , That it is a prophet , or as one of the prophets .
text2: Uni phenen , " Kado si o Elias . " Ai aver phenen , " Kado si iek profeto , vai sar iek andal profeturia . "

text: But when Herod heard thereof , he said , It is John , whom I beheaded : he is risen from the dead .
text2: Numa kana o Herod ashundia kadia , phendia , " Kado si o Iovano ! Phendem te shinen o shero le Iovanosko ; ai zhuvindisailo pai martia . "

text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John , and bound him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife : for he had married her .
text2: O Herod astardias le Iovanos , ai phangle les lantsonsa ai thodia les ande temnitsa palai Herodias , e rhomni leske phraleski o Philip : ke wo ansurisailo lasa .

text: For John had said unto Herod , It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother ' s wife .
text2: Ke o Iovano phenelas ka Herod , " Nai tuke slobodo te les e rhomni cho phraleski . "

text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him , and would have killed him ; but she could not :
text2: E Herodias xoliarikosas le Iovanosa , ai mangelas te mudarel le Iovanos , numa nashtisardia .

text: For Herod feared John , knowing that he was a just man and an holy , and observed him ; and when he heard him , he did many things , and heard him gladly .
text2: O Herod daralas katar o Iovano . Wo zhanelas kai o Iovano sas ek lasho ai chacho manush . Wo lelas sama lestar ai chi meklia khonik te dukhavel les . Kana o Iovano dia duma pa Del wo ashundia les raduimasa , numa ando lesko ilo nai mishto sas .

text: And when a convenient day was come , that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords , high captains , and chief estates of Galilee ;
text2: Antunchi e Herodias dikhlia sar dashtil te mudarel o Iovano . Po dies kai arakhadilo o Herod , dia ek pachiv le gazdaske , le bare kapitanuria , ai le mai bareske andai Galilee .

text: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in , and danced , and pleased Herod and them that sat with him , the king said unto the damsel , Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt , and I will give it thee .
text2: Ai kana e shei la Herodiaki avili andre , woi kheldias lenge , ai de sa zurales plachalias le Herodos ai won kai sas lesa , o amperato phendia ka shei , " Phushes mandar so godi manges , ai dava tu so godi manges . "

text: And he sware unto her , Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me , I will give it thee , unto the half of my kingdom .
text2: Ai solaxadia lake , " So godi manges mandar , dava tu so manges , vi dava tu dopash murhi amperetsaki . "

text: And she went forth , and said unto her mother , What shall I ask ? And she said , The head of John the Baptist .
text2: Woi geli kai laki dei , ai phendia lake , " So sai phushav lestar ? " Ai laki dei phendia , " O shero le Iovanosko o baptisto . "

text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king , and asked , saying , I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist .
text2: Woi avili strazo ka amperato , ai phushlia lestar , phenel , " An mange pek charo o shero le Iovanosko o baptisto .

text: And the king was exceeding sorry ; yet for his oath ' s sake , and for their sakes which sat with him , he would not reject her .
text2: O amperato nekezhisailo , numa ke solaxadias angla o narodo , phendias te den la so mangel .

text: And immediately the king sent an executioner , and commanded his head to be brought : and he went and beheaded him in the prison ,
text2: Strazo o amperato tradia iek andal ketani te shinen o shero le Iovanosko ande temnitsa , ai dia ordina te anel o shero le Iovanosko leste . Ek ketani gelo kai temnitsa ai shindia o shero le Iovanosko .

text: And brought his head in a charger , and gave it to the damsel : and the damsel gave it to her mother .
text2: Andine lesko shero pek charo ai dine les kai shei , ai woi angerdia les kai laki dei .

text: And when his disciples heard of it , they came and took up his corpse , and laid it in a tomb .
text2: Ai kana leske disipluria ashunde kadia , avile , line lesko stato , ai groposarde les .

text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus , and told him all things , both what they had done , and what they had taught .
text2: Le Apostluria avile palpale , ai phende ka Jesus so godi kerde , ai so sicharenas .

text: And he said unto them , Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place , and rest a while : for there were many coming and going , and they had no leisure so much as to eat .
text2: Wo phendia lenge , " Aven tume korkorho ande pusta ai hodinin xantsi , ke sas but narodo kai avenas ai zhanas , ai vi nas le vriama te xan .

text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately .
text2: Ai geletar pek chuno korkorho kai nas khonik .

text: And the people saw them departing , and many knew him , and ran afoot thither out of all cities , and outwent them , and came together unto him .
text2: O narodo dikhle le kana geletar , ai but zhanenas les , ai nashle telal avri anda sa le foruria , ai aresle kotse mai anglal lendar , ai chidinisaile .

text: And Jesus , when he came out , saw much people , and was moved with compassion toward them , because they were as sheep not having a shepherd : and he began to teach them many things .
text2: Kana O Jesus anklisto avri anda chuno , dikhlias but narodo , pelias leske mila anda lende , ke won sas sar bakriorhe bi le pastuxosa , ai wo sicharelas le but kai trobulsardias te zhanen .

text: And when the day was now far spent , his disciples came unto him , and said , This is a desert place , and now the time is far passed :
text2: Kana avili e riat leske disipluria avile leste , ai phende leske , " Si pusta katse ai vunzhe pozno .

text: Send them away , that they may go into the country round about , and into the villages , and buy themselves bread : for they have nothing to eat .
text2: Trade le narodos te zhan andel gava ai avrial le gave te chinen peske manrho , ke nai le khanchi te xan . "

text: He answered and said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they say unto him , Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread , and give them to eat ?
text2: Wo dia atweto ai phendia lenge , " Den le te xan . " Ai won phende leske , " Tu manges ame te zhas ai chinas manrhe kai anklel dui shela teliara te pravarel sa le manush ? "

text: He saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? go and see . And when they knew , they say , Five , and two fishes .
text2: Phendia lenge , " Sode manrhe si tume ? Zha ai dikh . " Ai kana zhanenas , phenen , " Panzh manrhe , ai dui mashe . "

text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass .
text2: O Jesus phendias le narodoske te beshen tele pel zeleno char .

text: And they sat down in ranks , by hundreds , and by fifties .
text2: Ai beshle tele andek than po panvardesh zhene ai po iek shel zhene .

text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes , he looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake the loaves , and gave them to his disciples to set before them ; and the two fishes divided he among them all .
text2: O Jesus lias le panzh manrhe ai le dui mashe , vazdia le iakha karing o rhaio , ai naisisardia , ai phaglias le manrhe , dias le kal disiplonge , ai le disipluria dine le ka narodo ; ai xulade le dui mashe mashkar lende .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled .
text2: Savorhe xale ai chailile .

text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments , and of the fishes .
text2: Antunchi le disipluria chide le kotora le manrheske ai le masheske kai ashshile , desh u dui kozhnitsi pherde sas .

text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men .
text2: Kodola kai xale le manrheske sas panzh mi mursh .

text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship , and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida , while he sent away the people .
text2: Strazo O Jesus kerdias le disipluria te zhan ando chuno te zhan mai anglal lestar pe kaver rig le paieske ka foro Bethsaida , zhi pon wo tradias le narodos te zhantar .

text: And when he had sent them away , he departed into a mountain to pray .
text2: Kana tradia le narodos te zhantar , gelo opre po plai te rhugilpe .

text: And when even was come , the ship was in the midst of the sea , and he alone on the land .
text2: Kana peli e riat , o chuno sas mashkaral e maria , ai O Jesus sas kotse korkorho pe phuv .

text: And he saw them toiling in rowing ; for the wind was contrary unto them : and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them , walking upon the sea , and would have passed by them .
text2: Dikhlia kai sas le but chino te visilin o chuno ; ke barval phurdelas zurales pe lende , mashkar le trin ai le shov chasuria diminiatsake , O Jesus avilo karing lende , phirelas po pai , ai wo nakhelas pasha lende .

text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea , they supposed it had been a spirit , and cried out :
text2: Kana le disipluria dikhle les phirel po pai , tsipisarde daratar ; " Choxano si ! "

text: For they all saw him , and were troubled . And immediately he talked with them , and saith unto them , Be of good cheer : it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: Ke savorhe dikhle les , ai chudisaile daratar . Strazo dia duma lensa , ai phendia lenge , " Aven veselo , ke me sim , na daran ! "

text: And he went up unto them into the ship ; and the wind ceased : and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure , and wondered .
text2: Ai Wo avilo karing lende ai anklisto ande chuno ; ai e barval aterdili : ai but chudisaile ai gindinaspe pa so kerdilia .

text: For they considered not the miracle of the loaves : for their heart was hardened .
text2: Ke chi haliarde so znachil o miraklo le manrhengo ; ke lengo ilo zuralo sas .

text: And when they had passed over , they came into the land of Gennesaret , and drew to the shore .
text2: Ai kana nakhle inchal o pai , aresle kai phuv ando them kai bushol Gennersaret , ai gele karing e berego .

text: And when they were come out of the ship , straightway they knew him ,
text2: Ai kana ankliste avri anda chuno , strazo le manush kotsar prinzharde les .

text: And ran through that whole region round about , and began to carry about in beds those that were sick , where they heard he was .
text2: Trade divano ande sa o them , ai le manush andine sa penge naswalen leste .

text: And whithersoever he entered , into villages , or cities , or country , they laid the sick in the streets , and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment : and as many as touched him were made whole .
text2: Ai kai godi gelo andel gava , andel foruria , vai avrial le gava ; andel bazaria ai pel vulitsi , won thode kodola kai sas naswale , ai phende leske , te ferdi dashtin le naswalen te pashon pasha leste te azban e tivala leske raxamaki , ai kon godi azbadias leski raxami sastile .

text: Then came together unto him the Pharisees , and certain of the scribes , which came from Jerusalem .
text2: Antunchi le Farizeanuria ai uni Gramnoturia avile andai Jerusalem , ai chidinisaile pasha Jesus .

text: And when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled , that is to say , with unwashen , hands , they found fault .
text2: Dikhle uni andal leske disipluria xanas bi te xalaven penge vas ,

text: For the Pharisees , and all the Jews , except they wash their hands oft , eat not , holding the tradition of the elders .
text2: ke le Farizeanuria ai sa le Zhiduvuria shoxar chi xan bi te xalaven penge vas . Won keren o zakono le phurenge .

text: And when they come from the market , except they wash , they eat not . And many other things there be , which they have received to hold , as the washing of cups , and pots , brasen vessels , and of tables .
text2: Ai kana aven andal bazari , won shoxar chi xan bi te xalaven penge vas . Ai si le mai but aver zakonuria kai won keren . Uni xalaven le daxtai , le kruzhki , ai le phiria le xarkune .

text: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked him , Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders , but eat bread with unwashen hands ?
text2: Antunchi le Farizeanuria ai le Gramnoturia phushen les , " Sostar che disipluria chi keren o zakono le phurenge , numa xan bi te xalaven penge vas ? "

text: He answered and said unto them , Well hath Esaias prophesied of you hypocrites , as it is written , This people honoureth me with their lips , but their heart is far from me .
text2: O Jesus dia atweto , ai phendia lenge , " Tume manush kai ankerdion so chi san , O Isaiah dias mishto profesi po tumende kana ramosardia , " Kado narodo preznain ma peska mosa , numa lengo ilo dur mandar .

text: Howbeit in vain do they worship me , teaching for doctines the commandments of men .
text2: Intaino preznain ma , ke won sicharen manushenge zakonuria sar te aviline le Devleske . "

text: For laying aside the commandment of God , ye hold the tradition of men , as the washing of pots and cups : and many other such like things ye do .
text2: Tume chi keren o zakono le Devlesko , numa keren o zakono le manushenge . "

text: And he said unto them , Full well ye reject the commandment of God , that ye may keep your own tradition .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Tume thon rigate o zakono le Devlesko numa keren tumaro zakono .

text: For Moses said , Honour thy father and thy mother ; and , Whoso curseth father or mother , let him die the death :
text2: Ke o Moses phendia , " Preznaisar che dades ai cha da , " ai kodo kai del duma nasul pa peske dades ai peska da , musai merel .

text: But ye say , If a man shall say to his father or mother , It is Corban , that is to say , a gift , by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me ; he shall be free .
text2: Numa tume phenen " Kon godi phenela peske dadeske vai peska dake , so sai demas tume te zhutiv tume , dem ka Del . "

text: And ye suffer him no more to do ought for his father or his mother ;
text2: Ai tume chi mai meken les e zhutil peske dades vai peska da .

text: Making the word of God of none effect through your tradition , which ye have delivered : and many such like things do ye .
text2: Tume thon rigate E Vorba le Devleski te keren tumaro zakono , ai tume keren but aver dieli sa kadia . "

text: And when he had called all the people unto him , he said unto them , Hearken unto me every one of you , and understand :
text2: Pala kodia akhardia le narodos peste , ai phendia lenge , " Savorhen , ashunen mande .

text: There is nothing from without a man , that entering into him can defile him : but the things which come out of him , those are they that defile the man .
text2: Nai so thol o manush ando mui kai maril les , numa so anklel anda lesko mui kai maril les .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Si tume khan , antunchi ashun ! "

text: And when he was entered into the house from the people , his disciples asked him concerning the parable .
text2: Wo meklia le narodos ai gelo ando kher . Antunchi leske disipluria phushle les pa paramichi .

text: And he saith unto them , Are ye so without understanding also ? Do ye not perceive , that whatsoever thing from without entereth into the man , it cannot defile him ;
text2: Ai phendia lenge , " Chi tume sa chi haliaren ? Chi haliaren , ke so thol ando lesko mui nashti maril les .

text: Because it entereth not into his heart , but into the belly , and goeth out into the draught , purging all meats ?
text2: Ke kadia chi zhal ando lesko ilo , numa ando ji , porme anklel avri , ( phenelas kai sa o xabe si lasho ) .

text: And he said , That which cometh out of the man , that defileth the man .
text2: Mai phendia lenge , so anklel andal manush kodia si kai kerel andal manush marime angla Del .

text: For from within , out of the heart of men , proceed evil thoughts , adulteries , fornications , murders ,
text2: Ke anda ilo anklel le nasul ginduria , kurvisia , mudarimos ,

text: Thefts , covetousness , wickedness , deceit , lasciviousness , an evil eye , blasphemy , pride , foolishness :
text2: chorimos , te manges zurales so si nai chiro , te keres vai so kai si defial nasul , atsimos , manges te dikhes po zhuvli le chorhe gindosa , zhaluzile , te des duma nasul pa Del , barimata , dzilimos .

text: All these evil things come from within , and defile the man .
text2: Sa kadala nasul dieli anklen andal manush , ai kodia si kai kerel andal manush marime angla Del .

text: And from thence he arose , and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon , and entered into an house , and would have no man know it : but he could not be hid .
text2: O Jesus gelotar kotsar ai gelo karing o Tire ai Sidon , gelo ando kher , chi mangelas khonik te zhanel kai wo sas kotse , numa nashti garavel les .

text: For a certain woman , whose young daughter had an unclean spirit , heard of him , and came and fell at his feet :
text2: Strazo ek zhuvli avili leste ke ashundia kai wo sas kotse . Sas la ek sheiorhi kai sas la ek bi vuzho ande late . Avili leste , ai peli kal punrhe ( shudiape ka leske punrhe ) .

text: The woman was a Greek , a Syrophenician by nation ; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter .
text2: E zhuvli sas Grekaika , biandilia ando them Phoenicia , woi manglia les te gonil le benges avri anda laki shei .

text: But Jesus said unto her , Let the children first be filled : for it is not meet to take the children ' s bread , and to cast it unto the dogs .
text2: Numa O Jesus phendia lake , " Nai vorta te les o manrho le glatengo ai te shudes les kal zhukel .

text: And she answered and said unto him , Yes , Lord : yet the dogs under the table eat of the children ' s crumbs .
text2: Woi dia atweto , ai phendia leske , " E , Gazda , numa le zhukel telai skafidi xan le prushuka le glatenge . "

text: And he said unto her , For this saying go thy way ; the devil is gone out of thy daughter .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus phendia lake , " Ke tu phendian kadala vorbi , zha khere , o beng anklisto avri anda chi shei . "

text: And when she was come to her house , she found the devil gone out , and her daughter laid upon the bed .
text2: Woi geli khere , ai dikhlia laki sheiorhi pashliol po than ; o beng anklisto avri anda late .

text: And again , departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon , he came unto the sea of Galilee , through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus gelotar andai foruria o Tire ai o Sidon , avilo palpale kai maria Galilee , nakhelas pasha o them Decapolis .

text: And they bring unto him one that was deaf , and had an impediment in his speech ; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him .
text2: Won andine leste ieke kashukes , ai nashti delas duma mishto ; ai mangle lestar te thol lesko vas pe leste .

text: And he took him aside from the multitude , and put his fingers into his ears , and he spit , and touched his tongue ;
text2: O Jesus lia les rigate katar o narodo , ai thodia leske naia andel khan , chungarde , ai azbadia leski shib ,

text: And looking up to heaven , he sighed , and saith unto him , Ephphatha , that is , Be opened .
text2: ai vazdia le iakha kal rhaio , rhugisailo ande peste ai phendia , " Ephphatha , " kodia si , phuterdiol .

text: And straightway his ears were opened , and the string of his tongue was loosed , and he spake plain .
text2: Strazo leske khan phuterdile , ai leski shib nas phangli , ai dino duma savsem / desea mishto ,

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man : but the more he charged them , so much the more a great deal they published it ;
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge te na phenen kanikaske ; numa mai but wo phenelas lenge te na phenen kanikaske , mai but won denas duma pa so kerdia O Jesus .

text: And were beyond measure astonished , saying , He hath done all things well : he maketh both the deaf to hear , and the dumb to speak .
text2: Ta o narodo chudisailo , phenelas , " So godi kerel si desea mishto . Wo kerel le kashuke te ashunen , ai kerel le muto te den duma savsem mishto .

text: In those days the multitude being very great , and having nothing to eat , Jesus called his disciples unto him , and saith unto them ,
text2: Pala kodia aver narodo avile , ai nai le so te xan . O Jesus akhardia peske disiplon peste , ai phendia lenge .

text: I have compassion on the multitude , because they have now been with me three days , and have nothing to eat :
text2: " Mila mange anda narodo , ke de trin dies mansa le , ai nai ke so te xan ,

text: And if I send them away fasting to their own houses , they will faint by the way : for divers of them came from far .
text2: Chi mangav le te zhan khere bokhale , ke kam zaline po drom ; ke dur sas o drom but manushenge . "

text: And his disciples answered him , From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness ?
text2: Leske disipluria phendia leske , " Kai te las dosta manrho ande kadia pusta te pravaras len ? "

text: And he asked them , How many loaves have ye ? And they said , Seven .
text2: O Jesus phushlia le , " Sode manrhe si tume ? " Won phende , " Efta manrhe . "

text: And he commanded the people to sit down on the ground : and he took the seven loaves , and gave thanks , and brake , and gave to his disciples to set before them ; and they did set them before the people .
text2: O Jesus phendia le narodoske te beshen tele pe phuv . Lia le efta manrhe , ai dias naisimos , phaglias le , ai dias le kal disipluria . Le disipluria dine le kal narodo .

text: And they had a few small fishes : and he blessed , and commanded to set them also before them .
text2: Sas le xantsi tsinorhe mashe : ai O Jesus dias naisimos , ai phendia le disipluria te thon le mashe angla lende te xan .

text: So they did eat , and were filled : and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets .
text2: Savorhe xale ai chailile . Le disipluria chide le kotora kai ashshile efta kozhnitsi , pherde sas .

text: And they that had eaten were about four thousand : and he sent them away .
text2: Kodola kai xale sas shtar mi mursh , Antunchi O Jesus tradia le narodos te zhantar .

text: And straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples , and came into the parts of Dalmanutha .
text2: Ai strazo O Jesus anklisto andek chuno peske disiplonsa , ai avilo ando them Dalmanutha .

text: And the Pharisees came forth , and began to question with him , seeking of him a sign from heaven , tempting him .
text2: Ai le Farizeanuria avile ka Jesus , ai mangle lestar te sikavel lenge ek semno kai si te avel anda rhaio .

text: And he sighed deeply in his spirit , and saith , Why doth this generation seek after a sign ? verily I say unto you , There shall no sign be given unto this generation .
text2: Ai nekezhisailo ande pesko duxo , ai phendia lenge , " Sostar kadia vitsa adies roden ek semno Chachimasa , phenav tumenge , chi iek semno chi avela dino len . "

text: And he left them , and entering into the ship again departed to the other side .
text2: Antunchi meklia le , ai anklisto ando chuno , ai geletar inchal o pai .

text: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread , neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf .
text2: Le disipluria bustarde te len manrho pesa , ai sas le ferdi iek manrho lensa ando chuno .

text: And he charged them , saying , Take heed , beware of the leaven of the Pharisees , and of the leaven of Herod .
text2: Ai O Jesus phendia lenge , " Arakhen tume katar e drozhda kai avel katar le Farizeanuria , ai le Herodoske .

text: And they reasoned among themselves , saying , It is because we have no bread .
text2: Le disipluria denaspe duma mashkar pende , ai phenenas , " Ke chi liam amensa manrho phenel kadia . "

text: And when Jesus knew it , he saith unto them , Why reason ye , because ye have no bread ? perceive ye not yet , neither understand ? have ye your heart yet hardened ?
text2: O Jesus zhanglias , ai phendias lenge , " Sostar phenen mashkar tumende , ke chi andian manrho ? Chi haliaren ? Ai chi den goji ?

text: Having eyes , see ye not ? and having ears , hear ye not ? and do ye not remember ?
text2: Si tumen iakha ai chi dikhen ? Ai si tumen khan ai chi ashunen ? Ai chi seren tume ?

text: When I brake the five loaves among five thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? They say unto him , Twelve .
text2: Kana phaglem le panzh manrhe ai tume dine kal panzh mi manushen ? Sode kozhnitsi pherdo kotora chide ? " Won phende leske , " Desh u dui .

text: And when the seven among four thousand , how many baskets full of fragments took ye up ? And they said , Seven .
text2: Ai kana sas efta manrhe kai tume dine kal shtar mi manushen , sode kozhnitsi pherdo kotora chide ? " Ai phende leske , " Efta " .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye do not understand ?
text2: Ai O Jesus phendia lenge , " Sostar sa chi haliaren ? "

text: And he cometh to Bethsaida ; and they bring a blind man unto him , and besought him to touch him .
text2: Antunchi wo avilo ande Bethsaida , ai andine ek korho manush ka Jesus , ai mangle les te azbal les .

text: And he took the blind man by the hand , and led him out of the town ; and when he had spit on his eyes , and put his hands upon him , he asked him if he saw ought .
text2: Lia le korhes vastestar , ai ningardia les avri andai gav . Antunchi chungarde pe leske iakha , ai thodia leske vas pe leste , ai phushlia les , " Sai dikhes vari so ? "

text: And he looked up , and said , I see men as trees , walking .
text2: Ai wo vazdia le iakha , ai phendia leske , " E , dichol mange le manush , numa miazon le khash phirenas . "

text: After that he put his hands again upon his eyes , and made him look up : and he was restored , and saw every man clearly .
text2: O Jesus pale thodia leske vas pe leske iakha , ai phendia leske te vazdel le iakha , sastilo ai dikhlia swako fielo mishto .

text: And he sent him away to his house , saying , Neither go into the town , nor tell it to any in the town .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus tradia les te zhaltar ka lesko kher , ai phendia leske , " Nai zhal palpale ando gav , vai phenes kanikaske ando gav . "

text: And Jesus went out , and his disciples , into the towns of Caesarea Philippi : and by the way he asked his disciples , saying unto them , Whom do men say that I am ?
text2: O Jesus ai leske disipluria geletar andel gava ando them Caesarea Philippe : ai sar zhanas phushlias katar peske disipluria , " Kon mothon le manush ke sim ? "

text: And they answered , John the Baptist : but some say , Elias ; and others , One of the prophets .
text2: Phende leske , " O Iovano o baptisto , numa uni phenen ke san o Elias ; ai aver phenen , iek andal profeturia . "

text: And he saith unto them , But whom say ye that I am ? And Peter answereth and saith unto him , Thou art the Christ .
text2: Wo phendia lenge , " Ai tume kon mothon ke sim ? " Ai o Petri phendia , " Tu san O Kristo . "

text: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus dias le trad , te na phenen kanikaske pa leste .

text: And he began to teach them , that the Son of man must suffer many things , and be rejected of the elders , and of the chief priests , and scribes , and be killed , and after three days rise again .
text2: De katar kodia vriama O Jesus sikavelas peske disiplon , ke O Shav le Manushesko musai chinuil but , ai avela shudino lendar katar le phurane ai katar le bare le rashange , ai le Gramnoturia , ai avela mudardo ai zhuvindila pala trin dies .

text: And he spake that saying openly . And Peter took him , and began to rebuke him .
text2: Wo phendia kadala vorbi angla lende . Antunchi o Petri lia les rigate ai phendias leske .

text: But when he had turned about and looked on his disciples , he rebuked Peter , saying , Get thee behind me , Satan : for thou savourest not the things that be of God , but the things that be of men .
text2: Numa kana O Jesus amboldinisailo , dikhlia pe peske disipluria , ai phenel le Petresko , " Le tu angla mande , Satano ! ( Beng ! ) Ke che ginduria na le Devleske , nume le manusheske . "

text: And when he had called the people unto him with his disciples also , he said unto them , Whosoever will come after me , let him deny himself , and take up his cross , and follow me .
text2: Ai kana O Jesus akhardia o narodo ai peske disiplon leste , wo phendia lenge , " Te si vari kon kai mangel te avel pala mande , musai te bustrel pa peste , te lel pesko trushul , ai te avel pala mande .

text: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it ; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel ' s , the same shall save it .
text2: Ke o manush kai mangela te garavel pesko traio xasarela les ; numa kodo kai dela pesko traio pala mande ai pala e lashi viasta , arakhela traio .

text: For what shall it profit a man , if he shall gain the whole world , and lose his own soul ?
text2: So lela o manush te niril sa e lumia ai te xasarela pesko duxos ?

text: Or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul ?
text2: So sai del o manush te chinel palpale pesko duxo ?

text: Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation ; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed , when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels .
text2: Ke kon godi lazhala mandar ai katar murhe vorbi mashkar le bezexalenge adies , O Shav le Manushesko avela lestar lazhal , kana avela ando pesko barimos le dadesko le Swuntsi angelonsa . "

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , That there be some of them that stand here , which shall not taste of death , till they have seen the kingdom of God come with power .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Chachimasa , phenav tumenge , " Uni andal kadala kai si katse chi merena zhi pon dikhena e amperetsia le Devleski avela le putierasa . "

text: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter , and James , and John , and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves : and he was transfigured before them .
text2: Shov dies pala kodia O Jesus lias pesa o Petri , ai o Iakov ai o Iovano , ai ningerdias le pek bari plaiing , ferdi won sas kotse : ai wo parhudilo angla lenge .

text: And his raiment became shining , exceeding white as snow ; so as no fuller on earth can white them .
text2: Leske tsalia parnile sar e vediara . Khonik pe phuv nashti xalavel le sakadia .

text: And there appeared unto them Elias with Moses : and they were talking with Jesus .
text2: Ai avisaile angla lende Elias ai o Moses denas duma le Kristosa .

text: And Peter answered and said to Jesus , Master , it is good for us to be here : and let us make three tabernacles ; one for thee , and one for Moses , and one for Elias .
text2: O Petri phendia ka Jesus , " Gazda , mishto ke sam katse ! Anzaras trin tseri , iek tuke , iek le Mososke , ai iek le Eliasoske . "

text: For he wist not what to say ; for they were sore afraid .
text2: O Petri chi zhanelas so te phenel : ke daraile zurales .

text: And there was a cloud that overshadowed them : and a voice came out of the cloud , saying , This is my beloved Son : hear him .
text2: Sas iek nuvero kai avilo ai vusharadia le , ai anda nuvero iek glaso phendias , phenel , " Kado si murho Shav kai si mange de sa drago :

text: And suddenly , when they had looked round about , they saw no man any more , save Jesus only with themselves .
text2: Ai strazo , kana won dikhenas kruglom pende , chi mai dikhle kanikas , ferdi O Jesus sas lensa .

text: And as they came down from the mountain , he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen , till the Son of man were risen from the dead .
text2: Sar avenas tele pai plaiing O Jesus dia le trad , " Na phenen kanikaske so dikhlian zhi kai O Shav le Manushesko zhuvindila andai martia . "

text: And they kept that saying with themselves , questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean .
text2: Ai le disipluria chi phende kanikaske so dikhle , numa denas duma mashkar pende . " So znachil ' O zhuvindimos pala peske martia . ' "

text: And they asked him , saying , Why say the scribes that Elias must first come ?
text2: Ai phushle katar O Jesus , phenen , " Sostar le Gramnoturia phenen ke o Elias trobul te avel mai anglal ? "

text: And he answered and told them , Elias verily cometh first , and restoreth all things ; and how it is written of the Son of man , that he must suffer many things , and be set at nought .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Chaches trobul te avel o Elias , ai te anel palpale swako fielo sar kai sas ; sar si ramosardia ke O Shav le Manushesko musai chinuil but , ai avela shudino lendar .

text: But I say unto you , That Elias is indeed come , and they have done unto him whatsoever they listed , as it is written of him .
text2: Numa phenav tumenge , " Ke o Elias vunzhe avilo , ai kerde lesa so godi mangle , sar sas ramosardia lestar . "

text: And when he came to his disciples , he saw a great multitude about them , and the scribes questioning with them .
text2: Kana avilo karing leske disipluria , dikhlia o baro narodo , ai le Gramnoturia phushenas lendar .

text: And straightway all the people , when they beheld him , were greatly amazed , and running to him saluted him .
text2: Ai strazo sa o narodo , kana dikhle les , chudinisaile but , ai nashle karing leste te phenen les , " Droboi tu . "

text: And he asked the scribes , What question ye with them ?
text2: O Jesus phushlia katar le Gramnoturia , " Pa soste den mui lendar ? "

text: And one of the multitude answered and said , Master , I have brought unto thee my son , which hath a dumb spirit ;
text2: Iek andal narodo dia atweto ai phendia , " Gazda , andem tute murho shav , ke si beng ande leste ai nashti del duma .

text: And wheresoever he taketh him , he teareth him : and he foameth , and gnasheth with his teeth , and pineth away : and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out ; and they could not .
text2: Ai kai godi o beng lel les , shudel les pe phuv , ai zhala leske spuma anda mui , ai chidel dandendar , ai chinuilas les : ai phushlem che disipluria te gonin le benges avri anda leste ; ai nashtisarde . "

text: He answereth him , and saith , O faithless generation , how long shall I be with you ? how long shall I suffer you ? bring him unto me .
text2: O Jesus dias atweto ai phendia leske , " Tume kai nai tume pachamos , zhi kana trobula te avav tumensa ? Zhi kana trobul te rhevdiv tumen ? Anen le shavorhes mande ! "

text: And they brought him unto him : and when he saw him , straightway the spirit tare him ; and he fell on the ground , and wallowed foaming .
text2: Ai andine les ka Jesus : ai kana dikhlia les , strazo o beng drechinil les ; ai pelo pe phuv , ai zhala leske spuma anda mui .

text: And he asked his father , How long is it ago since this came unto him ? And he said , Of a child .
text2: O Jesus phushlia katar lesko dat , " De sode vriama sas les beng ande leste ? " O dat phendia , " De sar sas iek glata .

text: And ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire , and into the waters , to destroy him : but if thou canst do any thing , have compassion on us , and help us .
text2: Ai butivar perel ande iag , ai ando pai te mudarel les : numa te sai keres vari so , av mila pe amende , ai zhutis ame .

text: Jesus said unto him , If thou canst believe , all things are possible to him that believeth .
text2: O Jesus phendia leske , " Te sai pachasa tu , le Devlesa vari so sai kerdiol kodoleske kai pachalpe .

text: And straightway the father of the child cried out , and said with tears , Lord , I believe ; help thou mine unbelief .
text2: Ai strazo o dat le glatasko tsipisardia , ai phendia le asuasa , " Devla , me pachav ; zhutis ma te mai pachav . "

text: When Jesus saw that the people came running together , he rebuked the foul spirit , saying unto him , Thou dumb and deaf spirit , I charge thee , come out of him , and enter no more into him .
text2: Kana O Jesus dikhlia o narodo avelas mai sigo karing leste , O Jesus dias duma zurales ka o bi vuzho , phendia leske , " Kashuko ai muto duxo , dav tu trad , ankles avri anda leste , ai chi mai zha ande leste . "

text: And the spirit cried , and rent him sore , and came out of him : and he was as one dead ; insomuch that many said , He is dead .
text2: Ai o bi vuzho tsipisardia , ai shudia les pe phuv , ai anklisto avri anda leste : ai sas sar iek mulo ; ai savorhe phende , " Mulo si ! "

text: But Jesus took him by the hand , and lifted him up ; and he arose .
text2: Numa O Jesus lia les vastestar , ai vazdia les ; ai wushtilo .

text: And when he was come into the house , his disciples asked him privately , Why could not we cast him out ?
text2: Ai kana O Jesus avilo ando kher , leske disipluria line les rigate , ai phushle les , " Sostar nashti gonisardiam les ame ? "

text: And he said unto them , This kind can come forth by nothing , but by prayer and fasting .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Kodolestar anklel avri ferdi kana rhugis tu ai zhonis .

text: And they departed thence , and passed through Galilee ; and he would not that any man should know it .
text2: O Jesus ai leske disipluria gele kotsar , ai nakhle pasha Galilee ; O Jesus chi mangelas vari kon te zhanel kai sas wo ,

text: For he taught his disciples , and said unto them , The Son of man is delivered into the hands of men , and they shall kill him ; and after that he is killed , he shall rise the third day .
text2: Ke sicharelas leske disiplon , ai phendia lenge , " O Shav le Manushesko si te avel dino andel vas le manushenge , ai won mudarena les , ai pala kadia mudardo si , o trito dies zhuvindila .

text: But they understood not that saying , and were afraid to ask him .
text2: Numa chi haliarde so phendia , ai daranas te phushen les .

text: And he came to Capernaum : and being in the house he asked them , What was it that ye disputed among yourselves by the way ?
text2: Ai O Jesus areslo ando Capernaum : ai kana sas ando kher wo phushlia len , " Sostar marenas mui mashkar tumende po drom ? "

text: But they held their peace : for by the way they had disputed among themselves , who should be the greatest .
text2: Numa won chi phende khanch leske ; ke sas po drom marenaspe mui pa , " Kon si o mai baro . "

text: And he sat down , and called the twelve , and saith unto them , If any man desire to be first , the same shall be last of all , and servant of all .
text2: Ai O Jesus beshlo tele , ai akhardia le desh u di disipluria , ai phendia lenge , " Vari kon kai mangel te avel pervo , musai avela paluno , ai avela tumaro podaitori ( servitori ) . "

text: And he took a child , and set him in the midst of them : and when he had taken him in his arms , he said unto them ,
text2: O Jesus akhardia peste iek tsinorho glata , ai thodia les angla lende : kana lia les ande peske vas , phendia lenge ,

text: Whosoever shall receive one of such children in my name , receiveth me : and whosoever shall receive me , receiveth not me , but him that sent me .
text2: " Kon godi primila iek tsinorho glata ando murho anav , primil man , ai kon godi primila ma , chi primil ma , numa wo kai tradia ma . "

text: And John answered him , saying , Master , we saw one casting out devils in thy name , and he followeth not us : and we forbad him , because he followeth not us .
text2: O Iovano phendia leske , phenel , " Gazda , dikhliam ieke manushes kai gonil le bengen ando cho anav , ai wo chi liape pala amende : ai ame aterdiardem les , ke chi liape pala amende .

text: But Jesus said , Forbid him not : for there is no man which shall do a miracle in my name , that can lightly speak evil of me .
text2: Numa O Jesus phendia leske , " Na aterdios les : ke nas iek manush kai kerel iek miraklo ande murho anav , kai sai del duma nasul pa mande . "

text: For he that is not against us is on our part .
text2: Ke kon chi rimol tumaro zakono si tumensalo .

text: For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name , because ye belong to Christ , verily I say unto you , he shall not lose his reward .
text2: Ke kon godi dela tu ek porharho le paieske te pel ande murho anav , ke tu san O Shav le Devlesko , chi xasarela lesko pochinimos . "

text: And whosoever shall offend one of these little ones that believe in me , it is better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he were cast into the sea .
text2: " Ai kon godi kerela iek anda kadala tsinorhe kai pachanpe ande mande te peren ando bezex , mai bini te avel ek baro bax phanglo ka leski kox , ai te avel shudino ande bari maria .

text: And if thy hand offend thee , cut it off : it is better for thee to enter into life maimed , than having two hands to go into hell , into the fire that never shall be quenched :
text2: Te si cho vas kai kerel tu te peres ando bezex , shin les , ai shude les dur tutar . Mai bini te zhas ando chacho traio ieka vastesa , de sar te aven tu dui vas ai te aves shudino ande iado , ande iag kai chi getolpe .

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Kai lenge rhimi chi merel , ai nashti mudarel e iag . Te si cho punrho kai kerel tu te peres ando bezex , shin les , mai bini te zhas ando chacho traio ieke punrhesa , de sar te aven tu dui punrhe ai te aves shudino ande iado .

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Kai lenge rhimi cii merel , ai nashti mudarel e iag .

text: And if thine eye offend thee , pluck it out : it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye , than having two eyes to be cast into hell fire :
text2: Ai te si chi iakh ke kerel tu te peres ando bezex , le la avri ai shude la dur tutar . Ke mai bini te zhas ande amperetsia le Devleski ieka iakhasa , de sar te aven tut dui iakha ai te shudino ande iag le iadoski .

text: Where their worm dieth not , and the fire is not quenched .
text2: Kai lenge rhimi chi merel , ai nashti mudarel e iag .

text: For every one shall be salted with fire , and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt .
text2: Savorhe avela londo iagasa , ai swako sakrifis avela londo lonensa .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his saltness , wherewith will ye season it ? Have salt in yourselves , and have peace one with another .
text2: Lasho si o lon ; numa o lon te xasarela pesko skusno , sar kerena anda leste pale londo ? Si tume lon ande tumende ai avela pacha iek kavresa .

text: And he arose from thence , and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan : and the people resort unto him again ; and , as he was wont , he taught them again .
text2: O Jesus gelotar andai Capernaum , ai avilo ande them Judea ai gelo inchal o pai Jordon : ai bare naroduria gele pala leste , ai sichardia len sar kerelas sa data .

text: And the Pharisees came to him , and asked him , Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife ? tempting him .
text2: Ai le Farizeanuria avile leste , ai phushle les , " Dar vorta ai slobodo ando zakono te mekel o manush peska rhomnia anda vari soste godi ? " te zumaven les .

text: And he answered and said unto them , What did Moses command you ?
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " So phendiasas o Moses tumenge ? "

text: And they said , Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement , and to put her away .
text2: Phende leske , " O Moses meklias ke sai mekel o manush peska rhomnia te dela la lil anda vas . "

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " O Moses ramosardia o zakono tumenge , ke zuradian tumaro ilo .

text: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female .
text2: Numa de anda gor la lumiaki , O Del kerdias le mursh ai zhuvli .

text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother , and cleave to his wife ;
text2: Anda kodia o mursh si te mekel peske dades ai peska da , ai avela astardo ka peski rhomni ,

text: And they twain shall be one flesh : so then they are no more twain , but one flesh .
text2: ai le dui avena iek stato : pala kadia na mai dui numa iek stato .

text: What therefore God hath joined together , let not man put asunder .
text2: So Del thodias andek than o manush te na hulavel .

text: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter .
text2: Kana gele palpale ando kher , le disipluria phushle katar O Jesus pa leske vorbi .

text: And he saith unto them , Whosoever shall put away his wife , and marry another , committeth adultery against her .
text2: Ai phendia lenge , " Kon godi mekela peska rhomnia , ai te lela avria kerdias kurvimos .

text: And if a woman shall put away her husband , and be married to another , she committeth adultery .
text2: Ai sakadia ek zhuvli mekela pesko rhom , ai te lela avria kerdias kurvimos . "

text: And they brought young children to him , that he should touch them : and his disciples rebuked those that brought them .
text2: Ai andine tsinorhe glaten ka Jesus te thol peske vas pe lende : numa peske disipluria dine trad kodolenge kai andine le .

text: But when Jesus saw it , he was much displeased , and said unto them , Suffer the little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Kana O Jesus ashundia kadia , xoliariko sas ai phendia peske displonge , " Mek te aven le glate mande , ai na aterdion le , ke e amperetsia le Devleski kodolenge si kai si sar lende . "

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child , he shall not enter therein .
text2: Chachimasa phenav tumenge , " Kon godi kai chi primil e amperetsia le Devleski sar ek glata , nashti dela ando rhaio . "

text: And he took them up in his arms , put his hands upon them , and blessed them .
text2: Ai wo lia le glate ande leske vas , thodia leske vas pe lende , ai rhugisardia lenge .

text: And when he was gone forth into the way , there came one running , and kneeled to him , and asked him , Good Master , what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life ?
text2: Ai kana O Jesus phirelas pel drom , iek manush nashelas karing leste ai dia le changa angla leste , ai phushlia les , " Lasho Gazda , che lashimos trobul te kerav te avel ma o traio kai chi mai getolpe ? "

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? there is none good but one , that is , God .
text2: O Jesus phendia leske , " Sostar mothos mange lasho ? Ke nai khonik lasho , O Del ferdi si lasho .

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Defraud not , Honour thy father and mother .
text2: Zhanes le zakonuria , na ker kurvimos , na mudar , na phen xoxaimos pa vari kon , na chor , na atsaimos , na pupuiimos , preznaisar che dades ai cha da . "

text: And he answered and said unto him , Master , all these have I observed from my youth .
text2: O manush phendia leske , " Gazda , sa kadala zakonuria ankerdem de sar simas terno . "

text: Then Jesus beholding him loved him , and said unto him , One thing thou lackest : go thy way , sell whatsoever thou hast , and give to the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , take up the cross , and follow me .
text2: O Jesus dikhlia pe leste , drago leske les , ai phendia leske , " Mai trobul te keres vari so , zha bichin so si tu , de kal chorhe , ai avela tu manjin ando rhaio : antunchi aidi pala mande . "

text: And he was sad at that saying , and went away grieved : for he had great possessions .
text2: Kana o terno manush ashundia kodia tristosailo ai gelotar , ke but barvalimos sas les .

text: And Jesus looked round about , and saith unto his disciples , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: O Jesus dikhlia le ai phendia peske disiplononge , " Ke trutno kodolenge kai si le barvalimos te zhan ande amperetsia le Devleski . "

text: And the disciples were astonished at his words . But Jesus answereth again , and saith unto them , Children , how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Ai le disipluria chudisaile kana ashunde kadia . Ai O Jesus pale phendia lenge , " Shave , ke trutno kodolenge kai pachanpe ande barvalimos te zhan ande amperetsia le Devleski . "

text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Mai vushoro te nakhel iek gemula andai iakh suviaki , de sar iek barvalo manush te zhal ande amperetsia le Devleski . "

text: And they were astonished out of measure , saying among themselves , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Ai chudisailo de sa shodo sas lenge , ai phenenas mashkar pende , " Apo , kon sai avela skepime ? "

text: And Jesus looking upon them saith , With men it is impossible , but not with God : for with God all things are possible .
text2: O Jesus dikhlias pe lende , ai phendia lenge , " Le manush anda pende nashtin , numa le Devlesa vari so sai kerdiol .

text: Then Peter began to say unto him , Lo , we have left all , and have followed thee .
text2: Antunchi o Petri phendia leske , " Ashun , ame mekliam swako fielo ai liam ame pala tute . "

text: And Jesus answered and said , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or brethren , or sisters , or father , or mother , or wife , or children , or lands , for my sake , and the gospel ' s ,
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Chachimasa , phenav tumenge , kon godi meklia khera , vai phralen , vai pheian , vai dades , vai da , vai rhomni , vai glaten , vai phuvia pala mande , ai pala e lashi viasta ,

text: But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time , houses , and brethren , and sisters , and mothers , and children , and lands , with persecutions ; and in the world to come eternal life .
text2: lela iek shelvar mai but akana pe kadia phuv , khera , ai phralen , ai pheian , ai deian , ai glaten , ai phuvia , ai but chinuimos , ai avela le o traio kai chi mai getolpe ande lumia kai si te avel .

text: But many that are first shall be last ; and the last first .
text2: Numa but anda le perve avena le palune , ai but kai sas le palune aven le perve . "

text: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem ; and Jesus went before them : and they were amazed ; and as they followed , they were afraid . And he took again the twelve , and began to tell them what things should happen unto him ,
text2: Sar le desh u dui disipluria zhanas ando Jerusalem , O Jesus gelo angla lende : chudisaile , ai sar lenas pe pala leste , daraile . Ai lia le desh u dui disiplon pa drom ai phendia lenge so musai avel leste .

text: Saying , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem ; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests , and unto the scribes ; and they shall condemn him to death , and shall deliver him to the Gentiles :
text2: Phenel , " Ashun , zhas ande Jerusalem kai O Shav le Manushesko avela dino ando vas le bare rasha ai le Gramnoturia , ai won kerena leski kris te mudaren les , ai dena les kal manush kai Nai Zhiduvuria .

text: And they shall mock him , and shall scourge him , and shall spit upon him , and shall kill him : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: Ai won maren mui lestar , ai maren les le bichosa , ai chungaren pe leste , ai karfon les po trushul : ai o trito dies si te zhuvindil . "

text: And James and John , the sons of Zebedee , come unto him , saying , Master , we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire .
text2: O Iakov ai o Iovano , le shave le Zebedeske , avile peste , phenenas , " Gazda , ame mangas tu te keres amenge so mangas . "

text: And he said unto them , What would ye that I should do for you ?
text2: Ai wo phendia lenge , " So mangen te kerav tumennge ? "

text: They said unto him , Grant unto us that we may sit , one on thy right hand , and the other on thy left hand , in thy glory .
text2: Won phende leske , " Mek te beshel iek ka cho chacho vas , ai iek ka cho stingo vas ande chiri amperetsia . "

text: But Jesus said unto them , Ye know not what ye ask : can ye drink of the cup that I drink of ? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with ?
text2: Numa O Jesus phendia lenge , " Chi zhanen so mangen , amboldiaspe ka Iakov ai o Iovano ai phushlia le , " Sai pen andai kuchi kai me si te piiav ? "

text: And they said unto him , We can . And Jesus said unto them , Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of ; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized :
text2: Ai won phende leske , " Sai " . Ai O Jesus phendia lenge , " Si te phen anda murhi kuchi :

text: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give ; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared .
text2: Numa te beshen ka murho chacho vas ai ka murho stingo , nai mandar te dav . Kodo than avela dino ka kodola kaske getosardias le murho Dat .

text: And when the ten heard it , they began to be much displeased with James and John .
text2: Kana le kolaver desh disipluria ashunde kodia , xoliale le Iakovosa ai le Iovanosa .

text: But Jesus called them to him , and saith unto them , Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and their great ones exercise authority upon them .
text2: O Jesus akhardia le peste , ai phendia , " Tume zhanen ke le bare le manushenge kai Nai Zhiduvuria gazdin len , ai keren lensa so mange .

text: But so shall it not be among you : but whosoever will be great among you , shall be your minister :
text2: Nai kadia mashkar tumende , numa savo godi mangel te avel baro mashkar tumende , avela tumaro podaitori .

text: And whosoever of you will be the chiefest , shall be servant of all .
text2: Ai savo godi mangel te avel o mai baro mashkar tumende , avela tumari sluga .

text: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto , but to minister , and to give his life a ransom for many .
text2: Sakadia O Shav le Manushesko , chi avilo te podail pes , numa avilo te podail ai te del pesko traio te pochinel anda but te skepil les . "

text: And they came to Jericho : and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people , blind Bartimaeus , the son of Timaeus , sat by the highway side begging .
text2: Ai aresle ando Jericho ; kana zhanas avri anda Jericho le disiplonsa ai but manushensa , iek korho kai bushol Bartimaeus , o shav le Timaeusosko , beshelas tele pasha drom , ai mangelas xabe vai love .

text: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth , he began to cry out , and say , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Wo ashundia ke O Jesus andai Nazareth nakhelas , ai tsipisardia , phenel , " Jesus , tu Shav le Davidosko , al tuke mila anda mande ! "

text: And many charged him that he should hold his peace : but he cried the more a great deal , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Ai but manush tsipinas pe leste ai phenenas leske te ashel : numa wo tsipilas mai zurales , " Tu Shav le Davidosko , al tuke mila anda mande . "

text: And Jesus stood still , and commanded him to be called . And they call the blind man , saying unto him , Be of good comfort , rise ; he calleth thee .
text2: Ai O Jesus aterdilo , ai phendia lenge te akharen les . Won akharen o korho manush , ai phenen leske , " Aves veselo , wushti , O Jesus akharel tu . "

text: And he , casting away his garment , rose , and came to Jesus .
text2: Ai wo lia tele leske bunda , wushtilo , ai avilo karing O Jesus .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , What wilt thou that I should do unto thee ? The blind man said unto him , Lord , that I might receive my sight .
text2: O Jesus phendia leske , " So manges te kerav tuke ? " O korho manush phendia leske , " Devla , phuter murhe iakha te dikhav . "

text: And Jesus said unto him , Go thy way ; thy faith hath made thee whole . And immediately he received his sight , and followed Jesus in the way .
text2: O Jesus phendia leske , " Zha , cho pachamos sastilia tu . " Ai strazo dikhlia , ai liape pala Jesus .

text: And when they came nigh to Jerusalem , unto Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount of Olives , he sendeth forth two of his disciples ,
text2: Kana pashilo karing Jerusalem , aresle ando Bethphage ai Bethani , karing o plai le maslinengo , O Jesus tradia dui anda leske disiplon

text: And saith unto them , Go your way into the village over against you : and as soon as ye be entered into it , ye shall find a colt tied , whereon never man sat ; loose him , and bring him .
text2: ai phendia lenge , " Zhan ando gav mai angle , ai kana aresena , akharena ieke magares phanglo kai shoxar chi iek manush beshlo opral ; phutren les , ai anen les .

text: And if any man say unto you , Why do ye this ? say ye that the Lord hath need of him ; and straightway he will send him hither .
text2: Te phenela tumen vari kon , " Sostar keren kadia ? Phenen leske , " Trobul le Devles ; ai strazo si te tradel les . "

text: And they went their way , and found the colt tied by the door without in a place where two ways met ; and they loose him .
text2: Le dui disipluria geletar , ai arakhle ieke magares kai sas phanglo pasha o wudar kai le dui droma avile andek than : ai phutrenas le .

text: And certain of them that stood there said unto them , What do ye , loosing the colt ?
text2: Le manush phushle , " Sostar phutren le magares ? "

text: And they said unto them even as Jesus had commanded : and they let them go .
text2: Le disipluria phende lenge so phendia lenge O Jesus , " Ke trobul le Devles . " Ai le manush mekle le te zhan .

text: And they brought the colt to Jesus , and cast their garments on him ; and he sat upon him .
text2: Angerde le magares ka Jesus , ai thode penge gada pe leste , ai O Jesus beshlo opral le magares .

text: And many spread their garments in the way : and others cut down branches off the trees , and strawed them in the way .
text2: But anda narodo shudenas penge raxamia po drom angla leste , kaver shinde patria pai le khash , ai thode le po drom angla leste .

text: And they that went before , and they that followed , cried , saying , Hosanna ; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord :
text2: Le manush kai zhanas anglal angla leste , ai kodola kai avenas palal pala leste , tsipinas , Hosana ! Raduime kodo kai aven ando anav le Devlesko :

text: Blessed be the kingdom of our father David , that cometh in the name of the Lord : Hosanna in the highest .
text2: Raduime si e amperetsia amari dadeski o David , kai avel ando anav le Devlesko : " Hosana zhi ando rhaio ! "

text: And Jesus entered into Jerusalem , and into the temple : and when he had looked round about upon all things , and now the eventide was come , he went out unto Bethany with the twelve .
text2: Ai O Jesus areslo ando Jerusalem , ai gelo ande tampla , wo dikhlia pe sa le dieli , antunchi O Jesus ai le desh u dui disipluria gele ande Bethani ke pozno sas .

text: And on the morrow , when they were come from Bethany , he was hungry :
text2: Pe terharin diminiatsi , sar avenas anda Bethani , O Jesus bokhailo ;

text: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves , he came , if haply he might find any thing thereon : and when he came to it , he found nothing but leaves ; for the time of figs was not yet .
text2: Pasha drom dur angla leste , O Jesus dikhlias ek pruing figengi kai sas la patria ferdi , gelo late te rodel fruti , ai arakhlias patria ferdi , ke e vriama le figengi nas inker .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto it , No man eat fruit of thee hereafter for ever . And his disciples heard it .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus phendia la pruingake , " Chi iek manush xal fruti anda tute na mai . " Ai leske disipluria ashunde kadala vorbi .

text: And they come to Jerusalem : and Jesus went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple , and overthrew the tables of the moneychangers , and the seats of them that sold doves ;
text2: Ai won aresle ando Jerusalem : ai O Jesus avilo ande tampla le Devlesko , ai gonisardia sa kodolen kai bichinenas ai chinenas ande tampla , dia muial le skafidia kodolenge kai parhuvenas le love , ai le skamina kodolenge kai bichinenas le golumburia ;

text: And would not suffer that any man should carry any vessel through the temple .
text2: Ai chi meklia khonik te angerel vari phiria ande bar le tamploski .

text: And he taught , saying unto them , Is it not written , My house shall be called of all nations the house of prayer ? but ye have made it a den of thieves .
text2: Ai sicharelas le , phenel lenge , " Ramome , murho kher avela akhardo rhugimasko : ande sa le thema . Numa tume keren anda leste shtala chorengi . "

text: And the scribes and chief priests heard it , and sought how they might destroy him : for they feared him , because all the people was astonished at his doctrine .
text2: Le Gramnoturia ai le bare rasha ashunde kadala vorbi , ai rodenas sar te mudaren les ; daraile lestar , ke sa le manush chudisaile pa lesko sicharimos .

text: And when even was come , he went out of the city .
text2: Kana e telairiat avili , O Jesus ai leske disipluria gele avri anda foro .

text: And in the morning , as they passed by , they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots .
text2: Pe terharin diminiatsi , sar nakhenas po drom , dikhle ek pruing figengi shuchili zhi kai vuni .

text: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him , Master , behold , the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away .
text2: Antunchi o Petri serelaspe so phendia O Jesus arachi , ai phendia ka Jesus , " Gazda , Dikh ! E pruing le figengi ke tu dian armaia muli . "

text: And Jesus answering saith unto them , Have faith in God .
text2: O Jesus phendia ; lenge , " Si tume pachamos ando Del . " Chachimasa , phenav tumenge ,

text: For verily I say unto you , That whosoever shall say unto this mountain , Be thou removed , and be thou cast into the sea ; and shall not doubt in his heart , but shall believe that those things which he saith shall come to pass ; he shall have whatsoever he saith .
text2: ke kon godi phenel plaiake , " Le tu katkar , ai av shudini ande maria " ; ai te na avela les gindo ke chi kerdiol , numa pachal kai so phenel avela dino .

text: Therefore I say unto you , What things soever ye desire , when ye pray , believe that ye receive them , and ye shall have them .
text2: Pala kadia phenav tuke , " So godi manges , kana rhugis tu , pachas kai avela so manges an avela dino . "

text: And when ye stand praying , forgive , if ye have ought against any : that your Father also which is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses .
text2: " Ai kana beshen ande punrhende te rhugin , te si tu vari so pe kanikaske ; iertin , antunchi cho Dat ando rhaio iertil che bezexa .

text: But if ye do not forgive , neither will your Father which is in heaven forgive your trespasses .
text2: Numa te na iertin le , cho Dat ando rhaio chi iertila che bezexa . "

text: And they come again to Jerusalem : and as he was walking in the temple , there come to him the chief priests , and the scribes , and the elders ,
text2: Ai avile palpale ando Jerusalem : ai sar O Jesus phirelas ande tamplo , le bare rasha , ai le Gramnoturia , ai le phure kai poronchinas avile leste ,

text: And say unto him , By what authority doest thou these things ? and who gave thee this authority to do these things ?
text2: ai phenen leske , " Kon phendias tuke ke sai keres so tu keres , ai kon dias tu kadia putiera ? "

text: And Jesus answered and said unto them , I will also ask of you one question , and answer me , and I will tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Vi me akana phushav tumendar ek divano , ai phenen mange , antunchi me phenav tumenge katar che putiera kerav so kerav .

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ? answer me .
text2: O bolimos le Iovanosko katar sas , anda rhaio vai manushendar ? " Phenen mange .

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then did ye not believe him ?
text2: Ai dinepe duma mashkar pende , ai phenenas , " Te phenasa anda rhaio si te phushel ame , " Sostar chi pachaian les ? "

text: But if we shall say , Of men ; they feared the people : for all men counted John , that he was a prophet indeed .
text2: Numa te phenasa , manushendar . Dar katar le manush , ke savorhe ankeren le Iovanos profeto . "

text: And they answered and said unto Jesus , We cannot tell . And Jesus answering saith unto them , Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Antunchi phende ka Jesus , " Chi zhanas . " Ai wo phendia lenge , " Chi me , chi phenav tumenge katar che putiera so kerav . "

text: And he began to speak unto them by parables . A certain man planted a vineyard , and set an hedge about it , and digged a place for the winefat , and built a tower , and let it out to husbandmen , and went into a far country .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus sichardia len le paramichensa , " Sas iek gazda kheresko kai thodia te bariol ek rez , ai thodia ek zido kruglom latar , ai kerdia ai lashardias iek than te strangon o struguro , vazdias iek wucho than te len sama kotsar . Ai dias e rez ka rabocha rezaria ( po wundilepe manushende ) ai gelotar andek dur them .

text: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant , that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard .
text2: Kana pashili e vriama te chidenpe struguro , tradias ek sluga kal manush kai bariarenaspe leski rez , te len struguro kai avelas leske .

text: And they caught him , and beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Ai astarde les , ai marde les , ai tradia les bi kanchesko .

text: And again he sent unto them another servant ; and at him they cast stones , and wounded him in the head , and sent him away shamefully handled .
text2: Magdata tradias lende aver sluges ; ai shude bax pe leste , ai dukhade lesko shero , ai chinuisarde les , ai tradias les .

text: And again he sent another ; and him they killed , and many others ; beating some , and killing some .
text2: Magdata tradia aver sluges ; ai mudarde les , ai tradias mai but , marde uni , ai mudarde uni .

text: Having yet therefore one son , his wellbeloved , he sent him also last unto them , saying , They will reverence my son .
text2: Ta ando gor sas les ieke shaves , kai sas leske de sa drago , ai wo tradia lende peske shaves , ai phenelas , " Si te preznain murhe shaves . "

text: But those husbandmen said among themselves , This is the heir ; come , let us kill him , and the inheritance shall be ours .
text2: Numa le rezaria phende iek avreske , " O Shav le Manushesko kai bariarelaspe rez ; Aven mudaras les , ai lias ame so si lesko . "

text: And they took him , and killed him , and cast him out of the vineyard .
text2: Ai line les , ai mudarde les , ai gonisarde les avri andai rez .

text: What shall therefore the lord of the vineyard do ? he will come and destroy the husbandmen , and will give the vineyard unto others .
text2: Kana o gazda le rezako avela , so kerela kodole manushenge ? Avela ai mudarel kodole nasul manushen , ai dela e rez ka kaver .

text: And have ye not read this scripture ; The stone which the builders rejected is become the head of the corner :
text2: " Ai chi jindian ando ramomos ? O bax kai le manush kai vazden o kher shude kerdilo o bax kai si sa e zor le kheresko .

text: This was the Lord ' s doing , and it is marvellous in our eyes ?
text2: O Del kerdias kadia , ai che mundro ande amare iakha ! "

text: And they sought to lay hold on him , but feared the people : for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them : and they left him , and went their way .
text2: Mangenas te thon o vas pe leste , numa daraile katar o narodo : ke won zhanenas kai wo dia duma iek paramichi pala lende , mekle les , ai geletar .

text: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians , to catch him in his words .
text2: Won trade leste uni andal Farizeanonge ai uni andal Herodianonge te astaren les ande lesko divano .

text: And when they were come , they say unto him , Master , we know that thou art true , and carest for no man : for thou regardest not the person of men , but teachest the way of God in truth : Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar , or not ?
text2: Ai kana aresle , phenenas leske " Gazda , zhanas ke chachimasa san , bi te daras vari kastar , ke chi thos partia kanikaske , numa sikaves o chachimos pa Del si amenge slobodo vai nai , te pochinas taksa ka Caesar ? "

text: Shall we give , or shall we not give ? But he , knowing their hypocrisy , said unto them , Why tempt ye me ? bring me a penny , that I may see it .
text2: " Pochinasa vai chi pochinasa ? " Numa O Jesus haliardias lenge nasul ginduria , ai phendias lenge , " Sostar tume zumaven ma ? Sikaven mange le love , te sai dikhav les .

text: And they brought it . And he saith unto them , Whose is this image and superscription ? And they said unto him , Caesar ' s .
text2: Ai andine leske iek pena . Ai O Jesus phendia lenge , " Kaski fatsa ai ramomos si kado ? " Ai phenen leske , " O Caesar . "

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar ' s , and to God the things that are God ' s . And they marvelled at him .
text2: Antunchi O Jesus phendias lenge , " Den ka Caesar so si lesko , ai den ka Del so si le Devlesko . " Kana ashunde , chudisaile .

text: Then come unto him the Sadducees , which say there is no resurrection ; and they asked him , saying ,
text2: Antunchi uni andal Saduseanonge avile ka Jesus , kai mothon ke nai traio pala e martia : ai phushle les , phenenas ,

text: Master , Moses wrote unto us , If a man ' s brother die , and leave his wife behind him , and leave no children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: " Gazda , o Moses ramosardia amende , " Te merela vari kasko phral , ai sas ansurime , ai nas les glate , lesko phral trobul te lel leska rhomnia , ai te vazdel familia peske phraleske . "

text: Now there were seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and dying left no seed .
text2: Sar mashkar amende efta phral . O pervo ansurisailo , ai mulo , ai nas les glate .

text: And the second took her , and died , neither left he any seed : and the third likewise .
text2: Ai o duito ansurisailo leska rhomniasa , ai mulo , ai nas les glate ai sakadia o trito .

text: And the seven had her , and left no seed : last of all the woman died also .
text2: Ai sakadia zhi ka o eftato , ai nas les glate : antunchi vi e zhuvli muli .

text: In the resurrection therefore , when they shall rise , whose wife shall she be of them ? for the seven had her to wife .
text2: Kana avela te zhuvindin le mule te zhan ando rhaio saveski andal efta phral avela e rhomnia ? "

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , Do ye not therefore err , because ye know not the scriptures , neither the power of God ?
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Shubin tume zurales ! Ke tume chi haliaren E Vorba le Devleski , ai chi e putiera le Devleski . "

text: For when they shall rise from the dead , they neither marry , nor are given in marriage ; but are as the angels which are in heaven .
text2: Ke kana zhuvindin le mule te zhan ando rhaio , le mursh chi lena rhomnia , ai le zhuvlia chi lena rhom , numa aven sar le angeluria le Devleske kai si ando rhaio .

text: And as touching the dead , that they rise : have ye not read in the book of Moses , how in the bush God spake unto him , saying , I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ?
text2: Numa anda kodia kai zhuvindin le mule te zhan ando rhaio , chi jindian ande klishka le Mosesoski , sar ande krenzha O Del phendia leske , phenelas , " Me sim O Del le Abramosko , ai O Del le Isakosko , ai O Del le Iakovosko ?

text: He is not the God of the dead , but the God of the living : ye therefore do greatly err .
text2: O Del nai O Del le mulengo , numa le zhuvindengo , shubin tume zurales . "

text: And one of the scribes came , and having heard them reasoning together , and perceiving that he had answered them well , asked him , Which is the first commandment of all ?
text2: Ai iek andal Gramnoturia avilo , ai ashundia le Saduseanuria marenas mui pende , vo haliardia ke phandadias o mui le Saduseanonge , phushlia les , " Savo si o mai baro andal zakonuria ? "

text: And Jesus answered him , The first of all the commandments is , Hear , O Israel ; The Lord our God is one Lord :
text2: Ai O Jesus phendia leske , " O pervo andal zakonuria si , Ashun , O Israel ; O Del , amaro Del , si ferdi iek Del .

text: And thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart , and with all thy soul , and with all thy mind , and with all thy strength : this is the first commandment .
text2: Te avel tuke drago O Del sa che ilesa , sa che duxosa , ai sa che gojasa , ai sa che zorasa : kado si o pervo zakono .

text: And the second is like , namely this , Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself . There is none other commandment greater than these .
text2: Ai o duito si saikfielo , te avel tuke drago le manush sode san tu tuke . Nai aver zakono o mai baro sar kadala . "

text: And the scribe said unto him , Well , Master , thou hast said the truth : for there is one God ; and there is none other but he :
text2: Ai o Gramnoto phendia leske , " Gazda , tu phendian o chachimos ; ferdi iek Del si , ai nai aver , ferdi wo si .

text: And to love him with all the heart , and with all the understanding , and with all the soul , and with all the strength , and to love his neighbour as himself , is more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices .
text2: Ai te avel leske drago O Del sa peske ilesa , ai sa peske haliarimos , ai sa peske duxosa , ai sa peske zorasa , ai te avel leske drago le manush sar si les leske , mai mishto si te keren le dui zakonuria sar te thon zhegeni ai aver podarki po altari ande tampla pala e sakrifis . "

text: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly , he said unto him , Thou art not far from the kingdom of God . And no man after that durst ask him any question .
text2: Ai kana O Jesus zhanelas ke wo haliardia , phendia leske , " Tu san nai dur katar e amperetsia le Devleski . Pala kodia khonik chi tromalas te phushel lestar vari so .

text: And Jesus answered and said , while he taught in the temple , How say the scribes that Christ is the Son of David ?
text2: Kana O Jesus sicharelas ande tampla , phushlia le , " Sar sai phenen le Gramnoturia ke O Kristo si O Shav le Davidosko ?

text: For David himself said by the Holy Ghost , The Lord said to my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand , till I make thine enemies thy footstool .
text2: O Swunto Duxo phendia ka David te phenel , " O gazda phendia murhe gazdaske , ' Besh ka murho chacho vas , zhi pon thav che duzhmanon tela che punrhe . ' "

text: David therefore himself calleth him Lord ; and whence is he then his son ? And the common people heard him gladly .
text2: Teala o David akharel les Gazda , sar si lesko shav ? Ai o baro narodo ashunelas les raduimasa .

text: And he said unto them in his doctrine , Beware of the scribes , which love to go in long clothing , and love salutations in the marketplaces ,
text2: Sar O Jesus sicharelas le , phendia lenge , " Arakhen tume katar le Gramnoturia , ke lenge drago te phiravenpe andel raxamia lunzhi , ai mangen savorhe te den le lasho dies pel wulitsi .

text: And the chief seats in the synagogues , and the uppermost rooms at feasts :
text2: Ai mangena le mai lashe skamina ande synagogue , ai te beshen ka shero le skafidiako kal pachiva .

text: Which devour widows ' houses , and for a pretence make long prayers : these shall receive greater damnation .
text2: Ai won len khera le phivlia , ai te na dichol lenge nasulimos but , pe lende avela kris mai bari .

text: And Jesus sat over against the treasury , and beheld how the people cast money into the treasury : and many that were rich cast in much .
text2: O Jesus beshlo pasha o than kai le manush thon le love ande tamplo , ai dikhlia sar thonas penge love ande tamplo , ai but andal barvale dine but .

text: And there came a certain poor widow , and she threw in two mites , which make a farthing .
text2: Ai ek phivli chorhi avili ai tholas dui xarkune kotora , anklen iek sent .

text: And he called unto him his disciples , and saith unto them , Verily I say unto you , That this poor widow hath cast more in , than all they which have cast into the treasury :
text2: Ai wo akhardia leste peske disiplon , ai phendia lenge , " Chachimasa , phenav tumenge , kacha chorhi phivli thodia mai but de sar savorhe :

text: For all they did cast in of their abundance ; but she of her want did cast in all that she had , even all her living .
text2: Ke le barvale dine katar le but love kai sas le , numa woi dia so godi sas la te traiil . "

text: And as he went out of the temple , one of his disciples saith unto him , Master , see what manner of stones and what buildings are here !
text2: Sar O Jesus anklisto avri andai tampla , iek andal leske disipluria phendia leske , " Dikh , Gazda , che shukar bax ai shukar khera ! "

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Seest thou these great buildings ? there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: Ai O Jesus phendia leske , " Dikhes sa kadala bare khera ? Chi mai ashela iek bax po kaver , sa so dikhes avela pherado . "

text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives over against the temple , Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately ,
text2: Sar O Jesus beshlo po plai le maslinenge , beshelas po than kai dikhlia o tampla , o Petri , o Iakov , o Iovano ai o Andre avile leste korkorho , ai phushle les ,

text: Tell us , when shall these things be ? and what shall be the sign when all these things shall be fulfilled ?
text2: " Phen amenge , kana kerdiolape kadia ? Ai so avela o semno kai aves kana kerdiona kodola buchi ? "

text: And Jesus answering them began to say , Take heed lest any man deceive you :
text2: O Jesus phendia lenge , " Len tume sama , te na atsavel tumen khonik .

text: For many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and shall deceive many .
text2: Ke but avena ande murho anav , ai phenena , " Me sim o Kristo " ai atsavena buten .

text: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars , be ye not troubled : for such things must needs be ; but the end shall not be yet .
text2: Ai kana ashunena ke marenpe ai viasta kai marenpe , na daran : ke kodia musai te kerdiol , numa nai inker o gor .

text: For nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom : and there shall be earthquakes in divers places , and there shall be famines and troubles : these are the beginnings of sorrows .
text2: Iek them marelape aver themesa , iek amperetsia marelape avria amperetsia : ai ande but thana izdrala e phuv , ai ande thana chi avela dosta te xan , avela but baiuria : kadala avela le semnuria ta anda gor le chinosko , ai o nekazo kai si te avel .

text: But take heed to yourselves : for they shall deliver you up to councils ; and in the synagogues ye shall be beaten : and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake , for a testimony against them .
