text: Parthians , and Medes , and Elamites , and the dwellers in Mesopotamia , and in Judaea , and Cappadocia , in Pontus , and Asia ,
text2: Si mashkar amende manush anda them kai bushol Parthians , ai Medes , ai Elamites , ai anda Mesopotamia , ai andai Judea , ai andai Cappodocia , ai andai Pontus ai Asia ,

text: Phrygia , and Pamphylia , in Egypt , and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene , and strangers of Rome , Jews and proselytes ,
text2: ai andai le Phrigia , ai Pamphilia , andai Egypt , ai uni thana andai Libya pashai Cyrene , ai kodola kai avile andai e Roma ,

text: Cretes and Arabians , we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God .
text2: Zhiduvuria ai aver manush kai kerdile sar lende . Le Cretia ai le Arapuria , sar ashunas le kai den duma ande amare shiba pal lashimata le Devleski ! "

text: And they were all amazed , and were in doubt , saying one to another , What meaneth this ?
text2: Savorhe chidisaile , ai chi zhanenas so te gindinpe , won mothonas iek kavreske , " So si so mothon ? "

text: Others mocking said , These men are full of new wine .
text2: Numa uni marenas mui ai mothonas , " Pherdo mol le . "

text: But Peter , standing up with the eleven , lifted up his voice , and said unto them , Ye men of Judaea , and all ye that dwell at Jerusalem , be this known unto you , and hearken to my words :
text2: Antunchi o Petri sikadilo peske desh u ieke disiplonsa , ai vazdia o glaso ai phendia lenge , " Tume manush kai san Zhiduvuria , ai tume savorhe kai avilian ande Jerusalem , te zhanen iek diela ai thon khan ka murhe vorbi . "

text: For these are not drunken , as ye suppose , seeing it is but the third hour of the day .
text2: Kakala manush nai mate sar tume mothon , ke akana si inia chasuria diminiatsi .

text: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel ;
text2: Numa akana si katse kai phendia sas o profeto Joel .

text: And it shall come to pass in the last days , saith God , I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh : and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy , and your young men shall see visions , and your old men shall dream dreams :
text2: Andel paluno dies O Del phenel , shorava murho Swunto Duxo po swako manush ; tumare shave ai tumare sheia profesisaren , ai tumare terne avela le vizione , ai tumare phure dikhena sune ;

text: And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit ; and they shall prophesy :
text2: ai pe murhe slugi , le mursh ai le zhuvlian , kodola duesa shorava murho Swunto Duxo , ai won den profesi .

text: And I will shew wonders in heaven above , and signs in the earth beneath ; blood , and fire , and vapour of smoke :
text2: Kerava bare dieli opre ando cheri , ai mirakluria tele pe phuv , rat , iag , ai tsu .

text: The sun shall be turned into darkness , and the moon into blood , before that great and notable day of the Lord come :
text2: O kham parhudiola ai kerdiola tuniariko , ai o shunuto pherdiola rat , mai anglal sar o dies kai avela O Kristo , kodo dies baro ai luvudime .

text: And it shall come to pass , that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved .
text2: Antunchi kon godi tsipila po anav le Devlesko avela skepime .

text: Ye men of Israel , hear these words ; Jesus of Nazareth , a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs , which God did by him in the midst of you , as ye yourselves also know :
text2: Tume manush kai san ande Israel , ashunen kadala vorbi . O Jesus andai Nazareth , kado manush kai leske O Del sas marturo angla tumende , ai katar le mirakluria ai le bare bucha kai kerdia lestar mashkar tumende ; sar tume zhanen .

text: Him , being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God , ye have taken , and by wicked hands have crucified and slain :
text2: Kado manush sas tume dino te manglia O Del , ai kai manglia wo mai anglal tume karfosardian les , mudardian les , katar le manush le bezexa le .

text: Whom God hath raised up , having loosed the pains of death : because it was not possible that he should be holden of it .
text2: O Del zhuvindisardia les , skepisardia les andai martia , ke nashtilas e martia te ankerel les .

text: For David speaketh concerning him , I foresaw the Lord always before my face , for he is on my right hand , that I should not be moved :
text2: Ke o David mothol pa peste : " Dikhem le Devles sagda sar beshelas angla mande : ke wo si pe murhi rig e chachi , saxke te na izdral .

text: Therefore did my heart rejoice , and my tongue was glad ; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope :
text2: Ai inker murho ilo raduimelo , ai murhi shib pherdo raduimos la ; ai vi murho stato merela raduimasa .

text: Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell , neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption .
text2: Ke chi mekes murho traio mashkar le mule , ai chi mekesa kodoles kai si chiro te dikhel o chorhimos .

text: Thou hast made known to me the ways of life ; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance .
text2: Sikadian mange le droma le traioske ; pheres ma raduimos ke pasha mande san .

text: Men and brethren , let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David , that he is both dead and buried , and his sepulchre is with us unto this day .
text2: Murhe phral , slobodo mange te dav tumensa duma vorta pa David amaro dat , mulo ai groposarde les , ai lesko gropo inker adies mashkar amende lo .

text: Therefore being a prophet , and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him , that of the fruit of his loins , according to the flesh , he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne ;
text2: Sar wo sas profeto , ai zhanelas ke O Del shinadia ai solaxadia te iek andel leske manush avela amperato .

text: He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ , that his soul was not left in hell , neither his flesh did see corruption .
text2: Pa zhuvindimos le Kristosko phendia , ai mothodia ke chi mekela les mashkar le mule , ai lesko stato chi dikhela o chorhimos .

text: This Jesus hath God raised up , whereof we all are witnesses .
text2: Kodo Jesus si kai O Del zhuvindisardia , ai savorhe marturia sam .

text: Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted , and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost , he hath shed forth this , which ye now see and hear .
text2: Vazdino katar o chachimos le Devlesko , lia katar O Dat O Swunto Duxo kai sas shinado , ai shordia pesko Swunto Duxo , sar dikhen ai ashunen .

text: For David is not ascended into the heavens : but he saith himself , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Ke o David chi gelo ando cheri , numa wo mothol , " O Del phendia murhe Devleske , besh pe murhi rik e chachi ,

text: Until I make thy foes thy footstool .
text2: zhi kai kerav skeri anda che duzhmaia .

text: Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly , that God hath made that same Jesus , whom ye have crucified , both Lord and Christ .
text2: Ai ke sa o kher le Israelongo te zhanel chachimasa , ke O Del kerdia Kristo kodo Jesus , kai tume karfosardian .

text: Now when they heard this , they were pricked in their heart , and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles , Men and brethren , what shall we do ?
text2: Kana ashunde kado divano , lengo ilo sas azbado , ai phende le Petreske ai kolaver apostlonge , " Murhe phral , so keras ? "

text: Then Peter said unto them , Repent , and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins , and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost .
text2: O Petri phendia lenge , " Kein tume anda tumare bezexa , ai swako anda tumende te avel boldo ando anav le Jesus Kristosko pala iertimos tumare bezexengo , ai avela dino O Swunto Duxo .

text: For the promise is unto you , and to your children , and to all that are afar off , even as many as the Lord our God shall call .
text2: Ke so sas shinado katar O Del tumenge si , ai tumare shavengo , ai sa kodolenge kai si dur , sode avena , sode O Del akharela len .

text: And with many other words did he testify and exhort , saying , Save yourselves from this untoward generation .
text2: Ai mai avre vorbensa motholas lenge te zuralel le , skepin tume anda kado narodo kai si bezexalo .

text: Then they that gladly received his word were baptized : and the same day there were added unto them about three thousand souls .
text2: Le manush kai premisarde leski vorba boldia len , ai ande kado dies pherdile trin mi shave Devleske .

text: And they continued stedfastly in the apostles ' doctrine and fellowship , and in breaking of bread , and in prayers .
text2: Ai zhanas angle kadia ando sicharimos le apostlongo ai te chidenpe opral andek than te xan o manrho , ai te rhuginpe .

text: And fear came upon every soul : and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles .
text2: Dar kerdiolas ando narodo , ke le apostluria kerenas but mirakluria ai but semnuria .

text: And all that believed were together , and had all things common ;
text2: Sa kodola kai pachanaspe ando Del sas ande iek than , ai kerenas buchi andek than .

text: And sold their possessions and goods , and parted them to all men , as every man had need .
text2: Bichinenas penge khera ai pengo mishtimos kai sas le , ai hulavenas le love pe savorhende .

text: And they , continuing daily with one accord in the temple , and breaking bread from house to house , did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart ,
text2: Savorhe sas swako dies andek than ande khangeri , ai phagenas o manrho andel khera , ai xanas penge xabe raduimasa , ai prostovanes ande pengo ilo .

text: Praising God , and having favour with all the people . And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved .
text2: Naisinas le Devles , ai arakhenas mishtimos mashkar sa o narodo . Ai O Del tholas ande khangeri swako dies aver manush kai sas skepime .

text: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer , being the ninth hour .
text2: O Petri ai o Iovano zhanas andek than ande khangeri kana sas o chaso le rhugimasko , kodo sas kal trin pala miazutso .

text: And a certain man lame from his mother ' s womb was carried , whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful , to ask alms of them that entered into the temple ;
text2: Kotse sas iek manush kai nashti phirelas de sar kerdilo , kai anenas les , ai thonas les swako dies angal e khangeri kai busholas shukar , te mangel love katar kodola kai gele ande tampla

text: Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms .
text2: Kado manush kana dikhlia le Petres ai le Iovanos sar zhan ande tampla , manglia lendar love .

text: And Peter , fastening his eyes upon him with John , said , Look on us .
text2: Petri ai o Iovano dikhen pe leste ai phende , " Dikh pe amende , "

text: And he gave heed unto them , expecting to receive something of them .
text2: ai wo dikhelas pe lende , ai azhukerelas te den les vari so .

text: Then Peter said , Silver and gold have I none ; but such as I have give I thee : In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk .
text2: Antunchi o Petri phendia leske , " Nai ma chi rup ai chi sumnakai , numa so si ma dav les tuke , anda o anav le Jesus Kristosko andai Nazareth . Wushti opre ai phir . "

text: And he took him by the right hand , and lifted him up : and immediately his feet and ancle bones received strength .
text2: Ai line les vastestar katar o vas chacho , ai vazde les ande punrhende , ai strazo leske punrhe vortosaile .

text: And he leaping up stood , and walked , and entered with them into the temple , walking , and leaping , and praising God .
text2: Ai anda iek data , wushtilo opre , ai phirdia , ai gelo lensa ande tampla , phirelas , xutelas , ai naisilas le Devles .

text: And all the people saw him walking and praising God :
text2: Savorhe dikhle les sar phirelas ai sar naisilas le Devles ;

text: And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple : and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him .
text2: ai preznaisarde ke kodo sas kai beshelas pashai tampla ke busholas shukar , ai mangelas love , ai savorhe chudisaile kana dikhle so kerdilia leske .

text: And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John , all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon ' s , greatly wondering .
text2: Ai sar kado manush chi mai mekelas le Petres ai le Iovanos , savorhe chudisaile , ai gele lende andek than kai sas anglai tampla kai busholas Solomon .

text: And when Peter saw it , he answered unto the people , Ye men of Israel , why marvel ye at this ? or why look ye so earnestly on us , as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk ?
text2: Kana o Petri dikhlia kodia , mothol o narodoske , " Tume kai san ande Israel , sostar chuden tume anda kadala bucha ? Sostar dikhen pe amende kadia , ke sar te avilino amende e putiera vai katar amaro lashimos kai kerdiam te phirel kado manush ?

text: The God of Abraham , and of Isaac , and of Jacob , the God of our fathers , hath glorified his Son Jesus ; whom ye delivered up , and denied him in the presence of Pilate , when he was determined to let him go .
text2: O Del le Abrahamosko , ai le Isaakosko , ai ke Iakovosko , O Del amare dadengo , luvudisardia pesko Shav O Jesus ; kai dian les ka Pilate , ai phendian ke chi mangen les , ai kai o Pilate mangelas te mekel les .

text: But ye denied the Holy One and the Just , and desired a murderer to be granted unto you ;
text2: Numa chi manglian le Swuntos ai kodoles kai sas chacho , ai manglian te meken kodoles kai mudarelas .

text: And killed the Prince of life , whom God hath raised from the dead ; whereof we are witnesses .
text2: Kerdian te mudaren kodoles kai sas o Baro o traio , kai O Del zhuvindisardia andal mule , ai ame dikhliam ai marturia sam .

text: And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong , whom ye see and know : yea , the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all .
text2: Katar o pachamos ande lesko anav , si ke lesko anav , chachardia kodoles kai dikhen ai zhanen ; pala pachamos ande leste si kai kado manush sastilo antrego angla tumende .

text: And now , brethren , I wot that through ignorance ye did it , as did also your rulers .
text2: Akana , murhe phral , zhanav ke chi zhanenas anda kodia tume , ai tume bare kerdian kadia le Jesusosa .

text: But those things , which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets , that Christ should suffer , he hath so fulfilled .
text2: Numa O Del kerdia kadia , so sas phendo mai anglal katar o mui peske profetongo , ke O Kristo trobulas te chinuil .

text: Repent ye therefore , and be converted , that your sins may be blotted out , when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord ;
text2: Kein tume anda tumare bezexa , ai parhuven tumaro traio , saxke te aven tumare bezexa iertime . Antunchi O Del sai kerela te avel pe tumende vriama lashe .

text: And he shall send Jesus Christ , which before was preached unto you :
text2: Wo tradel palpale tumenge le Jesusos . Wo si O Kristo de demult kai sas alosardia amenge .

text: Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things , which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began .
text2: Akana O Kristo trobul te beshel ando rhaio zhi kai avel e vriama kai sa avela neviardo , sar O Del phendiasas katar pesko Swuntsi profeturia de dumult .

text: For Moses truly said unto the fathers , A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren , like unto me ; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you .
text2: O Moses phendia , " O Del , tumaro Del vazdel les mashkar tumende ieke profetos sar mande , ai ashunena leste so godi mothola tumenge .

text: And it shall come to pass , that every soul , which will not hear that prophet , shall be destroyed from among the people .
text2: Ai kon godi chi ashunela kodo le profetos , avela lino avri mashkar tumende .

text: Yea , and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after , as many as have spoken , have likewise foretold of these days .
text2: Sa le profeturia kai dine duma de katar o Samuel , vi won phende pa kadala dies .

text: Ye are the children of the prophets , and of the covenant which God made with our fathers , saying unto Abraham , And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed .
text2: Tume san le shav le profetonge , ai so O Del shinadia sas amare dadensa kai phendiasas le Abrahamoske , sa le niamon la phuviake avena Swuntsome pala chiro narodo .

text: Unto you first God , having raised up his Son Jesus , sent him to bless you , in turning away every one of you from his iniquities .
text2: O Del vazdia pesko Shav Jesus , ai tradia les tumende mai anglal te swuntsol tume , kana duriardia tumendar le bezexa . "

text: And as they spake unto the people , the priests , and the captain of the temple , and the Sadducees , came upon them ,
text2: Sar denas duma o Petri ai o Iovano le narodosa , avile le rasha , ai o baro le ketanengo kai lenas sama katar e tampla , ai le Saduseanuria ,

text: Being grieved that they taught the people , and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead .
text2: nas lenge mishto kai le dui disipluria sicharenas le narodos , ai mothonas le narodoske ke O Jesus zhuvindisailo , ke kodia sikavelas ke le mule sai zhuvindin .

text: And they laid hands on them , and put them in hold unto the next day : for it was now eventide .
text2: Thode o vas pe lende , ai thode le ande temnitsa , zhi pe terharin ke vunzhi kana line le e riat sas .

text: Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed ; and the number of the men was about five thousand .
text2: Numa but andal manush kana ashunde sas o divano kai phende , pachaiepe , ai butile mai but , ai kerdilia panzh mi shave Devleske .

text: And it came to pass on the morrow , that their rulers , and elders , and scribes ,
text2: Pe terharin le bare le narodoske , le mai phure , ai le manush kai ramonas o zakono chidinisaile ande Jerusalem .

text: And Annas the high priest , and Caiaphas , and John , and Alexander , and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest , were gathered together at Jerusalem .
text2: O baro rashai kai busholas Annas , ai o Caiaphas , o Iovano , ai o Alexander , ai sa kodola kai sas anda kodia familia ( niamon ) chidisaile andek than ande Jerusalem .

text: And when they had set them in the midst , they asked , By what power , or by what name , have ye done this ?
text2: Andine mashkar pende le Iovanos ai le Petres , ai phushle " Katar kaski putiera , vai ando kasko anav , kerdian tume kodola bucha ? "

text: Then Peter , filled with the Holy Ghost , said unto them , Ye rulers of the people , and elders of Israel ,
text2: Antunchi o Petri , pherdo le Swunto Duxosa phendia lenge , " Tume kai san le bare le narodoske , ai tume le phure kai san ande Israel ,

text: If we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man , by what means he is made whole ;
text2: Tuma phushen ame adies andak mishtimos kai sas kerdo ieke manusheske kai sas naswalo . Ai ame mothas tumenge sar sastilo .

text: Be it known unto you all , and to all the people of Israel , that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth , whom ye crucified , whom God raised from the dead , even by him doth this man stand here before you whole .
text2: Te zhanen savorhe , ai sa narodo andai Israel te zhanel , ando anav le Jesus Kristosko andai Nazareth , kai tume karfosardian po trushul , ai kai O Del zhuvindisardia les mashkar le mule , lestar si kai kado manush si sasto angla tumende .

text: This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders , which is become the head of the corner .
text2: O Kristo si o bax kai tume shudian , numa wo si o mai baro bax kai trobul te vazden .

text: Neither is there salvation in any other : for there is none other name under heaven given among men , whereby we must be saved .
text2: Nai skepimos ande chi iek aver ; ke nai ando cheri chi iek aver anav kai sas dino mashkar le manush , kai ame sai avas skepime .

text: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John , and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men , they marvelled ; and they took knowledge of them , that they had been with Jesus .
text2: Kana dikhle o pachamos le Petresko ai le Iovanosko , chudisaile savorhe , ke won zhanenas ke won sas manush sar aver kai chi sichile , ai prinzharde le ke sas le Kristosa .

text: And beholding the man which was healed standing with them , they could say nothing against it .
text2: Numa kana dikhle pasha pende le manushes kai sastilo sas , chi zhanenas so te mothon .

text: But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council , they conferred among themselves ,
text2: Ai phende lenge antunchi te anklen avri anda kodia soba , ai denas pe duma won de won ,

text: Saying , What shall we do to these men ? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them is manifest to all them that dwell in Jerusalem ; and we cannot deny it .
text2: " So te keren kodole manushenge ? " Ke sa o narodo anda Jerusalem zhanenas ke kodo miraklo won kerde les , ai won nashtinas te mothon ke nas chaches .

text: But that it spread no further among the people , let us straitly threaten them , that they speak henceforth to no man in this name .
text2: Numa te na zhangliolpe mai dur mashkar o narodo so kerdilia , tsipisaras pe lende , ai te aterdiaras le te na mai den duma kanikasa ande kodo anav .

text: And they called them , and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus .
text2: Akharde le , ai phende lenge , " Te na mai sicharen , ai te na mai den duma ande anav le Jesusosko .

text: But Peter and John answered and said unto them , Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God , judge ye .
text2: Numa o Petri ai o Iovano phende lenge , " Dikhen tume te si vorta angla Del te pachas tumaro mui de sar le Devlesko .

text: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard .
text2: Ke nashtisaras te garavas , ai te na das duma pa so dikhliam ai so ashundiam . "

text: So when they had further threatened them , they let them go , finding nothing how they might punish them , because of the people : for all men glorified God for that which was done .
text2: Ai mai tsipisarde pe lende te na mai sicharen , ai porme mekle le , chi zhanenas sar te den le mai bare kris , ke pala narodo ; ke sa o narodo rhuginaspe ka Del , ai naisinas le Devleske anda so kerdilia .

text: For the man was above forty years old , on whom this miracle of healing was shewed .
text2: Ke o manush kai sastilo sas , sas mai but de sar shtarvardesh bershengo .

text: And being let go , they went to their own company , and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them .
text2: Kana mekle le , gele karing penge manush , ai phende so godi le rasha ai le mai phure phende lenge .

text: And when they heard that , they lifted up their voice to God with one accord , and said , Lord , thou art God , which hast made heaven , and earth , and the sea , and all that in them is :
text2: Kana ashunde savorhe , vazde savorhe pengo glaso karing O Del andek than ai phende , " Devla , tu san O Del , tu kai kerdian o cheri , ai e phuv , ai e maria , ai so godi si ;

text: Who by the mouth of thy servant David hast said , Why did the heathen rage , and the people imagine vain things ?
text2: Tu phendian katar cho Swunto Duxo , katar o mui amaro dadesko , che sluga , o David , " Sostar le tsema buntuinpe , ai keren barimata ai le chorhe ginduria kai si mashkar o narodo ?

text: The kings of the earth stood up , and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord , and against his Christ .
text2: Le amperatsi la phuviake xolaile , ai le bare chidinisaile te maren pe le Devlesa , ai leske Shavesa O Kristo . " ( Psalm 2 : 1 - 2 )

text: For of a truth against thy holy child Jesus , whom thou hast anointed , both Herod , and Pontius Pilate , with the Gentiles , and the people of Israel , were gathered together ,
text2: Chaches te marenpe che Swuntone Shavesa O Jesus , kai thodian les te avel o baro , o Herod ai o Pilate chidinisaile ande kado foro le themensa ai le narodosa kai si ando Israel .

text: For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done .
text2: Te keren so godi cho vas ai cho zakono aterdiardia mai anglal .

text: And now , Lord , behold their threatenings : and grant unto thy servants , that with all boldness they may speak thy word ,
text2: Akana , Devla , dikh so roden te aterdiaren che slugen te mothon chi vorba bare chachimasa .

text: By stretching forth thine hand to heal ; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child Jesus .
text2: Kana lunzhardian cho vas te kerdiol sastimata , ai mirakluria ai bare bucha ando anav cho Swuntone Shav o Jesus .

text: And when they had prayed , the place was shaken where they were assembled together ; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost , and they spake the word of God with boldness .
text2: Kana terdile te rhuginpe , kodo than kai sas chidine izdraia , ai savorhe pherdile Swunto Duxo , ai porme phende E Vorba le Devleski putierasa ande pengo ilo .

text: And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul : neither said any of them that ought of the things which he possessed was his own ; but they had all things common .
text2: Sa kodola kai pachaie sas iek ilo ai sas iek duxo ; khonik chi mothol ke godi sas les , lesko sas ferdi , numa sas savorhenge andek than .

text: And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus : and great grace was upon them all .
text2: Le apostluria divininas pa Del la putierasa pa Jesus kai zhuvindisailo , ai iek baro lashimos sas mashkar lende .

text: Neither was there any among them that lacked : for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them , and brought the prices of the things that were sold ,
text2: Khonik mashkar lende chi trobulas le kanch ; kaste godi sas phuvia vai khera bichinenas le , ai anenas le love kai bichinde sas le ,

text: And laid them down at the apostles ' feet : and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need .
text2: ai thonas le andal punrhe le apostlonge , ai denas sakoneste so trobulas les .

text: And Joses , who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas , ( which is , being interpreted , The son of consolation , ) a Levite , and of the country of Cyprus ,
text2: O Josef , kai akharenas les le apostluria Barnabbas , ai kodia znachil o shav kai zhutil , wo sas anda Levite , andai phuv kai busholas Cyprus .

text: Having land , sold it , and brought the money , and laid it at the apostles ' feet .
text2: Vi wo sas les iek phuv ai bichindia la , ai andia le love kal punrhe le apostlonge .

text: But a certain man named Ananias , with Sapphira his wife , sold a possession ,
text2: Iek manush kai busholas Ananias , ai leski zhuvli kai busholas Sapphira , bichinde penge phuv .

text: And kept back part of the price , his wife also being privy to it , and brought a certain part , and laid it at the apostles ' feet .
text2: Ai garade andal love , leski rhomni zhanelas , ai angerde so ashilia andel love kal punrhe le apostlonge .

text: But Peter said , Ananias , why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost , and to keep back part of the price of the land ?
text2: Numa o Petri phendia leske , " Ananias , Sostar o beng lia cho ilo ai te kerel tu te xoxaves le Swuntone Duxos , ai kai garadian andal love kana bichindian e phuv ?

text: Whiles it remained , was it not thine own ? and after it was sold , was it not in thine own power ? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart ? thou hast not lied unto men , but unto God .
text2: Mai anglal sar te bichines kodia phuv chiro sas , ai kana bichindian les le love chire sas , sarta thodian ande cho ilo ? Kasaviatar buchi , chi xoxadian le manushen numa le Devles . "

text: And Ananias hearing these words fell down , and gave up the ghost : and great fear came on all them that heard these things .
text2: O Ananias kana ashundia kodola vorbi , pelo tele ai mulo ; ai sa o narodo kai sas kotse daraile .

text: And the young men arose , wound him up , and carried him out , and buried him .
text2: Le mai terne wushtilo opre , vulisarde les andek tsol , ai angerde les te gropon les .

text: And it was about the space of three hours after , when his wife , not knowing what was done , came in .
text2: Trin chasuria pala kodia leski rhomni avili kotse , ai chi zhanelas so kerdilia .

text: And Peter answered unto her , Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much ? And she said , Yea , for so much .
text2: O Petri divinil lasa , ai phushel la , " Phen mange , pe ka savo pretso bichindian tumare phuv ? " E , woi mothol pe kado pretso .

text: Then Peter said unto her , How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord ? behold , the feet of them which have buried thy husband are at the door , and shall carry thee out .
text2: Antunchi o Petri mothol lake , " Sarta akordisailian te xoxaven le Swuntsone Duxos kai si le Devlesko ? Ashun kodola kai groposarde che rhomes angla wudar le , ai vi tu te angeren .

text: Then fell she down straightway at his feet , and yielded up the ghost : and the young men came in , and found her dead , and , carrying her forth , buried her by her husband .
text2: Strazo peli kal punrhe le apostlonge , ai muli ; kana le terne avile andre , arakhle la muli , angerde la , ai groposarde la pasha lako rhom .

text: And great fear came upon all the church , and upon as many as heard these things .
text2: Savorhe daraile kai sas kotse , ai vi kodola kai ashunde so kerdilia .

text: And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people ; ( and they were all with one accord in Solomon ' s porch .
text2: But mirakluria ai but bucha kerdionas mashkar o narodo katar le vas le apostlonge . Savorhe beshenas andek than anglal o wudara kodoleske kai busholas Solomon .

text: And of the rest durst no man join himself to them : but the people magnified them .
text2: Ai chi iek andal kolaver chi mai tromanas te zhan lensa ; numa o narodo bariarenas le zurales .

text: And believers were the more added to the Lord , multitudes both of men and women . )
text2: But narodo mai but ai mai but mursh ai zhuvlia pachanaspe ando Del , ai buntionas .

text: Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets , and laid them on beds and couches , that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them .
text2: Anenas le naswalen pel droma , an thonas le pel paturia , saxke kana o Petri nakhela leski vushalin te sai sastiarel vulen .

text: There came also a multitude out of the cities round about unto Jerusalem , bringing sick folks , and them which were vexed with unclean spirits : and they were healed every one .
text2: But narodo zhalas , uni andel gava kai sas pashe ande Jerusalem , anenas le naswalen , ai le manushenge kai sas o bi vuzho ande lende , ai savorhe sastionas .

text: Then the high priest rose up , and all they that were with him , ( which is the sect of the Sadducees , ) and were filled with indignation ,
text2: Antunchi o baro rashai , ai sa kodola kai sas lesa le Saduseanuria , xoliariko sas pe apostluria .

text: And laid their hands on the apostles , and put them in the common prison .
text2: Line le apostluria , ai thode le ande temnitsa .

text: But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors , and brought them forth , and said ,
text2: Numa iek angelo le Devlesko phuterdia e riate le vurotsi la temnisaki , ai lia le avri , ai phendia lenge ,

text: Go , stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life .
text2: " Zhan ande tampla ai mothon le narodoske sa le vorbi kai si ande kado nevo traio . "

text: And when they heard that , they entered into the temple early in the morning , and taught . But the high priest came , and they that were with him , and called the council together , and all the senate of the children of Israel and sent to the prison to have them brought .
text2: Kana o Petri ai o Iovano ashunde kodia , de diminiatsi gele le ande tampla , ai sicharenas le narodos . O baro rashai ai kodola sas lesa avile , ai chide le mai phuren ai sa le bare pel Zhiduvuria te den duma , porme trade ketanen le apostlonge katar e temnitsa .

text: But when the officers came , and found them not in the prison , they returned , and told ,
text2: Numa kana le ketani aresle kai temnitsa , won ma nas kotse , gele palpale kal bare le ketani , ai phende so kerdilia . Phenen ,

text: Saying , The prison truly found we shut with all safety , and the keepers standing without before the doors : but when we had opened , we found no man within .
text2: " Le wudara la temisake phandade sas , ai le ketani kai lenas sama kotse sas anglal wudara ; numa kana phuterdiam le wudara , chi arakhlem kanikas andre . "

text: Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things , they doubted of them whereunto this would grow .
text2: Kana o baro le ketanengo kai lenas sama kater e tampla ai le bare le rashange ashunde kodola vorbi , chi zhanenas so kerdilia kai ma nai le slugi ai denas pe duma iek kavresa , so si te kerdiol .

text: Then came one and told them , saying , Behold , the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple , and teaching the people .
text2: Vari kon avilia te mothol lenge , " Eta le manush kai thodian ande temnitsa si ande tamplo , ai sicharen le narodos pa Del . "

text: Then went the captain with the officers , and brought them without violence : for they feared the people , lest they should have been stoned .
text2: O baro le ketanengo gelo peske manushensa , ai andine le , numa chi line le pe zor , ke daranas katar o narodo ke shudel le baxensa pe lende .

text: And when they had brought them , they set them before the council : and the high priest asked them ,
text2: Kana andine le palpale , angla o narodo kai sas kotse , ai o baro rashai phushlia le , phenelas ,

text: Saying , Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name ? and , behold , ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine , and intend to bring this man ' s blood upon us .
text2: " Ke phendiamas tumenge te na mai sicharen le narodos ande kado anav ? Ai akana sa o Jerusalem si sichardo tumendar , ai tume mangen te perel pe amende o rat kodole manushengo . "

text: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said , We ought to obey God rather than men .
text2: O Petri ai le kaver apostluria phende , " Trobul te pachas o mui , o mui le Devlesko de sar le manushengo .

text: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus , whom ye slew and hanged on a tree .
text2: O Del amare dadengo zhuvindisailo , O Jesus , kai mudardian kana karfosardian les po trushul .

text: Him hath God exalted with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour , for to give repentance to Israel , and forgiveness of sins .
text2: O Del vazdia les pesko chache vastesa sar O Shav le Amperatosko , ai O Skepitori te del ka Israel , te keinpe , ai te aven iertime anda penge bezexa .

text: And we are his witnesses of these things ; and so is also the Holy Ghost , whom God hath given to them that obey him .
text2: Ame sam marturia anda kadala dieli , ai vi O Swunto Duxo kai O Del dia ka kodola kai pachan lesko mui . "

text: When they heard that , they were cut to the heart , and took counsel to slay them .
text2: Kana ashunde kodia , le bare mangle te mudaren le .

text: Then stood there up one in the council , a Pharisee , named Gamaliel , a doctor of the law , had in reputation among all the people , and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space ;
text2: Numa iek manush mashkar o narodo , ek Farisi , kai busholas Gamaliel , kai sicharelas o zakono kai o narodo lazhalas lestar ai pachalas lesko mui , wushtilo opre ai phendia te anklen avri le apostluria pe xantsi vriama .

text: And said unto them , Ye men of Israel , take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men .
text2: Ai phendia lenge , " Tume manush kai san andai Israel , arakhen tume so si te keren kadale manushensa . "

text: For before these days rose up Theudas , boasting himself to be somebody ; to whom a number of men , about four hundred , joined themselves : who was slain ; and all , as many as obeyed him , were scattered , and brought to nought .
text2: Ke nai de dumult sikadilia o Theudas , kai motholas kai wo si manush baro , ai shtar shela manush linepe pala leste ; numa vularde les ai sa kodola kai line sas pe pala leste , xasaile ai chi mai ashilia kanch anda lende .

text: After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing , and drew away much people after him : he also perished ; and all , even as many as obeyed him , were dispersed .
text2: Ai pala leste sas o Judah andai Galilee , kai tsirdia vi wo manushen pesa , ai vi kodola xasaile , ai sa kodola kai linepe pala leste , xsaile vi won .

text: And now I say unto you , Refrain from these men , and let them alone : for if this counsel or this work be of men , it will come to nought :
text2: Akana phenav tumenge , na len sama kadale manushenge ai meken le te zhantar ; ai so keren kadala manush te avela lendar pale kadia si te xasavon

text: But if it be of God , ye cannot overthrow it ; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God .
text2: Numa te avela katar O Del nashtil te xasaren kadia buchi , ai na zumaven te rimon e kris le Devleski . "

text: And to him they agreed : and when they had called the apostles , and beaten them , they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus , and let them go .
text2: Ai vi won haliarde sar leste ; ai akharde le apostluria , ai marde le , ai phende lenge te na mai den duma ando anav le Jesusosko , ai porme mekle le .

text: And they departed from the presence of the council , rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name .
text2: Ai geletar kotsar le bare , ai drago sas lenge ke chinuisarde le pala anav le Jesusoske .

text: And daily in the temple , and in every house , they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ .
text2: Ai swako dies ande khangeri , ai andel khera , savon te sicharen ai te mothon e lashi viasta pa Jesus Kristo .

text: And in those days , when the number of the disciples was multiplied , there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews , because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration .
text2: Ai antunchi le slugi mai butionas , le Zhiduvuria kai denas duma grekchisko vachinas pe pal Zhiduvuria kodole themeske , ke lenge zhuvlia kai sas phivlia chidenas le so trobulas le swako dies .

text: Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples unto them , and said , It is not reason that we should leave the word of God , and serve tables .
text2: Le desh u dui disipluria chide andek than sa le kolavre slugen ai phende lenge , nai mishto te terduas te mothas po Del ai te la sama katar o xabe .

text: Wherefore , brethren , look ye out among you seven men of honest report , full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom , whom we may appoint over this business .
text2: Anda kodia murhe phral , alon mashkar tumende efta mursh , kai zhal pa lende shukar xiro , ai kai si pherdo Swunto Duxo ande lende , ai gojaver , ai dasa lende kadia buchi .

text: But we will give ourselves continually to prayer , and to the ministry of the word .
text2: Ai ame rodasa te das mai but vriama ka rhugimos , ai kai vorba le Devleski .

text: And the saying pleased the whole multitude : and they chose Stephen , a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost , and Philip , and Prochorus , and Nicanor , and Timon , and Parmenas , and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch :
text2: So phende pa kodola bucha sa o narodo drago sas lenge ; ai thode iekes kai busholas Stephen , kodo manush sas pherdo pachamos ai O Swunto Duxo , ai vi o Philip , ai Prochorus , ai Nicanor , ai Timon , ai Parmenas , ai Nicolas , iek manush andai Antioch kai mai anglal wo pachalaspe sar le Zhiduvuria .

text: Whom they set before the apostles : and when they had prayed , they laid their hands on them .
text2: Andine le kal slugi kai kana rhugisaile thode le vas pe lende .

text: And the word of God increased ; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly ; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith .
text2: E Vorba le Devleski zhalas mai dur ai mai dur , ai le slugi mai butionas but anda Jerusalem ; ai but andal rasha vi won , dine pe le Devleske .

text: And Stephen , full of faith and power , did great wonders and miracles among the people .
text2: O Stephen , kai sas pherdo lashimos ai pherdo putiera , kerelas bari bucha andel Devlesko anav , ai bare mirakluria mashkar o narodo .

text: Then there arose certain of the synagogue , which is called the synagogue of the Libertines , and Cyrenians , and Alexandrians , and of them of Cilicia and of Asia , disputing with Stephen .
text2: Uni manush nas dakordo le Stephenosa , won sas andai synagogue , won bushonas Libertianes ai Cyrenians , ai Alexandrians , le Zhiduvonsa andai Cilicia ai andai Asia .

text: And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake .
text2: Numa nashtinas te inkeren pala leski goji ai pala Swunto Duxo kai delas duma pa lesko mui .

text: Then they suborned men , which said , We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses , and against God .
text2: Antunchi pochinde avre manushenge , te mothon , " Ashundiam leste ke delas duma ai marelas mui katar o Moses , ai katar O Del . "

text: And they stirred up the people , and the elders , and the scribes , and came upon him , and caught him , and brought him to the council ,
text2: Xoliarde o narodos , ai le mai phure , ai kodola kai ramonas o zakono , ai porme pashile pashai Stephen , ai line les , ai angerde les kal mai bare .

text: And set up false witnesses , which said , This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place , and the law :
text2: Ai andine manushen kai xoxavenas ai thonas dosh pe leste intaino , won mothonas , " Kado manush marel mui katar amari Swunto tampla , ai katar o zakono le Mosesosko ;

text: For we have heard him say , that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place , and shall change the customs which Moses delivered us .
text2: Ke ame ashundiam leste , kai phendia ke O Jesus kai sas andai Nazareth peravela kadia tampla , ai parhuvel o zakono kai dia ame o Moses . "

text: And all that sat in the council , looking stedfastly on him , saw his face as it had been the face of an angel .
text2: Sa le manush kai sas kotse ande kodo than , dikhenas po Stephen , ai dikhle ke lesko mui sas sar ieke angelosko .

text: Then said the high priest , Are these things so ?
text2: O baro rashai phushlia katar o Stephen te si chaches .

text: And he said , Men , brethren , and fathers , hearken ; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham , when he was in Mesopotamia , before he dwelt in Charran ,
text2: O Stephen phendia , " Manushale , murhe phral , ai murhe dada ashunen : O Del le putierako sikadilo amare dadeske o Abraham kana sas ande Mesopotamia , mai anglal sar te beshel ando Haran , ai phendia leske .

text: And said unto him , Get thee out of thy country , and from thy kindred , and come into the land which I shall shew thee .
text2: Zhatar anda cho them , ai mek che niamuria , ai zha ando them kai sikavava tuke .

text: Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans , and dwelt in Charran : and from thence , when his father was dead , he removed him into this land , wherein ye now dwell .
text2: Antunchi gelo anda them kai sas le Chaldeans , ai avilo ando Haran ; ai kotsar , kana mulo lesko dat , O Del andia les ando them kai san tume akana .

text: And he gave him none inheritance in it , no , not so much as to set his foot on : yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession , and to his seed after him , when as yet he had no child .
text2: O Del chi dia les kotse chi iek kher , chi phuv te tho o punrho . Numa O Del shinadia ke dela les o them , ai kodola kai avena pala leste avela vi lengo them kana wo merela , inker ande kodia vriama o Abraham nas les glati .

text: And God spake on this wise , That his seed should sojourn in a strange land ; and that they should bring them into bondage , and entreat them evil four hundred years .
text2: Ai eta so phendia lesko O Del , kodola kai avena pala tute traiina andek them , ai won avena slugi , ai chinuina le shtar shela bersh .

text: And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge , said God : and after that shall they come forth , and serve me in this place .
text2: Numa o them kai chinuisardia le , me dava les pe kris , phendia O Del , ai porme pala kodia anklen avri , ai podaina man katse .

text: And he gave him the covenant of circumcision : and so Abraham begat Isaac , and circumcised him the eighth day ; and Isaac begat Jacob ; and Jacob begat the twelve patriarchs .
text2: O Del dia o Abraham o kontrakto le shinimasko : O Abraham sas les iek shav o Isaak ai shindia lesko boriko le oxtoto dies . Ai o Isaak sas o dat le Iakovosko ; ai o Iakov sas les desh u dui shave .

text: And the patriarchs , moved with envy , sold Joseph into Egypt : but God was with him ,
text2: Numa le phral le Josephoske xolaile po Joseph , ai bichinde les te avel sluga ande Egypt . Numa O Del sas lesa ,

text: And delivered him out of all his afflictions , and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt ; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house .
text2: ai ankalavelas les anda sa leske baiuria , ai dia les te avel gojaver , ai o Joseph pelo drago le Pharaohnoske kai sas o amperato le Egyptako ; ai thodia le Josephos te lel pesko vas te avel baro pe Egypt ai pe sa o kher le Pharaohnosko .

text: Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan , and great affliction : and our fathers found no sustenance .
text2: Rimosaile e phuv ai chi mai bariolas xaben ande Egypt ai vi ando Canaan , ai sas baro nekazo ; ai amare dada chi mai arakhenas xaben te pravarenpe .

text: But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt , he sent out our fathers first .
text2: O Iakov ashundia ke sas jiv ande Egypt , ai tradia amare daden e pervo data .

text: And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren ; and Joseph ' s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh .
text2: Ai e duito data le phral le Josefoske prinzharde les ; ai o Pharaohono diape gor anda che familia sas o Josef .

text: Then sent Joseph , and called his father Jacob to him , and all his kindred , threescore and fifteen souls .
text2: Porme o Josef tradia te anen le Iakovos kai sas lesko dat , ai sa peska niamon kai sas eftavardesh tai panzh zhene .

text: So Jacob went down into Egypt , and died , he , and our fathers ,
text2: O Iakov avilo ande Egypt , ai mulo kotse , ai vi amare dada .

text: And were carried over into Sychem , and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor the father of Sychem .
text2: Ai angerde le ando Shechem , ai thode le ando groposhevo kai o Abraham chindiasas lovensa katar le shave le Hamoroske , o dat le Shechemosko .

text: But when the time of the promise drew nigh , which God had sworn to Abraham , the people grew and multiplied in Egypt ,
text2: E vriama pasholas kai trobulas te kerdiol so O Del shinadia sas le Abrahamoske , ai o narodo butiolas ande Egypt ,

text: Till another king arose , which knew not Joseph .
text2: zhi kai kerdilia aver amperato kai chi zhanelas le Josefos .

text: The same dealt subtilly with our kindred , and evil entreated our fathers , so that they cast out their young children , to the end they might not live .
text2: Kodo amperato xoxadia amare narodos , ai chinuisardia amare narodos , kana phendia lenge pe zor te meken tsinorhen te meren .

text: In which time Moses was born , and was exceeding fair , and nourished up in his father ' s house three months :
text2: Ande kodia vriama o Moses biandilo , ai wo sas drago ai lasho angla iakha le Devleske , sas pravardo trin shon ando kher peske dadesko ;

text: And when he was cast out , Pharaoh ' s daughter took him up , and nourished him for her own son .
text2: ai kana mekle les , e shei le Pharoahnoske lia les , ai bariardia les sar ta avino lako shav .

text: And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians , and was mighty in words and in deeds .
text2: O Moses sas sichardo ande sa e goji le Egyptonge , ai zuralo sas kana divinilas ai kana kerel vari so .

text: And when he was full forty years old , it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel .
text2: Shtarvardesh bershengo sas kana avilia leske po ilo te zhal te dikhel peske phralen kai sas Zhiduvuria .

text: And seeing one of them suffer wrong , he defended him , and avenged him that was oppressed , and smote the Egyptian :
text2: Dikhlia sar marenas iekes , ai mardia pe wo anda kuko kai sas mardo , ai dia iek le Egyptianos .

text: For he supposed his brethren would have understood how that God by his hand would deliver them : but they understood not .
text2: Wo gindilas ke leske phral le Zhiduvuria haliarenas ke O Del si te tradel lenge o skepimos katar o Moses ; numa won chi haliarde .

text: And the next day he shewed himself unto them as they strove , and would have set them at one again , saying , Sirs , ye are brethren ; why do ye wrong one to another ?
text2: Pe terharin o Moses arakhlia duie Zhidovon kai marenaspe , ai wo manglia te aterdiarel le , ai mothol lenge , " Murhe vortacha , tume phral san , sostar maren tume ? " Numa iek anda lende kai marelas pe kukulesa , spidia le Mosesos ,

text: But he that did his neighbour wrong thrust him away , saying , Who made thee a ruler and a judge over us ?
text2: ai phenel , " Kon thodia tu baro ai te des ame kris tu ? "

text: Wilt thou kill me , as thou diddest the Egyptian yesterday ?
text2: Ai phendia leske , " Manges te mudares i man sar mudardia arachi le Egyptianos ? "

text: Then fled Moses at this saying , and was a stranger in the land of Madian , where he begat two sons .
text2: Kana ashundia o Moses kodola vorbi liape an nashlo , ai gelo andek them kai bushol Midian , ai kotse sas les dui shave .

text: And when forty years were expired , there appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush .
text2: Shtarvardesh bersh pala kodia , iek angelo sikadilo leske ande pusta kai sas o plai kai busholas Sinai ande parha kai sas ande krenzha kai phabolas .

text: When Moses saw it , he wondered at the sight : and as he drew near to behold it , the voice of the Lord came unto him ,
text2: Kana dikhlia kodia o Moses , chudisailo anda so dikhlia , ai sar pasholas o glaso le Devlesko , ashundilia leske , phenelas ,

text: Saying , I am the God of thy fathers , the God of Abrham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob . Then Moses trembled , and durst not behold .
text2: " Me sim O Del che dadengo , O Del le Abrahamosko , ai O Del le Isaakosko , ai O Del le Iakovosko . " O Moses izdralas , ai chi tromalas te dikhel .

text: Then said the Lord to him , Put off thy shoes from thy feet : for the place where thou standest is holy ground .
text2: O Del phenel leske , " Le le papucha anda che punrhe , ke po phuv kai beshes swuntsola .

text: I have seen , I have seen the affliction of my people which is in Egypt , and I have heard their groaning , and am come down to deliver them . And now come , I will send thee into Egypt .
text2: Dikhlem o nekazo murhe narodosko kai si ande Egypt , ashundem lengo tsipimos , ai hulistem akana te ankalavav le avri . Akana zha , Me tradava tu ande Egypt .

text: This Moses whom they refused , saying , Who made thee a ruler and a judge ? the same did God send to be a ruler and a deliverer by the hand of the angel which appeared to him in the bush .
text2: Sa kodo Moses kai le Zhiduvuria gonisarde les , ai phende leske , " Kon thodia tu baro ai te des kris ? " O Del tradia les sar baro ai skepitori la putierasa le angeloski kai sikadilia sas leske ande krenzha .

text: He brought them out , after that he had shewed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt , and in the Red sea , and in the wilderness forty years .
text2: O Moses si kai ankaladia le Zhidovon andai Egypt , ai kai kerdia mirakluria ai semnuria ande kodo them , kai pai e loli , ai ande pusta shtarvardesh bersh .

text: This is that Moses , which said unto the children of Israel , A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren , like unto me ; him shall ye hear .
text2: Ai pale o Moses phendia le Zhidovonge , O Del tradela tumenge iek profeto sar mande kei avela iek anda tumaro narodo .

text: This is he , that was in the church in the wilderness with the angel which spake to him in the mount Sina , and with our fathers : who received the lively oracles to give unto us :
text2: Wo si kai sas mashkar le Zhiduvuria kai sas chidine ande pusta , wo sas amare dadensa ai le angelosa kai delas duma lesa pe plaiing kai bushol Sinai , ai o Moses phendia le vorbi ka amare daden , ai lia le vorbi le Devleske te anel le amende ;

text: To whom our fathers would not obey , but thrust him from them , and in their hearts turned back again into Egypt ,
text2: Numa amare dada chi mangle te lenpe pala leste , chi mangle kodo zakono ai ande pengo ilo mangenas te zhan palpale ande Egypt .

text: Saying unto Aaron , Make us gods to go before us : for as for this Moses , which brought us out of the land of Egypt , we wot not what is become of him .
text2: Ai phende ieke manusheske kai busholas Aaron , ker amenge dela kai phiren angla amende ke o Moses kai ankaladia ame avri andai Egypt , chi zhanas so kerdilia ande leste .

text: And they made a calf in those days , and offered sacrifice unto the idol , and rejoiced in the works of their own hands .
text2: Ai kerde ande kodola diesa iek vitselo sumnakuno , ai mudarde ieke zhegania ai phende te avel angla vitselo , ai raduisaile savorhe anda so kerde ande penge vas .

text: Then God turned , and gave them up to worship the host of heaven ; as it is written in the book of the prophets , O ye house of Israel , have ye offered to me slain beasts and sacrifices by the space of forty years in the wilderness ?
text2: Antunchi O Del durilo lendar , ai meklia len te rhuginpe kal chererhaia ai kal shunuto ai kal dieli kai si ando cheri ; sar si ramome ande klishka le profetonge , tume narodo andai Israel , mange si kai dian le zhigenien ai ande murho anav kai mudardian le shtarvardesh bersh ande pusta ?

text: Yea , ye took up the tabernacle of Moloch , and the star of your god Remphan , figures which ye made to worship them : and I will carry you away beyond Babylon .
text2: Nichi , numa angerdian e tsera le Devleski kai busholas Moloch , ai e chererhai kai sas tumaro Del o Remphan , kodola patreturia kai tume kerdian te rhugin tume lende ; anda kodia angerava tume mai dur de sar e Babylon .

text: Our fathers had the tabernacle of witness in the wilderness , as he had appointed , speaking unto Moses , that he should make it according to the fashion that he had seen .
text2: Ande pusta amare dada sas le iek tsera kai sas andre ramome le zakonuria . Kodia tsera sas kerdi sar O Del phendia , sas le Mosesoske te kerel la , ai phendia sas le Mosesoske te kerel saikfielo sai kodia tsera kai dikhlia ;

text: Which also our fathers that came after brought in with Jesus into the possession of the Gentiles , whom God drave out before the face of our fathers , unto the days of David ;
text2: Kodia tsera sas dini ka amaro narodo kai avilo pala amende , ai angerde la pensa kana sas o Josef o baro line o them katar le thema kai O Del gonisardia anda lende . Ai beshlo zhi kai avilo o David .

text: Who found favour before God , and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob .
text2: O David sas drago le Devleske , ai manglia te kerel ek kher le Devleske , pala O Del o Iakovosko .

text: But Solomon built him an house .
text2: Numa o Solomon kerdia o kher le Devlesko .

text: Howbeit the most High dwelleth not in temples made with hands ; as saith the prophet ,
text2: Numa O Del chi beshel anda so sas kerdo andel vas le manusheske , sar mothol o profeto .

text: Heaven is my throne , and earth is my footstool : what house will ye build me ? saith the Lord : or what is the place of my rest ?
text2: O rhaio si murhi amperetsia ai e phuv si kai phirav savestar kher kerena mange ? Mothol O Del . Vai kai avela o than kai hodiniva ?

text: Hath not my hand made all these things ?
text2: Pate nai murho vas kai kerdia sa kadala bucha ?

text: Ye stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears , ye do always resist the Holy Ghost : as your fathers did , so do ye .
text2: Tume manushale kai chi pachan o mui ai kai tumaro ilo ai tumare khan phandade le ka glaso le Devlesko , ai chi meken O Swunto Duxo te del ande tumaro ilo , vi tume sar tumare dadasa .

text: Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted ? and they have slain them which shewed before of the coming of the Just One ; of whom ye have been now the betrayers and murderers :
text2: Savo andal profeturia si kai tumare dada chinuisarde le ai marde le ? Mudarde kodolen kai mothonas mai anglal ke si te avel O Swunto kodo kai bichindian les ai mudardian les ;

text: Who have received the law by the disposition of angels , and have not kept it .
text2: Tume kai sas tume dino o zakono le Devlesko katar le angeluria , ai chi lian tume pa kado zakono .

text: When they heard these things , they were cut to the heart , and they gnashed on him with their teeth .
text2: Kana ashunde kodala vorbi , xolaile , ai kristsiinas andal dand pe leste .

text: But he , being full of the Holy Ghost , looked up stedfastly into heaven , and saw the glory of God , and Jesus standing on the right hand of God ,
text2: Numa o Stephen kai sas pherdo Swunto Duxo , vazdia le iakha karing o rhaio , ai dikhlia o barimos le Devlesko , ai le Kristos ande punrhende sar beshelas pe rik e chachi le Devleski .

text: And said , Behold , I see the heavens opened , and the Son of man standing on the right hand of God .
text2: Ai phendia , " Eta , Dikhav o cheri sar si phuterdo , ai O Shav le Manushesko ande punrhende pe rik e chachi le Devleski . "

text: Then they cried out with a loud voice , and stopped their ears , and ran upon him with one accord ,
text2: Savorhe tsipinas , ai phandade penge khan , ai savorhe xokle pe leste , ai angerde les avri anda foro , ai shude bax anda leste te mudaren les ; le manush kai shudenas bax anda leste dine penge tsalia ka terno manush te garavel le , wo busholas Saul .

text: And they stoned Stephen , calling upon God , and saying , Lord Jesus , receive my spirit .
text2: Ande kodia kai shudenas le baxensa anda leste o Stephen , rhugilaspe ai motholas , " Devla , le murho traio tute . "

text: And he kneeled down , and cried with a loud voice , Lord , lay not this sin to their charge . And when he had said this , he fell asleep .
text2: Porme pelo ande changende , ai tsipisardia zurales , " Devla , na xoliavol pe lende anda so kerde , " ai kana phendia kodola vorbi mulo .

text: And Saul was consenting unto his death . And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem ; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria , except the apostles .
text2: O Saul phendia , " Ke mishto kerde kai mudarde le Stephenos . " Ando kodo dies mudarde buten andal shave le Devleske kai sas ande khangeri ande Jerusalem ; ai savorhe rhespisaile andal gava karing e Judea ai Samaria ,

text: And devout men carried Stephen to his burial , and made great lamentation over him .
text2: ferdi le desh u dui apostluria chi gele .

text: As for Saul , he made havock of the church , entering into every house , and haling men and women committed them to prison .
text2: Le shave le Devleske angroposarde le Stephenos , ai rovenas but pe leski martia . O Saul pa peske rik delas anda khangeria phagavelas , zhalas ande swako kher , ai lelas avri le murshen ai le zhuvlian ai tholas le ande temnitsi .

text: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word .
text2: Kodola kai rhespisaile sas , zhanas foro forostar ai mothonas e lashi viasta le Devleski .

text: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria , and preached Christ unto them .
text2: O Filip gelo ando foro kai sas ande Samaria , ai delas duma pa Kristo .

text: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake , hearing and seeing the miracles which he did .
text2: But narodo ashunelas ka Filip so motholas , ashunenas ai dikhenas le mirakluria kai kerelas .

text: For unclean spirits , crying with loud voice , came out of many that were possessed with them : and many taken with palsies , and that were lame , were healed .
text2: Ke o beng anklelas avri anda but manush kai sas ande lende , ai tsipinas zurales , ai but manush kai nashti phirenas ai uni kai sas bange , lenge punrhe sastile .

text: And there was great joy in that city .
text2: Baro raduimos sas ando kado foro .

text: But there was a certain man , called Simon , which beforetime in the same city used sorcery , and bewitched the people of Samaria , giving out that himself was some great one :
text2: Sas mai anglal ande kodo foro iek manush kai busholas Simon , kai wo miazolas peske bare buchi , wo kerelas le bucha le bengeske , ai o narodo kai sas ande Samaria chudelas pe .

text: To whom they all gave heed , from the least to the greatest , saying , This man is the great power of God .
text2: Savorhe dikh katar o mai tsigno zhi ka mai baro , ashunenas leste , ai mothonas , kako si e putiera e bari le Devleski .

text: And to him they had regard , because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries .
text2: Ashunenas leste mishto , ke de dumult chudinas le narodos le buchansa kai kerelas .

text: But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God , and the name of Jesus Christ , they were baptized , both men and women .
text2: Numa kana pachaiepe ande Filip , wo kai motholas lenge e lashi viasta le rehaioski kai si le Devleski ai pa anav le Jesus Kristosko , murhs ai zhuvlia boldepe .

text: Then Simon himself believed also : and when he was baptized , he continued with Philip , and wondered , beholding the miracles and signs which were done .
text2: O Simon , vi wo pac haiape , ai kana boldiape , phirelas le Filiposa , ai dikhelas ai chudelaspe katar le mirakluria ai le bare semnuria kai kerdionas .

text: Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God , they sent unto them Peter and John :
text2: Le apostluria kai sas ande Jerusalem kana ashunde ke o narodo ande Samaria pachaiepe ande Vorba le Devleski , trade le Petres ai le Iovanos lende .

text: Who , when they were come down , prayed for them , that they might receive the Holy Ghost :
text2: Gele ande Samaria ka kodola manush , rhugisarde lenge , saxke te len O Swunto Duxo ;

text: ( For as yet he was fallen upon none of them : only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus . )
text2: ke inker chi hulisto sas pe chi iek anda lende ; ferdi bolde sas ando anav le Jesusosko ,

text: Then laid they their hands on them , and they received the Holy Ghost .
text2: Antunchi o Pertri ai o Iovano thode le vas pe lende , ai line O Swunto Duxo .

text: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles ' hands the Holy Ghost was given , he offered them money ,
text2: Kana o Simon dikhlia ke O Swunto Duxo sas dino kana le apostluria thode lenge vas pe lende , wo mangelas te del le love ,

text: Saying , Give me also this power , that on whomsoever I lay hands , he may receive the Holy Ghost .
text2: phenelas , " Den i man kadia putiera , saxke kana rhugiv ma i me vari kaske , ai thava le vas pe leste , te lel vi wo O Swunto Duxo . "

text: But Peter said unto him , Thy money perish with thee , because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money .
text2: Numa o Petri phendia leske , " Che love xasavon tusa , ke tu pachaian tu ke e putiera le Devleski sas dini le lovensa .

text: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter : for thy heart is not right in the sight of God .
text2: Nai tu kanch anda kadia buchi , ai chi poronchis tu : ke cho ilo nai vorta angla Del .

text: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness , and pray God , if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee .
text2: Keisavo anda cho bi lashimos , ai rhugisavo ka Del , te sai kerdiola te iertil tu anda chorho gindo kai sas tu .

text: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness , and in the bond of iniquity .
text2: Ke dikhav ke pherdo bi lashimos san , ai o bezex phandel tu . "

text: Then answered Simon , and said , Pray ye to the Lord for me , that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me .
text2: O Simon del atweto , " Rhugin tume ka Del anda mande , saxke te na kerdiol mange sa le dieli kai phendian mange . "

text: And they , when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord , returned to Jerusalem , and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans .
text2: Kana phende so kerdia O Del lenge , ai kana dine duma pa Del , o Petri ai o Iovano geletar palpale ande Jerusalem , ai mothonas e lashi viasta le Devleski ande but foruria le Samaritanonge .

text: And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip , saying , Arise , and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza , which is desert .
text2: Ai o angelo le Devlesko phendia le Filiposke , phenelas , " Wushti opre ai zha tele South po drom kai hulel ande Jerusalem zhando Gaza , " kodo kai si pusta .

text: And he arose and went : and , behold , a man of Ethiopia , an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians , who had the charge of all her treasure , and had come to Jerusalem for to worship ,
text2: Wushtilo opre ai gelotar ; ai eta , ek Ethiopiano , kai sas sluga ( eunuch ) tela vas la amperatasaiko busholas Candace , kai sas ande Ethiopia , ai wo lelas sama pe lako sumnakai ai lako mishtimos , ai wo avilo ando Jerusalem te rhugilpe ka Del .

text: Was returning , and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet .
text2: Ai porme zhalas khere , sar beshelas pe pesko vurdon jinelas ande Vorba le Devleski pa profeto Isaiah .

text: Then the Spirit said unto Philip , Go near , and join thyself to this chariot .
text2: O Swunto Duxo phendia le Filiposke , " Zha mai angle , ai pashos pasha kudo vurdon . "

text: And Philip ran thither to him , and heard him read the prophet Esaias , and said , Understandest thou what thou readest ?
text2: O Filip pashilo pasha leste nashimasa , ai ashunelas sar o Ethiopiano jinelas ande Vorba le Devleski pa profeto Isaiah , ai phushlia les , " Haliares so jines ? "

text: And he said , How can I , except some man should guide me ? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him .
text2: Kodo manush phendia , " Sar te haliarav te na avela vari kon te mothol mange ? " Ai phendia le Filiposke te anklel lesa po vurdon , ai te beshel pasha leste .

text: The place of the scripture which he read was this , He was led as a sheep to the slaughter ; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer , so opened he not his mouth :
text2: Ai eta , so jinelas ande Vorba le Devleski , angerde les sar iek bakriorho kai ingeren les te mudaren les ; wo sas sar iek vitselo kai chi mothol kanch angla kuko kai rhandel le bal pa leste , chi phuterdia vov si o mui .

text: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away : and who shall declare his generation ? for his life is taken from the earth .
text2: Mekliape tele numa nas lenge mila anda leste , chi kerde leske kris , kon sai dela duma pa kodola kai avena pala leste ?

text: And the eunuch answered Philip , and said , I pray thee , of whom speaketh the prophet this ? of himself , or of some other man ?
text2: Ke mudarde les pe kadia phuv . Kodo sluga phendia le Filiposke , " Rhugiv ma tute , phen mange pa kaste del duma o profeto kadia , pa peste del duma vai pa aver vari kon ? "

text: Then Philip opened his mouth , and began at the same scripture , and preached unto him Jesus .
text2: Antunchi o Filip phuterdia o mui , ai de kotsar liape te mothol leske pe lashi viasta le Jesusoski .

text: And as they went on their way , they came unto a certain water : and the eunuch said , See , here is water ; what doth hinder me to be baptized ?
text2: Sar zhanas pa drom , arakhle pai ; ai wo phendia le Filiposke , " Eta pai , ai sostar te na bolav ma ? "

text: And Philip said , If thou believest with all thine heart , thou mayest . And he answered and said , I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God .
text2: O Filip phendia leske , " Te pachasa tu sa che ilesa , sai kerdiol so manges . Wo phendia , " Pachav ke O Jesus Kristo si O Shav le Devlesko . "

text: And he commanded the chariot to stand still : and they went down both into the water , both Philip and the eunuch ; and he baptized him .
text2: Aterdiardia o vurdon , ai won huliste tele , vi le dui zhene ando pai , ai o Filip boldia les .

text: And when they were come up out of the water , the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip , that the eunuch saw him no more : and he went on his way rejoicing .
text2: Kana ankliste avri andai pai , O Swunto Duxo le Devlesko lia le Filipos , ai o eunuch chi mai dikhlia les ; numa zhalas pesko drom raduimasa .

text: But Philip was found at Azotus : and passing through he preached in all the cities , till he came to Caesarea .
text2: O Filip arakhlia pe andek foro kai bushol Azotus ; ai kotsar zhalas ande Caesarea , numa motholas e lashi viasta le Devleski ande sa le foruria kai nakhelas .

text: And Saul , yet breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord , went unto the high priest ,
text2: Ai o Saul , tsipilas ai phenelas te mudarel le disiplon kai sas le Devleske , gelo ka baro rashai ,

text: And desired of him letters to Damascus to the synagogues , that if he found any of this way , whether they were men or women , he might bring them bound unto Jerusalem .
text2: ai manglia lestar lila te sai del andel khangeria kai sas ando Damascus , saxke te arakhela manushen , mursh vai zhuvlia kai lenas pe pala Del , te astarel le ai te anel le ando Jerusalem .

text: And as he journeyed , he came near Damascus : and suddenly there shined round about him a light from heaven :
text2: Sar zhalas pa drom , ai sar pasholas pasha Damascus : ek vediara kai avelas anda cheri strefialas kruglom lestar ;

text: And he fell to the earth , and heard a voice saying unto him , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Pelo pe phuv , ai ashundia ek glaso kai motholas leske , " Saul , Saul , Sostar chinuis ma ? "

text: And he said , Who art thou , Lord ? And the Lord said , I am Jesus whom thou persecutest : it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks .
text2: Ai wo phendia , " Kon san tu , Devla ? " ai O Del phendia , " Me sim O Jesus kai chinuis ; trutno tuke te de palpale katar le kanrhe . "

text: And he trembling and astonished said , Lord , what wilt thou have me to do ? And the Lord said unto him , Arise , and go into the city , and it shall be told thee what thou must do .
text2: Izdralas ai chudisailo , phendia , " Devla , so manges te kerav ? " Ai O Del phendia leske , " Wushti opre , zha ando foro , ai mothola tuke so trobul te keres . "

text: And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless , hearing a voice , but seeing no man .
text2: Le manush kai lenaspe pala Saul aterdile , ai chi mai mothonas kanch , ashunenas o glaso , numa chi dikhenas kanikas .

text: And Saul arose from the earth ; and when his eyes were opened , he saw no man : but they led him by the hand , and brought him into Damascus .
text2: O Saul wushtilo opre katar e phuv , ai marka ke leske iakha phuterde sas , chi dikhelas kanch , line les vastestar ai angerde les ando Damascus .

text: And he was three days without sight , and neither did eat nor drink .
text2: Beshlo trin dies bi te dikhel , ai chi xalia ai chi pelia kanch .

text: And there was a certain disciple at Damascus , named Ananias ; and to him said the Lord in a vision , Ananias . And he said , Behold , I am here , Lord .
text2: Sas ando Damascus iek disiplo kai busholas Ananias ; O Del phendia leske ande ek vizion , " Ananias , " ai wo phendia , " Eta , me sim katse , Devla . "

text: And the Lord said unto him , Arise , and go into the street which is called Straight , and inquire in the house of Judas for one called Saul , of Tarsus : for , behold , he prayeth ,
text2: O Del phendia leske , " Wushti opre , zha po drom kai bushol o Chacho , ai rode ando kher le Judasosko iek manush kai bushol Saul , anda Tarsus .

text: And hath seen in a vision a man named Ananias coming in , and putting his hand on him , that he might receive his sight .
text2: Ke o Saul rhugilpe , ai dikhlia ande vizion iek manush kai bushol Ananias , kai avilo leste ai thodia le vas pe leste , te phuterdiol leske iakha ai te dikhel .

text: Then Ananias answered , Lord , I have heard by many of this man , how much evil he hath done to thy saints at Jerusalem :
text2: Porme o Ananias phendia , " Devla , ashundem katar but manush , sar kado manush chinuilas che shaven ande Jerusalem ;

text: And here he hath authority from the chief priests to bind all that call on thy name .
text2: ai si les katse putiera katar le bare rasha te phandavel kodolen kai divinin pa cho anav . "

text: But the Lord said unto him , Go thy way : for he is a chosen vessel unto me , to bear my name before the Gentiles , and kings , and the children of Israel :
text2: Numa O Del phendia leske , " Zha , ke me alosardem kadale manushes , ai thava les te kerel mange buchi , ai te mothol murho anav le kolavre themenge , ka penge amperatsi , ai kal Zhiduvuria ;

text: For I will shew him how great things he must suffer for my name ' s sake .
text2: ai sikavava leske so godi trobul te chinuil pala murho anav . "

text: And Ananias went his way , and entered into the house ; and putting his hands on him said , Brother Saul , the Lord , even Jesus , that appeared unto thee in the way as thou camest , hath sent me , that thou mightest receive thy sight , and be filled with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ai o Ananias gelotar , ai kana areslo ando kher ; thodhia le vas po Saul ai phendia , " Saul , murho phral , O Del , vi O Jesus kai sikadilo tuke po drom kai avesas katse , wo tradia ma saxke te rhugiv tuke , te dikhes ai te aves pherdo Swunto Duxo .

text: And immediately there fell from his eyes as it had been scales : and he received sight forthwith , and arose , and was baptized .
text2: Strazo pelia anda leske iakha korzhi , ai dikhlia , wushtilo opre , ai boldiape .

text: And when he had received meat , he was strengthened . Then was Saul certain days with the disciples which were at Damascus .
text2: Ai antunchi kana xalia , pale zurailo . O Saul beshlo xantsi dies le disiplonsa kai sas ando Damascus .

text: And straightway he preached Christ in the synagogues , that he is the Son of God .
text2: Ai strazo delas duma pa Kristo andel synagoguria , ke O Jesus si O Shav le Devlesko .

text: But all that heard him were amazed , and said ; Is not this he that destroyed them which called on this name in Jerusalem , and came hither for that intent , that he might bring them bound unto the chief priests ?
text2: Sa le manush kai ashunenas leste chudinaspe , ai mothonas ; " Nai kado ke chinuilas ande Jerusalem kodolen kai mothonas pa anav le Devlesko , ai chi avilo katse te phandavel le , ai te angerel le angla le bare rasha ? "

text: But Saul increased the more in strength , and confounded the Jews which dwelt at Damascus , proving that this is very Christ .
text2: Numa o Saul delas duma pa Del mai but ai mai but putierasa kai avelas katar O Del . Le Zhiduvuria kai sas anda Damascus chi mai zhanenas so te mothon leske , kana sikavelas lenge ke O Jesus si O Kristo .

text: And after that many days were fulfilled , the Jews took counsel to kill him :
text2: Neskolki dies pala kodia , le Zhiduvuria denas pe duma te mudaren les ;

text: But their laying await was known of Saul . And they watched the gates day and night to kill him .
text2: Numa o Saul ashundia pa so mangenas te keren . Vi diese ai vi e riate lenas sama pel vudara le foroske te roden les ai te mudaren les .

text: Then the disciples took him by night , and let him down by the wall in a basket .
text2: Numa andek riat le disipluria line les , ai nakhade les inchal o zido andek shkonitsa .

text: And when Saul was come to Jerusalem , he assayed to join himself to the disciples : but they were all afraid of him , and believed not that he was a disciple .
text2: Kana areslo ande Jerusalem , o Saul mangelas te zhal te beshel le disiplonsa ; numa sa le disipluria daranas lestar , ke chi pachanas ke wo sas ek disiplo le Devlesko .

text: But Barnabas took him , and brought him to the apostles , and declared unto them how he had seen the Lord in the way , and that he had spoken to him , and how he had preached boldly at Damascus in the name of Jesus .
text2: O Barnabas lia les pesa , ai angerdia les ka le apostluria , ai phendia lenge sar o Saul dikhlia le Devles po drom , ai wo dia lesa duma , ai sar ando Damascus dia duma pa Del ando anav le Jesusosko chachimasa .

text: And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem .
text2: De antunchara o Saul beshlo le disiplonsa ai zhalas avri andai Jerusalem ai avelas palpale , ai dia duma pa Del ando anav le Jesusosko bi darasa ,

text: And he spake boldly in the name of the Lord Jesus , and disputed against the Grecians : but they went about to slay him .
text2: ai delas duma pa Del vi le Zhidovonsa ; numa le Zhiduvuria mangenas te mudarenas les .

text: Which when the brethren knew , they brought him down to Caesarea , and sent him forth to Tarsus .
text2: Le disipluria kana ashunde te mangen te mudaren les , angerde les ande Caesaria , ai trade les te zhal ande Tarsus .

text: Then had the churches rest throughout all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria , and were edified ; and walking in the fear of the Lord , and in the comfort of the Holy Ghost , were multiplied .
text2: E khangeri antunchi ande pacha sas ande sa e Judea , ande Galilee , ande Samaria , e khangeri zuravolas le Devlesa , ai traiinas chachimasa le Devlesa , ai mai but narodo pherdiolas e khangeri ke zhutilas O Swunto Duxo .

text: And it came to pass , as Peter passed throughout all quarters , he came down also to the saints which dwelt at Lydda .
text2: O Petri kai zhalas pe sa o them gelo andek dies kal shave le Devleske kai sas andek foro kai bushol Lydda .

text: And there he found a certain man named Aeneas , which had kept his bed eight years , and was sick of the palsy .
text2: Arakhlia ieke manushes kai busholas Aneneas , kai sas po pato de oxto bersh , ke nashtilas te phirel .

text: And Peter said unto him , Aeneas , Jesus Christ maketh thee whole : arise , and make thy bed . And he arose immediately .
text2: O Petri phendia leske , " Aneneas , O Jesus Kristo sastiarel tu , wushti opre , ai lashar cho pato , " ai strazo wushtilo opre .

text: And all that dwelt at Lydda and Saron saw him , and turned to the Lord .
