text2: Sa o narodo kai sas kai e Lydda ai Sharon dikhle les , ai dinepe vi won ka Del .

text: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha , which by interpretation is called Dorcas : this woman was full of good works and almsdeeds which she did .
text2: Sas ande Joppe mashkar le disipluria ek zhuvli kai busholas Tabitha , kodia znachil Dorcas ; woi kerelas mishtimos ai zhutilas le choren .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that she was sick , and died : whom when they had washed , they laid her in an upper chamber .
text2: Naswaili ande kodia vriama ai muli ; kana xalade la , angerde la andek soba opre .

text: And forasmuch as Lydda was nigh to Joppa , and the disciples had heard that Peter was there , they sent unto him two men , desiring him that he would not delay to come to them .
text2: Sar o foro sas pashe pasha Joppa , le disipluria ashunde ke o Petri kotse sas , trade duie manushen leste , te mangen lestar te avel lende strazo .

text: Then Peter arose and went with them . When he was come , they brought him into the upper chamber : and all the widows stood by him weeping , and shewing the coats and garments which Dorcas made , while she was with them .
text2: O Petri wushtilo opre ai gelo kodole manushensa . Kana areslo , angerde les ande soba kai sas opre , sa le zhuvlia kai sas phivlia sas pasha leste ai rovenas , ai sikavenas leske le gada ai le raxamia kai e Dorcas kerelas , inker kana traiilas .

text: But Peter put them all forth , and kneeled down , and prayed ; and turning him to the body said , Tabitha , arise . And she opened her eyes : and when she saw Peter , she sat up .
text2: O Petri phendia te anklen savorhe avri , ai thodia pe anda changende , ai rhugisailo , porme gelo karing late ai phendia , " Tabitha , wushti opre . " Woi phuterdia le iakha , ai kana dikhlia le Petres , beshli tele .

text: And he gave her his hand , and lifted her up , and when he had called the saints and widows , presented her alive .
text2: O Petri delas vas ai zhutisardia la te wushtel opre ; ai antunchi akhardia le devlekane ai le phivlian , ai dia la lenge zhuvindi .

text: And it was known throughout all Joppa ; and many believed in the Lord .
text2: Kodia diela ande sa Joppa zhanelas o narodo , ai but narodo pachaiepe ando Del .

text: And it came to pass , that he tarried many days in Joppa with one Simon a tanner .
text2: O Petri beshlo xantsi vriama ando Joppa ka iek manush kai pachaiape ando Del , wo busholas Simon , ek shapozniko .

text: There was a certain man in Caesarea called Cornelius , a centurion of the band called the Italian band ,
text2: Sas ando Caesarea iek manush kai busholas Cornelius , wo sas baro mashkar le Romanonge ketani , mothonas lenge le ketani le Italianonge .

text: A devout man , and one that feared God with all his house , which gave much alms to the people , and prayed to God alway .
text2: Kodo manush pachalaspe ando Del , ai pachalas o mui le Devlesko ai vi leski familia , wo zhutilas but le chorhe manushen , ai rhugilaspe ka Del sagda .

text: He saw in a vision evidently about the ninth hour of the day an angel of God coming in to him , and saying unto him , Cornelius .
text2: Kal trin pala miazutso dikhlia iazhno ek vizion , ek angelo le Devlesko avilo leste ando kher , ai mothol leske , " Cornelius . "

text: And when he looked on him , he was afraid , and said , What is it , Lord ? And he said unto him , Thy prayers and thine alms are come up for a memorial before God .
text2: Ai dikhlia pe leste darasa , ai phendia , " So si , Devla ? " Ai o angelo phendia leske , " O Del ashundia che rhugimata ai dikhlia ke zhutisardian le chorhen ai diape goji pe tute .

text: And now send men to Joppa , and call for one Simon , whose surname is Peter :
text2: Trade akana manushen ando Joppa te anen le Simonos kai akharel les Petri .

text: He lodgeth with one Simon a tanner , whose house is by the sea side : he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do .
text2: Wo beshel le manushensa kai bushol Simon , wo kerel buchi morchaki , ai lesko kher pashai maria ; wo phenel tuke so te keres . "

text: And when the angel which spake unto Cornelius was departed , he called two of his household servants , and a devout soldier of them that waited on him continually ;
text2: Kana o angelo kai dia lesa duma gelotar , o Cornelius akhardia duie slugen , ai ek ketana kai kerelas leski buchi ai kai pachalaspe ando Del .

text: And when he had declared all these things unto them , he sent them to Joppa .
text2: Ai kana phendia lenge so kerdilia , tradia le ando Joppa .

text: On the morrow , as they went on their journey , and drew nigh unto the city , Peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth hour :
text2: Pe terharin , sar zhanas pa drom , ai sar pashonas pasha foro , o Petri anklisto po kher kal desh u dui te rhugilpe .

text: And he became very hungry , and would have eaten : but while they made ready , he fell into a trance ,
text2: Bokhailo , ai mangelas te xal , zhi kai lasharenas leske te xal , dikhlia ek vizion .

text: And saw heaven opened , and a certain vessel descending unto him , as it had been a great sheet knit at the four corners , and let down to the earth :
text2: Dikhlia o cheri sar phuterdilo , ai vari so hulelas tele , sar ek bari selia kai sas phangli katar le shtar koltsuria , kai hulelas ai bufliolas pe phuv ;

text: Wherein were all manner of fourfooted beasts of the earth , and wild beasts , and creeping things , and fowls of the air .
text2: Ai andre sas but failuria zhigeni shtar punrhensa , ai sapa , shuporli ( chorhe zhigeni ) , ai but fialuria chiriklia .

text: And there came a voice to him , Rise , Peter ; kill , and eat .
text2: Ai ek glaso mothol leske , Wushti , Petri , Mudar , ai xa , "

text: But Peter said , Not so , Lord ; for I have never eaten any thing that is common or unclean .
text2: Numa o Petri phendia , " Nichi , Devla , ke shoxar chi xalem vari so kai si bi vuzho vai marime . "

text: And the voice spake unto him again the second time , What God hath cleansed , that call not thou common .
text2: Ai o glaso mai phendia leske , " So O Del vuzhardo , na dikh tu sar te avino marime . "

text: This was done thrice : and the vessel was received up again into heaven .
text2: Ai o trio data phendia leske , ai strazo kodola diela anklisti opre ando cheri .

text: Now while Peter doubted in himself what this vision which he had seen should mean , behold , the men which were sent from Cornelius had made inquiry for Simon ' s house , and stood before the gate ,
text2: O Petri delaspe goji so znachil kodia vizion kai dikhlia , eta le trin manush kai sas tradine katar o Cornelius phushenas te arakhen kai sas o kher le Simonosko , ai won vorta angla o wudar sas .

text: And called , and asked whether Simon , which was surnamed Peter , were lodged there .
text2: Ai phushle zurales te sas kotse kai beshel o Simon kai akharen les Petri .

text: While Peter thought on the vision , the Spirit said unto him , Behold , three men seek thee .
text2: O Petri delaspe goji pe vizion , ai O Swunto Duxo phendia leske , " Ashun , si katse trin manush kai roden tu .

text: Arise therefore , and get thee down , and go with them , doubting nothing : for I have sent them .
text2: Wushti opre , ai huli tele ai zha lensa , ke me tradem le .

text: Then Peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from Cornelius ; and said , Behold , I am he whom ye seek : what is the cause wherefore ye are come ?
text2: O Petri hulisto tele ai phendia kodole manushenge kai avile katar o Cornelius , " Me sim kodo kai roden , ai phenen lenge sostar avilian ? "

text: And they said , Cornelius the centurion , a just man , and one that feareth God , and of good report among all the nation of the Jews , was warned from God by an holy angel to send for thee into his house , and to hear words of thee .
text2: Won phenen , " O Cornelius tradia ame , o baro ketanengo , kodo manush lasholo , rhugilpe ka Del , ai sa le Zhiduvuria lazhan lestar , ek angelo le Devlesko phendia leske te ingeras tu leste , te ashunel so si tu te mothos leske . "

text: Then called he them in , and lodged them . And on the morrow Peter went away with them , and certain brethren from Joppa accompanied him .
text2: O Petri phendia lenge te aven andre , ai te beshen kodia riat . Pe terharin gelotar lensa , uni andal phral le Joppeske gele lensa .

text: And the morrow after they entered into Caesarea . And Cornelius waited for them , and had called together his kinsmen and near friends .
text2: Aresle ando Caesarea pe terharin , o Cornelius azhukerelas le peske niamonsa ai peske vortachensa .

text: And as Peter was coming in , Cornelius met him , and fell down at his feet , and worshipped him .
text2: Sar delas te del andre o Petri ando kher , o Cornelius gelo angla leste , ai shudiape ka leske punrhe , ai bandilo tele pe phuv angle leste .

text: But Peter took him up , saying , Stand up ; I myself also am a man .
text2: Numa o Petri vazdia les opre ai phendia , " Wushti opre , ke i me sim manush . "

text: And as he talked with him , he went in , and found many that were come together .
text2: Sar divinilas lesa , dine ando kher , kotse arakhlia bute manushen .

text: And he said unto them , Ye know how that it is an unlawful thing for a man that is a Jew to keep company , or come unto one of another nation ; but God hath shewed me that I should not call any man common or unclean .
text2: Ai phendia lenge , " Zhanen , nai slobodo te phirel ieke streinosa vai te zhal leste ; numa O Del sikadia mange te na dikhav chi ieke manush sar marime vai bi vuzho .

text: Therefore came I unto you without gainsaying , as soon as I was sent for : I ask therefore for what intent ye have sent for me ?
text2: Anda kodia kana akhardian ma , avilem vi te mothav vari so , numa manglemas te zhanav sostar kerdian ma te avav ? "

text: And Cornelius said , Four days ago I was fasting until this hour ; and at the ninth hour I prayed in my house , and , behold , a man stood before me in bright clothing ,
text2: O Cornelius phendia , " De shtar dies palpale kana postivas ; kal trin pala miazutso rhugivas ma ando murho kher , ai eta , ek manush kai sas pe leste tsalia kai strefianas avilo angla mande ,

text: And said , Cornelius , thy prayer is heard , and thine alms are had in remembrance in the sight of God .
text2: ai phendia , " Cornelius , O Del ashundia cho rhugimos , ai diape goji ka mishtimos kai kerdian le chorhenge .

text: Send therefore to Joppa , and call hither Simon , whose surname is Peter ; he is lodged in the house of one Simon a tanner by the sea side : who , when he cometh , shall speak unto thee .
text2: Trade , vari kas ando Joppa , ai an le Simonos , kai akharen les Petri ; wo beshel ando kher le Simonosko kai kerel buchi morchaki pashai maria .

text: Immediately therefore I sent to thee ; and thou hast well done that thou art come . Now therefore are we all here present before God , to hear all things that are commanded thee of God .
text2: Wo , kana avela , del duma tuke . Strazo tradem vari kas karing tute , ai mishto kerdian kai avilian . Akana savorhe sam angla Del , te ashunas so godi O Del phendia tuke te phenes amenge . "

text: Then Peter opened his mouth , and said , Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons :
text2: Antunchi o Petri phendia , " Chachimasa akana zhanav ke O Del nai leske mai drago iek manush de sar aver .

text: But in every nation he that feareth him , and worketh righteousness , is accepted with him .
text2: Numa swako manush ande vari savi vitsa te avela , ai pachala le Devlesko mui , ai kerel so si vorta .

text: The word which God sent unto the children of Israel , preaching peace by Jesus Christ : ( he is Lord of all : )
text2: Drago lo le Devleske . Tradia e vorba kal shave le Zhidovonge , ai andia lenge e pacha katar O Jesus Kristo , kai so O Del savorhenge .

text: That word , I say , ye know , which was published throughout all Judaea , and began from Galilee , after the baptism which John preached ;
text2: Zhanen so kerdilia ande sa e Judea , ai kai kerde ande Galilee , mai anglal pala bolimos kai phendia o Iovano .

text: How God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power : who went about doing good , and healing all that were oppressed of the devil ; for God was with him .
text2: Zhanen sar O Del shordia pesko Swunto Duxo ai peski putiera po Jesus andai Nazareth , kai zhalas than thanestar ai kerelas mishtimos , ai sastiarelas kodolen kai sas telai putiera le bengeske ; ke O Del lesa sas .

text: And we are witnesses of all things which he did both in the land of the Jews , and in Jerusalem ; whom they slew and hanged on a tree :
text2: Ame sam marturia ande sa godi kerdia ando them le Zhidovon , ai ande Jerusalem ; mudarde les kana karfosarde les po trushul .

text: Him God raised up the third day , and shewed him openly ;
text2: Numa O Del zhuvindisardia les o trito dies , ai manglia te sikadiol .

text: Not to all the people , but unto witnesses chosen before of God , even to us , who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead .
text2: Na sa le manushenge , numa le marturia kai sas alome mai anglal katar O Del , ame kai xaliam ai piliam lesa palal o zhuvindimos andal mule .

text: And he commanded us to preach unto the people , and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God to be the Judge of quick and dead .
text2: Ai O Kristo dia ame ordina te das duma pa Del le narodoske , ai te mothas ke wo si kai sas thodino katar O Del te avel kritsinitori pel zhuvinde ai pal mule .

text: To him give all the prophets witness , that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins .
text2: Sa le profeturia mothon pa leste , ke kon godi pachalpe anda leste , avena lenge bezexa iertime ando lesko anav . "

text: While Peter yet spake these words , the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word .
text2: Sar o Petri divinilas , O Swunto Duxo hulisto pe sa kodola kai ashunenas kodo divano .

text: And they of the circumcision which believed were astonished , as many as came with Peter , because that on the Gentiles also was poured out the gift of the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ai le shave le Devleske kai avile sas le Petresa chudisaile , ke dikhle kai O Swunto Duxo hulisto vi pe le Nai Zhiduvuria .

text: For they heard them speak with tongues , and magnify God . Then answered Peter ,
text2: Ke ashunenas len sar denas duma anda kolaver shiba , ai naisinas le Devles . Antunchi o Petri phendia ,

text: Can any man forbid water , that these should not be baptized , which have received the Holy Ghost as well as we ?
text2: " Sai aterdiaras kadale manushen te aven bolde ando pai . Akana kai hulisto O Swunto Duxo pe lende sar amende ?

text: And he commanded them to be baptized in the name of the Lord . Then prayed they him to tarry certain days .
text2: Ai dia ordina te bolen le ando anav le Devlesko . " Ai porme mangle lestar te beshel lensa trin shtar dies .

text: And the apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God .
text2: Le apostluria ai le phral kai sas ande Judea ashunde le Nai Zhiduvuria dinepe kal Del .

text: And when Peter was come up to Jerusalem , they that were of the circumcision contended with him ,
text2: Antunchi o Perti gelo ando Jerusalem , ai le shave le Devleske kai sas ande Jerusalem phende leske , ke chi kerdia vorta .

text: Saying , Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised , and didst eat with them .
text2: Ai phendias , gelian kal Nai Zhiduvuria , ai xalian lensa .

text: But Peter rehearsed the matter from the beginning , and expounded it by order unto them , saying ,
text2: Ai o Petri liape te mothol lenge so kerdilia , phenelas , " Simas ando Joppa , ai sar rhugivas ma , dikhlem viziona , vari so kai miazolas sar ek bari selia , kai sas phangli kal shtar koltsuria , hulelas anda cheri ai avili zhi mande .

text: Upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes , I considered , and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth , and wild beasts , and creeping things , and fowls of the air .
text2: Me dikhavas pe kodia selia , ai lem sama , ai dikhlem zhigeni shtare punrhensa , ai sapa , shuporli ( chorhe zhigeni ) , ai chiriklia .

text: And I heard a voice saying unto me , Arise , Peter ; slay and eat .
text2: Ai ashundem ek glaso kai motholas mange , " Wushti opre , Petri , mudar ai xa . "

text: But I said , Not so , Lord : for nothing common or unclean hath at any time entered into my mouth .
text2: Ai me phendem , " Nichi , Devla , ke shoxar chi xalem vari so kai si bi vuzho vai marime . "

text: But the voice answered me again from heaven , What God hath cleansed , that call not thou common .
text2: Ai pe duito data iek glaso avilo anda cheri , " So O Del phendia ke si vuzho , tu na dikh sar bi vuzho . "

text: And this was done three times : and all were drawn up again into heaven .
text2: Kodia sas mange phendo trivar ; porme sa geletar ando cheri .

text: And , behold , immediately there were three men already come unto the house where I was , sent from Caesarea unto me .
text2: Ai eta , strazo trin manush kai sas tradine anda Caesarea karing mande , avile mande kai beshav .

text: And the spirit bade me go with them , nothing doubting . Moreover these six brethren accompanied me , and we entered into the man ' s house :
text2: O Swunto Duxo phenelas mange te zhav lensa , ai gelem , kodole shov lashe avile mansa , ai diam ando kher ande kodola manushesko kai bushol Cornelius .

text: And he shewed us how he had seen an angel in his house , which stood and said unto him , Send men to Joppa , and call for Simon , whose surname is Peter ;
text2: Kodo manush phendia amenge sar dikhliasas le angelos ande pesko kher , o angelo avilo leste , ai phendia leske , " Trade manush ando Joppa , te anen le Simonos , kodoles kai akharen o Petri ,

text: Who shall tell thee words , whereby thou and all thy house shall be saved .
text2: kai mothola tuke o divano , kai tu ai chi familia avena skepime . "

text: And as I began to speak , the Holy Ghost fell on them , as on us at the beginning .
text2: Kana lem te dav duma , O Swunto Duxo hulisto pe lende , sar pe amende anda gor ,

text: Then remembered I the word of the Lord , how that he said , John indeed baptized with water ; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ai antunchi dema goji kal vorbi kai phendiasas O Del , o Iovano boldia ando pai , numa tume avena bolde ando Swunto Duxo .

text: Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as he did unto us , who believed on the Lord Jesus Christ ; what was I , that I could withstand God ?
text2: " O Del dia len kodia podarka de sar amenge , kai pachaia ma ando Devles Jesus Kristo , sar sai te na kerav so mothol O Del ? "

text: When they heard these things , they held their peace , and glorified God , saying , Then hath God also to the Gentiles granted repentance unto life .
text2: Kana ashunde kado divano , chi mai phende kanch , ai naisin le Devles , phenenas , " O Del dia o keimos vi kal manush kai Nai Zhiduvuria , saxke te avel o iertimos vi len o traio . "

text: Now they which were scattered abroad upon the persecution that arose about Stephen travelled as far as Phenice , and Cyprus , and Antioch , preaching the word to none but unto the Jews only .
text2: Kodola kai sas rhespisaile pala o baio le manushenge kana o Stephen sas mudardo , gele zhande le Phoinicia , ai Cyrus , ai Antioch , phenenas E Vorba le Devleski ferdi le Zhidovonge .

text: And some of them were men of Cyprus and Cyrene , which , when they were come to Antioch , spake unto the Grecians , preaching the Lord Jesus .
text2: Ai uni mashkar lende sas manush ande Cyprus ai andai Cyrene , kai kana avile ande Antioch , gele kal Grekuria , ai mothonas lenge e lashi viasta pa Jesus Kristo .

text: And the hand of the Lord was with them : and a great number believed , and turned unto the Lord .
text2: O vas le Devlesko lensa sas , ai buta manush pachaiepe , ai dinepe ka Del .

text: Then tidings of these things came unto the ears of the church which was in Jerusalem : and they sent forth Barnabas , that he should go as far as Antioch .
text2: Kodia ashundilia zhi kal khan le manushenge kai sas ande khangeri ande Jerusalem ; ai trade iekes kai busholas Barnabas , zhi ando Antioch ,

text: Who , when he came , and had seen the grace of God , was glad , and exhorted them all , that with purpose of heart they would cleave unto the Lord .
text2: kana areslo , ai dikhlia o lashimos le Devlesko , raduisailo , ai phendia lenge , savorhenge te beshen ieke ilesa phangle ka Del .

text: For he was a good man , and full of the Holy Ghost and of faith : and much people was added unto the Lord .
text2: Ke lasho manush sas , pherdo Swunto Duxo ai pachamos ; ai but narodo diape ka Del .

text: Then departed Barnabas to Tarsus , for to seek Saul :
text2: Antunchi o Barnabas gelo ande Tarsus , te rodel kodoles kai bushol Saul .

text: And when he had found him , he brought him unto Antioch . And it came to pass , that a whole year they assembled themselves with the church , and taught much people . And the disciples were called Christians first in Antioch .
text2: Kana arakhlia les , andia les ando Antioch , iek bersh chidepe andek than andel khangeria , ai sicharenas but narodos . Ando Antioch sas e pervo data kai le disipluria sas akharde le Shave le Devleske .

text: And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch .
text2: Ande kodia vriama le profeturia gele anda Jerusalem ando Antioch .

text: And there stood up one of them named Agabus , and signified by the spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world : which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar .
text2: Iek anda lende kai busholas Agabus wushtilo opre , ai phendia katar O Swunto Duxo ke chi mai avela xaben pe sa e phuv , ai kerdilia kana o Claudius Caesar sas o baro le themengo .

text: Then the disciples , every man according to his ability , determined to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in Judaea :
text2: Le disipluria dinepe duma , ai te traden xaben sako so dashtila kal phral kai sas ande Judea ;

text: Which also they did , and sent it to the elders by the hands of Barnabas and Saul .
text2: Ai kerde kadia , trade xaben kal mai phure kai sas ande Judea le Barnabasa ai le Saulosa .

text: Now about that time Herod the king stretched forth his hands to vex certain of the church .
text2: Sa ande kodia vriama o amperato Herod chinuilas uni manushen kai sas Devleske andel khangeria .

text: And he killed James the brother of John with the sword .
text2: Ai mudardia la sabiasa o James , ophral le Iovanosko .

text: And because he saw it pleased the Jews , he proceeded further to take Peter also . ( Then were the days of unleavened bread . )
text2: Ai dikhlia ke so kerelas drago sas le Zhidovonge , phendia te phandaven le Petres . Kodia kerdilia ande vriama le manrhonge bi drozhdi .

text: And when he had apprehended him , he put him in prison , and delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep him ; intending after Easter to bring him forth to the people .
text2: Line les , ai thode les ande temnitsa , ai thode desh u shov ketani te arakhen les ; ai mangen te sikaven les angla narodo pala E Patradi .

text: Peter therefore was kept in prison : but prayer was made without ceasing of the church unto God for him .
text2: O Petri sas phandado ande temnitsa ; numa e khangeri chi terdiolas te rhugilpe ka Del anda leste .

text: And when Herod would have brought him forth , the same night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers , bound with two chains : and the keepers before the door kept the prison .
text2: Iek riat mai anglal kai o amperato Herod zhalas te angerel le Petres angla narodo , o Petri sovelas ai phanglo sas dui lantsonsa mashkar dui ketani ; ai aver ketani lenas sama angla wudar katar e temnitsa .

text: And , behold , the angel of the Lord came upon him , and a light shined in the prison : and he smote Peter on the side , and raised him up , saying , Arise up quickly . And his chains fell off from his hands .
text2: Eta , o angelo le Devlesko avilo , ai ek bari vediara strefialas ande temnitsa . O angelo wushtiardia le Petres , ai phenel leske , " Wushti opre strazo , " ai le lantsuria pele tele katar leske vas .

text: And the angel said unto him , Gird thyself , and bind on thy sandals . And so he did . And he saith unto him , Cast thy garment about thee , and follow me .
text2: Ai o angelo phendia leske , " Tho chi prashtai ai le shpargati . " Ai o Petri kerdia so phendia leske , o angelo mai phendia leske , " Le pe tute chi raxami , ai aidi pala mande . "

text: And he went out , and followed him ; and wist not that it was true which was done by the angel ; but thought he saw a vision .
text2: O Petri anklisto avri , ai liape pala leste , ai chi zhanelas ke so kerelas o angelo , chache sas , gindilas ke vizion dikhelas .

text: When they were past the first and the second ward , they came unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city ; which opened to them of his own accord : and they went out , and passed on through one street ; and forthwith the angel departed from him .
text2: Kana nakhle anglal pervo ketani ai porme anglal duito , aresle angla o wudar o sastruno kai angerel ando foro , kodo wudar phuterdiol korkorho angla lende , ankliste avri , ai dine po drom , ai strazo o angelo meklia le Petres .

text: And when Peter was come to himself , he said , Now I know of a surety , that the Lord hath sent his angel , and hath delivered me out of the hand of Herod , and from all the expectation of the people of the Jews .
text2: Avilo peste o Petri ai mothol , akana dikhav ke chaches O Del tradia peske angelos , ai ke lia ma anda vas le amperatosko , ai so godi le Zhiduvuria azhukerenas .

text: And when he had considered the thing , he came to the house of Mary the mother of John , whose surname was Mark ; where many were gathered together praying .
text2: Kana haliardia so kerdilia lesa , gelo ka kher la Mariako , woi sas e dei la Iovanoski , kai akharenas les Mark , kotse but narodo sas andek than ai rhuginaspe .

text: And as Peter knocked at the door of the gate , a damsel came to hearken , named Rhoda .
text2: O Petri mardia anda o wudar , ai ek shei kai busholas Rhode , avili te dikhel .

text: And when she knew Peter ' s voice , she opened not the gate for gladness , but ran in , and told how Peter stood before the gate .
text2: Ai prinzhardia o glaso le Petresko , ai ando pesko raduimos chi phuterdia o wudar , numa geli te mothol le kolavrenge ke o Petri angla o wudar sas .

text: And they said unto her , Thou art mad . But she constantly affirmed that it was even so . Then said they , It is his angel .
text2: Won mothonas lake , " Dzili san , " numa woi motholas ke chaches sas . Ai won mothonas , " Ke lesko angelo si . "

text: But Peter continued knocking : and when they had opened the door , and saw him , they were astonished .
text2: Numao Petri mai marelas anda o wudar , ai kana phuterde o wudar ai dikhle les , chudisaile .

text: But he , beckoning unto them with the hand to hold their peace , declared unto them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison . And he said , Go shew these things unto James , and to the brethren . And he departed , and went into another place .
text2: Kerdia lenge anda vas te na kerren mui , ai phendia lenge sar O Del lia les avri andai temnitsa . Ai phendia , phenen so kerdilia le Jamesoske ai le kolaver phralenge . Porme gelotar , ai gelo ande kolaver rik .

text: Now as soon as it was day , there was no small stir among the soldiers , what was become of Peter .
text2: Kana phuterdilo o dies , le ketani chi haliarenas so kerdilia , ai chi zhanenas kai sas o Petri .

text: And when Herod had sought for him , and found him not , he examined the keepers , and commanded that they should be put to death . And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea , and there abode .
text2: Ai kana o amperato Herod rodia les , chi arakhe les , ai phushlia katar le bare , ai dia ordina te mudaren le ketanen kai lenas sama lestar . Porme o Herod gelo andai Judea zhando Casarea , te beshel kotse xantsi vriama .

text: And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon : but they came with one accord to him , and , having made Blastus the king ' s chamberlain their friend , desired peace ; because their country was nourished by the king ' s country .
text2: O Herod defial xoliariko sas po narodo kai sas ando Tyre ai ando Sidon , numa won avile karing leste . Line pesa pe penge rik , ieka ketani kai busholas Blastus , wo sas pasha amperato , porme gele te mangen katar o Herod e pacha lensa , ke won lestar anenas xaben ande pengo them katar o amperato .

text: And upon a set day Herod , arrayed in royal apparel , sat upon his throne , and made an oration unto them .
text2: O dies kai manglia o Herod , liape peste peske tsalia le amperetsisko , ai beshlo po skamin , ai dia lensa duma angla savorhende .

text: And the people gave a shout , saying , It is the voice of a god , and not of a man .
text2: Ai o narodo tsipilas , phenenas , " Nai kado manush kai del duma , numa del si . "

text: And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him , because he gave not God the glory : and he was eaten of worms , and gave up the ghost .
text2: Numa strazo o angelo le Devlesko naswardia ( dia palma ) le amperatos , ke mangelas te garavel pesko barimos , kai trobulas le Devleske te avel , le rhimi xale les , ai mulo .

text: But the word of God grew and multiplied .
text2: E Vorba le Devleski ashundilias mai but ai mai but .

text: And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem , when they had fulfilled their ministry , and took with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Kana o Barnabas ai o Saul getosarde penge buchi avile palpale anda Jerusalem , angerde pesa le Iovanos kai akharenas les Mark .

text: Now there were in the church that was at Antioch certain prophets and teachers ; as Barnabas , and Simeon that was called Niger , and Lucius of Cyrene , and Manaen , which had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch , and Saul .
text2: Sas ande khangeri ande Antioch profeturia ai manush kai sicharenas o zakono ; o Barnabas , ai o Simon kai akharenas les Niger , o Luvius andai Cyrene , ai o Manaen kai barilo sas le amperatosa o Herod , ai o Saul .

text: As they ministered to the Lord , and fasted , the Holy Ghost said , Separate me Barnabas and Saul for the work whereunto I have called them .
text2: Sar kerenas buchi le Devleski , ai postinas , O Swunto Duxo phendia , " Rigate o Barnabas ai o Saul mange te keren e buchi kai mangav te keren . "

text: And when they had fasted and prayed , and laid their hands on them , they sent them away .
text2: Antunchi kana rhugisaile ai postisarde , thode le vas pe lende , ai rhudisarde lenge , ai mekle le te zhantar .

text: So they , being sent forth by the Holy Ghost , departed unto Seleucia ; and from thence they sailed to Cyprus .
text2: O Barnabas ai o Saul sas tradine katar O Swunto Duxo ande Seleucia ; ai kotsar line o paraxodo te zhan andek izula kai bushol Cyprus .

text: And when they were at Salamis , they preached the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews : and they had also John to their minister .
text2: Kana aresle ande Salamis , phende E Vorba le Devleski andel synagoguria le Zhidovonge ; ai o Iovano zhutilas le .

text: And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos , they found a certain sorcerer , a false prophet , a Jew , whose name was Bar - jesus :
text2: Porme kana nakhle sa e izula zhi ando Paphos , arakhle ieke manushes kai sas drabarno , xoxamno profeto , Zhidovo sas , wo busholas Bar - jesus .

text: Which was with the deputy of the country , Sergius Paulus , a prudent man ; who called for Barnabas and Saul , and desired to hear the word of God .
text2: Wo traiilas pasha manush kai sas baro pe kodia izula , o Sergius Paulus , kodo manush gojaver sas ; ai o baro le izulako akhardia Barnabas ai o Saul , ke mangelas te ashunel E Vorba le Devleski .

text: But Elymas the sorcerer ( for so is his name by interpretation ) withstood them , seeking to turn away the deputy from the faith .
text2: Numa o Elimas o drabarno ( ke kodo si lesko anav kai akharenas les ) chi mangelas o Barnabas ai o Saul te zhan te mothon E Vorba le Devleski le bareske .

text: Then Saul , ( who also is called Paul , ) filled with the Holy Ghost , set his eyes on him ,
text2: Antunchi o Saul ( kai akharenas les Paul ) pherdo sas le Swuntone Duxosa , dikhlia pe leste ai phendia ,

text: And said , O full of all subtilty and all mischief , thou child of the devil , thou enemy of all righteousness , wilt thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord ?
text2: " Tu manusha kai san pherdo xoxaiimos ai chorimos , tu kai san o shav le bengesko , o duzhmano la krisako , e kris e vorta aterdiol , ai na mai rimosar le zakonuria kai si vorta le Devleske .

text: And now , behold , the hand of the Lord is upon thee , and thou shalt be blind , not seeing the sun for a season . And immediately there fell on him a mist and a darkness ; and he went about seeking some to lead him by the hand .
text2: Akana , o vas le Devlesko pe tute lo , aves sa korho pe xantsi vriama , ai chi mai dikhesa o kham . Ai strazo o tuniariko pelo pe leste , ai rodelas sar te phirel ai manushen te sai sikaven leske po drom .

text: Then the deputy , when he saw what was done , believed , being astonished at the doctrine of the Lord .
text2: O baro kai poronchilas pe izula , kana dikhlia so kerdilia , pachaiape ando Del , ai ande lesko zakono .

text: Now when Paul and his company loosed from Paphos , they came to Perga in Pamphylia : and John departing from them returned to Jerusalem .
text2: O Pavlo ai leske vortacha line o paraxodo anda Paphos , ai gele ando Perga ande Pamphlia ; o Iovano meklia le , ai gelotar palpale ande Jerusalem .

text: But when they departed from Perga , they came to Antioch in Pisidia , and went into the synagogue on the sabbath day , and sat down .
text2: Andai Perga gele pengo drom , ai aresle ando Antioch ande Pisidia , ai gele ande synagogue Savatone , ai beshle tele .

text: And after the reading of the law and the prophets the rulers of the synagogue sent unto them , saying , Ye men and brethren , if ye have any word of exhortation for the people , say on .
text2: Kana jinde e klishka le Zakonoski ai pa le Profetonge , E Vorba le Devleski , le bare rasha le synagogaki trade vari kas te mothon lenge , " Amare phral , te si tume vari so te mothon katar O Del , mothon . "

text: Then Paul stood up , and beckoning with his hand said , Men of Israel , and ye that fear God , give audience .
text2: O Pavlo wushtilo opre , ai kerdia semno anda vas , ai phendia , " Tume Zhiduvuria , ai tume kai pachan tume ando Del , ashunen .

text: The God of this people of Israel chose our fathers , and exalted the people when they dwelt as strangers in the land of Egypt , and with an high arm brought he them out of it .
text2: O Del le Zhidovongo alosardia amare daden , kerdia te butiol kado narodo zhi kai sas streinuria ande Egypt , ai ankaladia le avri peske vastesa o zurales .

text: And about the time of forty years suffered he their manners in the wilderness .
text2: Lia sama lendar shtarvardesh bersh ande pusta .

text: And when he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Chanaan , he divided their land to them by lot .
text2: Mudardia efta vitsen kai sas anda Canaan , ai dia e phuv palpale ka pesko narodo te beshen .

text: And after that he gave unto them judges about the space of four hundred and fifty years , until Samuel the prophet .
text2: Antunchi pala kodia shtar shela ai panvardesh bersh dia le kristatoria kai sicharenas le , zhi kai avilo o Samuel o profeto .

text: And afterward they desired a king : and God gave unto them Saul the son of Cis , a man of the tribe of Benjamin , by the space of forty years .
text2: Porme mangle iek amperato ; ai O Del dia le pe shtarvardesh bersh o Saul , o shav le Kishesko , andai e vitsa kai sas le Benjamin .

text: And when he had removed him , he raised up unto them David to be their king ; to whom also he gave testimony , and said , I have found David the son of Jesse , a man after mine own heart , which shall fulfil all my will .
text2: Porme kana chi mai mangle o Saul , O Del dia le le Davidos te avel lengo amperato ; ai phendia pa leste , pa David , o shav le Jesesko , kodo manush si sar mangel les murho ilo , ai kai kerela so mangav lestar .

text: Of this man ' s seed hath God according to his promise raised unto Israel a Saviour , Jesus :
text2: Andai e vitsa le Davidoski O Del shinadia te del ek Skepitori , ai andia le Zhidovonge ieke Skepitores , kai si O Jesus .

text: When John had first preached before his coming the baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel .
text2: Mai anglal sar te avel , o Iovano phendia pa bolimos , ai pe keimos le bezexengo sa le Zhidovonge .

text: And as John fulfilled his course , he said , Whom think ye that I am ? I am not he . But , behold , there cometh one after me , whose shoes of his feet I am not worthy to loose .
text2: Ai kana o Iovano getosardia peske buchi , phenelas , " Kon sim me ? So gindin tume ? Chi sim O Kristo . Numa pala mande avel kodo kai chi sim dosta vuzho te phutrav leske doria le papuchenge ! "

text: Men and brethren , children of the stock of Abraham , and whosoever among you feareth God , to you is the word of this salvation sent .
text2: Murhe phral , Tume kai san shave andai e vitsa le Abrahamoske , ai tume kai pachan o mui le Devlesko , tumenge si kai sas tradini e vora le skepimaski .

text: For they that dwell at Jerusalem , and their rulers , because they knew him not , nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day , they have fulfilled them in condemning him .
text2: Le Zhiduvuria ande Jerusalem , ai lenge bare kerde so le profeturia phende kana mudarde les , chi zhangle le Kristos , ai chi haliarde so le profeturia phende , numa won jinenas pa kodia swako Savato .

text: And though they found no cause of death in him , yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain .
text2: Marka ke chi arakhle anda leste baio kadia de baro , kai trobulas mudardo , mangle katar o Pilate te mudarel les .

text: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him , they took him down from the tree , and laid him in a sepulchre .
text2: Ai kana kerde so godi sas ramome pa leste , huliarde les pa trushul , ai thode les ando greposhevo .

text: But God raised him from the dead :
text2: Numa O Del wushtiardia les mashkar le mule .

text: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem , who are his witnesses unto the people .
text2: Sikadilo but dies kodolenge kai gelesas lesa andai Galilee zhi ande Jerusalem , ai kai akana won si leske marturia mashkar o narodo .

text: And we declare unto you glad tidings , how that the promise which was made unto the fathers ,
text2: Ai ame phenas tumenge kadia lashi viasta , kai sas shinadi amare dadenge .

text: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children , in that he hath raised up Jesus again ; as it is also written in the second psalm , Thou art my Son , this day have I begotten thee .
text2: O Del kerdia so shinadiasas amenge kai sam le shave amare dadenge , kana zhuvindisailo O Jesus sar si ramome ando Psalm duito , tu san murho Shav , kerdem tu adies .

text: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead , now no more to return to corruption , he said on this wise , I will give you the sure mercies of David .
text2: O Del phendiasas ke zhuvindila les andai martia , ai anela les ka traio te na mai merel kadia , phendia sas , me kerava so shinademas le Davidoske .

text: Wherefore he saith also in another psalm , Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption .
text2: Anda kodia , mai phenel ande kolaver Psalm 16 : 8 - 11 , chi mekesa kodoles kai si chiro te cherniol .

text: For David , after he had served his own generation by the will of God , fell on sleep , and was laid unto his fathers , and saw corruption :
text2: O David kerdia ande peske vriama so manglia lestar O Del , porme mulo , ai sas gropome pasha peske daden , ai chernilo .

text: But he , whom God raised again , saw no corruption .
text2: Numa kodo kai O Del zhuvindisardia les , chi chernilo .

text: Be it known unto you therefore , men and brethren , that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins :
text2: Murhe phral , lestar si kai o iertimos le bezexengo si tumen dino .

text: And by him all that believe are justified from all things , from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses .
text2: Ai kon godi pachalape ande leste avela iertime and peske bezexa lestar , ai kai o zakaono le Mosesosko nashtilas te kerel .

text: Beware therefore , lest that come upon you , which is spoken of in the prophets ;
text2: Arakhen tume , te na kerdiol tumenge , so si phendo katar le profeturia .

text: Behold , ye despisers , and wonder , and perish : for I work a work in your days , a work which ye shall in no wise believe , though a man declare it unto you .
text2: Ashunen tume , kai chi pachan tume , chudin tume , ai meren : ke si te kerav ande tumare dies iek diela kai chi pachana , te mothola la tumenge vari kon . "

text: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue , the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath .
text2: Kana o Pavlo ai o Barnabas ankliste avri andai synagogue , mangle lendar te aven palpale o Savato te den duma pa sa kodala dieli .

text: Now when the congregation was broken up , many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas : who , speaking to them , persuaded them to continue in the grace of God .
text2: Kana getosailo divano , but mashkar le Zhiduvuria ai mashkar kodola kai Nas Zhiduvuria kai kerenas o zakono le Zhidovonge linepe pala Pavlo ai pala Barnabas . O Barnabas ai o Pavlo zhutinas le ai divininas lensa pa Del , ai mothonas lenge te beshen ando lashimos le Devlesko .

text: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God .
text2: O kolaver Savato pashte sa narodo le forosko chidinisailo te ashunel E Vorba le Devleski .

text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes , they were filled with envy , and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul , contradicting and blaspheming .
text2: Le Zhiduvuria kai dikhle sa o narodo kai chidinisailo , na lenge mishto , ai mothonas ke nas vorta so motholas o Pavlo , ai marenas mui lestar .

text: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold , and said , It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you : but seeing ye put it from you , and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life , lo , we turn to the Gentiles .
text2: O Pavlo ai o Barnabas phende lenge chachimasa , " Ke tumenge mai anglal E Vorba le Devleski trobulas te avel phendi , numa te chi mangena te ashunen , ai te kerena tume kris pe tumende ke chi san dosta lashe te zhan ando rhaio , apo ame zhas te mothas pa Del kodolenge kai chi zhanen pa Del .

text: For so hath the Lord commanded us , saying , I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles , that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth .
text2: Ke kadia phendia amenge O Del te keras . " Thodem tu te aves e vediara la lumiaki , te angeres o skepimos zhandel gora la lumiaki . "

text: And when the Gentiles heard this , they were glad , and glorified the word of the Lord : and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed .
text2: Kana le Nai Zhiduvuria ashunde kodia , raduisaile , ai luvudinas E Vorba le Devleski : ai sa kodola kai sas lenge shinado o traio kai chi mai getolpe pachaiepe .

text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region .
text2: E Vorba le Devleski ashundilias ande sa o them .

text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women , and the chief men of the city , and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and expelled them out of their coasts .
text2: Numa le Zhiduvuria rimonas le zhuvlian kai nas andal Zhiduvuria ai kai rhuginaspe ka Del , ai vi le manushen kai sas bare ando foro , kerde te chinuin o Pavlo ai o Barnabas , ai shude le avri anda them .

text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them , and came unto Iconium .
text2: O Pavlo ai o Barnabas kana ankliste avri chinosarde e phulberia pa penge papucha , ai geletar ando Iconium .

text: And the disciples were filled with joy , and with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Ai le disipluria ande Antioch pherdo raduimasa , ai le Swuntone Duxosa .

text: And it came to pass in Iconium , that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews , and so spake , that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed .
text2: Ando Iconium o Pavlo ai o Barnabas dine andek than ande synagogue le Zhidovonge , ai kadia de mishto dine duma , kai but narodo andal Zhiduvuria ai andal Grekuria pachaiepe .

text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles , and made their minds evil affected against the brethren .
text2: Numa uni andal Zhiduvuria chi pachaiepe , ai rimonas kodolen kai Nas Zhiduvuria , ai kerenas le te avel le chorhe ginduria pel phral .

text: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord , which gave testimony unto the word of his grace , and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands .
text2: Numa o Pavlo ai o Barnabas beshle but vriama ando Iconium , ai denas duma ai chi daranas ai pachanaspe ando Del , O Del sikavela lenge ke so mothonas pa lesko lashimos , chacho sas , ai delas len e zor te keren semnuria ai mirakluria .

text: But the multitude of the city was divided : and part held with the Jews , and part with the apostles .
text2: Numa o narodo ande foro huladesas , uni sas le Zhidovonsa , ai uni le apostlonsa .

text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles , and also of the Jews with their rulers , to use them despitefully , and to stone them ,
text2: Le Zhiduvuria ai kodola kai Nas Zhiduvuria penge barensa lashardionas te chinuin o Pavlo ai o Barnabas , ai te mudaren le baxensa .

text: They were ware of it , and fled unto Lystra and Derbe , cities of Lycaonia , and unto the region that lieth round about :
text2: Kana o Pavlo ai o Barnabas haliarde so mangenas te keren lensa , geletar karing o Lystra ai o Derbe , le foruria kai si ande Lyconia , ai le thana kotsar pashe .

text: And there they preached the gospel .
text2: Ai kotse denas duma e lashi viasta .

text: And there sat a certain man at Lystra , impotent in his feet , being a cripple from his mother ' s womb , who never had walked :
text2: Ando Listra beshelas tele iek manush ke nashtilas te phiral , bange sas leske punrhe de sar kerdilo sas , ai shoxar chi phirdia sas .

text: The same heard Paul speak : who stedfastly beholding him , and perceiving that he had faith to be healed ,
text2: Ashunelas sar divinilas o Pavlo , ai o Pavlo dikhel pe leste , ai dikhlia ke pachalpe kai sai sastiol .

text: Said with a loud voice , Stand upright on thy feet . And he leaped and walked .
text2: O Pavlo tsipisardia zurales , " Wushti opre pe che punrhe . " Ai wushtilo strazo ai phirdia .

text: And when the people saw what Paul had done , they lifted up their voices , saying in the speech of Lycaonia , The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men .
text2: Kana o narodo dikhlia so kerdia o Pavlo , vazde o glaso , ai phende ande shib kodole themeske , Lycaonia ; Le dela ( le ikoni ) kai kerdile sar le manush avile mashkar amende .

text: And they called Barnabas , Jupiter ; and Paul , Mercurius , because he was the chief speaker .
text2: Akharenas o Barnabas Jupiter ; ai o Pavlo , akharenas les Mercurius , ke wo si kai divinilas .

text: Then the priest of Jupiter , which was before their city , brought oxen and garlands unto the gates , and would have done sacrifice with the people .
text2: O rashai anda Jupiter , kai sas angla wudar le forosko , andai gurumlia ai lulujansa anglal wudara , wo ai o narodo mangenas te keren sakrifis ka Pavlo ai Barnabas .

text: Which when the apostles , Barnabas and Paul , heard of , they rent their clothes , and ran in among the people , crying out ,
text2: Kana le apostluria , o Barnabas ai o Pavlo ashunde kodia , shinde penge tsalia , ai gele mashkar le manushen , tsipinas , ai phenenas ,

text: And saying , Sirs , why do ye these things ? We also are men of like passions with you , and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God , which made heaven , and earth , and the sea , and all things that are therein :
text2: " Murhe vortacha , sostar keren kadia ? Iame sam manush sar tumende , ai anas tumenge ek lashi viasta , ai sikavas tumenge te na mai keren kadala dieli kai nai lashi , ai te bolden tume karing O Del o zhuvindo kai kerdia o cheri , e phuv , e maria , ai so godi si .

text: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways .
text2: O Del mai anglal meklia sa le themen te lenpe pala pengo zakono .

text: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness , in that he did good , and gave us rain from heaven , and fruitful seasons , filling our hearts with food and gladness .
text2: Numa savo sikavelas pesko mishtimos anda cheri , kerelas te del breshind , ai te avel xaben pe e vriama , ai delas tume but xaben , ai pherelas tumare ile mishtimos .

text: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people , that they had not done sacrifice unto them .
text2: Vi kana divininas kadia le apostluria le Devleske nashtinas te aterdiaren le narodos , te bariaren lengo anav . '

text: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium , who persuaded the people , and , having stoned Paul , drew him out of the city , supposing he had been dead .
text2: Antunchi avile andai Antioch ai andai Iconium Zhiduvuria , ai tsirdenas le narodos pe penge rik , ai kana shudele baxensa po Pavlo , ai ingerde les avri anda foro , won gindinas ke mulo .

text: Howbeit , as the disciples stood round about him , he rose up , and came into the city : and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe .
text2: Numa le disipluria geletar leste , ai pale wushtilo , ai pale gelo ando foro . Pe terharin gelotar o Pavlo ai o Barnabas anda Derbe .

text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city , and had taught many , they returned again to Lystra , and to Iconium , and Antioch ,
text2: Kana o Pavlo ai o Barnabas dine duma pa Del ande kodo foro , ai sichardia but manushen . Antunchi geletar palpale ande Lystra , ande Iconium , ai ando Antioch ,

text: Confirming the souls of the disciples , and exhorting them to continue in the faith , and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: ai o Pavlo ai o Barnabas denas zor le kolavre phralen , ai mothonas lenge pa Del ai te beshen ando pachamos kai sas dino , ai mothonas lenge trobul te nakhas pa but chino mai anglal te aresas ando rhaio le Devlesko .

text: And when they had ordained them elders in every church , and had prayed with fasting , they commended them to the Lord , on whom they believed .
text2: Ando swako khangeri , won alosarde le mai phure lenge , ai rhugisaile ai postisarde , ai mangenas katar O Del te arakhel le ande kodo Del , kai pachaiesaspe .

text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia , they came to Pamphylia .
text2: Porme kana nakhle andai Pisidia , avile ande Pamphilia .

text: And when they had preached the word in Perga , they went down into Attalia :
text2: Ai kana phende pa Del andek foro kai bushol Perga , gele ande Attalia ;

text: And thence sailed to Antioch , from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled .
text2: Ai kotsar line o paraxodo ai gele ando Antioch , kodo foro kai thosesas les angla Del pala e buchi kai kerde sas .

text: And when they were come , and had gathered the church together , they rehearsed all that God had done with them , and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles .
text2: Kana aresle ande Antioch , ai chide la khangeria , phende so godi O Del kerdia sas lensa , ai sar phuterde sas le themenge o drom le pachamasko .

text: And there they abode long time with the disciples .
text2: Ai beshlo but vriama le disiplonsa .

text: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren , and said , Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Uni manush avilo andai Judea ande Antioch te phenen le phralenge , te na avena shinde sar o zakono le Mosesosko manglia , won nashtin avena skepime .

text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them , they determined that Paul and Barnabas , and certain other of them , should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question .
text2: O Pavlo ai o Barnabas phenenas lenge te nas nai vorta , ai divininas pa kodia buchi , antunchi mangle o Pavlo ai o Barnabas ai aver manush te zhan ande Jerusalem , saxke te den duma pe kadia buchi le kolavre apostlonsa ai le mai phurensa .

text: And being brought on their way by the church , they passed through Phenice and Samaria , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles : and they caused great joy unto all the brethren .
text2: E khangeri tradia le pala kodia diela , nakhle andai Phoenicia ai andai Samaria , ai mothonas sar kodola kai Nas Zhiduvuria , dinesaspe ka Del , ai kana ashunde le kolaver phral kodia diela raduisaile sas .

text: And when they were come to Jerusalem , they were received of the church , and of the apostles and elders , and they declared all things that God had done with them .
text2: Kana aresle ande Jerusalem , e khangeri akhardia le peste , ai le apostluria ai le mai phure , ai phende lenge so godi O Del kerdia sas lensa .

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed , saying , That it was needful to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses .
text2: Numa uni andal Farizeanuria kai vi won dine sas pe ka Del , wushtilo opre ai phende , trobul te shinen kodolen kai Nas Zhiduvuria ai kai dinepe ka Del , ai te lenpe pala zakono le Mosesosko .

text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter .
text2: Le apostluria le Devleske ai le mai phure chidepe andek than te len sama pa kodia diela .

text: And when there had been much disputing , Peter rose up , and said unto them , Men and brethren , ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us , that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
text2: Kerdilia ek baro bunto , numa o Petri wushtilo opre , ai phendia lenge , " Murhe phral , zhanen ke de dumult O Del alosardia mashkar tumende , saxke anda murho mui le Nas Zhiduvuria trobul te ashunen E Vorba le Devleski , ai te pachanpe .

text: And God , which knoweth the hearts , bare them witness , giving them the Holy Ghost , even as he did unto us ;
text2: Ai O Del , kai zhanel le ile , sikadia lenge o chachimos kana dia vi len O Swunto Duxo sar amen ;

text: And put no difference between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
text2: Le Devleske iek fialo sam , vi won ai vi ame , vi lengo ilo vuzhardia le pachamasa .

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God , to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
text2: Akana sostar zumaven le Devles , te thon ek pharimos pe le disiplon , kai chi amare dada ai chi ame nashti rhevdisardiam .

text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved , even as they .
text2: Numa pala lashimos le Devlesko o Jesus Kristo avasa skepime , sam sa sar lende .

text: Then all the multitude kept silence , and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul , declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them .
text2: Sa o narodo ande khangeri chi mai phendia kanch , ai ashunenas ka Pavlo ai ka Barnabas , sar mothonas pa le mirakluria ai le semnuria kai kerdia sas O Del lensa mashkar le Nas Zhiduvuria .

text: And after they had held their peace , James answered , saying , Men and brethren , hearken unto me :
text2: Kana aterdile te divinin , o Iakov phendia , " Murhe phral , ashunen mande . "

text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
text2: O Simon phendia sar O Del mai anglal dikhlia pe thema , ai te alol mashkar lende narodos kai ingeren la lesko anav .

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
text2: Ai kodola sa kerdion le vorbi kai le profeturia phende sas kai sas ramome ,

text: After this I will return , and will build again the tabernacle of David , which is fallen down ; and I will build again the ruins thereof , and I will set it up :
text2: ai pala kodia avava palpale , ai vazdava palpale o kher le Davidosko , kai sas perado ; vazdava opre so sas tele , ai vortova .

text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord , and all the Gentiles , upon whom my name is called , saith the Lord , who doeth all these things .
text2: Saxke , so ashelia andal manush te roden le Devles , ai sa le thema kai murho anav si luvudime , phenel O Del . Wo kerel sa kadala dieli .

text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world .
text2: Mothol O Del kai dia te zhanen kadale buchi de anda gor la lumiake .

text: Wherefore my sentence is , that we trouble not them , which from among the Gentiles are turned to God :
text2: Amos 9 : 11 - 12 . Anda kodia , me mangav te na keren bunto mashkar le manush kai chi zhanen le Devles ai kai denpe le Devleske .

text: But that we write unto them , that they abstain from pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from things strangled , and from blood .
text2: Numa te ramon lenge , te arakhenpe te na xan mas bi vuzho kai sas dino ando anav le ikonengo , ai te arakhenpe katar le biznibraznia , ai te na xan mas zhigeniengo kai sas tasade , ai te na pen rat .

text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath day .
text2: Ke demult le mai phure manush mothon o zakono le Mosesosko ande swako foro , ai jinen o zakono andel khangeria swako Savato .

text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders , with the whole church , to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas ; namely , Judas surnamed Barsabas , and Silas , chief men among the brethren :
text2: Ai pelia drago le apostlonge ai le mai phurenge ai sa le khangeriake , te alon mashkar lende , ai te traden ande Antioch le Paulosa ai o Barnabas ; o Judas kai akharenas les Barsabas , ai o Silas , manush kai jinenas pe leste le phral .

text: And they wrote letters by them after this manner ; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia :
text2: Ai dine le lila kai mothol , " Le apostluria ai le mai phure ai tumare phral traden but bax , sastimos kal phral kai chi zhanen le Devles kai traiin ande Antioch , ande Syria , ai ande Cilicia .

text: Forasmuch as we have heard , that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , saying , Ye must be circumcised , and keep the law : to whom we gave no such commandment :
text2: Ashundiam , ke uni manush kai gele tumende amendar , ai kai ame chi tradiam le , dziliarde tume , phenenas , trobul te aven shinde ai garaven o zakono ; ame chi phendiam lenge te phenen kadala vorbi .

text: It seemed good unto us , being assembled with one accord , to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
text2: Anda kodia ame diam andek than , ai mangliam te alosaras lashe manush , ai te tradas le tumenge , kodolensa kai si amenge drago o Barnabas ai o Paul .

text: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Kadala manush dine pengo traio pala anav amaro Devlesko Jesus Kristo .

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who shall also tell you the same things by mouth .
text2: Ame tradiam tumenge o Judas ai o Silas , kai phenena tumenge te traiin sar ame ramosardiam .

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things ;
text2: Ke O Swunto Duxo , ai ame mangliam te na thas pe tumende mai but pharimos de ferdi so trobul tumen te keren .

text: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols , and from blood , and from things strangled , and from fornication : from which if ye keep yourselves , ye shall do well . Fare ye well .
text2: Te na xan anda mas kai sas dino angla ikoni , ai rat zhigeniengo kai sas tasade , arakhen tume katar e biznibraznia , ai traiina mishto , te na kerena kadala dieli . Ashen Devlesa . "

text: So when they were dismissed , they came to Antioch : and when they had gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle :
text2: Kana won geletar kotsar katar kodia khangeri , gele ando Antioch ; ai dine o lil ka narodo kai pachalaspe ando Del ando Antioch .

text: Which when they had read , they rejoiced for the consolation .
text2: Kana jinde o lil , le phral raduisaile ke anelas lenge lashimos ai zor .

text: And Judas and Silas , being prophets also themselves , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
text2: O Judas ai o Silas , kai vi won sas profeturia , sicharenas le , ai denas le zor kana divininas lensa .

text: And after they had tarried there a space , they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles .
text2: Pala xantsi vriama , mekle le phral te zhantar karing kodola kai trade sas le .

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still .
text2: Numa o Silas gindilas kai mai mishto te beshela .

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
text2: Vi o Pavlo ai o Barnabas beshle ando Antioch , sicharenas ai mothonas e lashi Vorba le Devleski le kolavren phralensa .

text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas , Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord , and see how they do .
text2: Neskolki dies nakhle , porme o Pavlo phendia le Barnabasoske , " Aven , dikhas le phralen ande sa le foruria kai phendiam E Vorba le Devleski , te dikhas sar si kodala phral . "

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: O Barnabas manglia te ingerel pesa vi le Iovanos , kai akharenas le Mark .

text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them , who departed from them from Pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
text2: Numa o Pavlo miazolas leske kai nai mishto te len pesa kodoles kai mekliasas le andai Pamphilia , ai kai chi avilo te zhutil le ande penge buchi .

text: And the contention was so sharp between them , that they departed asunder one from the other : and so Barnabas took Mark , and sailed unto Cyprus ;
text2: Xolaile , ai meklepe o Pavlo , ai o Barnabas lia pesa le Markos ai line o paraxodo , ai gele andek izula kai bushol Cyprus ;

text: And Paul chose Silas , and departed , being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God .
text2: O Pavlo alosardia o Silas , lia les pesa , ai geletar , kai trade le le phral ando lashimos de Devlesko .

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches .
text2: Ai gele ande Syria ai ande Cilicia , te den zor le khangeria .

text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra : and , behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timotheus , the son of a certain woman , which was a Jewess , and believed ; but his father was a Greek :
text2: Porme o Pavlo gelo ande Derbe ai ande Lystra , ai kotse sas ek disiplo kai busholas Timothy , wo sas o shav ieka zhuvliako kai sas Zhiduvaika , ai pachalaspe ando Del , ai lesko dat sas Greko .

text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium .
text2: Le phral andai Lystra ai andai Iconium mothonas pa leste ke lasho manush sas .

text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him ; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters : for they knew all that his father was a Greek .
text2: O Pavlo manglia te ingerel les pesa , ai shindia les palal Zhiduvuria ke kadia sas lenge zakono , ke but Zhiduvuria sas kotsar , ai savorhe zhanenas ke lesko dat Greko sas .

text: And as they went through the cities , they delivered them the decrees for to keep , that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem .
text2: Kana nakhenas pal foruria , mothonas le phralenge te keren so mangen le apostluria le Devleske ai le mai phure kai si ande Jerusalem .

text: And so were the churches established in the faith , and increased in number daily .
text2: Le khangeria zuravolas lengo pachamos , ai butionas swako dies .

text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia , and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia ,
text2: O Swunto Duxo chi meklia le te mothon E Vorba le Devleski ande Asia , ai nakhle ande Phrygia ai anda them kai busho Galatia .

text: After they were come to Mysia , they assayed to go into Bithynia : but the Spirit suffered them not .
text2: Kana aresle ande Mysia , mangle te zhan ande Bithynia , numa O Swunto Duxo le Kristosko chi manglia .

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas .
text2: Nakhle anda Mysia ai aresle ando Troas .

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night ; There stood a man of Macedonia , and prayed him , saying , Come over into Macedonia , and help us .
text2: Ande kodia riat o Pavlo dikhlia ek vizion , ek manush andai Macedonia sikadilo lesko , ai rhugisailo leste , ai phendia , aidi amende ande Macedonia , ai zhutisar ame .

text: And after he had seen the vision , immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia , assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them .
text2: Kana o Pavlo dikhlia kodia vizion , mangliam strazo te zhas ande Macedonia , ke haliardiam ke O Del mangelas te phenas kotse E Vorba le Devleski .

text: Therefore loosing from Troas , we came with a straight course to Samothracia , and the next day to Neapolis ;
text2: Kana geliamtar ando Troas , liam o paraxodo ai geliam strazo ande Samothracia , ai pe terharin aresliam ande Neopolis .

text: And from thence to Philippi , which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia , and a colony : and we were in that city abiding certain days .
text2: Kotsar geliam ande Philippi , kodo si o pervo foro kai si andai Macedonia , kai avile sas le Romanuria : beshliam xantsi dies ande kodo foro .

text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side , where prayer was wont to be made ; and we sat down , and spake unto the women which resorted thither .
text2: Kana dia o Savato anklistiam avri anda foro karing o pai , ke rodasas ek than te sai rhugisavas ; beshliam tele , ai diam duma le zhuvliansa kai sas chidine kotse .

text: And a certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , which worshipped God , heard us : whose heart the Lord opened , that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul .
text2: Ek anda lende busholas Lydia , bichinelas brazba poxtan ando foro kai bushol Thyatira . Woi sas ek zhuvli kai pachalaspe ando Del , ai ashunelas : O Del phuterdia lako ilo te sai ashunel so motholas o Paul .

text: And when she was baptized , and her household , she besought us , saying , If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and abide there . And she constrained us .
text2: Kana boldiape peska familiasa , manglia amendar vari so , ai phendia , te haliarena tume ke vorta sim karing O Del , aven ande murho kher , ai beshen mande . Ai astarelas zor pe amende te beshas .

text: And it came to pass , as we went to prayer , a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us , which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying :
text2: Sar zhasas pe kodo than te rhugisavas , ek shei kai sas o beng ande late avili amende , ai woi sai motholas so si te avel , ai nirilas but love peske barenge ke drabarel ai phenel so si te avel .

text: The same followed Paul and us , and cried , saying , These men are the servants of the most high God , which shew unto us the way of salvation .
text2: Ai liape pala Pavlo ai pala amende , motholas , kakala manush si le slugi le Devleske kai si opre , ai won mothon tumenge o drom le skepimasko .

text: And this did she many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . And he came out the same hour .
text2: Ai woi phendia kadia but dies , chi haliarelas les . O Pavlo nashti mai rhevdilas , boldinisailo karing late , ai phendia le bengeske , " Ando anav le Jesus Kristosko ankli avri anda late . " Ai strazo anklisto avri .

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone , they caught Paul and Silas , and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers ,
text2: Le gazda kodola slugaki , kana dikhle ke anklisto o bi vuzho anda late , line le Pavlos ai o Silas , ai angerde le mashkar o foro anglal bare .

text: And brought them to the magistrates , saying , These men , being Jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
text2: Angerde le angla bare ketani ai phenen , " Kakala manush , buntuin amaro foro ;

text: And teach customs , which are not lawful for us to receive , neither to observe , being Romans .
text2: ai sicharen le zakonuria kai amenge nai slobodo te las , ai chi te keras kodo zakono . Ame sam Romanuria . "

text: And the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent off their clothes , and commanded to beat them .
text2: Vi o narodo xolailo pe lende , le bare ketani phende te shinen le tsalia pa Pavlo , ai pa Silas , ai dine ordina te maren len le bichosa .

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
text2: Kana marde le but , thode le ande temnitsa , ai phende kodoleske kai lelas sama katar e temnitsa te arakhel le zurales .

text: Who , having received such a charge , thrust them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
text2: Sar phende leske kodia , kodo manush thodia le ande temnitsa ta ando gor po zido , ai thodia lenge punrhe ande bare khash .

text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed , and sang praises unto God : and the prisoners heard them .
text2: Kal desh u dui e riat o Pavlo ai o Silas rhuginaspe ai jilabenas te bariaren le Devlesko anav . Le kolaver manush kai sas ande temnitsa ashunenas lende .

text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken : and immediately all the doors were opened , and every one ' s bands were loosed .
text2: Numa strazo zurales mishtisaile e phuv , kadia de zurales kai le ziduria le temnitsake pele tele strazo , ai sa le wudara phuterdile , ai le lantsuria sa le manushenge kai sas ande temnitsa phuterdile .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: O manush kai lelas sama katar e temnitsa wushtisailo , ai kana dikhlia le wudara la temnitsaki sar phuterdili , ankaladia peske sabia , ai mangelas te mudarelpe , ke gindilas ke sa le manush kai sas ande temnitsa geletar .

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: Numa o Pavlo tsipisardia zurales , phenelas , " Na ker tuke baio , ke savorhe katse sam . "

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Strazo kodo manush lia pesa vediara , ai strazo dia ande temnitsa , ai shudiape kal punrhe le Pavloske ai o Silas izdraimasa .

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: Ankaladia le avri ai phendia , " Manusha , so trobul te kerav te avav skepime . "

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: O Pavlo ai o Silas phende , " Pachas tu ando Del o Jesus Kristo , ai avesas skepime , tu ai chi familia . "

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Ai dine duma leske pai Vorba le Devleski , ai vi kodolenge kai sas ando lesko kher .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Kodo manush kai lelas sama katar e temnitsa lia le pesa strazo kodia e riat , ai xaliadia lenge dukha , ai won bolde les , ai vi kodolen kai sas leske .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: Kana angerdia le peste khere , ai dia le te xan , ai raduime sas wo ai sa peski familia , ke pachaiesaspe ando Del .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Kana phuterdilo o dies , le ketani Romanuria trade te mothon le manusheske kai lelas sama katar e temnitsa , phenenas , " Mekes kodole manushen avri .

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Ai kado manush kai arakhelas e temnitsa phendia le Pavloske , ke mangle lestar te mekel le te zhantar : phendia lenge , " Anklen avri ai zhantar , O Del tumensa . "

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: Numa o Pavlo phendia lenge , " Mardia ame angla narodo ai bi te keren kris pe amende , ame kai sam chache Romanuria , ai thodia ame ande temnitsa , ai akana meken ame te zhastar chordanes ? Nichi , Mek te aven won te meken ame .

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Le zhandari gele te mothon kado divano kal ketani , ai le ketani daraile kana ashunde ke kodola manush Romanuria sas .

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: Gele lende , ai mangle lendar te iertin le , ai mekle le , ai phende lenge te zhantar anda kado foro .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: Kana ankliste avri andai temnitsa , gele ando kher la Lydiako : ai kana dikhle kodole phralen , mai dine le xantsi zor katar O Del , ai geletar .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: O Pavlo ai o Silas nakhle pai Amphipolis , ai pai Apollonia , ai aresle ande Thessalonica , kai le Zhiduvuria sas le synagogue kotse .

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: Sar kerelas wo butivar , o Pavlo , dia andre ande synagogue , trin Savatone gelo ai divinilas lensa pa zakonuria le Devlesko .

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: Motholas lenge ai sikavelas lenge , ke O Kristo trobulas te chinuil , ai te zhuvindil mashkar le mule ; ai kado Jesus , kai mothav tumenge pa leste , wo si O Kristo .

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Uni anda lende pachaie , ai raduimesas le Pavlosa ai o Silas , ai but andal Grekuria rhuginaspe ka Del , ai vi but zhuvlia kai sas gojaver .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: Le zhiduvuria kai chi pachanaspe ando Del nas lenge mishto , ai line pesa uni manushen kai nas lashe , kai kerenas baio mashkar o narodo , ai kerde bunto ando foro , ai gele ka kher ieke manushesko kai busholas Jason , ai rodenas kotse o Pavlo ai o Silas te anen le ka narodo .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: Numa chi arakhle le , line kodole manushes kai busholas Jason , ai mai avre phralen kai zhandari kodole foroske ai tsipinas , " Kadala manush sa rimosarde e lumia , avile vi katse .

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: Ai o Jason meklia le te aven leste , ai sa kado narodo chi keren o zakono amare amperatosko , o Caesar , phenenas , ke si aver amperato kai bushol Jesus . "

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: Kodola vorbi xoliarde le narodos , ai le zhandari kai sas ando foro .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: O Jason ai le kolaver kai sas lesa , pochinde love kai zhandari ai o zhandari meklia le pala kodia .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Strazo le phral kodia riat phende le Pavloske ai o Silas te zhantar ande Berea , ai kana aresle kotse dine ande khangeri le Zhidovonge .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Kodola Zhiduvuria mai lashe sas de sar le Zhiduvuria kai sas ande Thessalonica , ashunde E Vorba le Devleski dragosa , ai swako dies lenas sama ande Vorba le Devleski , te si vorta so mothonas lenge .

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: But anda lende pachaiepe , ai vi but zhuvlia kai sas Grekaiki , kai sas andai vitsa le barvalenge , ai but manush .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: Numa kana le Zhiduvuria andai Thessalonica ashunde ke o Pavlo motholas pai Vorba le Devleski ande Berea , gele kotse te rimon le narodos .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: Strazo kodo phral kotsar phende le Pauloske te zhaltar karing o pai , numa o Silas ai o Timothy beshlo ande Berea .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: Kodola kai angerenas le Paulos , gele lesa zhi ande Athens , porme mekle les , ai geletar palpale , ai o Pavlo phendia lenge te phenel le Silasoske ai o Timothy te aven leste mai sigo .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
