text2: O Pavlo azhukerelas le ande Athens , numa haliarelas ande peste ke lesko duxo nas leske mishto , ke dikhlia le manush rhuginaspe kal ikoni ande sa kodo foro .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Divinilas ande khangeri le Zhidovonsa , ai vi kodolensa kai nas Zhiduvuria ai kai rhuginaspe ka Del . Ai vi kodolensa ando foro mashkaral po bazari swako dies kai arakhelas .

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Uni andal dokxtoria le Epicureononge ai le Stoiconge marenas mui le Paulosa , uni mothonas , " So si kado divano ? " Uni kai ashunenas ke mothol pa Jesus ai pa zhuvindimos , mothonas , " Wo mothol pa aver dela . "

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: Antunchi line les , ai angerde les ka Areopagus , phenenas , " Mangas te zhanas so si kado nevo zakono kai tu sichares ?

text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
text2: Ke tu keres ame te ashunas dieli kai si shode . Ame mangliamas te zhanas so si kodola dieli . "

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: Sa le manush kai beshenas ande Athens ai le streia kai beshenas ande Athens , nakhavenas penge vriama te mothon vai te ashunen nevimos .

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: Antunchi o Pavlo beshlo ande punrhende po plai bushol ' Mars ' , ai phendia lenge , " Tume kai san andai Athens , me dikhav ke tume san manush kai roden le zakonuria le devlenge ande soste godi .

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: Chaches nakhlem angla tumaro foro , ai dikhlem savendar dieli si tume te keren tumare khangeria , ai vi arakhlem ek than kai si ramome pe leste , " Kai ek del kai chi zhanas . " Tume rhuginpe ka leste bi te zhanen les . Pa kodo si kai mothav tumenge .

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: O Del kai kerdia e lumia ai so godi si , wo si o baro po cheri ai pe phuv , chi beshel andel tampluria ( khangeria ) kai kerde le manush andel vas .

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: Nai podaime le manushenge vastensa , sar te trobulsardino les vari so , wo kai del savorhen o traio , ai barval , ai vi la kolaver dieli .

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: Kerdia sa le manushen te aven anda iek rat , ai te beshen pe sa e lumia , ai thodia e vriama mai anglal , ai le thana vorta kai trobulas te beshen .

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: Wo manglia le manush te roden le Devles , ai te thon zor te arakhen les le rodemasa , marka ke nai dur amendar .

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: Ke ande leste si ame o traio , ai sai mishtisavas , ai sam so sam , ai vi tumare gramnoturia phende , " Ke leske shave sam . "

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: Te sam andal shave le Devleske , nashti pachas ke O Del si sar o sumnkai , vai sar o rup , vai sar o bax , kai sas ramome katar e buchi ai katar le mashinki le manusheske .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: O Del chi mai lel sama palpale kana sas le vriama kai le manush chi zhanenas kanch , akana mothol sa le manushenge kai godi si te keinpe anda penge bezexa .

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: Ke thodia ek dies , kai kerela kris pe lumia le chachimasa ieke manushesa kai wo alosardia ; dia te zhanen savorhe kana andai kodole manushes , katar e martia ka traio .

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Kana ashunde pa zhuvindimos mashkar le mule , uni asanas , ai uni mothonas , pe kadia buchi pa zhuvindimos desa amensa duma aver data .

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Porme o Pavlo gelotar mashkar lende .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: Numa uni linepe pala leste , ai pachaiepe , mashkar lende sas ek manush kai busholas Dionysius , ai wo sas anda kodo narodo kai chidelaspe te keren kris . E zhuvli kai busholas Damaris pachaiape ai mai aver lensa .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Pala kodia o Pavlo gelotar andai Athens , ai gelo ande Corinth .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Kotse arakhlia ieke Zhidovos kai busholas Aquila , wo kerdilo sas ando them kai bushol Pontius , antunchi areslo sas andai Aitalia peska zhuvliasa , woi busholas Priscilla ; ke o amperato o Claudius diasas ordina ka sa le Zhiduvuria te zhantar andai Rome , ai o Pavlo gelo lende .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: Ai sar kerenas iek fial buchi , beshlo lende , ai kerdia buchi , tseri kerelas lensa .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: O Pavlo divinilas ande synagogue swako Savato , ai anelas ka Del le Zhidovon ai le Grekon .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Ai kana o Silas ai o Timote avile kotse andai Macedonia , o Pavlo thodia peske vriama te mothol E Vorba le Devleski le Zhidovonge , ai phenelas lenge ke O Jesus si O Kristo .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: Numa le Zhiduvuria chi lenaspe pala leste , ai marenas mui lestar , o Pavlo chinosardia peske tsalia , ai phendia lenge , " Tumaro rat si te perel pe tumare shero " me vorta si , numa akana zhav karing le Nai Zhiduvuria .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Kana gelotar kotsar , avilo ka ek manush kai busholas Justus , kado manush pachalaspe ando Del , ai lesko kher sas pashai khangeri .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Numa o Crispus , o baro rashai la khangeriako pachaiape ando Del , wo ai sa peski familia , ai but andal Corinthiana kai ashundesas , dinepe ka Del , ai boldepe .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: O Del mothol le Pavloske andek vizion ande riat , " Na dara , numa des duma , na terdiol .

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: Ke me tusa sim , ai khonik chi thola o vas pe tute te kerel tuke o baio ke des duma , ke but narodo sima ande kado foro . "

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: O Pavlo beshlo kotse iek bersh ai shov shon , sicharelas E Vorba le Devleski mashkar lende .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Ande vriama kai o Gallio , o baro Romano poronchilas pek them kai busholas Achaia , le Zhidvuria xolaile po Pavlo , ai angerde les anglai kris , mothonas ,

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: " Kado manush thol le manushen te lenpe pala Del , numa na sar mangel o zakono .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Kana o Pavlo lelas te mothol vari so , o Gallio mothol le Zhidovonge , " Te avilino ke kado manush kerdia vari so kai nai vorta , vai te kerdia ek baio , me ashunav tumaro divano , tume Zhiduvuria .

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: Numa te xalian tume andek vorba , vai ke pel anava , vai pe tumaro zakono , keren so tume mangen , nai murhe diela , chi mangav te kerav kris pe kadala dieli . "

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Ai phendia lenge te zhantar .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Antunchi sa le Grekuria line o Sosthenes , o baro la khangeriako , ai marde les kotse anglai kris , numa o Gallio nas leske diela .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: O Pavlo mai beshlo but vriama ande Corinth , porme lia pesko dies lasho katar le phral kai sas kotse , porme lia o paraxodo ai gelotar ande Syria , lia pesa e Priscilla ai o Aquilla ; numa mai anglal sar te zhaltar rhanglia le bal pa pesko shero ande Cenchrea ; ke kadia diasas vorba .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Areslo ando Ephesus , ai o Pavlo meklia peske vortakon kotse ; ai gelo ande synagogue , ai kotse delas duma le Zhidovonsa .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Ai won mangenas lestar te beshel mai but lensa , numa chi manglia ,

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: ai lia pesko dies lasho lendar , ai phendia , " Trobul te zhav ka iek pachiv kai si ando Jerusalem , numa avava palpale tumende , te mangel O Del , " ai gelotar andai Ephesus .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Kana areslo ande Caesarea , gelo ande Jerusalem , ai kotse gelo kai khangeri te dikhel le phralen , porme gelotar ando Antioch . Kana beshlo xantsi vriama ando Antioch , gelotar , ai zhalas karing e Galatia ai e Phrygia , ai kotse delas zor ando anav le Devlesko le disiplon kai sas kotse .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Iek Zhidovo kai busholas Apollos , wo kerdiilosas ande Alexandria , areslo ande Ephesus , kado manush delas duma mishto ai zhanelas mishto E Vorba le Devleski .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Zhanelas o drom le Devlesko , ai dragosa kerelas buchi le Devleski , motholas ai sicharelas vorta so sas O Jesus , so phendia sas chacho , numa zhanelas ferdi pa o bolimos le Iovanosko .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Thodiape te divinilas andel synagogue , ai kana o Aquilla ai e Priscilla ashunde les , line les pesa , ai sikade leske mai vorta o drom le Devlesko .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Mangelas te nakhel ande Achaia , le phral phende leske te zhal , ai trade iek lil kotse kal disipluria , kana avela te premin les mishto . Kana areslo kotse , lashi buchi kerelas mashkar kodola kai dinesaspe le Devleske katar o lashimos le Devlesko .

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Ke sikavelas vorta angla narodo kai le Zhiduvuria nas vorta angla Del , sikavela lenge katar E Vorba le Devleski ke O Jesus si O Kristo .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Zhi kai o Apollos sas ande Corinth , o Pavlo kana nakhlo anda sa le gava kai si ande Asia , areslo ando Ephesus , ai kotse arakhlia uni disiplon .

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: Ai phendia lenge , " Lian anda tumende O Swunto Duxo kana pachan tume ? " Won phende leske , " Ame chi ashundiam ke si ek Swunto Duxo . "

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Ai phendia lenge , " Anda savo bolimos tume sanas bolde ? " Ai won phende leske , " Ando bolimos le Iovanosko . "

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Antunchi o Pavlo phendia , " O Iovano boldia kodolen kai mangenas te parhuven pengo traio , ai motholas le Zhidovonge te pachanpe ande kodo kai avela pala leste , kodo si O Kristo .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Pe kodola vorbi , bolde sas ando anav le Devlesko O Jesus .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Kana o Pavlo thodia le vas pe lende , O Swunto Duxo avilo pe lende , ai denas duma andal kolaver shiba , ai mothonas so si te avel .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Won sas sa andek than desh u dui manush .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Porme o Pavlo gelo ande synagogue , ai kotse dia duma bi darako trin shon , ai delas duma pal dieli le rhaioske kai si le Devlesko .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: Numa uni lengo ilo zuralo sas , ai chi pachanaspe , ai mothonas chorhe dieli pa drom le Devlesko angla narodo . Antunchi o Pavlo gelotar lendar , ai lia le manushen kai pachanaspe ando Del pesa ; ai sicharelas len pa Del swako dies andek shkola ieke manusheske kai busholas Tirannas .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Kodia buchi gelia dui bersh , ai sa kodola kai beshenas ande Asia , Zhiduvuria ai Grekuria ashunde E Vorba le Devleski .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Ai O Del kerelas bare mirakluria le Pavlosa .

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: Kadia kai thonas pe naswale gada vai dikhlorhe kai azbade sas le Pavlos , ai le naswale sastionas , ai le manush kai sas o beng lende zhalastar .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Sas uni Zhiduvuria kai zhanas andek than ando foro forestar te gonin le bengen andal naswale , zumavenas ando anav le Devlesko Jesus te keren le te anklen avri , phende le bengenge , " Dav tume ordina ando anav le Jesusosko , anklen avri , kado Jesus kai o Pavlo mothol pe leste . "

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: Ieke bare rasha kai sas Zhidovo , busholas Sceva , sas les efta shave , kodola shave kerenas kadia .

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Numa o beng mothol lenge , " Zhanav kon si O Jesus , ai zhanav kon si o Pavlo , numa tume kon san ? "

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Ai kado manush kai sas o beng ande leste xoko pe lende , ai sas les putiera pe lende , ai mardia le . Kadia de zurales kai nashle anda kodo kher sa nange ai dukhade .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Kodola diela zhanenas sa le Zhiduvuria sa le Grekuria kai beshenas ando Ephesus , ai daraile savorhe , ai o anav le Devlesko Jesus sas bariardia .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: But shave le Devleske avenas te mothonas angla narodo so kerde .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: But anda kodola kai kerenas drabarimos , andine penge klishki , ai phabarenas le angla sa o narodo . Ai line sama le love kai monas kadala klishki , ai arakhle ke sas pe panvardesh mi teliara rupune .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Ai E Vorba le Devleski zhalas katar godi ande putiera ai ande zor .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Akana kai kodola dieli nakhle , o Pavlo manglia te zhal ande Jerusalem . Ai manglia te nakhel pai Macedonia ai pai Greece , " Ai kana avava kotse , " phendia , " Trobul te dikhav Rome . "

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Tradia antunchi ande Macedonia dui anda peske zhutitoria , o Timote ai o Erastus ; ai wo mai beshlo xantsi vriama ande Asia .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Ande kodia vriama kerdilia but bunto pala zakono le Devlesko .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Iek manush kai sas zhintari , wo busholas Demetrius , wo kerelas ikoni rupeske pala Diana , ai le manush kai kerenas leski buchi nirinas but love .

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Ai chidia sa kodolen kai kerenas kodalatar buchi , ai phendia lenge , " Manushale , te sam barvale , barvale sam pala e buchi kai si ame .

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Ai dikhen ai ashunen , ke na ferdi ando Ephesus , numa pashte ande sa Asia , kado kai bushol Pavlo phendia le manushenge ai sikadia lenge ke le dela kai si kerde andal vas le manushenge nai dela .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Kadia diela chi rimol ferdi amari buchi , numa vi e bari del Diana te xasarel sa pesko barimos ande tampla , ai antunchi chi mai avela la lako barimos , ai kadia ikona kai rhuginpe late o narodo kai si ande Asia ai sa le lumia ! "

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Kana ashunde kodola vorbi , savorhe xolaile , ai tsipinas . Phenenas , " Bari si e ikona Diana le Ephesusonge . "

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Sa o foro buntisailosas , ai line pesa o Gaius ai o Aristarchus , dui andal Macedonia , kai sas le vortacha le Pauloske kai zhanas lesa , ai gele savorhe andek bari soba .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: O Pavlo mangelas vi wo te zhal angla narodo , numa le shave le Devleske chi mekenas les .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Uni andel bare kai poronchinas pe uni gava ande Asia , kai sas leske vortacha , trade leske lil te mangenpe lestar te na zhal ande kodo kher .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: Uni mothonas kadia , uni aver fialo ke buntuimos kerdiliasas ; ai but anda narodo chi zhanenas sostar chidinisaile sas andek than .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Uni manush anda narodo line o Alexander ai thode les angla narodo . O Alexander antunchi kerdia iek semno anda vas ai manglia te del duma te chacharel le angla narodo .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Numa kana haliarde ke Zhidovo sas , tsipisarde savorhe andek than sa kodola vorbi pashte dui chasuria , " Bari si e ikona Diana le Ephesusonge " .

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: Ai kana o baro manush le forosko ashadia le narodos te na mai buntuilpe , phendia , " Ephesusanuria , sa e lumia zhanel ke o foro kai si ando Ephesus , lel sama katar o tampla kai si e ikona Diana ai lako patreto kai hulisto anda cheri ( Jupiter ) .

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Khonik nashti mothol ke chi zhanel , anda kodia trobul te na mai buntuin tume , ai te na keren kanch mai anglal sar te gindin tume .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Tume andian kadale manushen katse , won chi chorde andal tampluria , ai chi marde mui katar amari ikona .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Te si o Demetrius , ai leske manush te thonpe vari kashte dosh , si diesa krisake , ai si zhandari , ai kotse trobul te zhan te mothon pe kaste thon dosh .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: Ai te mai si tumen vari so kai miazol tumenge ke nai mishto , lasharasa kodia diela ande kris .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Ke sai dosharen ame ke buntuisailiam anda so kerdilia adies . Ke kanchi nai ame te sikavas ke vorta keras kai chidinisailiam .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
text2: Kana getosardia pesko divano , phendia le narodoske te zhantar khere .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Kana o bunto terdilo , o Pavlo chidia andek than le shave le Devleske ai kana mai dia les zor katar E Vorba le Devleski , lia pesko dies lasho lendar , ai gelotar ande Macedonia .

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: Nakhlo anda kodola gava ai zuralelas anda pachamos le shave le Devleske pal divanuria pa Del kai motholas lenge . Porme gelo ande Gretsia ,

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: ai kotse beshlo trin shon . Lelas o paraxodo te zhaltar ande Syria , numa kana ashundia ke le Zhiduvuria divininas pa leste te zumaven te rimon lesko drom ; manglia te zhaltar , numa te nakhel pai Macedonia .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: Sopater , o shav le Pirrhusosko , andai Berea gelo lesa ; ai vi o Aristarcheus ai o Secundus andai Thessalonica : ai o Gaius andai Derbe ; o Timote ai o Tychicus ai o Trophimus andai Asia .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Sa kadala geletar anglal ai azhukerenas ame ando Troas .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Ame liam o paraxodo andai Philippi kana getosaile E Patradi , ai panzh dies pala kodia aresliam lende ando Troas , ai kotse beshliam iek kurko .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Savatone le disipluria chidinesas andek than te xas e mol ai o manrho . O Pavlo kai trobulas te zhaltar pe terharin , divinilas pa Del le phralensa kai sas kotse , ai dia lensa duma zhi kal desh u dui e riat .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: But vediara sas ande soba kai sas opre , ai kai sas chidine .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Sas iek terno manush kai busholas Eutychus , kai beshelas pe feliastra ; ai lia les e lindri zurales ande kodia kai ashunelas o divano kai motholas o Pavlo , ai ande kodia lindri pelo de katar e trito feliastra zhi tele pe phuv . Numa kana gele te vazden les , wo mulo sas .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: Numa o Pavlo hulisto tele , bandilo karing leste , ai lia les ande peske vas , ai phendia , " Na daran ke chi mulo ! "

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Kana anklisto opre palpale , o Pavlo phaglia o manrho ai xalia , ai mai dia duma but pa Del zhi ando dies , porme gelotar .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: O terno manush kai mulo sas pale zhuvindisailo ai traiilas , ai savorhe raduimesas .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: Ame geliamtar mai anglal po paraxodo kai ingerelas ame ando Assos , ai kotse trobulas te las le Pavlos amensa . Wo phendia sas te keras kadia , ke wo mangelas telal te zhal .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: Kana areslo amen ando Assos , liam les amensa po paraxodo , ai aresliam ando Mitylene .

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: Porme geliamtar kotsar , ai aresliam pe terharin ando Chios . Ai pe terharin aresliam ando Samos ai beshliam ando Trogillium ; ai pala kodo dies aresliam ando Miletus .

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
text2: O Pavlo mangelas te nakhel anglai Ephesus , numa bi te aterdiol saxke te na xasarel vriama ande Asia . Grebilaspe te aresel te dashtilas ande Jerusalem , kodo dies kai sas e Pentecost .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: Numa o Pavlo tradia vari kas anda Miletus ando Ephesus , te akharel le mai phuren kai si ande khangeri .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Ai kana avile leste , wo phenel lenge , " Tume zhanen sar kerdem tumensa , de sar o pervo dies kai areslem ande Asia .

text: Serving the Lord with all humility of mind , and with many tears , and temptations , which befell me by the lying in wait of the Jews :
text2: Kerava buchi le Devleski bi te kerav barimata , univar rovavas , ai le zumaimos , ai univar trutno sas mange ke le Zhiduvuria rodenas te rimon mange .

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: Zhanen ke chi garadem kanch anda so trobulas te zhanen , ai ke chi daravas te mothav tumenge pa Del , ai te sicharav tume angla narodo , ai andal kher khereske .

text: Testifying both to the Jews , and also to the Greeks , repentance toward God , and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Mothavas le Zhidovonge ai le Grekonge , te keinpe anda penge bezexa karing O Del , ai te pachanpe ando amaro Del O Jesus Kristo .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: Ai akana , eta , le Swuntone Duxosa kai si ande mande , zhav ande Jerusalem , ai chi zhanav so avel mansa .

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Numa ferdi foro forostar , O Swunto Duxo mothol mange mai anglal ke e temnitsa ai chino azhukerel ma .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: Numa me chi lav sama katar murho traio , ke sar te avilino bari diela , numa ferdi te kerav so si ma te kerav raduimasa , ai e buchi kai dia ma O Del O Jesus te kerav , te mothav e lashi viasta anda lashimos le Devleski .

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: Ai akana , zhanav ke chi mai dikhena murho mui , tume savorhe , tume kai sas mansa kana demas duma pa rhaio le Devlesko .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Anda kodia mothav tumenge adies , ke te xasavola iek anda sa le manush nai murhe dosh .

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: Ke mothodem tumenge , sa o zakono le Devlesko , ai chi garadem kanchi .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: Tume arakhen tume , ai arakhen le kolavren kai O Swunto Duxo thodia tumen te len sama . Len sama katar e khangeri le Devleski , kai wo chindia la pesko ratesa .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Zhanav ke thola pe mashkar tumende manush sar le ruv , kai roden te rimon kana zhavatar , ai rodena te rimon savorhen .

text: Also of your own selves shall men arise , speaking perverse things , to draw away disciples after them .
text2: Ai vazdelape mashkar tumende manush kai sicharen o xoxaimos ai te tsirden le shave le Devleske karing peske .

text: Therefore watch , and remember , that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears .
text2: Arakhen tume ! Ai seren tume , ke trin bersh chi aterdilem , vi adiese , vi e riate te sicharav tume , ai te zuravol tumaro pachamos karing O Del , le asuensa sicharavas sakones anda tumende .

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: " Ai akana , mekav tumen le Devlesa , ai kai leski lashi Vorba . Kodo kai si les e putiera te del tume zor , ai te del tume le mishtimata kai garavel sar iek barvalimos sa kodolenge kai si leske .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: Chi manglem chi le love , chi o sumnakai , ai kankaske tsalia .

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: Tume zhanen ke kerdem buchi murhe vastensa , saxke te avel ma so trobul ma ai vi kodolen kai sas mansa .

text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: Sikadem tumenge ande soste godi ke trobul te kerelpe buchi , saxke te zhutisaras le chorhen , ai das ame goji kal vorbi kai amaro Del . O Jesus phendia , " Ke mai drago te des de sar te avel tut dino . "

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: Kana getosardia pesko divano , thodiape ande changende o Pavlo , ai rhugisailo lensa .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Savorhe rovenas , ai line le Pavlos korhatar te chumidin les mai anglal sar te zhaltar .

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: Ai mai but nekezhime sas ke o Pavlo phendia sas ke chi mai dikhena les . Ai savorhe gele lesa zhi ka paraxodo .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Kana mekliam le , geliamtar po paraxodo ai geliam strazo ando Cos ; ai pe terharin aresliam kai izula Rhodes , ai kotsar geliamtar ando Patara .

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Ai arakhliam iek paraxodo kai nakhelas pai Phoenicia , liam les , ai geliamtar .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Kana dikhliam e izula Cyprus , chi aterdiliam , mekliam la pe stingo , ai geliam mai angle karing e Syria , ai aterdiliam ande Tyre : Ke o paraxodo trobulas te huliarel tele o tovorho kai sas les .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Ai kotse arakhliam manush kai pachanaspe ando Del , beshliam lensa iek kurko . Ai O Swunto Duxo phendia kodola phral te mothon le Pavloske te na zhal ando Jerusalem .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Ai kana nakhlo kurko , mangliamas te zhastar mai angle . Ai savorhe avile amensa , zhi avri anda foro penge rhomniansa penge shavensa . Thodiam ame anda changende pe chishai pasha pai te rhugisavas .

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: Porme kana liam amenge dies lasho iek kavrestar , anklistiam po paraxodo , ai won geletar khere .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: Kana getosardiam te zhas po paraxodo , geliam anda Tyre ando Ptolemais , ai kotse geliam te dikhas le shave le Devleske , amare phral , ai beshliam lensa iek dies .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Pe terharin geliamtar , ai aresliam ando Caesarea . Kana aviliam ando kher le Filiposko , wo sas manush kai divinilas pa Del , iek andal efta manush kai alosardiamas ando Jerusalem , beshliam leste .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Sas les shtar sheia , kai nas ansurime . Won denas duma pa E Vorba le Devleski .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Beshliam kotse neskolki dies , iek profeto kai busholas Agabus avilo andai Judea .

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: Ai avilo te dikhel ame , ai lia e prashtia le Pavloski , ai phanglia peske punrhe ai peske vas , ai phendia , " Eta , so phendia O Swunto Duxo , kodo manush kai si leski kadia prashtia le Zhiduvuria phandenas les sakadia ando Jerusalem , ai dena les ka le Nai Zhiduvuria . "

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Kana ashundiam kodia , ame ai kodola kai samas lende ando kher , mangliam ame katar o Pavlo te na zhal ande Jerusalem .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: O Pavlo phendia , " So keren , kai roven ai dukhaven murho ilo ? Vi mekava te phanden ma , ai vi te mudaren ma ando Jerusalem pala o anav le Devlesko , Jesus Kristo . "

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: O Pavlo chi mekelaspe pala lende , ai won chi mai phende leske kanch , phenenas , " E voia le Devleski te kerdiol . "

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Xantsi dies pala kodia lashardiliam , ai geliamtar ando Jerusalem .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Uni andal shave le Devleske anda Caesarea avile amensa , ai angerdia lensa iek manush kai busholas Mnason andai Cyprus , wo diasas pe ka Del de dumult ai leste trobulas te beshas .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Kana aresliam ande Jerusalem , le shave le Devleske kai sas kotse raduime sas kana dikhle ame .

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Pe terharin o Pavlo gelo amensa ka iek phral kai busholas Iakov , ai sa le mai phure chidepe kotse .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: Kana dia o vas savorhensa , o Pavlo phendia lenge so godi O Del kerdia mashkar le Nai Zhiduvuria , la buchasa kai dia les O Del .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: Kana ashunde leste , bariarenas o anav le Devlesko , phende leske , " Dikhes , amaro phral , sode mi Zhiduvuria pachaiepe ai si le o zakono ande lengo ilo . "

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: Ai won ashunde pa tute , ke tu sichares sa le Zhidovon kai traiin mashkar le Nai Zhiduvuria , te na lenpe pala zakono le Mosesosko , ai ke mothos lenge te na shinen penge glaten ai te na lenpe pala zakono o Zhidovisko .

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: So te keras ? Kodola manush si te chidenpe andek than , ke si te zhangliolpe ke avilian .

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: Anda kodia ker so si te mothas tuke . Si mashkar amende shtar manush kai shinade te rhuginpe ai te lenpe pala zakono le Devlesko .

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: Anger le tusa , ai zha lensa kai khangeri kai vuzharen , ai pochin anda lende , te rhanden penge bal : ai kadia savorhe zhanena ke nas kanchi chacho pa so phendesas pa tute , numa ke vi tu les tu pala zakono le Mosesosko .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: Numa kodola kai Nai Zhiduvuria kai pachanpe , tradiam lenge ek lil , ai phendiam lenge , te na xan anda mas kai sas dino anglal ikoni , ai chi rat , chi zhigeniengo kai sas tasade , ai te arakhenpe katar e biznibraznia . "

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: O Pavlo lia kodole manushen , vuzhardiape , ai pe terharin gelo ande tamplo lensa , te mothol savo dies o vuzhimos kerdiolape , ai te den iek zhigania sako anda peste .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Ai kana o kurko pashte getolaspe , le Zhiduvuria andai Asia avile , ai dikhle le Pavlos ande tampla , buntuisarde sa le narodos , ai line les , tsipinas ,

text: Crying out , Men of Israel , help : This is the man , that teacheth all men every where against the people , and the law , and this place : and further brought Greeks also into the temple , and hath polluted this holy place .
text2: " Tume kai san anda Isarel , zhutin ! Kodo si o manush kai del duma bi malades pal Zhiduvuria ai amaro zakono le Mosesosko , ai pa kadia tampla , ai akana angerdias le Grekuria ande Swunto than , Ai kadia tampla mai nai vuzhi . "

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: Won mothonas kadia , ke mai anglal o Trophimus andai Ephesus sas lesa ando foro . Ai won gindinas ke o Pavlo angerdiasas les ande tampla .

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Sa o foro buntuisailo , ai o narodo pa sako rik avelas , line o Pavlos , ai line les avri andai tampla , ai phandade strazo le wudara .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
text2: Mangenas te mudaren le Pavlos , numa e viasta avili zhi ka baro le ketanengo kai sas andal Romanuria , ke sa e Jerusalem buntuilaspe .

text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions , and ran down unto them : and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , they left beating of Paul .
text2: Strazo lia pesa ketanen ai mai baren , ai gele lende , kana dikhle le bares le ketanengo ai le ketanen , chi mai marenas le Pavlos .

text: Then the chief captain came near , and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains ; and demanded who he was , and what he had done .
text2: Antunchi o baro le ketanengo pashilo pasha Pavlo , lia les , ai phendia te phanden les duie lantsonsa . Ai porme phushlia kon si wo ai so kerdia ?

text: And some cried one thing , some another , among the multitude : and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult , he commanded him to be carried into the castle .
text2: Numa anda narodo uni tsipinas iek diela , uni mothonas aver diela , ai nashtilas te lel o gor kanikastar ke pra but bunto sas , ai phendia leske ketana te angeren o Pavlos ando baro kher le ketanengo .

text: And when he came upon the stairs , so it was , that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people .
text2: Kana aresle kal skeri , le ketani line le Pavlos andel vas ke de but narodo kai sas .

text: For the multitude of the people followed after , crying , Away with him .
text2: Ke savorhe lenaspe pala leste ai tsipinas te mudaren les .

text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle , he said unto the chief captain , May I speak unto thee ? Who said , Canst thou speak Greek ?
text2: Strazo kana zhanas ando baro kher le ketanengo o Pavlo phendia le bareske , " Sai mothav vari so tuke ? " ai o baro phushel les , " Zhanes te des duma Grechisko ? "

text: Art not thou that Egyptian , which before these days madest an uproar , and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers ?
text2: " Apo tu chi san o Egypsiano , kai mai buntisailo sas , ai kai angerdia pesa ande pusta shtare mien choren ? "

text: But Paul said , I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , a citizen of no mean city : and , I beseech thee , suffer me to speak unto the people .
text2: O Pavlo phendia , " Zhidovo sim , me sim o Pavlo anda e Tarsus , kai si ande e Cilicia , me kerdilem andek baro foro . Mek ma , mangav ma tutar te dav duma le narodosa . "

text: And when he had given him licence , Paul stood on the stairs , and beckoned with the hand unto the people . And when there was made a great silence , he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue , saying ,
text2: O baro le ketanengo meklia les te del duma , o Pavlo ande punrhende sas pel skeri , ai kerelas anda vas le narodoske . Ai kerdilia iek baro chixo ( ma nai bunto ) , ai o Pavlo dia duma lenge ande shib le Zhidovisko ai phenelas ,

text: Men , brethren , and fathers , hear ye my defence which I make now unto you .
text2: " Manushale , Murhe phral , ai tume kai san dada , ashunen akana so si ma te mothav tumenge ke chi sim doshalo ! "

text: ( And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them , they kept the more silence : and he saith , )
text2: Kana ashunde kodala manush ke delas duma o Pavlo ande shib le Zhidovisko , mai but chixo sas ; ai o Pavlo phendia ,

text: I am verily a man which am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers , and was zealous toward God , as ye all are this day .
text2: " Me sim zhidovo , me kerdilem ande Tarsus o foro kai si ande Cilicia , numa barilem ande kado foro ai beshavas pashol punrhe ieke manusheske kai busholas Gamaliel . Wo sicharelas ma vorta te zhanav o zakono amare dadengo , ai kodo manush radimasa kerelas buchi le Devleski , sar keren tume savorhe adies .

text: And I persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
text2: Me chinuisardem zhi kai martia sa kodolen kai lenaspe pala drom le Jesusosko , aterdiardem murshen ai zhuvlian ai thodem le ande temnitsa .

text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness , and all the estate of the elders : from whom also I received letters unto the brethren , and went to Damascus , to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem , for to be punished .
text2: O baro rashai ai le mai phure kai sas ande tampla sai mothon tumenge ke o chachimos phenav . Won dine ma lila le phralenge le Zhidovonge kai si ando Damascus , ai gelem kotse te aterdiarav kodolen kai pachanaspe ando Del ai te anav le ando Jerusalem te chinuiv le . "

text: And it came to pass , that , as I made my journey , and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon , suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me .
text2: " Po drom kai zhavas ai sar pashuavas pasha Damascus , strazo karing le desh u dui chasuria iek bari vediara avili anda cheri , ai strefialas kruglom mandar .

text: And I fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Pelem pe phuv , ai iek glaso ashundem kai motholas mange , " Saul , Saul ! Sostar chinuis ma ? "

text: And I answered , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said unto me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
text2: Ai me dem atweto , " Kon san tu Devla ? " Ai wo phendia mange , " Me sim O Jesus andai Nazareth , kai tu chinuis . "

text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light , and were afraid ; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
text2: Kodola kai sas mansa dikhle e vediara , numa chi ashunenas o glaso kodolesko kai delas duma ,

text: And I said , What shall I do , Lord ? And the Lord said unto me , Arise , and go into Damascus ; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do .
text2: Antunchi phendem , " So te kerav , Devla ? " Ai O Del mothol mange , " Wushti opre , zha ando Damascus ; ai kotse mothonas tuke so godi trobul te keres . "

text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me , I came into Damascus .
text2: Chi mai dikhavas kanch palai razha kodola vediaraki , kodola kai sas mansa line ma vastestar ai aresliam ando Damascus .

text: And one Ananias , a devout man according to the law , having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there ,
text2: Kotse sas iek manush kai busholas Ananias , wo lelaspe pala zakono le Mosesosko , ai sa le Zhiduvuria anda Damascus lazhanas lestar , ai chetainas les .

text: Came unto me , and stood , and said unto me , Brother Saul , receive thy sight . And the same hour I looked up upon him .
text2: Avilo mande , ai phendia mange , " Saul , Murho phral , te aven che iakha phuterde , ai strazo murhe iakha phuterdile ai dikhavas . "

text: And he said , The God of our fathers hath chosen thee , that thou shouldest know his will , and see that Just One , and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth .
text2: Ai phendia , " O Del amare dadengo alosardia tu , te zhanes so mangel , ai te dikhes kodoles kai si chacho , ai te ashunes o glaso anda lesko mui .

text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
text2: Ke tu avesa lesko marturo mashkar sa le manush andal dieli kai dikhlian ai ashundian .

text: And now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on the name of the Lord .
text2: Ai akana , na mai azhuker , wushti opre , ai aves boldo , ai te aves xalado anda che bezexa kana akhares po anav le Devlesko . "

text: And it came to pass , that , when I was come again to Jerusalem , even while I prayed in the temple , I was in a trance ;
text2: " Kana gelem palpale ande Jerusalem , ai rhugivas ma ande tampla , dikhlem iak vizion ,

text: And saw him saying unto me , Make haste , and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem : for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me .
text2: ai dikhlem le Devles kai motholas mange , " Grebisavo , ankli avri andai Jerusalem , ke o narodo chi pachana pe so phenesa pa mande . "

text: And I said , Lord , they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
text2: Ai me phendem , " Devla , won zhanen ke me savas ande temnitsi ai keravas tumaren le sastrensa ande swako synagogue kodolen kai pachanaspe ande tute .

text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting unto his death , and kept the raiment of them that slew him .
text2: Ai kana shorde o rat le Stephenosko , me simas kotse , ai phenavas ke vorta kerenas kodole kai mudarenas les , ai ankerdem lenge tsalia zhi kai mudaren les . "

text: And he said unto me , Depart : for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles .
text2: Porme O Del mothol mange , " Zha , tradava tu dur karing le thema . "

text: And they gave him audience unto this word , and then lifted up their voices , and said , Away with such a fellow from the earth : for it is not fit that he should live .
text2: O narodo ashunelas leste zhi kai phendia kadala vorbi , ai porme tsipinnas , ai phende , " Len pai lumia kasavestar manush , intaino traiil . "

text: And as they cried out , and cast off their clothes , and threw dust into the air ,
text2: Ai tsipinas , ai shudelas penge tsalia ai shudenas phulberia opre .

text: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle , and bade that he should be examined by scourging ; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him .
text2: O baro le ketanengo phendia te ingeren le Pavlos andre ando baro kher , ai te maren les le bichosa saxke te del duma , ai te zhanen sostar o narodo tsipilas pe leste .

text: And as they bound him with thongs , Paul said unto the centurion that stood by , Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman , and uncondemned ?
text2: Numa kana phangle les te maren les le bichosa , o Pavlo phendia la ketanaki kai sas pasha leste , " Si tumenge slobodo te maren le bichosa ieke chacho Romanos , kai nas inker dino ande kris ? "

text: When the centurion heard that , he went and told the chief captain , saying , Take heed what thou doest : for this man is a Roman .
text2: Kana ashundia kodola vorbi wo gelo karing o mai baro ketana te mothol leske , " So si te keres akana ? Kado manush Romano lo ! "

text: Then the chief captain came , and said unto him , Tell me , art thou a Roman ? He said , Yea .
text2: Antunchi o baro ketana gelo karing o Pavlo , ai phushlia les , " Phen mange te san chacho Romano ? " O Pavlo dia atweto , " E " .

text: And the chief captain answered , With a great sum obtained I this freedom . And Paul said , But I was free born .
text2: Ai o baro ketana phendia , " Pochindem bare love te kerdiuav chacho Romano . " Ai o Pavlo phendia leske , " Me kadia kerdilem . "

text: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him : and the chief captain also was afraid , after he knew that he was a Roman , and because he had bound him .
text2: Strazo , kodola kai lenas te maren les ai te keren les te del duma durile lestar , ai vi o baro ketana darailo kana dikhlia ke o Pavlo sas ek chacho Romano , ke wo phanglia le Pavlos le lantsonsa .

text: On the morrow , because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews , he loosed him from his bands , and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear , and brought Paul down , and set him before them .
text2: Pe terharin mangelas te zhanel chaches anda soste le Zhiduvuria dosharenas les , o baro ketana phuterdia leske lantsuria , ai dia ordina ke le bare rashan , ai le kolavren , le mai phure te chidenpe andek than . Porme lia le Pavlos , ai thodia les mashkar lende .

text: And Paul , earnestly beholding the council , said , Men and brethren , I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day .
text2: Ai o Pavlo dikhlia pe lende , ai phendia , " Manushale ! Murhe phral ! Chachimasa ai ilesa kerdem o zakono le Devlesko zhi adies . "

text: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth .
text2: O baro rashai kai busholas Ananias dia ordina kodolen kai sas pasha leste te den les iek pa mui .

text: Then said Paul unto him , God shall smite thee , thou whited wall : for sittest thou to judge me after the law , and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law ?
text2: Antunchi o Pavlo phendia leske , " O Del marela tu , tu baro zido parniardo ! Tu beshes tele katse te des ma pe kris pala zakono , numa tu chi keres sar si o zakono ke des ordina te maren ma ? "

text: And they that stood by said , Revilest thou God ' s high priest ?
text2: Kodola kai sas pasha leste , mothonas , mardian mui katar o baro rashai le Devlesko ! "

text: Then said Paul , I wist not , brethren , that he was the high priest : for it is written , Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people .
text2: Ai o Pavlo phendia , " Chi zhanavas , murhe phral ke wo si o baro rashai . Ke E Vorba le Devleski mothol , " Na de duma bi malades pa baro kai poronchil pe cho narodo . "

text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees , and the other Pharisees , he cried out in the council , Men and brethren , I am a Pharisee , the son of a Pharisee : of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question .
text2: Numa kana o Pavlo zhanelas ke uni anda narodo kai sas kotse sas andal Saduseanuria , ai kolaver rik sas andal Farizeanuria , anda kodia o Pavlo tsipilas angla lende , " Manushale , Murhe phral , Farisi sim , shav le Farizeanosko ; ai ke pachav ma ke le mule sai zhuvindin , anda kodia den me pe kris ! "

text: And when he had so said , there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees : and the multitude was divided .
text2: Kana ashunde so phendia o Pavlo , kerdilia iek bunto mashkar le Farizeanuria ai le Saduseanuria , ai ande kodo kher kai beshenas hulazhile .

text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit : but the Pharisees confess both .
text2: Ke le Saduseanuria mothonas ke le mule nashti mai zhuvindin , ai ke nai angeluria , ai chi duxuria , numa le Farizeanuria pachanaspe ande kodola dieli .

text: And there arose a great cry : and the scribes that were of the Pharisees ' part arose , and strove , saying , We find no evil in this man : but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him , let us not fight against God .
text2: Baro bunto kerdilia , ai uni anda kodola manush kai sicharenas o zakono , kai won sas pe rig le Farizeanonge wushtile opre , ai tsipinas zurales , phenenas , " Ame chi arakhas chi iek bi lashimos ande kado manush ! Amborim ek duxo vai ek angelo dia lesa duma ! "

text: And when there arose a great dissension , the chief captain , fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them , commanded the soldiers to go down , and to take him by force from among them , and to bring him into the castle .
text2: Kadia de zurales buntuisaile , ai o baro le ketanengo darailo ke mudaren le Pavlos , anda kodia dia ordina peske ketanen te zhan mashkar o narodo , ai te len le Pavlos mashkar lende , ai te anen les kotse kai sas le ketani .

text: And the night following the Lord stood by him , and said , Be of good cheer , Paul : for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem , so must thou bear witness also at Rome .
text2: Pe terharin e riat O Del sikadilo le Pavloske , ai phendia leske , " Na dara , ke sar dian duma pa mande ande Jerusalem , trobul te mothos pa mande vi ande Rome . "

text: And when it was day , certain of the Jews banded together , and bound themselves under a curse , saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul .
text2: Kana phuterdilo o dies , le Zhiduvuria denas pe duma , ai phende ke lenpe armaiansa , te na xan kanch ai te na pen zhi kai mudaren le Pavlos .

text: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy .
text2: Kodola kai linepe te keren kodia diela sas mai but sar shtarvardesh zhene .

text: And they came to the chief priests and elders , and said , We have bound ourselves under a great curse , that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul .
text2: Gele kal bare le rashange ai kal mai phure , ai phendia lenge , " Ame liam ame armaiansa pe amende , te na xas zhi kai mudaras le Paulos .

text: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow , as though ye would inquire something more perfectly concerning him : and we , or ever he come near , are ready to kill him .
text2: Akana tume ai le mai bare mangen ka baro le ketanengo te anel le Pavlos tumenge terhara , ai mothon ke mangen te dikhen mai mishto so kerdia , ai ame , mai anglal ke sar te pashol tumende , mudaras les . "

text: And when Paul ' s sister ' s son heard of their lying in wait , he went and entered into the castle , and told Paul .
text2: Kana o shav le Pavloski phei ashundia so mangenas te keren , gelo kal ketani , dia andre ando kher ai phendia le Pavloske .

text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him , and said , Bring this young man unto the chief captain : for he hath a certain thing to tell him .
text2: O Pavlo akhardia iekes andal ketani , ai phendia , " Anger kakale terne manushes ka baro le ketanengo ; ke si les vari so te mothol leske . "

text: So he took him , and brought him to the chief captain , and said , Paul the prisoner called me unto him , and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee , who hath something to say unto thee .
text2: Le ketana lia kodole terne manushes pesa , ai angerdia les ka baro le ketanengo , ai phendia , " O Pavlo kai si phandado , akhardia ma , ai manglia mandar te anav tuke kadale terne manushes , ke si les vari so te mothol tuke . "

text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand , and went with him aside privately , and asked him , What is that thou hast to tell me ?
text2: O baro lia le terne manushes vastestar , ai gelo lesa mai dur , ai phushlia lestar , " So si tu te mothos mange ? "

text: And he said , The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council , as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly .
text2: Ai wo phendia , " Le Zhiduvuria mangen tutar te anes le Pavlos anglal bare terhara , ai mothon ke le bare mangen te dikhen mai mishto so kerdia ai te phushen vari so lestar .

text: But do not thou yield unto them : for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men , which have bound themselves with an oath , that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him : and now are they ready , looking for a promise from thee .
text2: Numa tu na pachas so mothon , ke mai but sar shtarvardesh mashkar lende , keren narozhno te len les ai dinepe armaia pe pende te na xan kanch ai te na pen zhi kai mudaren les . Won azhukeren akana , ai azhukeren pala tute so keresa .

text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart , and charged him , See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me .
text2: O baro le ketanengo phendia le terne manusheske te zhaltar . Numa mai anglal phendia leske te na mothol kanikaske o divano kai phendia leske .

text: And he called unto him two centurions , saying , Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea , and horsemen threescore and ten , and spearmen two hundred , at the third hour of the night ;
text2: Porme akhardia duien andal ketani , ai phendia lenge , " Chiden kal inia e riate dui shela ketani , shovardesh ketani pel gras , ai dui shela ketani kai meken le fleshensa te zhan zhi ando Caesarea .

text: And provide them beasts , that they may set Paul on , and bring him safe unto Felix the governor .
text2: Ai lasharen grasten te ingeren le Pavlos , ai arakhen les pa drom te aresel ka governori , o Felix .

text: And he wrote a letter after this manner :
text2: Ai ramosardia iek lil leste . Ai mothol " Me o Claudius Lysias , tradav tuke lasho dies , tu o lasho governori o Felix .

text: This man was taken of the Jews , and should have been killed of them : then came I with an army , and rescued him , having understood that he was a Roman .
text2: Le Zhiduvuria line kadale manushes , ai mangenas te mudaren les , numa me avilem ketanensa , ai lem les ke ashundem ke wo Romano sas .

text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him , I brought him forth into their council :
text2: Ai mangavas te zhanav sostar thon dosh pe leste , angerdem les angla lengo baro .

text: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Ai dikhlem ke thonas dosh pe leste pa uni vorbi kai motholas pa lengo zakono , numa chi mudardia kanikas te mudaren les vai te phandaven les .

text: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man , I sent straightway to thee , and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him . Farewell .
text2: Phende mange ke le Zhiduvuria rodenas te len les , ai strazo me tradem les tuke , ai phenava kodolenge kai thon dosh pe leste te aven tute . Ash Devlesa . "

text: Then the soldiers , as it was commanded them , took Paul , and brought him by night to Antipatris .
text2: Le ketani , palai ordina kai sas dini lende , line le Pavlos , ai angerde les e riate zhi ande Antipatris .

text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the castle :
text2: Pe terharin mekle le ketanen kai sas pel gras te ingeren les , ai won geletar palpale khere .

text: Who , when they came to Caesarea , and delivered the epistle to the governor , presented Paul also before him .
text2: Kana aresle ando Caesarea , le ketani pel gras dine o lil ka governori kotse , ai dine les le Pavlos .

text: And when the governor had read the letter , he asked of what province he was . And when he understood that he was of Cilicia ;
text2: Ai kana o governori kotsar jindia o lil , phushlia anda savi rik o Pavlo sas . Ai phende leske , ke sas andai Cilicia .

text: I will hear thee , said he , when thine accusers are also come . And he commanded him to be kept in Herod ' s judgment hall .
text2: " Ashunava tute , " phendia leske , " Kana kodola kai thon dosh pe tute avena . Ai dia ordina te garaven les kotse kai o amperato Herod kerelas peske krisa .

text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders , and with a certain orator named Tertullus , who informed the governor against Paul .
text2: Pansh dies pala kodia avilo o baro rashai o Anianas ai avre manushensa mai phure , ai ieke ablakatosa ka busholas Tertullus , won avile karing o Felix ando Caesarea te thon dosh po Pavlo .

text: And when he was called forth , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness , and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence ,
text2: Akharde le Pavlos , ai o Tertullus liape te dosharel les , phenelas , " Tu kai san baro ando Caesarea , pala tute si ame iek bari pacha , ai but dieli kerdian te avel mishto amare themeske .

text: We accept it always , and in all places , most noble Felix , with all thankfulness .
text2: Ai so godi si ame , ande swako vriama , ai katar godi , ame naisisaras tuke .

text: Notwithstanding , that I be not further tedious unto thee , I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words .
text2: Numa te na xasaras chi vriama , mangav ma tutar te ashunes ande cho lashimos so si ame te mothas tuke ande xantsi vorbi .

text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow , and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes :
text2: Ame arakhliam kadale manushes ek manush nai lasho , ai buntuil sa le Zhidovon ande lumia , ai o baro le Nazarengo .

text: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple : whom we took , and would have judged according to our law .
text2: Ai vi zumadia te marel mui katar o tampla , ai ame aterdiardiam les . Ame mangliam te das les pe kris pala amaro zakono ,

text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us , and with great violence took him away out of our hands ,
text2: numa o baro le ketanengo o Lysias kana avilo , lia les anda amare vas ai xaliape amensa .

text: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee : by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things , whereof we accuse him .
text2: Ai dia ordina kodolen kai thon dosh pe kado manush te aven tute . Dikhesa tu kana phushesa lestar ai ashunesa lestar sa le dieli , kai ame dosharas les . "

text: And the Jews also assented , saying that these things were so .
text2: Le Zhiduvuria mai zuravenas e dosh pe leste , ai mothonas ke kadia si .

text: Then Paul , after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak , answered , Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation , I do the more cheerfully answer for myself :
text2: Pala kodia o governori kerdia semno le Pavloske te del duma , o Pavlo dia atweto , " Zhanav ke tu san o baro kadale themesko de dumult , ai bi darako phenav angla tute ke chi sim doshalo .

text: Because that thou mayest understand , that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship .
text2: Sai dikhes tu korkorho ke nai mai but de sar desh u dui dies kai simas ande Jerusalem te rhugiv ma ka Del .

text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man , neither raising up the people , neither in the synagogues , nor in the city :
text2: Chi arakhle ma ande tampla , chi ande chi iek than , chi anda foro te dav duma varikasa , vai te chidav le narodos te buntuilpe .

text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me .
text2: Ai nai le so te sikaven te dosharen ma akana .

text: But this I confess unto thee , that after the way which they call heresy , so worship I the God of my fathers , believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets :
text2: Phenav tuke chachimasa , ke me kerav buchi le Devleski , O Del murhe dadengo , ai lav ma pala drom o nevo kai won mothon ke nai chacho , numa me pachav ma ande so godi si ramome ando zakono ai so mothon le profeturia .

text: And have hope toward God , which they themselves also allow , that there shall be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and unjust .
text2: Ai si ma o pachamos ando Del , sar sas murhe daden ke zhuvindina , vi le manush kai si vorta ai vi le manush kai nai vorta .

text: And herein do I exercise myself , to have always a conscience void of offence toward God , and toward men .
text2: Anda kodia thav murhi zor te avel sagda murho gindo bi doshako angla Del , ai angla manush .

text: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings .
text2: But bersh gelemtar anda Jerusalem , numa akana avilem te anav zhutimos le lovensa ka murhe narodos .

text: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple , neither with multitude , nor with tumult .
text2: Uni Zhiduvuria andai Asia arakhle ma ande tampla vuzhardo . Nas narodo mansa , ai nas chi iek bunto .

text: Who ought to have been here before thee , and object , if they had ought against me .
text2: Won trobunas te aven tute , ai te mothon le dosha , kai won sas le pe mande .

text: Or else let these same here say , if they have found any evil doing in me , while I stood before the council ,
text2: Vai kakala te mothon , savestar baio won arakhle ke me sim doshalo , kana simas anglal bare kai keren la krisa .

text: Except it be for this one voice , that I cried standing among them , Touching the resurrection of the dead I am called in question by you this day .
text2: Vai amborim kai tsipisardem kana simas mashkar lende , ai kai phendem ke pachav ma ke le mule wushten , anda kodia dino sim pe kris adies angla tute . "

text: And when Felix heard these things , having more perfect knowledge of that way , he deferred them , and said , When Lysias the chief captain shall come down , I will know the uttermost of your matter .
text2: Ai o Felix zhanelas mishto kodo zakono , ai phendia , " Dikhasa mai angle pa kadia diela , kana o baro le ketanengo o Lysias avela , dikhava so kerava anda chi diela . "

text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul , and to let him have liberty , and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him .
text2: Ai dia ordina ka ek ketana te lel sama katar o Pavlo , te na nashel , numa te meken leske vortachen te dikhen les vai te den les vari so .

text: And after certain days , when Felix came with his wife Drusilla , which was a Jewess , he sent for Paul , and heard him concerning the faith in Christ .
text2: Xantsi dies pala kodia o Felix avilo peska rhomniasa , woi bushol Drusilla , woi si Zhidovaika . Ai akhardia le Paulos te ashunen sar del duma pa pachamos ando Kristo .

text: And as he reasoned of righteousness , temperance , and judgment to come Felix trembled , and answered , Go thy way for this time ; when I have a convenient season , I will call for thee .
text2: Numa o Pavlo delas duma sar te traiis ek traio vorta , ai te les tutar sama , ai e kris kai si te avel pe lumia , o Felix darailo , ai phendia , " Zhatar ai mai ashunava tute aver data kana avela ma vriama . "

text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul , that he might loose him : wherefore he sent for him the oftener , and communed with him .
text2: Ai vi gindilas ke o Pavlo del les love , anda kodia akharela les butivar te del duma lesa .

text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix ' room : and Felix , willing to shew the Jews a pleasure , left Paul bound .
text2: Dui bersh nakhle kadia , porme o Porcius Festus lia o than le governorosko o Felix , ai o Felix te avel drago le Zhidovonge , meklia le Pavlos ande temnitsa .

text: Now when Festus was come into the province , after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
text2: Trin dies nakhle , ai o Festus areslo ande kado them , gelo andai Caesarea ande Jerusalem .

text: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul , and besought him ,
text2: Kotse o baro rashai ai o baro anda le Zhiduvuria phende leske le dosha kai si le po Pavlo . Mangle les katar o Festus .

text: And desired favour against him , that he would send for him to Jerusalem , laying wait in the way to kill him .
text2: Te kerel lenge iek mishtimos , te anen le Pavlos ande Jerusalem , ke won dine sas pe duma so te keren le Pavlosa ke mangenas te mudaren les pa drom kana avela .

text: But Festus answered , that Paul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he himself would depart shortly thither .
text2: Numa o Festus phendia , " Ke o Pavlo arakhado sas ande Caesarea , ai ke sigo vriama vi wo trobul te zhaltar palpale .

text: Let them therefore , said he , which among you are able , go down with me , and accuse this man , if there be any wickedness in him .
text2: Ai mothol le mai bare mashkar tumende te aven mansa , ai te avela ka kado manush si doshalo ande vari soste , mek dosharen les . "

text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days , he went down unto Caesarea ; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought .
text2: O Festus beshlo lensa desh dies , porme gelotar palpale ande Caesarea . Pe terharin gelo ando kher kai keren le krisa , ai dia ordina te anen le Pavlos .

text: And when he was come , the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about , and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul , which they could not prove .
text2: Kana avilo , le Zhiduvuria kai avile sas andai Jerusalem kruglom lestar sas , ai mothonas pe leste but ai bare dosha , kai won nashtinas te sikaven ke sas pe leste .

text: While he answered for himself , Neither against the law of the Jews , neither against the temple , nor yet against Caesar , have I offended any thing at all .
text2: O Pavlo chacharelaspe ai motholas , " Chi kerdem chi iek dosh , chi karing o zakono le Zhidovongo , chi karing e tamplo , ai chi karing o Caesar . "

text: But Festus , willing to do the Jews a pleasure , answered Paul , and said , Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these things before me ?
text2: O Festus kai mangelas te avel drago le Zhidovonge , manglia katar o Pavlo , " Manges te zhas ande Jerusalem , ai te aves kotse , dino ande kris angla mande pa kadala dieli kai dosharen tu ? "

text: Then said Paul , I stand at Caesar ' s judgment seat , where I ought to be judged : to the Jews have I done no wrong , as thou very well knowest .
text2: Antunchi o Pavlo phendia , " Anglai kris le Caesaroske sim , ai katse trobul te avav lino pe kris . Chi kerdem chi iek baio karing le Zhiduvuria , ai vi tu zhanes mishto .

text: For if I be an offender , or have committed any thing worthy of death , I refuse not to die : but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me , no man may deliver me unto them . I appeal unto Caesar .
text2: Te sim doshalo , ai kerdem iek baio kai trobul te merav , me merava . Numa le dieli kai won dosharen ma nai chache , kanikaske nai slobodo te del ma kal Zhiduvuria , ai te mudaren ma , ke me akharav le Caesaros .

text: Then Festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , Hast thou appealed unto Caesar ? unto Caesar shalt thou go .
text2: Porme kana o Festus dia duma le mai barensa kai sas kotse , phendia , " Tu manges te akhares le Caesaros , Apo leste zhasa . "

text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus .
text2: Xantsi dies pala kodia o amperato Agrippa ai e Bernice aresle ando Caesarea te dikhen le Festus .

text: And when they had been there many days , Festus declared Paul ' s cause unto the king , saying , There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix :
text2: Ai mangenas te beshen kotse meskolke dies , o Festus andia angla amperato e diela le Pavloski , ai mothol leske , " Si katse iek manush kai o Felix meklia ande temnitsa ;
